name: 3 Ingredient Banana Hacks
ingredients:
Pancakes:
1 ripe Banana
2 Eggs
Pinch of Cinnamon
Muffins:
2 ripe Banana
4 Eggs
1/2 cup Blueberries
Cookies:
1 Banana, super ripe
1 cup Quick Cooking Oats
2 Tbsp Raisins
directions:
Pancakes: Mash bananas and then stir in eggs and cinnamon. Heat some oil in a pan and pour a ladle of the mixture to form rounds. Brown on both sides.
Muffins: Mash bananas and then stir in the eggs. Lightly grease a muffin tin and drop blueberries into each well. Cover with the mixture and bake at 350F for about 15 minutes.
Cookies: Mash bananas well, and then stir in oats and raisins. Bake at 350F for 15 minutes.

name: 7-Up Jello Salad
ingredients:
2 packages Lemon or Lime Jello
2 cups Hot Water
2 cups 7-Up
4 Bananas, sliced
2 cups Small Marshmallows
1 large can Crushed Pineapple, drained (save the juice)
Reserved Pineapple Juice
1 Tbsp Flour
1/2 cup Sugar
1 Egg, well beaten
1 cup Whipped Cream
directions:
Mix jello and water.
Let cool in refrigerator for 1/2 hour. Chilled not set.
Add the 7-Up, bananas, marshmallows, and crushed pineapple into the jello. Mix well and return to the fridge.
While jello is setting,prepare topping.
Mix reserved pinapple juice, flour, sugar and egg together. Cook mixture on stovetop until thickened.
Cool and add whipped cream.
Spread on jello.

name: Agua Fresca
ingredients:
3 cups Watermelon
1/4 cup Lime Juice
1/2 cup Simple Syrup
1/2 cup Water
directions:
Blend all ingredients together.
Pass through a fine mesh strainer and transfer to a pitcher.
Chill in the fridge. Serve with ice.

name: Air Fryer Chicken Tikka Skewers With Spiced Rice
ingredients:
14 oz Boneless Skinless Chicken Thighs
2 Tbsp Greek Yogurt
3 Tbsp Tikka Masala Paste
9 oz Microwave Rice
2 Lemons
2 Red Onions
FOR THE TOMATO SALAD
10 oz Vine Tomatoes
1 Green Chili
2 tsp Black Sesame Seeds
1 Tbsp Olive Oil
FOR THE RAITA
¼ Cucumber
5 oz Greek Yogurt
½ oz Fresh Mint
directions:
Halve and finely slice the red onions. Add half to a bowl with the juice of ½ lemon and season with salt. Cut the rest of the lemon into wedges for serving and leave the onions to quickly pickle while you prep the rest of the dish.
Halve the other lemon. Slice the chicken thighs into three pieces. Add to a bowl with the juice of ½ lemon, the yogurt and tikka paste. Season generously with salt and pepper, then mix well. Cover and set aside in the fridge for at least 30 mins.
Meanwhile, make the raita. Halve the cucumber lengthwise and scoop out the seeds before finely dicing. Finely chop the mint. Add the yogurt to a bowl and squeeze in the juice of the remaining lemon half. Add the cucumber and mint to the bowl and season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
Add the rest of the onions to the air fryer, drizzle with ½ Tbsp olive oil and top with the chicken pieces, then drizzle with another ½ Tbsp oil. Set the air fryer to 200°C and cook for 14-16 mins until charred and the chicken juices run clear.
Finely slice the green chili and cut the tomato into wedges. Add the tomatoes to a bowl along with the nigella seeds, then season with salt and pepper.
Cook the rice according to package instructions.
Remove the chicken from the air fryer, then toss the cooked onions with the rice. Season with salt and pepper.
Divide the rice between two plates, add the tomatoes, then top with the tikka chicken and pickled onions. Scatter with the green chili, lemon wedges and more mint, if you like.
notes: Cook time 25 min

name: Air Fryer Chipotle Tomato Tostadas with Feta & Limey Pickles
ingredients:
½ Red Onion
3 oz Radishes
1 Lime
1 Avocado
6 Corn Tortillas
½ oz Coriander
1 Jalapeño
1 Tbsp Chipotle Paste
12 oz Cherry Tomatoes
1 oz Feta
2 Tbsp Greek Yogurt
1 Tbsp Olive Oil
Sugar, to serve
directions:
Finely slice the red onion and radishes, then add to a bowl with the juice of ½ a lime, salt and sugar, if using. Give them a massage with your hands and set aside to turn bright pink.
Get your tortillas into the air fryer and cook them for around 5 mins in 1 min bursts, flattening them out each time so they don't curl up too much. Once crisp, remove them from the air fryer to cool, they will also firm up as they cool.
Halve the avocado, remove the pit and scoop into a processor along with the yogurt, coriander stalks, and the remaining lime juice. Season generously with salt and pepper then blitz smooth. Finely dice the jalapeño and mix through, removing the seeds if you like it less spicy.
Add the tomatoes to a bowl with the chipotle paste and the olive oil. Season with salt and pepper then pop in the air fryer at 160°C for 20 mins. They should be nicely jammy with charred edges.
Spread the avocado onto the crisp tortilla and top with the roast tomatoes. Crumble over the feta, scatter with coriander and top with the pickles.
notes: Cook time 35 min

name: Air Fryer Salmon Tacos With Mango Chipotle Glaze
ingredients:
4 Skinless Salmon Filets
2 Tbsp Mango Chutney
1 Tbsp Chipotle Paste
1 Cabbage, shredded
1 Red Onion
1 oz Fresh Dill
2 Limes
3 oz Spring Onions
1 Scotch Bonnet Chili
8 Small Corn Tortillas
3 Tbsp Sour Cream
Olive Oil
Radish, to serve
directions:
Preheat the air fryer to high (400°F).
Dice the salmon into medium-sized cubes (about 3 per filet). Season the salmon with salt and pop into a parchment lined pan or a tray. Mix together the chutney and the chipotle paste and tip over the salmon. Pop into the airfryer for 8-10 mins or until fully cooked, spooning any extra marinade over the fish as it cooks.
Thinly slice the cabbage and red onion and chuck into a bowl. Dress with a little salt and lime juice and toss through chopped dill. Thinly slice the scotch bonnet, season with salt and squeeze a little lime juice over the top.
Heat the tacos according to the package instructions.
Pull the fish out of the oven, it should be cooked and glazed in the spicy, smoky mango chipotle mix. (Flake it into smaller pieces, if you like.)
Build your tacos starting with the shells, topped with sour cream, some fish, a handful of slaw, the chilies and chopped spring onion and radishes.
notes: Cook time 20 min

name: Any Fruit Salad
ingredients:
Fruit of Choice
Lime Juice
Honey
To Match Sample Image:
Strawberries
Cherries
Pineapple
Mango
Kiwi
Nectarine
directions:
Chop fruits of choice into small cubes and try to cut them to the same general size.
Drizzle with honey and lime juice to lightly sweeten and help the fruit last a bit longer.
Mix and serve!

name: Apple Balsamic Chicken
ingredients:
1/2 cup Chicken Broth
1/4 cup Apple Cider or Apple Juice
1/4 cup Balsamic Vinegar
2 Tbsp Lemon Juice
1/2 tsp Salt
1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
1/2 tsp Thyme, dried
1/2 tsp Paprika
1/2 tsp Pepper
4 Bone-in Chicken Thighs (about 1½ lbs), skin removed
2 Tbsp Butter
2 Tbsp All-Purpose Flour
directions:
In a small bowl, combine the first nine ingredients. Place chicken in a 6-qt. electric pressure cooker. Pour broth mixture over meat. Lock lid and make sure the vent is closed. Select manual setting, set pressure to high, and set time for 10 minutes.
When finished cooking, allow pressure to naturally release for 10 minutes, then quick-release any remaining pressure according to manufacturer's directions.
Remove chicken and keep warm. Skim fat from cooking liquid. In a small saucepan, melt butter and whisk in flour until smooth. Gradually add cooking liquid. Cook and stir until sauce is thickened (2-3 minutes). Serve with chicken.
notes:
Prep: 15 min.
Cook: 15 min + releasing

name: Apple Crisp
ingredients:
3 Apples
1/2 cup Flour
3/4 cup Brown Sugar
1/2 cup Butter or Margarine
3/4 cup Oats
directions:
Put apples in buttered 9"x9" pan.
Mix brown sugar and flour.
Cut in butter.
Stir in oats.
Spread over apples.
Bake 350 for 35-40 min.

name: Apple Dip
ingredients:
8 oz Cream Cheese
Lots of Caramel Sauce
Apples
directions:
Mix all of the cream cheese with how ever much caramel your soul desires (Add caramel to taste).
Add more caramel as topping to the dip.
Cut up an apple and eat with the dip!

name: Apple Pastries
ingredients:
1 package Puff Pastry, frozen
2-3 Apples
1/2 cup Sugar
1/4 cup Cinnamon
1 Egg White, beaten
1 cup Powdered Sugar
1 tsp Water or Almond Milk
directions:
Preheat oven to 350º. Thaw puff pastry according to instructions. Core your apples with an apple corer and peel your apple. Then slice into .5 inch rings. Set aside.
Roll thawed puff pastry out and use a rolling pin to stretch out the length. Use a pizza cutter to make thin, long, 1/2 inch or thinner strips.
Then gently wrap the apple rings with the puff pastry strips going through the hole of the apple ring. You can pinch together strips as needed, just be sure most/all of the apple is wrapped tightly in the pastry strips.
Mix the cinnamon/sugar together well. Place apple pastries on parchment lined cookie sheets. Brush the wrapped apple rings with egg whites and dip or sprinkle on cinnamon sugar generously.
Bake for about 25-30 minutes or until puff pastry is nice and browned, cooked all the way through.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 25 min

name: Apple Pie
ingredients:
9 Apples, peeled, cored, sliced, and de-seeded
1 Tbsp Lemon Juice
3/4 cup Sugar
2 Tbsp All-Purpose Flour
1/2 tsp Cinnamon
1/8 tsp Ground Nutmeg
directions:
Peel apples, cut out the core (including seeds, seed husks, etc.) and slice.
Put in pie crust and cover with thinly rolled out dough.
Cover the top of the pie (make sure to cover the edges) with tin foil to prevent over-browning.
Bake at 375 for 25 minutes with the foil on.
Take the foil off and bake for 25-30 minutes or until the top is golden brown.
Cool on a wire rack.

name: Apple Salad
ingredients:
1 small package Strawberry Jello
1-1/8 cup Boiling Water
3/4 cup Orange Juice
Rind of 1 Orange
1 can Crushed Pineapple, drained
1/2 cup Sugar
3-4 Apples, grated
directions:
Dissolve jello in water then add remaining ingredients.
Set in a ring mold and fill center with tinted whipped cream and sliced bananas.

name: Apricot Balsamic Glazed Pork Tenderloin with Ginger Rice and Sesame Green Beans
ingredients:
1 thumb Ginger
1 Garlic Clove
2 Scallions
2 Tbsp Soy Sauce
1 Shallot
1 Chicken Stock Concentrate
1/2 cup Jasmine Rice
10 oz Pork Tenderloin
1 Tbsp Fry Seasoning
1 Apricot Jam
5 tsp Balsamic Vinegar
2 tsp Brown Sugar
6 oz Green Beans
1 Tbsp Sesame Oil
directions:
Rice: Wash and dry all produce. Peel and mince or grate ginger and garlic. Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens. Halve, peel, and mince half the shallot.
Melt 1 Tbsp butter in a small pot over medium-high heat. Add ginger, garlic, and scallion whites; cook until softened, 1-2 minutes. Add half the stock concentrate and 3/4 cup water. Bring to a boil, then stir in rice. Cover and reduce heat to a gentle simmer. Cook until tender, 15-18 minutes.Fluff rice with a fork; season with salt and pepper.
Pork Tenderloins: Pat pork dry with paper towels; season all over with salt, pepper, and 1 tsp fry seasoning. Heat a large drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Add pork and cook, turning occasionally, until browned on all sides and cooked through, 15-20 minutes. Turn off heat; transfer to a cutting board to rest. Wash out pan.
Melt 1 Tbsp butter in same pan over medium-high heat. Add minced shallot and cook until softened, 2-3 minutes. Stir in jam and vinegar. Simmer until syrupy, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Stir in 1/4 cup water, brown sugar, and remaining stock concentrate. Bring to a boil, then lower heat. Let bubble until thickened, 3-4 minutes. Remove from heat; stir in 1 Tbsp butter. Season with salt and pepper.
Stir any resting juices from pork into pan with glaze. Slice pork crosswise into medallions. Drizzle pork with glaze.
Green Beans: Pierce green bean bag with a fork; place bag on a plate. Microwave until tender, 1-2 minutes. Carefully transfer green beans to a medium bowl. Toss with sesame oil; season with salt and pepper.
Divide rice, pork, and green beans between plates. Top everything with scallion greens and soy sauce to taste.
notes: Prep time 15 min and Cook time 45 min. Calories: 720

name: Arugula Goat Cheese Salad with Farro and Honey Mustard
ingredients:
1/2 cup Farro, dry
4 packed cups Arugula
6 oz Brussels Sprouts,shredded or shaved (about 3 scant cups)
1/2 cup Pecans, chopped
1 (4 oz) Log Goat Cheese, crumbled (sub feta or grated sharp white cheddar)
2 cups Rotisserie Chicken, shredded (or 1 can drained & rinsed chickpeas)
Almond Honey Mustard Dressing:
1/4 cup Orange Juice, freshly squeezed (from 1 to 2 oranges)
3 Tbsp Creamy Almond Butter
3 Tbsp Extra-Virgin Olive Oil
2 Tbsp Dijon Mustard
1 Tbsp Honey
1/2 tsp Salt
Pepper
directions:
Cook Farro: Fill a medium pot half full of water. Add a pinch of salt and bring to a boil. Add farro; reduce heat and simmer until the farro is tender, about 15 to 20 minutes for pearled farro; 20 to 30 minutes for semi-pearled farro; up to 40 minutes for whole farro.
Drain, then spread grains onto a large plate or sheet pan to cool for 15 minutes.
While farro cools, prepare Almond Honey Mustard Dressing by combining all dressing ingredients in a medium bowl and mixing until smooth.
In a large bowl, combine arugula, Brussels Sprouts, pecans, and farro; season with a pinch of salt and give it a toss. Add dressing and toss to combine. Add goat cheese and chicken (or chickpeas); toss again. Serve immediately.
notes: Prep time 20 min and Cook time 15 min

name: Bacon and Cheddar Potatoes
ingredients:
4 White Potatoes, cooked and skin on
Olive Oil
Salt, to taste
7 oz Cheddar Cheese
5½ oz Bacon, diced
directions:
Cut the potatoes in a canoe shape.
Place the potatoes in a greased baking dish with olive oil and bake at 400F degrees for 30-40 minutes.
Arrange the potatoes on a plate and cover with warm cheddar.
Place crispy diced bacon on top.

name: Bacon and Eggs Bowls
ingredients:
250g Bacon, thickly sliced and roughly chopped
3 Eggs, large
270ml + 1/2 tsp Milk
Pepper
Pinch of Nutmeg
1/2 cup Gruyere Cheese, grated
4 Buns
directions:
Fry the bacon in a pan set to medium heat until crispy. Transfer to a paper towel lined pan to absorb excess oil. Set aside.
Whisk the eggs, milk, salt, pepper and nutmeg in a bowl. For extra flavor, you can add any herb or seasoning of your choice.
Slice the tops off the buns and remove the bread from the center, creating bowls. Place the bowls on a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil.
Evenly distribute the bacon and cheese between the bread bowls, then pour the egg mixture on top.
Bake at 320F for 30-40 min, until the egg has set and is lightly browned. Remove from oven and enjoy.

name: Bacon-Corn Chowder
ingredients:
5 cups Redskin Potatoes, cubed
16 oz package Corn, frozen
6 Bacon slices, crisply cooked and crumbled
1/4 cup Onion, dried and minced
2 (14.5 oz) cans Chicken Broth
1 cup Water
2 tsp Garlic Salt
1 tsp Pepper
1/4 tsp Turmeric
12 oz can Evaporated Milk
8 oz package Monterey Jack Cheese, shredded
Chives for garnish
directions:
Combine all ingredients except milk, cheese, and chives in a slow cooker.
Cover and cook on low setting for 8 to 9 hours, until potatoes are tender.
Stir in milk and cheese; cover and cook until cheese melts.
Garnish with chives, if desired.
original_author: Everyday Slow Cooker - Gooseberry Patch book

name: Bagels
ingredients:
3½ cups Bread Flour (He used 11½% protein)
1½ Tbsp Sugar
1/2 Tbsp Instant Dried Yeast
1/2 Tbsp Salt
1¼ cup Lukewarm Water
1 Tbsp Honey
directions:
Add all dry ingredients to a bowl. Mix and then add tepid water and mix again.
Don't add extra flour. Just keep kneading until it comes together. Throw it down and then fold until it is elastic.
Once it stops fighting you, start kneading and rolling. Do gluten window test - you should be able to see through the dough without it ripping.
Let dough rest in an oiled bowl for an hour in a warm place.
Add a light dusting of flour, pour dough on top, and divide into pieces. (around 6 bagels). Roll into a ball, poke a hole in the middle with a floured finger, and add to a pan. Let them rest.
Bring water to a boil, add honey once boiling, and then add in the bagel one at a time. Let the bagel boil on both sides for 2 minutes each.
Add back to baking tray, sprinkle on seasoning, and bake for 15-25 minutes in a 415F oven.
notes: Seasoning idea: flakey sea salt, black poppy seeds, sesame seeds, garlic flakes, onion flakes.

name: Baked Caramelized Onion Pasta
ingredients:
3 Yellow Onions, large and sliced
1 head Garlic, top sliced off
½ cup Sun Dried Tomatoes + Oil, chopped
1 tsp Salt
1 tsp Black Pepper
1 Tbsp Paprika
1 tsp Parsley, dried
½ cup Heavy Cream, or coconut milk
2 Tbsp Balsamic Vinegar
3 cups Farfalle Pasta, cooked
1 handful Parsley, fresh and chopped
1 handful Basil, fresh and chopped
1 Lemon, juiced
directions:
Preheat the oven to 400F.
To a casserole dish, add the onions, sun dried tomatoes, balsamic vinegar, paprika, salt, pepper and dried parsley.
Toss, and then place the whole garlic head in the middle. Drizzle the entire dish with olive oil or the leftover sun dried tomato oil, cover with foil, and then pop in the oven for 1 hour, tossing halfway through. The onions should be caramelized by the time it comes out of the oven.
About 20 minutes before the casserole dish is done, prepare the pasta according to package directions, reserving up to a cup of pasta water.
Remove the garlic from the casserole dish, and when safe to handle, squeeze out the cloves. Add the fresh parsley, basil, lemon juice and heavy cream, along with the cooked pasta and pasta water as needed. Stir and enjoy!
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 60 min

name: Baked Chicken Breasts
ingredients:
6-7 Chicken Breasts
Swiss Cheese
1 box Stove Top Stuffing
2 cans Cream of Chicken Soup
Half cube Butter
directions:
Place slice of Swiss Cheese on top of each chicken breast.
Sprinkle Stove Top stuffing crumbs on top.
Mix cream of chicken soup with spice packet from Stove Top mix.
Spread on top of stuffing crumbs.
Dab with half cube of butter.
Cover baking dish with foil.
Bake at 350 degrees for an hour.

name: Baked Onion Cheese Rings
ingredients:
1 Onion
1 small package Potato Chips
1 slice Mozzarella Cheese, cut into strips
1 slice Cheddar Cheese, cut into strips
Flour
1 Egg, beaten
directions:
Put potato chips in a Ziploc bag and crush until they are crumbs.
Slice the onion into 1/2 inch thickness and separate the rings.
Arrange cheese strips inside the onion rings. Repeat, alternating with the mozzarella and cheddar cheese.
Dip the onion rings in flour to coat them. Then dip them in the beaten egg.
Thoroughly coat the rings in potato chip crumbs.
Bake for 15 minutes at 350 degrees.
Enjoy with tomato sauce or ketchup.

name: Baked Shrimp and Broccoli Foil Packs with Garlic Lemon Butter Sauce
ingredients:
1 lb Shrimp, medium size, raw, peeled and deveined
2 Tbsp Butter, diced
1 Tbsp Garlic, minced
1 tsp Italian Seasoning
1/4 tsp Onion Powder
2 Tbsp Vegetable or Chicken Stock, divided
Salt & Pepper, to taste
1/4 tsp Smoked Paprika
Red Pepper Flakes, optional
1/2 Lemon, juiced
1 large head Broccoli, broken into florets
Parsley, chopped for garnish
directions:
To make these baked shrimp foil packs: Preheat your oven to 425ºF. Cut 2 sheets of 14 by 12-inch (35 x 30 cm) heavy-duty aluminum foil then lay each piece separately on the countertop.
In a small bowl, combine the ingredients for the spice mix: Italian Seasoning, onion powder, salt, pepper, and smoked paprika.
In a shallow plate, add shrimp and sprinkle with the spice mix, coating on all sides.
Divide shrimp onto the aluminum foil near the center then place broccoli florets to one side of the shrimp.
Add garlic over broccoli and shrimp, then sprinkle with lemon juice, red crushed chili pepper flakes (if using) and finish with salt and pepper. Divide butter pieces evenly among the shrimp foil packets, layering them over the shrimp and broccoli.
Add a tablespoon of vegetable stock in each foil packet and wrap packets in and crimp edges together then wrap ends up. Don’t wrap too tight – keep a little extra space inside for heat to circulate.
Transfer to a baking sheet and bake shrimp foil packets in the oven, sealed side upward until shrimps have cooked through, about 15 minutes.
Carefully unwrap the baked shrimp and broccoli foil packets then garnish with fresh parsley and a slice of lemon. Enjoy!

name: Baked Tomato and Egg Cups
ingredients:
3 Roma Tomatoes, large, halved and centers scooped out
6 Eggs, smaller the better
Salt & Pepper, to taste
Fresh Herbs
Toasted Bread, for serving
directions:
Preheat oven to 450º
Place tomatoes on a baking sheet. You might need to slice a tiny bit off the bottom of each tomato to keep them level on the pan.
Crack eggs and gently place in the cavity of each tomato.
Season with salt and pepper. I added dried red pepper flakes for a little heat.
Bake for 6-7 minutes for runny eggs or 8-10 for soft set eggs.
Remove from oven and top with fresh chopped herbs.
Serve as is or on top of toasted bread. This is also wonderful stuffed into a toasted bagel.

name: Baked Ziti
ingredients:
16 oz Ziti Pasta or Penne Pasta
1 Onion, chopped
1 Ib Lean Ground Beef
Pepper, to taste
Garlic Powder, to taste
Onion Powder, to taste
1 tsp Garlic, minced
2 (26 oz) jars Spaghetti Sauce
8 slices Provolone Cheese
1½ cups Sour Cream
2 cups Mozzarella Cheese, shredded
2 Tbsp Parmesan Cheese, grated
directions:
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta, and cook until al dente, about 7-8 minutes; drain.
In a large skillet, add onion, ground beef, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and minced garlic over medium heat. Cook and then drain grease.
Add spaghetti sauce, and simmer 15 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 350F degrees. Spray 2 (8 x 8 inch) pans with non-stick cooking spray. Layer as follows in each pan: 1/4 of the pasta, 1/4 of the sauce, 4 slices of Provolone cheese, 1/2 of sour cream,  1/4 of pasta, 1/4 mozzarella cheese and 1/4 of sauce mixture. Top with grated Parmesan Cheese and remaining mozzarella cheese.
Bake covered for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until cheeses are melted.
notes: Works as a freezer meal

name: Balsamic Vinegar Noodles
ingredients:
Rotini Noodles, cooked
Mozzarella Cheese
Balsamic Vinegar
Salt & Pepper
Mixed-Up salt
Basil
Tomatoes, cut up in cubes
directions:
Cook the Rotini noodles.
Add cheese, vinegar, salt, pepper, and tomatoes.
Mix until noodles are a medium brown.
notes: You can switch out the pasta for lettuce to have a Caprese Salad

name: Banana Chocolate Chip Bread
ingredients:
1 cup Butter
2 cup Sugar
2 tsp Vanilla
2 tsp Lemon Juice
4 Eggs
5 ripe Bananas, 4 mashed and 1 coarsely chopped
1 tsp Salt
3½ cup Flour
2 tsp Baking Soda
2 tsp Baking Powder
1 cup Sour Cream
1 (12 oz) Chocolate Chips
directions:
Cream butter and sugar.
Add vanilla, lemon juice and eggs, beating well.
Stir in mashed bananas.
Sift together salt, flour, baking soda and baking powder.
Combine with banana mixture.
Add sour cream, (nuts), and coarsely chopped banana.
Turn into 2 greased loaf pans or 7 small loaf pans.
(Top with more chopped nuts.)
Bake at 350 degrees for 1½ hours or 1 hour for small pans or until surface springs back when touched.
Cool in pan.
notes: 1/2 cup nuts (optional)

name: Banana Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Bars
ingredients:
1 cup Brown Sugar, packed
3/4 cup Butter or Margarine, softened
1 Egg
1/2 tsp Salt
4 Bananas, mashed
4 cups Old-Fashioned Rolled Oats
1/2 cup Chocolate Chips
1/2 cup Craisins
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a large bowl, beat brown sugar and butter until smooth and creamy. Beat in egg, salt and bananas until well combined. Stir in oats, chocolate chips and Craisins and mix thoroughly.
Spread evenly in prepared pan. Bake in preheated oven for 50 to 60 minutes or until a tester inserted in center comes out clean. Place pan on a wire rack to cool completely, then cut into bars.
notes: 13x9 inch cake pan, greased

name: Banana Cream Pie Filling
ingredients:
3 ripe Bananas, sliced
1 package Banana Pudding
1 Pie Crust
directions:
Poke the bottom the pie crust with a fork.
Bake empty pie crust at 375F for 25 minutes.
Slice bananas and place in the bottom of the pie crust.
Spread Jell-O over the bananas.
Serve with whipped cream

name: Banana Crush
ingredients:
2 cups Sugar
3 cups Water
1½ cups Orange Juice
1/4 cup Lemon Juice
3 Bananas, mashed
1 (46 oz) can Pineapple Juice
3 quarts 7-Up
directions:
Combine sugar and water.
Cook to a syrup.
Remove from heat and add remaining ingredients.
Let cool.
Pour into ice cube trays and freeze.
To serve, put 2-3 ice cubes into a glass and fill with 7 UP.
notes:
Great for parties
Ice cube trays needed

name: Banana Granola Drops
ingredients:
1½ cups All-Purpose Flour
1/2 tsp Baking Soda
1/2 tsp Salt
1 tsp Ground Cinnamon
1/2 cup Butter or Margarine, softened
1 cup Brown Sugar, packed
1 Egg
1/2 tsp Vanilla
1 cup Bananas, mashed
1 cup Granola
directions:
Preheat oven to 375F.
In a small bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon.
In a large bowl, beat butter and brown sugar until smooth and creamy. Add egg, vanilla and bananas and beat until well blended. Add flour mixture and mix well. Stir in granola.
Drop by tablespoon-fuls, about 2 inches apart, onto prepared cookie sheet.
Bake in preheated oven for 12 minutes or until golden brown.
Immediately transfer to wire racks to cool.

name: Banana Nutella Ice Cream
ingredients:
4 Bananas, chopped and frozen
1/2 cup Nutella
directions:
Peel and slice bananas and place in freezer for 3 hours or until frozen.
Place bananas and Nutella in food processor and run until contents are smooth and blended.
Can be served like soft serve now or transferred to loaf an and place in freezer for 2 hours to get normal ice cream texture.
notes: Rather than Nutella, add raspberries or other fruits.

name: Banana Quick Bread
ingredients:
1 cup Sugar
4 oz Butter, unsalted
2 Eggs, large
3 ripe Bananas
1 Tbsp Milk
1 tsp Ground Cinnamon
2 cups Flour
1 tsp Baking Powder
1 tsp Baking Soda
1 tsp Salt
directions:
preheat oven to 350 F.
Cream the sugar and butter in a large mixing bowl until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs one at a time, beat well after each addition.
Ina small bowl, mash the bananas with a fork.
Mix in the milk and cinnamon.
In another bowl, mix together the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
Add the banana mixture to the creamed mixture and stir until combined.
Add dry ingredients, mixing just until flour disappears.
Pour batter into paper lined muffin pans and bake 15-20 minutes, until toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

name: Banana Split Cupcakes
ingredients:
429g All-Purpose Flour
265g Caster Sugar
1/2 tsp Salt
3 tsp Baking Powder
375ml of Milk
125ml Vegetable Oil
125g Butter, unsalted and softened
2 Tbsp Greek Yogurt or Sour Cream
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
2 Eggs, large
2-3 drops Yellow Food Coloring
2 Bananas, ripe and mashed
200 ml Chocolate Sauce
Crushed Peanuts, to sprinkle
20 Maraschino Cherries
directions:
Preheat your oven to 355F or 320F for a fan forced oven.
In the bowl of a stand mixer fitter with the paddle attachment, add the flour, baking powder, caster sugar and salt. Turn mixer on low speed and allow it to mix well.
Add the softened butter and let it mix until it resembles a fine sand like texture.
Next, add milk, eggs, yogurt, yellow food dye, oil and vanilla extract in a large bowl and whisk well.
Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients in a slow and steady stream. Scrape down the bowl, add mashed banana, and mix for another 20 seconds.
Fill each cupcake line 3/4 of the way. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Allow them to cool completely before frosting.
To finish off the cupcakes, core the center and fill with chocolate sauce. Fit the end of your piping tip with a 1M tip and frost the cupcakes in a swirl motion.
Drizzle chocolate sauce over the top. Sprinkle with crushed peanuts and top with a cherry.
notes:
Frosting - Vanilla Buttercream Frosting
Cake - Recipe can be used for 8" cake tin - adjust baking time to 30-40 minutes.

name: BBQ Cheddar Pork Burgers with Chipotle Aioli & Potato Wedges
ingredients:
1 Yellow Onion
12 oz Yukon Gold Potatoes
2 Tbsp Mayo
1 tsp Chipotle Powder
4 Tbsp BBQ Sauce
1 Tbsp Fry Seasoning
10 oz Ground Pork
1/2 cup Cheddar Cheese
2 Potato Buns
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce.
Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch-thick wedges and toss on a baking sheet with a large drizzle of oil, half the fry seasoning (you'll use the rest later), salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack until browned and tender, 20-25 minutes.
Halve, peel, and thinly slice onion; mince a few slices until you have 2 Tbsp. Halve buns.
In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise with chipotle powder to taste (start with a pinch, then taste and add more from there if desired). Season with salt and pepper; set aside.
Melt 1 Tbsp butter in a large pan over medium heat. Add sliced onion and season with salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and lightly browned, 10-15 minutes. TIP: Lower heat and add a splash of water if onion begins to brown too quickly. Stir in half the BBQ sauce (you'll use the rest later); cook until sauce is warmed through, 1-2 minutes more. Turn off heat; transfer to a medium bowl. Wash out pan.
In a large bowl, combine pork, minced onion, remaining fry seasoning, salt, and pepper. Form into two patties, each slightly wider than a burger bun.
Heat a drizzle of oil in pan used for onion over medium-high heat. Add patties and cook until browned and cooked through, 4-7 minutes per side. In the last 1-2 minutes of cooking, top each patty with cheddar; cover pan until cheese melts. While patties cook, toast buns until golden.
Spread bottom buns with remaining BBQ sauce. Spread top buns with chipotle aioli. Fill buns with patties and caramelized onion. Divide burgers between plates and serve with potato wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 35 min. Calories: 1100

name: BBQ Meat Loaf
ingredients:
2 lbs. Ground Beef
1 cup Fresh Bread Crumbs
1 Onion, finely chopped
1 Egg
1-1/2 tsp Salt
1/4 tsp Pepper
2 (8 oz) cans Tomato Sauce
1/2 cups Water
3 Tbsp Vinegar
3 Tbsp Brown Sugar
2 Tbsp Mustard
2 tsp Worcestershire Sauce
directions:
Mix beef, crumbs, onion, egg, salt, pepper and 1/2 can tomato sauce; form into a loaf.
Combine rest of tomato sauce and all other ingredients.
Stir and pour over loaf.
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
Baste occasionally.

name: BBQ Sauce
ingredients:
1 Tbsp Worcestershire Sauce
1 Tbsp Ketchup
1 Tbsp Honey
directions: Simply mix the three ingredients together and serve with fries or chicken nuggets.

name: Bellissimo Bruschetta Burgers with Herby Potato Wedges & Parmesan-Roasted Asparagus
ingredients:
12 oz Yukon Gold Potatoes
4 oz Grape Tomatoes
6 oz Asparagus
Chives
Parsley
1 Garlic Clove
1 tsp Garlic Powder
1 Tbsp Italian Seasoning
5 tsp Balsamic Vinegar
10 oz Ground Beef
1/4 Parmesan Cheese
1/2 cup Mozzarella Cheese
2 Tbsp Mayo
2 Tbsp Ketchup
2 Brioche Buns
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch-thick wedges. Quarter tomatoes. Thinly slice chives. Pick parsley leaves from stems; finely chop leaves. Peel and mince or grate garlic. Trim and discard bottom 1 inch from asparagus.
Sauce: Place 2 Tbsp butter in a small microwave-safe bowl; microwave until softened, 10 seconds. Stir in garlic powder and season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
Fries and asparagus: Toss potatoes on one side of a baking sheet with a large drizzle of olive oil, half the Italian Seasoning (you'll use the rest for the burgers), salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack for 10 minutes (you'll add the asparagus then). Once potatoes have roasted 10 minutes, remove sheet from oven. Carefully toss asparagus on empty side with a drizzle of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Push stalks close together and sprinkle with Parmesan.
Return to top rack and roast until potatoes are browned, asparagus is tender, and cheese melts, 10-12 minutes more.
Burgers: While potatoes roast, in a second small bowl, combine tomatoes, vinegar, half the chives, half the chopped parsley, and a pinch of garlic to taste. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside to marinate, stirring occasionally, until ready to serve. In a medium bowl, combine beef, remaining chives, remaining chopped parsley, remaining Italian Seasoning, salt, and pepper.
Form into two patties, each slightly wider than a burger bun.
Heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add patties and cook to desired doneness, 3-5 minutes per side. In the last 1-2 minutes of cooking, top each patty with mozzarella; cover pan until cheese melts. Meanwhile, in a third small bowl, combine ketchup and mayonnaise.
Toast buns; spread cut sides with garlic butter. Fill buns with patties and bruschetta topping. Divide burgers, potato wedges, and asparagus between plates. Serve sauce on the side for dipping.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 35 min. Calories: 1160

name: Bicol Express Coconut Curry
ingredients:
3-4 Chicken Tenderloins, cubed
1 can Coconut Milk
1 Onion, diced
1 Serrano or Jalapeño Pepper
1 tsp Garlic Powder
Salt & Pepper, to taste
Rice, for serving
directions:
Dice onion and cook in 1-2 Tbsp oil until translucent and slightly brown.
Remove from pan, add a bit more oil to the pan, and cook cubed chicken with salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
While those are cooking, chop the Serrano or Jalapeño Pepper and stir into the coconut milk. (We’ve discovered this will make it easier to cook the pepper without making your eyes water.)
Once the chicken has reached an internal temp of 165F, add the onions, coconut milk, and pepper back to the pan. Cook for a few minutes to soften up the peppers and heat up the coconut milk.
Serve over cooked rice with soy sauce and sesame seeds if you’re feeling fancy.
notes: When multiplying ingredients to serve more people, only increase the amount of pepper if the one you cut up is super mild. Otherwise, mouths may burn and contacts will be ruined.
original_author: Ryan Remer and the filipinos who taught him

name: Birthday Cake Popcorn
ingredients:
6 Tbsp Popcorn Kernels, un-popped (6 to 8 cups popped)
8 oz White Chocolate
1/4 cups Vegetable Shortening
1 cup Yellow Cake Mix
1/4 cup Rainbow Sprinkles
directions:
Pop popcorn in an air popper, or in a microwave using a paper bag, 3 Tbsp at a time. Transfer to a large bowl.
Melt chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl for 30 second intervals (stirring each time) until melted. Add vegetable mix to the chocolate/shortening mixture and stir then add the sprinkles and stir again.
Pour the warm chocolate mixture over the popcorn, and stir until evenly coated. Use your hands, get messy.
Pour the popcorn onto a baking sheet line with wax paper to harden at room temperature.

name: Black Forest Brownie Cups
ingredients:
1 Package Fudge Brownie Mix, Duncan Hines
1/3 cup Butter
1 Egg
3/4 cup Cherry Pie Filling
3/4 cup Cool Whip
Unsweetened Hersey's Cocoa Powder
directions:
Preheat oven to 350.
Spray muffin tins with non stick cooking spray (1¾ inch muffin cups.
In a large bowl, stir together brownie mix, butter cut into pieces, and egg. (Mixture should be thick.)
Scoop 1 Tbsp of the brownie mixture into the muffin tins.
Push the mixture up on the side to make the bowl.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and chill in the refrigerator for 5 minutes or until the middle sinks a bit.
Fill each sunken center with 2 tsp of Cherry Pie Filling.
Bake for 15-17 minutes or until a toothpick comes out almost completely clean.
top with whipped cream and a sprinkle of Cocoa Powder.
notes: Try topping with ice cream after cooking for 20 minutes instead of Cherry filling.

name: Blackened Chicken with Tomato Parmesan Cream Sauce
ingredients:
4 Chicken Breasts
2 Tbsp Olive Oil
1 Lemon, juiced
Blackening Seasoning:
2 Tbsp Paprika
1 Tbsp Garlic Powder
1 Tbsp Onion Powder
1 Tbsp Dried Thyme
1 Tbsp Dried Oregano
2 tsp Black Pepper
1 tsp Salt
1/2 tsp Cayenne Pepper
Tomato Parmesan Cream Sauce:
1/4 cup Sundried Tomatoes, removed from the oil and chopped
4 Garlic Cloves, minced
½ tsp Red Pepper Flakes
½ tsp Italian Seasoning
½ cup Chicken Stock
½ cup Heavy Cream
½ cup Parmesan Cheese, shredded
Salt & Pepper, to taste
Fresh Basil, garnish
directions:
Preheat the oven to 375 F.
In a bowl, combine all of the dry spices to create the blackened seasoning.
Remove the chicken from the packaging and pat it dry with paper towels to remove excess moisture. Lightly coat each chicken breast in olive oil. Generously season all sides of each chicken breast and set it aside.
Preheat a cast iron skillet to medium-high heat on the stovetop (if not using a cast iron pan make sure you have a pan that can go from the stove to the oven).
Add 1 tbsp of the olive oil and let it preheat in the pan (do not let it get too hot so that it starts smoking). Place each chicken breast down into the skillet and let it cook for 3 minutes or until it easily lifts from the pan and can be flipped.
Once you flip each chicken breast, turn off the stove and carefully transfer the pan into the oven for 15 minutes to finish cooking. Use a thermometer to check that the chicken is cooked to an internal temperature of 165 F.
Remove from the oven and let it rest for 5 minutes before slicing. Add a little lemon juice over the top or make the Tomato Parmesan Cream Sauce in the following steps.
Remove the chicken from the skillet and set it aside to rest. Place the skillet back onto the heat and leave any drippings and seasoning in the pan.
Over medium-low heat, add in the chopped sundried tomatoes, garlic, red pepper flakes, and Italian seasoning. Sauté a few minutes to develop the aromatic flavors in the spices.
Pour in the chicken stock and heavy cream and continue to whisk over the heat for a few minutes to bring it up to temperature. Do not boil.
Once the liquid is hot, reduce the heat fully to low. Slowly add in the parmesan cheese and whisk well before adding more. Let the cheese melt and thicken the sauce.
Remove it from the heat and serve over the top of the sliced chicken. Garnish with basil if desired.

name: Blueberry Freezer Jam
ingredients:
3 cups Blueberries
1/2 cup Sugar
2 Tbsp Lemon Juice
2 Tbsp Pectin
directions:
Mix blueberries, sugar and lemon juice in saucepan.
Simmer over low heat.
Mash fruit.
Stir in pectin.
Pour in jars and leave a 1/2 inch at the top.
Boil water and then put jars in for 10+ minutes to seal the tops.

name: Blueberry Jam Recipe
ingredients:
5 cups Blueberries
1/4 cup Water
3 cups Sugar
1 cup Honey
directions:
Bring blueberries and water to a boil.
Mash and stir for 5 minutes.
Add sugar and honey.
Boil uncovered for 30 minutes on medium heat.
Pour in jars leaving 1/4 inch at the top.
Boil water and put jars in for 10+ min. to seal them.

name: Blueberry Jello Salad
ingredients:
2 small packages Black Cherry Jello
1 cup Boiling Water
1 cup Blueberries
1 small can Crushed Pineapple
1 large container Cool Whip
directions:
Thoroughly dissolve jello and boiling water.
Add blueberries and pineapple, juice and all.
Let partially set.
Add 1/2 of Cool Whip and mix well.
Pour in bowl or pan and cover with remaining Cool Whip.
(Sprinkle nuts on top.)
Return to the refrigerator until completely set.
notes: 1/2 cup chopped walnuts (optional)

name: Blueberry Smoothie
ingredients:
1/2 cup Milk
2 Tbsp Frozen Grape Juice Concentrate
1/4 cup Frozen Blueberries
1/4 - 1/2 cup Vanilla Greek Yogurt
1 tsp Honey
directions:
Put milk, juice and blueberries into a blender. Blend for about 30 seconds.
Then add the Greek Yogurt and honey. Blend well.
Either serve it as a smoothie or turn it into Popsicles.

name: Braided Cheesy Garlic Bread
ingredients:
Dough:
2½ cups All-Purpose Flour
1¼ tsp Active Dry Yeast (one packet)
1¼ cup Warm Milk
1/2 tsp Sugar
1 tsp Salt
Filling:
1 Head of Garlic, peeled and minced
4 Tbsp Fresh Parsley, finely chopped
1/3 cup Parmesan, grated
1/2 cup Butter, softened
1/2 cup Mozzarella, shredded
directions:
In a bowl, combine warm milk, yeast, and sugar. Once the mixture becomes foamy, gradually mix in the flour and salt. Knead the dough into a smooth ball. Cover and allow the dough to rise for 1 hour in a warm spot.
Meanwhile, make the filling. Combine all ingredients in a bowl, except the mozzarella. Set aside.
Preheat oven to 350F. Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface to form a rectangle. Spread the filling over the dough and make sure to leave an inch around the edges. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over the top.
Roll the dough into a log lengthwise. Slice the roll in half lengthwise leaving one end (about 1 inch) intact. Twist the two sides into a braid, while trying to keep the cut sides facing up.
Grease a loaf pan and place the braided dough inside. Cover and allow to rise again for about 45 minutes to 1 hour. Uncover, brush with olive oil, and bake for about 30-35 minutes.

name: Braised Brisket Tacos with Street Corn and Jalapeño Lime Ranch
ingredients:
Street Corn Recipe
Jalapeño Lime Ranch Recipe
1½ Tbsp Chipotle Powder
1 Tbsp Paprika
1 Tbsp Oregano, dried
1 Tbsp Ground All Spice
1 tsp Coriander
Braised Brisket:
2 Tbsp Olive Oil
3 lb. Brisket Beef Chuck or Brisket, divide into 4 chunks
6 Garlic Cloves, minced
1 Sweet Onion, diced
3/4 cup Orange Juice
1 Lime, juiced
14 oz can Crushed Tomatoes
2 Tbsp Chipotle Adobo Sauce
2 cups Beef Stock
Salt & Pepper, to taste
8 Flour Tortillas
1 cup Mozzarella or Monterey Jack, shredded
directions:
Braised Beef Brisket (Instant Pot and Stove Instructions):
Combine brisket spices in a small bowl. Use a few teaspoons to rub on all sides of the brisket pieces. Add oil to the pot and brown the brisket on all sides using the saute function on the Instant Pot or over high heat on the stove if you're using a dutch oven/stock pot. Once it's nicely browned on all sides, remove and put on a plate.
Saute onion and garlic until softened, scraping up brown bits on the bottom of the pot. Add the rest of the seasonings into the pot, followed by the remaining brisket ingredients. Submerge the meat into the liquid. Cook for 40 minutes on Pressure Cook or for about 2 hours on low heat in a pot on the stove. Once the meat can be easily shredded with a fork, it is ready. In some cases you may need to add 5-10 more minutes on the pressure cook function in an Instant Pot or another 30 minutes on the stove.
Remove meat, shred and add back into the pot and cook on saute mode for 5-10 minutes so the excess water boils out of the braising liquid and the meat absorbs the flavor. If using a pot over the stove top, turn heat up to achieve a low boil and cook for 5-10 minutes.
notes: Prep time 30 min and Cook time 45 min (including Street Corn and Jalapeño Lime Ranch recipes)

name: Brazilian Lemonade
ingredients:
2 cups Sugar
4 cups Limes, quartered (including the peel)
6 cups Water
4 oz Sweetened Condensed Milk
directions:
Place sugar, limes, sweetened condensed milk, and 2 cups of water in a blender.
Holding the lid down firmly, blend the mixture until everything is combined and frothy.
Then pass through a strainer and add remaining 4 cups of water.
Serve the drink in glasses of ice and garnish with lime wedges and enjoy!
notes: How many limes make up 4 cups? Your guess is as good as mine.

name: Bread Bowls
ingredients:
1/4 cup Warm Water
1 Tbsp Yeast
1 cup Scalded Milk
1/8 cup Sugar
1/8 cup Shortening
1 tsp Salt
1 Egg
3-4 cup Flour
directions:
Dissolve yeast in warm water and set aside.
In another bowl, combine milk, sugar, shortening and salt with 2 cups of flour. Beat until smooth.
Beat in eggs, dissolved yeast, and additional flour to make a soft dough. Knead well and let rise until doubled.
Shape into baseball sized balls. Bake at 400F for 15-20 minutes.

name: Breadsticks at Tiffany's
ingredients:
1 Tbsp Yeast
1-1/2 cup Warm Water
1 Tbsp Honey
1 tsp Salt
3-1/2 to 4 cups Flour
1/2 cup Margarine
directions:
Melt butter in 9x10 inch pan.
In a bowl, dissolve yeast in water, stir in honey.
Mix salt and flour; stir into water mixture.
Knead dough for 10 minutes.
Roll into a rectangle the size of the pan.
Sprinkle with garlic salt or onion salt or sesame seeds and Parmesan Cheese.
Let rise for 15 minutes.
Bake at 425 degrees for 20 minutes.

name: Breadsticks at Tastemade
ingredients:
Dough:
1 tsp Sugar
1 Envelope Instant Yeast
4 cups Bread Flour
1½ tsp Salt
1½ cups Warm Water
2 Tbsp Olive Oil
Topping:
1/4 tsp Garlic Powder
1/2 tsp Salt
4 Tbsp Butter
1/2 cup Parmesan Cheese, finely grated
directions:
In the bowl of a stand mixer, add water, sugar, and yeast. Allow to stand for 5 minutes, or until yeast bubbles up.
Add flour, salt, olive oil, and remaining water to yeast mixture. Using the dough hook attachment, mix until the dough pulls away from the sides of the bowl to form a ball. If the mixture is too wet, add a Tbsp of flour at a time.
Cover bowl with plastic wrap or towel, and allow to rest in a warm place until dough doubles in volume (approx. 1½ hours).
Preheat oven to 425 F.
Divide dough into two, and then cut into eight pieces. Using your hands roll each piece into approx. a 10 inch cylinder. Using a sharp paring knife, cut the dough so that they look like bread sticks, and transfer to a lined baking sheet coated in cooking spray. Make sure to slightly space them apart.
Bake for 7-8 minutes, until just slightly golden.
Melt butter with salt and garlic powder. Brush over warm bread sticks, and top with a generous sprinkling of Parmesan Cheese.

name: Breakfast Ramekins
ingredients:
Prosciutto
Cherry Tomatoes, halved
Eggs
Pepper
Parmesan, grated
Chives, to garnish
directions:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
Layer the bottom of your ramekin with prosciutto. Toss a handful of halved cherry tomatoes, add an egg and season with pepper and grated Parmesan.
Bake for 10-15 minutes, depending on how well-done you like your egg yolks.
Garnish with more grated Parmesan and chopped chives.

name: Broccoli Cheese Soup
ingredients:
1 Tbsp Butter, melted
1/2 Onion, chopped
1/4 cup Butter, melted
1/4 cups Flour
2 cups Half-and-Half
2 cups Chicken Broth
1/2 lbs. Fresh Broccoli Florets or a 12 oz bag of Frozen Broccoli
1 cup Carrot, shredded
8 oz Cheddar Cheese, shredded
Salt & Pepper
directions:
Saute onion in Tbsp butter until translucent; set aside.
Cook 1/4 cup butter and flour using a whisk over medium heat for 3-5 minutes.
Stir constantly and add half and half.
Add chicken broth; simmer for 20 minutes.
Add broccoli, carrots and onions.
Cook over low heat 20-25 minutes, or until broccoli is tender.
Put portions into blender and puree until smooth.
Return to heat; add cheese and season.
notes: cook time: 1 hour

name: Broccoli Salad
ingredients:
8 slices Bacon
5 cups Broccoli Florets (from 1 large head of broccoli)
1/3 cup Red Onion, diced
1/2 cup Unsweetened C, dried
1/2 cup Sunflower Seeds
1/4 cup Goat Cheese, crumbled
Dressing:
1/2 cup Mayonnaise
1/4 cup Plain Yogurt
directions:
Cook the bacon. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Add the bacon slices to a parchment-lined baking tray and cook for 15 to 18 minutes, or until crispy. Remove the bacon from the oven and transfer it to a paper towel-lined plate to dry and cool.
Add the broccoli, red onion, cranberries, sunflower seeds, and goat cheese to a large mixing bowl. When the bacon is cool to the touch, crumble it on top.
To make the dressing, add the mayonnaise and yogurt to a small bowl and stir together.
Pour the dressing on top of the broccoli salad and toss to combine.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 10 min

name: Brown Sugar Bourbon Pork Chops with Apple Pan Sauce, Scallion Mashed Potatoes & Roasted Brussels Sprouts
ingredients:
12 oz Yukon Gold Potatoes
8 oz Brussels Sprouts
1 Apple
2 Scallions
10 oz Pork Chops
10.8 grams Brown Sugar Bourbon Seasoning
1 Chicken Stock Concentrate
2 Tbsp Sour Cream
directions:
Potatoes: Adjust rack to middle position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry all produce. Dice potatoes into 1/2-inch pieces. Place in a medium pot with enough salted water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil and cook until tender, 15-20 minutes. Reserve 1/2 cup potato cooking liquid, then drain and return potatoes to pot. Keep covered off heat until ready to mash.
Mash potatoes until mostly smooth. Stir in scallion greens, sour cream, 1 Tbsp butter, and a splash of reserved potato cooking liquid. Season with salt and pepper. Keep covered until ready to serve. TIP: If needed, add more reserved potato cooking liquid a splash at a time until potatoes are smooth and creamy.
Brussels Sprouts: Trim and halve Brussels Sprouts lengthwise. Toss on a baking sheet with a large drizzle of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Roast until lightly browned, 20-25 minutes.
Pork: Pat pork dry with paper towels; prick all over with a fork or knife. Season all over with McCormick Grill Mates Brown Sugar Bourbon Seasoning. Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add pork and cook until browned and cooked through, 4-6 minutes per side. Turn off heat; transfer pork to a plate. Wipe out pan. TIP: If the pork begins to brown too quickly, reduce heat to medium.
Apple Pan Sauce: Meanwhile, halve, core, and dice apple into 1/4-inch pieces. Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens. Heat 1 Tbsp butter and a drizzle of oil in pan used for pork over medium-high heat. Add apple and scallion whites; season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until golden, 4-6 minutes. Stir in stock concentrate, 1/2 cup water, and 1/2 tsp sugar. Cook until sauce is thickened and apple is tender, 5-7 minutes. In the last 2 minutes, return pork to pan until warmed through. Season with salt and pepper. Turn off heat.
Divide pork, mashed potatoes, and Brussels Sprouts between plates. Top pork with apple pan sauce and serve.
notes:
Prep time 10 min and Cook time 35 min. Calories: 660
Switch out brussels sprouts for Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Balsamic Vinegar and Honey recipe

name: Brussels Sprouts with White Balsamic-Pear Chutney
ingredients:
4 Tbsp Extra-Virgin Olive Oil, divided
1/3 cup Shallots, finely chopped
1 small Pear, cored and finely chopped (I like D'Anjou)
1 Tbsp Maple Syrup
3/4 tsp Salt, divided
3 Tbsp White Balsamic Vinegar
2 tsp Fresh Rosemary, finely chopped
1 lb. Brussels Sprouts, trimmed and halved
directions:
Heat 2 Tbsp of the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add shallots; cook 3 minutes. Add pear, maple syrup, and 1/4 tsp of the salt; cook 3 minutes. Stir in balsamic and cook 8 to 10 minutes, until pears are softened and mixture is golden. Stir in rosemary and transfer to a bowl.
Add remaining 2 Tbsp oil to pan. Arrange Brussels, cut side-down, and cook, undisturbed, for 4 minutes, until golden-brown. Toss and continue to cook, stirring occasionally, until Brussels are crisp-tender, about 5 to 7 more minutes. Season with remaining 1/2 tsp salt.
Add chutney back to pan and toss with spouts. Transfer a serving platter or bowl.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 20 min

name: Buffalo Chicken Taquitos
ingredients:
1½ cups Rotisserie Chicken, shredded
6 Small Tortillas
1/2 cup Buffalo Sauce
1/4 cup Plain Greek Yogurt
2 Tbsp Green Onion
1/4 cup Red Onion, diced
1/3 cup Cheddar Cheese, shredded
1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
1/2 tsp Sea Salt
directions:
In a large bowl, combine shredded chicken, cheese, green onion, red onion, buffalo sauce, greek yogurt, sea salt and garlic powder.
Mix to combine.
Heat up your tortillas in the microwave for 10 seconds.
Add a serving on one side of the tortilla. Tightly roll up. Do this until you're out of buffalo chicken.
Place on the stovetop to heat on both sides.
Top with green onion and serve with ranch or blue cheese.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 10 min

name: Buldak Carbonara Ramen
ingredients:
1 package Buldak Ramen
1½ Tbsp Kewpie Mayo
1 Egg Yolk
1 tsp Chili Oil
½ cup Green Onions, chopped
directions:
Start by boiling noodles according to the instructions on the package. To add some texture, pull a Jake Peralta and save a few uncooked noodle crumbles as a topping.
Chop half a cup of green onions.
Mix the Buldak seasoning packets, egg yolk, and mayo in serving bowl.
Add cooked and drained noodles to serving bowl. Mix everything up, top it off with chili oil, green onions, and crunchy noodles.
notes: Cook time 10 min

name: Bulgogi Pork Tenderloin with Roasted Carrots & Lemony Rice
ingredients:
12 oz Carrots
1 Lemon
2 Scallions
1/2 cup Jasmine Rice
10 oz Pork Tenderloin
4 oz Bulgogi
1 Tbsp Sesame Seeds
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Trim, peel, and cut carrots into 1/2-inch-thick rounds. Zest and quarter lemon. Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens.
Rice: In a small pot, combine rice, 3/4 cup water, and a big pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to a low simmer. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve. Fluff rice with a fork. Stir in half the lemon zest (add more zest if you like), 1 Tbsp butter, and a squeeze of lemon juice; season with salt and pepper.
Carrots: While rice cooks, toss carrots on one side of a baking sheet with a drizzle of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack for 10 minutes. Once carrots have roasted 10 minutes, remove sheet from oven. Flip carrots and put back in oven until carrots are tender, 10-12 minutes more.
Pork: Meanwhile, pat pork dry with paper towels; season all over with salt and pepper. Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add pork; sear, turning occasionally, until browned all over, 4-8 minutes. Carefully place seared pork on empty side of carrot pan. Cook until pork is tender (10 to 12 minutes). TIP: If carrots are done before pork, remove from sheet and continue roasting pork.
When pork and carrots have 5 minutes left, melt 1 Tbsp butter in pan used for pork over medium-high heat. Add scallion whites and cook until fragrant, 1-2 minutes. Stir in bulgogi sauce and 1 Tbsp water. Bring to a simmer, stirring, until warmed through, 2-3 minutes. Turn off heat. TIP: If sauce is too thick, stir in a splash more water.
Thinly slice pork crosswise. Divide rice, pork, and carrots between plates. Drizzle pork with sauce. Sprinkle with scallion greens and sesame seeds. Serve with remaining lemon wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 30 min. Calories: 700

name: Butter Ball Cookies
ingredients:
1/2 lb. Butter
4-6 Tbsp Powdered Sugar
2 cups Flour
1 tsp Vanilla
directions:
Mix all ingredients.
Roll into walnut size balls.
Bake for 15-18 minutes at 350 degrees.
Cool on wire racks.
Sprinkle with sifted powdered sugar.
notes: optional: 1 cup Walnuts, chopped

name: Butter Cream Frosting
ingredients:
1/3 cup Butter or Margarine
4-1/2 cups Powdered Sugar
1/4 cup Milk
1-1/2 tsp Vanilla
Food Coloring, optional
directions:
In a mixing bowl beat butter till fluffy. Gradually add 2 cups of powdered sugar. Beat well.
Slowly beat in the 1/4 cup of milk and vanilla.
Slowly beat in remaining powdered sugar.
Beat in additional milk, if needed, to reach spreading consistency.
If desired, tint with food coloring.
notes:
For chocolate frosting:
beat 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder into butter.
Reduce powdered sugar to 4 cups.

name: Butter Naan
ingredients:
4 cups All-Purpose Flour 18 oz (weight)
1 Tbsp Instant Dry Yeast
2 tsp Salt
1/2 tsp Baking Soda
1 tsp Baking Powder
3/4 cup Plain Yogurt or Buttermilk
1 cup Warm Water
4 Tbsp Butter, melted
1 Tbsp Cilantro, minced
directions:
Combine flour, yeast, salt, baking soda and baking powder in a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment and beat on low speed to combine.
Add yogurt and water to the mixer bowl. Starting on low speed, beat until the mixture forms a shaggy dough, then switch to the hook attachment and knead for 4 minutes on medium-low speed. It may look very sticky at first but will come together as it kneads (don't add more flour).
Flour a work surface. Dump out the dough and sprinkle it lightly with flour, too. Knead once or twice to form a large ball. Cut the dough into 8 equal pieces and form each piece into a ball by rolling the dough between your hands.
The dough is still quite sticky at this point, but you can work with it.
Cover and let rise 1 hour.
Use a rolling pin to roll each dough ball flat to about 1/4” thick, if not slightly thinner. Lightly flour the work surface and dough as needed. Lift the dough off the counter and use your hands to gently pull it into a thinner, slightly oblong shape. Let it rest 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, preheat a cast iron pan for 5 minutes on medium-high heat. You’ll know it’s hot enough when you sprinkle it with water and it beads and evaporates immediately.
Add one naan to the pan. Cover the pan and cook until bubbles start to grow on the top of the naan (about 30-60 seconds).
Flip and cook on the other side until the dough loses its shiny, raw look and starts charring in spots (about 30 seconds more). For more dramatic puffing up and charring (like authentic tandoori-style naan), see notes below for instructions on finishing the naan over a direct flame.
As naan breads are cooked, transfer them to a plate and cover with a towel to keep warm.
Melt the butter and stir in cilantro, if using. Immediately brush the butter over warm naan (this seals the moisture into the hot bread and ensures softness).

name: Cadbury Egg Cookies
ingredients:
3 cups All-Purpose Flour
1½ tsp Baking Powder
1 tsp Baking Soda
1 tsp Sea Salt
1 cup Butter, unsalted and room temperature
1½ cups Brown Sugar, light
1/2 cup Sugar
2 Eggs, large
2 tsp Vanilla Extract
1½ cups Cadbury Mini Eggs, chopped
1 cup Chocolate Chips
1 cup Toasted Coconut
Flaked Sea Salt, for sprinkling on cookies
directions:
If you decide to toast the coconut, preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Place one cup of shredded coconut on a baking sheet that has been lined with parchment paper or a Silpat baking mat. Spread out the coconut in an even layer onto the baking sheet. Bake for 5-7 minutes, stirring once, or until coconut is very light brown and toasted. Remove from oven and let cool completely.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with a Silpat baking mat or parchment paper and set aside.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and sea salt. Set aside.
Using a stand mixer, cream butter and sugars together for about 1 minute. Add in the eggs and vanilla and mix until combined.
Add the dry ingredients and mix on low until just combined.
Chop the Cadbury eggs and toast the coconut. Chop the Cadbury eggs by placing them in a Ziploc bag and smash with a rolling pin. Make sure you don't smash them too much, you don't want them completely crushed.
Stir in the chopped Cadbury Mini Eggs, chocolate chips, and toasted coconut.
Form the cookie dough into balls, about 2 tablespoons of dough. Place on prepared baking sheet, about 2 inches apart.
Bake cookies for 10-12 minutes or until the edges are slightly golden brown. Remove from oven and sprinkle with sea salt. Let cookies cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes. Transfer to a wire cooling rack and cool completely.
notes: You can chill the cookie dough for 24 to 72 hours if you want to enhance the flavor of the cookies. The cookies will keep in an airtight container for 3-4 days. You can also freeze the cookie dough and baked cookies.

name: Cafe Rio Rice
ingredients:
3 cups Rice, uncooked
1 Tbsp Butter or Margarine
6 Garlic Cloves, minced
1 tsp Fresh Lime Juice
2 Tbsp Chicken Bouillon Granules
8.5 cups Water
2 Tbsp Sugar
1 Tbsp Fresh Lime Juice
6 Tbsp fresh Cilantro
directions:
In sauce pan, combine rice, butter, garlic 1 tsp lime, chicken broth and water.
Bring to a boil.
Cover and cook on low for 15-20 minutes, until rice is tender.
Remove from heat.
In a small bowl combine lime juice, sugar and cilantro.
Pour over hot cooked rice and mix in as you fluff the rice.

name: Cajun Bang Bang Salmon Bites
ingredients:
4 Salmon Filets
1 tsp Garlic Powder
1/2 tsp Pepper
1 tsp Paprika
1 Tbsp Oil
1½ TbsP Cajun Seasonings
1/2 cup Kewpie Mayo
1/3 cup Sweet Thai Chili Sauce
2 Tbsp Sriracha
Green Onions
directions:
Cut salmon into 2-inch cubes.
Add seasonings to a bowl and mix well. Toss salmon bites in seasoning mix and coat well and evenly.
Air fry at 350F for 3-4 minutes of each side. Be careful not to overcook the salmon to avoid drying it out.
Make the sauce by adding the kewpie mayo, sweet chili sauce, and sriracha together. Mix well.
Drizzle cooked salmon bites with sauce and garnish with chopped green onions.

name: Cajun Garlic-Parmesan Alfredo
ingredients:
3 Chicken Breasts
Tbsp Extra-Virgin Olive Oil
1 Tbsp Cajun Seasoning
20g Butter, unsalted
1 Onion, finely chopped
3 Garlic cloves
250ml Boiling Chicken Stock
400ml Milk
1 Tbsp Cajun Seasoning
50g Parmesan, grated
2 Tbsp Cream Cheese
Pepper, to taste
50ml Single Cream
Parsley, finely chopped
300g Spaghetti
directions:
Preheat oven to 365°F.
Place chicken breasts in a large baking dish, drizzle with olive oil and add cajun seasoning, coat chicken breast all over, then bake for 25 mins.
Heat unsalted butter in a large pan, then add onion - fry for 5 mins or until soft, then add garlic and sauté for 1 min. Add boiling chicken stock and semi skimmed milk, stir to combine, then bring pan to a simmer and reduce sauce for 10-15 mins, stirring regularly. If the milk starts to bubble aggressively, then reduce heat to avoid burning milk.
Bring a large saucepan of lightly salted to water to boil and add spaghetti. Cook until al dente. When draining, reserve some pasta water to add to dish before serving.
Once sauce has reduced, add cajun seasoning, parmesan, light cream cheese and single cream. Add pasta water to loosen the sauce if it needs it. At this point, reserve a few tbsp of Alfredo sauce to top chicken later on, then add finely chopped parsley and toss in cooked spaghetti, with some pasta water, to combine.
Remove and thinly slice cooked chicken breasts. Serve pasta immediately with cajun chicken breast, top with a drizzle of Alfredo sauce and some more grated parmesan.
notes: Cook time 30 min

name: Cajun Shrimp
ingredients:
1 lb. Shrimp, uncooked
1 tsp Cajun Seasoning
1 Red Bell Pepper, diced
1 Tbsp Olive Oil, or Avocado Oil
3 Tbsp Butter
3 Garlic Cloves, minced
3 Tbsp Flour
1½ cups Chicken Broth
3/4 cups Heavy Cream or Half-and-Half
1 Tbsp Honey
2 tsp Hot Sauce
10 oz Rotel Diced Tomatoes with Green Chilies, juice reserved
3/4 cup Cheddar Jack Cheese, shredded
2 tsp Lime Juice
2 tsp Cajun Seasoning
1 tsp Brown Sugar
1/2 tsp Mustard Powder
1/2 tsp Oregano
1 pinch Cayenne Pepper
1 pinch Red Pepper Flakes
Lime Wedges
directions:
Thaw the shrimp completely (if frozen) and pat the surface dry. You may also need to remove the shell, tail, and veins.
Drain and reserve the juice from the diced tomatoes, we’ll use the liquid to deglaze that skillet after cooking. (You should have about 1/4 cup.)
Combine the chicken broth, heavy cream, honey, hot sauce, and seasonings and set aside.
Sprinkle the shrimp with cajun seasoning.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp and diced red peppers and cook for about 1 minute + 20 seconds per side. (Use a timer to avoid overcooking). Tilt the pan to transfer the shrimp and peppers onto a clean plate. Note that they’ll cook a little bit more as they sit, and again when added back to the sauce.
Add the reserved juice from the tomatoes and set the heat to medium. Use a silicone spatula to clean the bottom and sides of the skillet. Reduce the liquid by half.
Add the butter and the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add the flour and stir continuously for 2 minutes, until the raw flour smell is cooked off.
Add the chicken broth mixture in small splashes, stirring continuously.
Bring the sauce to a boil, then reduce to a gentle bubble. Add the drained tomatoes and let it simmer and reduce for 10 minutes, uncovered. During this time the flavors will meld, and the sauce will thicken and concentrate.
Reduce heat to low. Slowly sprinkle in the cheese, stirring continuously, until melted and combined. Slowly stir in the lime juice.
Add the shrimp and peppers and stir to combine. Add the fresh lime wedges to the skillet and remove from heat. Sprinkle with cilantro and serve with rice, beans, or salad!
notes: Prep time 15 min and Cook time 25 min

name: Candied Lemon Slices
ingredients:
1 -2 Lemons, large, sliced in rings
Ice Bath
1½ cups Water
3/4 cups Sugar
Melted Chocolate, optional for garnish
directions:
Start by boiling a few cups of water in a saucepan. While your water is heating, prepare an ice bath (water and ice in a medium sized bowl).
Once boiling, drop the lemon slices into the boiling water and allow them to boil for 2 minutes before removing them and placing them into an ice bath.
Meanwhile, place the granulated sugar and water in a heavy bottom stainless steel saucepan or dutch oven, mix to combine and bring to a boil. Make sure not to mix the syrup after the initial stir, otherwise the syrup could crystallize. The pot matters here, you want to make sure that your syrup will heat evenly!
Prepare a cooling rack with parchment paper underneath the rack to catch any syrup drippings.
Once the syrup has reached a temperature of 225F/107C (this should take about 20 minutes using a gas stove), place the citrus slices in the syrup.
Continue to heat the syrup and lemon slices until it reaches 245F/118C (this should take an additional 20 minutes using a gas stove), then turn off the heat. Remove the lemon slices one by one using a fork, food tweezers or a utensil that feels natural to you and place each slice on the prepared cooling rack.
For easy cleanup, add about a cup of water into your saucepan with the leftover syrup and continue to heat for a few minutes. The added water will help to dissolve any crusted sugar bits that are clinging to your pan.
Let the lemons cool for 2 hours before enjoying or dipping them in melted chocolate!
notes: Prep time 20 min and Cook time 20 min

name: Candied Orange Peels
ingredients:
2 large Navel Oranges
1 cup Water
1 cup Sugar, plus more for coating
directions:
Boil a pot of water. Thoroughly wash the oranges to get rid of any waxy residue.
Slice off both ends, and then follow the curve of the oranges to slice off the peel. Try to keep most of the pith intact.
Slice off any remaining fruit flesh, and slice lengthwise into strips. Add the peels to the water and soften for at least 5 minutes. Drain and set aside on a rack.
In a saucepan, combine water and sugar. Stir until dissolved and then heat to boil. Once boiling, add the peels and reduce to a simmer.
Allow the syrup to thicken, about 20-25 minutes.
Remove peels and spread evenly across a cooling rack. allow to dry for at least 2 hours. You can speed dry them in the oven at the lowest temperature until the peels feel slightly tacky.
Coat the peels in sugar, and allow to dry or serve right away.

name: Carmelitas
ingredients:
3/4 cup Butter, melted
3/4 cup Brown Sugar, light and packed
1 Tbsp Vanilla Extract
1 cup All-Purpose Flour
1 cup Whole-Rolled Old Fashioned Oats (not instant or quick cook)
1 tsp Baking Soda
1/2 tsp Salt, or to taste
35 Caramel Squares, unwrapped (Werther's Originals Baking Caramels work)
1/2 cup Heavy Cream
1 cup (6 oz) Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips or Chunks
directions:
Preheat oven to 350F. Line an 8x8-inch pan with aluminum foil and spray with cooking spray. Lining your pan is highly recommended for ease of cleanup due to the stickiness of the caramel; set pan aside.
In a large microwave-safe mixing bowl, add the butter and heat on high power to melt, about 90 seconds.
Add the brown sugar, vanilla, and whisk until smooth.
Add the flour, oats, baking soda, optional pinch salt, and stir until combined. Mixture will be quite thick.
Add half of the mixture to the prepared pan (just eyeball it), and smooth it with spatula or the back of a spoon, to create an even, smooth, flat layer; set remainder aside.
Bake for 10 minutes. While it bakes, make the caramel sauce.
In a large microwave-safe mixing bowl, combine the caramels, cream, salt, and heat on high power in 60-second bursts to melt caramels, stirring after each burst. It will likely take about 4 to 5 minutes total to melt; heat until mixture can be stirred smooth. Alternatively, combine caramels and cream in a medium saucepan, and heat over medium-low heat to melt, stirring nearly continuously, until mixture can be stirred smooth.
After 10 minutes, remove pan from the oven and evenly sprinkle with the chocolate.
Slowly and evenly pour caramel sauce over the chocolate.
Evenly crumble reserved oatmeal-brown sugar mixture over the top.
Return pan to oven and bake for about 15 to 18 minutes, or until edges are lightly browned and center is bubbling slightly.
Allow bars to cool completely in the pan before slicing and serving, giving the molten caramel time to firm up. This can take up to 4 hours, or overnight, at room temperature. You can speed it up by placing pan in fridge with a sheet of foil over the top to prevent fridge smells. If you don't wait for bars to cool completely, they'll be a literal hot mess. They'll taste fine (don't burn yourself), but they won't slice neatly with clean cuts.
notes: Prep time 15 min and Cook time 25 min.

name: Caramel Candy Brownies
ingredients:
Filling:
14 oz Caramels, unwrapped
2 Tbsp Milk
Base and Topping:
4 squares (1 oz each) Unsweetened Chocolate
3/4 cup Butter
2 cups Sugar
3 Eggs
1 Tbsp Milk
1 cup All-Purpose Flour
1 cup Pecans, chopped and divided
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
Filling: in a microwave-safe bowl, on medium power, heat caramels and milk for 3 minutes. Remove from oven and stir until melted and smooth. (Alternatively, heat caramels and milk in a saucepan over low heat, stirring until smooth and melted.) Keep warm while preparing brownie batter.
Base and topping: in a large sauce pan, over low heat, melt chocolate and butter, stirring constantly, until smooth. Remove from heat and set aside to cool slightly. When mixture has cooled, stir in sugar. Add eggs and beat until just blended. Stir in milk. Blend in flour. Stir in nuts.
Spread half the batter evenly and prepared pan. Spoon filling over batter. Sprinkle 3/4 cups of the nuts over top. Drop remaining batter by spoonfuls over nuts, then sprinkle with remaining nuts. Bake in preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until a tester inserted in center comes out clean. Place pan on a wire rack to cool completely, then cut into squares.
notes: 9-inch square cake pan, greased

name: Caramel in a Jar
ingredients:
1½ cups Sugar
1½ cups Brown Sugar
1 cup Light Corn Syrup
⅔ cup Butter
1⅓ cups Heavy Whipping Cream
directions:
Combine all ingredients except whipping cream in 3-quart heavy saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, 15-20 minutes or until mixture comes to a full boil. Stir in whipping cream; continue cooking 1 minute. Cool 5 minutes.
Pour mixture into 5 (8-ounce) jars. Cool 15 minutes; cover. Store refrigerated.
Microwave, stirring occasionally, 30-60 seconds or until warm. Serve over ice cream.
notes:
Prep Time: 5 min | Total Time: 40 min
https://www.landolakes.com/recipe/17142/caramel-silk-in-a-jar/
original_author: Land O Lakes and Cindy Remer

name: Caramel Oatmeal Bars
ingredients:
Base:
1½ cups All-Purpose Flour
3/4 cup Brown Sugar, packed
1/2 cup Quick-Cooking Rolled Oats
1/2 cup Butter or Margarine
1 Egg, beaten
1/2 cups Pecans, chopped
Topping:
1¼ cups Milk or Sweetened Condensed Milk
25 Soft caramels, unwrapped
1/4 cup Butter or Margarine
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
Base: in a large bowl, mix together flour, brown sugar and oats. Using two knives, a pastry blender or your fingers, cut butter in until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Add egg and mix until blended. Stir in pecans. Set aside 1½ cups and press remainder evenly into prepared pan. Bake in preheated oven for 15 to 18 minutes or until lightly browned. Place pan on rack to cool slightly.
Topping: In a sauce pan, over low heat, melt caramels with milk, stirring constantly until smooth. Pour over baked base. Sprinkle reserved crumb mixture evenly over top. Bake 20 to 25 minutes longer, until bubbly and golden brown. Place pan on a rack to cool completely, then cut into bars.
notes: 13x9 inch cake pan, greased

name: Caramel Peanut Cup Bars
ingredients:
Base:
1 package Yellow Cake Mix
1/2 cup Butter or Margarine, softened
1 Egg
20 miniature Peanut Butter Cups, chopped
Topping:
2½ cups Caramel Sundae Sauce
2 Tbsp Cornstarch
1/4 cup Peanut Butter
1 cup Peanuts, salted and chopped
1 container of Ready to Serve Chocolate Frosting
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
Base: in a large bowl, mix together cake mix, butter and egg, until smooth. Fold and peanut butter cups. Spread mixture evenly in prepared pan. Bake in preheated oven for 18 to 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Place pan on a wire rack to cool slightly.
Topping: in a sauce pan, over low heat, stir together caramel sauce, cornstarch and peanut butter. Increase heat and bring to a boil; cook, stirring constantly, for two minutes, until smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in 1/2 cup of the peanuts and spread evenly over warm base.
Bake 6 to 8 minutes longer or until almost set. Place pan on a rack to cool completely. Spread frosting over top. Sprinkle with remaining peanuts. Chill at least one hour before cutting into bars.
notes: 13x9 inch cake pan, greased

name: Caramelized Onion Dip
ingredients:
2 Onions, large
3 Garlic Cloves
1 Tbsp Butter
Salt and Pepper
1 Tbsp Rosemary
1 tsp Sugar
1 Tbsp Balsamic Vinegar
2 handfuls of Cheese
1 tsp Onion Powder
12 oz Cream Cheese
3 Tbsp Yogurt
2 Tbsp Mayo
2 Tbsp Nutritional Yeast
Drizzle of oil for the top
Sprinkle of Smoked Paprika, for topping
Fresh Chives
directions:
Start by cooking off your onions in the butter over a medium heat. You want them to caramelize so it should take up to 20 mins.
Then add in the garlic, rosemary, sugar, salt, balsamic vinegar and pepper and cook for a few minutes more.
Once cooked, add it to a bowl with the onion powder, cheese, cream cheese, mayo, yogurt and yeast and mix well.
Pour it into a bowl or ramekin and top with more cheese, some oil and paprika and bake for 15 mins or until bubbling. Dip in some bread and enjoy!!

name: Caramels
ingredients:
2 cups Sugar
2 cups Light Corn Syrup
1 tsp Vanilla
1 Tbsp Margarine
1 (13 oz) can Evaporated Milk
directions:
Combine sugar and syrup.
Bring to a boil and add butter.
Add milk, a little at a time.
Continue cooking slowly so boiling never ceases, stirring constantly.
Boil to firm ball stage, 242 degrees.
Add vanilla (and pour over nuts which have been scattered at the bottom of a well oiled cookie sheet.)
Let stand several hours.
Turn out onto wax paper and cut into squares.
Wrap in wax paper.
notes: 1 cup chopped nuts (optional)

name: Carrot Rice
ingredients:
5 Tbsp Olive Oil
1 Carrot, grated
½ Onion, chopped
2 cups Basmati Rice
3 cups Water
1 Stock Cube
Salt, to taste
directions:
Wash and grate the carrot. Chop the onion into small bits.
Measure out your rice and rinse several times in water until the water runs clear.
Pour olive oil into a pot and bring to medium-high heat. Fry the carrots and onion in the oil for about 5 minutes, stirring it every so often.
Add in the rice and fry for another 5 minutes, stirring it every so often.
Add in the water and once it starts boiling add the stock cube and salt to taste. Cover with a lid and tin foil and cook on very low heat for 15 minutes.

name: Cavatappi Beef Ragu with Parmesan & Parsley
ingredients:
3 oz Carrots
1/4 oz Parsley
6 oz Cavatappi Pasta
10 oz Ground Beef
1 Tbsp Italian Seasoning
14 oz Marinara Sauce
2 Tbsp Cream Cheese
1/4 cup Parmesan Cheese
directions:
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Wash and dry produce. Trim, peel, and finely chop carrot. Pick parsley leaves from stems; roughly chop leaves.
Once water is boiling, add cavatappi to pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, 9-11 minutes. Drain.
While cavatappi cooks, heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add carrot; cook, stirring, until browned and tender, 6-8 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Increase heat under pan with carrot to medium high and add a drizzle of oil. Push carrot to one side of pan. Add beef to empty side. Cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned. Sprinkle with Italian Seasoning. Cook, stirring, until beef is cooked through, 4-6 minutes. Season generously with salt and pepper. Stir carrot and beef to combine.
Stir in marinara and 1/3 cup water (1/2 cup for 4 servings). Reduce to a simmer and cook until sauce has slightly thickened, 3-4 minutes. Reduce heat to low. Stir in cream cheese until thoroughly combined. Add drained cavatappi, 1 Tbsp butter, and half the chopped parsley; stir until pasta is warmed through, 1-2 minutes. (For 4, if pan is too small, carefully transfer everything to pot used for pasta.) Season with salt and pepper.
Divide pasta between bowls. Top with Parmesan and remaining chopped parsley. Serve.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 25 min. Calories: 970

name: Challah Scarf
ingredients:
1/2 cup Lukewarm Water
1/4 cup Sugar
1 Tbsp Active Dry Yeast
1/4 Honey
100g Butter, melted and slightly cooled
4 Egg Yolks
3 Eggs, at room temp
4½ cups All-Purpose Flour
2½ tsp Salt
directions:
Combine the water and a pinch of the sugar in a bowl. Sprinkle the yeast over top and set aside until foamy (5-6 min).
Add the remaining sugar, honey, butter, egg yolks and 2 of the whole eggs and using an electric mixer, beat to combine.
Add half the flour and the salt and mix at a low speed until smooth. Add remaining flour and combine. Pour onto a floured surface and knead by hand until the dough is smooth and elastic, 8 minutes.
Place the dough into an oiled bowl and cover the top with plastic wrap. Let rise in a warm draft free place until doubled in size, 1½ hours.
Remove the dough from the bowl and cut off a small amount for the fringe of the scarf, set aside. Using a scale, begin to cut 9 even pieces measuring each piece and adding/removing dough as needed.
Once you have divided the dough evenly, roll each piece into a thin snake roughly 20 inches in length. Connect all nine strands at the top of your board by pinching then together.
To braid, start with the most right strand and place over the 2 left adjacent strands. Then take the same strand under the next 2 left adjacent strands. Do the same with the left most strand. Repeat the process and a braid will soon appear.
Once finished, tuck all the strands together and decorate with remaining dough creating the fringe and seams. Cover loosely with a tea towel and let rise for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 350F. Whisk remaining egg and brush the loaf. Bake for 35-40 minutes covering with foil after 30 minutes to prevent over browning. Transfer to a wire rack to cool.

name: Cheddar Bay Biscuits
ingredients:
2 cups All-Purpose Flour
2 tsp Baking Powder
1/2 tsp Baking Soda
1 tsp Sugar
3/4 tsp Salt
1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
1/4 tsp Cayenne Pepper
1 cup Sharp Cheddar Cheese
1 cup Cold Buttermilk
1/2 cup Unsalted Butter, melted and cooled for 5 minutes
2 Tbsp Butter, melted
1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
1/4 tsp Parsley, dried
directions:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees.
In a large bowl, mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, sugar, salt, garlic powder and cayenne pepper. Stir in the cheddar cheese and set aside.
In a separate bowl, mix the buttermilk and melted butter together until small lumps form.
Add the buttermilk to the large bowl with the flour and mix until a dough has formed and the ingredients are no longer dry. Do not overmix.
Lightly grease a 1/4 cup and scoop out the dough with it. Place on a light colored, lightly greased baking sheet, leaving slightly more than an inch between each. You should have 10 total.
