Bake for about 12 minutes, until they are golden brown.
While the biscuits are baking, combine melted butter, garlic powder, and parsley. Brush the tops of the biscuits when they come out of the oven and serve immediately.
notes: Prep time 8 min and Cook time 12 min

name: Cheese and Potato Soup
ingredients:
2 Tbsp Vegetable Oil
1/2 cup Celery, chopped
1/2 cup Carrot, chopped
1/2 cup Onions, chopped
1/2 tsp Thyme, dried
3 Tbsp All-Purpose Flour
2 cups Chicken Broth
2 cups Milk
1 10-12 oz Russet Potato, peeled, diced
1 cup Sharp Cheddar Cheese, shredded
1/2 cup Ham, chopped
Fresh Parsley, chopped
directions:
Heat oil in heavy large saucepan over medium heat.
Add celery, carrot, onion and thyme and saute until vegetables begin to soften, about 5 minutes.
Sprinkle flour over and stir 2 minutes. Gradually whisk in broth, then milk.
Add potato and bring soup to boil.
Reduce heat and simmer soup until potato is tender, and 20 minutes.
Add cheese 1/3 cup at a time, stirring until melted and smooth after each addition. Mix in ham.
Season soup to taste with Tabasco, salt and pepper. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

name: Cheese Ball with Chipped Beef
ingredients:
2 (8 oz) packages Cream Cheese
2 small package Chipped Beef (lunch meat thin sliced)
1 tsp Worcestershire Sauce
2 Tbsp Chives or Green Onions, chopped
1 Tbsp Milk
1 Tbsp Almonds, for outer decoration
directions:
Chop up the beef into little squares.
Mix all ingredients together except 1 package of chopped beef.
Shape into 2 balls and roll in remaining chipped beef.
Refrigerate until set.

name: Cheese Ball
ingredients:
16 oz Cream Cheese, softened but still slightly firm
1/3 cup Sour Cream
8 oz Medium Cheddar Cheese, shredded
1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
1/2 tsp Onion Powder
1/2 tsp Coarse Ground Black Pepper
1 cup Pecans, chopped small
directions:
To a large stand mixer add the cream cheese, sour cream, cheddar cheese, garlic powder and onion powder and black pepper, then beat on low speed until smooth, about 1-2 minutes.
Put mixture in the refrigerator for 1 hour to chill.
Lay a large plastic wrap square on your counter and put the mixture on it, then gather the sides and bunch them up to help shape the mixture into a ball.
Add the chopped pecans to a large bowl and roll the cheese ball into the chopped pecans then serve with crackers.

name: Cheese Sauce
ingredients:
1 oz Butter
1 oz Flour
2 Cups Milk
2 Cups Cheese
Salt & Pepper
directions:
Melt butter.
Whisk in flour and cook on medium for 2-3 minutes.
Whisk in milk and bring to a boil stirring constantly.
Once boiling, reduce temperature to a simmer and simmer fro 10 minutes stirring occasionally.
Remove sauce from heat and whisk in cheese and season with salt and pepper.

name: Cheesecake Swirl Brownies
ingredients:
Filling:
4 oz Cream Cheese, softened
2 Tbsp Sugar
1 Egg
Base and Topping:
1 cup All-Purpose Flour
1/2 cups Unsweetened Cocoa Powder, sifted
3/4 cup Sugar
1/2 tsp Baking Powder
1/2 cups Mini Chocolate Chips
1/4 cup Walnuts, chopped
1/4 cup Vegetable Oil
1/4 cup Unsweetened Applesauce
1/4 cup Milk
1 tsp Vanilla
1 Egg
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
Filling: in a small bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Beat in egg until incorporated. Set aside.
Base and Topping:In a large bowl, mix together flour, cocoa, sugar and baking powder. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts.
In another small bowl, whisk together oil, applesauce, milk, vanilla and egg until well blended. Add to flour mixture and mix until combined. Reserve one cup of mixture for topping and spread remainder evenly and prepared pan. Spread cream cheese filling evenly over batter. Drop reserved batter, by spoonfuls, over filling.
Run a knife through the batter at 1-inch intervals across the width of the pan, to create a marbling effect. Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes or until a tester inserted in center comes out clean. Place pan on a wire rack to cool completely, then cut into squares.
notes: 8-inch square cake pan, greased

name: Cheesy Potato Flatbread
ingredients:
1 cup Plain Yogurt
1½ cup Self-Raising Flour
3 Potatoes, cooked and mashed
1 cup Cheese, shredded
1 tsp Italian Seasonings
Butter, melted for brushing
Fresh Parsley, for garnishing
directions:
Make the dough: In a bowl combine yogurt and flour. Form into a ball and knead until soft, this won't take long. Divide the dough into 2 parts.
Make the filling by combining mashed potatoes with cheese and seasonings.
Roll out each part into a 1cm thick circle. Add half of the filling into the middle and gather the edges of the dough around the filling, pinch together to seal.
Flip and roll out to a disk shape.
Pan fry on both sides until golden over medium high heat or pop in the oven for 10 minutes at 350F.
Brush with melted butter and garnish with fresh parsley. Serve and enjoy right away!

name: Cheesy Turkey & Poblano Tostadas with Pico de Gallo & Smoky Crema
ingredients:
1 Red Onion
1 Roma Tomato
1/4 oz Cilantro
1 Lemon
1 Poblano Pepper
10 oz Ground Turkey
1 Tbsp Southwest Spice Blend
1 tsp Chili Powder
1 Chicken Stock Concentrate
6 Flour Tortillas
1/2 cup Mexican Blend
2 Tbsp Sour Cream
1 tsp Smoked Paprika
1 tsp Hot Sauce
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 450 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Halve and peel onion; thinly slice one half. Finely chop remaining onion until you have 2 Tbsp (For 4, thinly slice whole onion; finely chop a few slices until you have 3 Tbsp). Dice tomato. Roughly chop cilantro. Quarter lemon. Halve, core, and thinly slice poblano into strips.
In a small bowl, combine chopped onion, tomato, cilantro, juice from half the lemon, and a pinch of salt and pepper. In a small bowl, combine paprika and sour cream. Add a pinch of salt and pepper to taste.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add turkey and Southwest Spice; cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned, 3-5 minutes (it'll finish cooking in the next step). Turn off heat; transfer to a plate. Wipe out pan.
Heat a drizzle of oil in pan used for turkey over medium-high heat. Add sliced onion and poblano. Cook, stirring occasionally, until browned and tender, 5-7 minutes. Season with chili powder, salt, and pepper. Return turkey to pan; stir to combine. Stir in stock concentrate and 1/4 cup water. Cook until mixture is thickened and saucy, 1-2 minutes. TIP: If mixture seems dry, add another splash of water.
Meanwhile, drizzle tortillas with 1 Tbsp oil; brush or rub to coat all over. Arrange on a baking sheet in a single layer. Gently prick each tortilla in a few places with a fork. (For 4, divide between 2 baking sheets; toast on top and middle racks, flipping tortillas and swapping baking sheet positions halfway through toasting.) Toast on top rack, carefully flipping tortillas halfway through, until lightly golden, 4-5 minutes per side. TIP: Watch carefully to avoid burning.
Divide tortillas between plates; evenly sprinkle with Mexican cheese. Top with turkey mixture, pico de gallo, and smoky crema. Drizzle with hot sauce to taste. Serve with remaining lemon wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 40 min. Calories: 880

name: Cherry Tomato & Basil Pasta
ingredients:
1/2 lb. Pasta
1 cup Heavy Cream
3/4 cup Parmesan Cheese, grated
1 Tbsp Tomato Paste
4-6 Garlic Cloves, minced
1/4 cup Chicken Stock
1 tsp Chili Flakes
2 tsp Pepper
Salt, to taste
4 Tbsp Olive Oil or Unsalted Butter
1½ cups Cherry Tomatoes, halved
2 Tbsp Basil, fresh and chopped
⁠1 tsp Oregano, fresh
For Serving: 2 Tbsp Parsley, fresh and chopped
Mozzarella Pearls (about 5 per serving)
Chili Flakes, to taste
Olive Oil Drizzle
directions:
Bring a pot of water to a boil. Add about 1 tablespoon of salt and cook the pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain, reserving 1 cup of the pasta water.
⁠Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add olive oil and minced garlic; sauté for 30 seconds. Add the cherry tomatoes and toss well.
⁠Pour in the chicken stock, add salt, black pepper and chili flakes, and cook until most of the liquid has evaporated.
⁠Remove the skins from the cherry tomatoes (Optional), then stir in the tomato paste.
⁠Pour in the heavy cream and add 1/4 cup of the grated Parmesan, stir in the fresh basil and oregano, mix well and reduce the heat.
⁠Add the half-cooked pasta to the skillet, along with the remaining Parmesan Cheese. Add about 1/4 cup of the reserved pasta water and stir everything together. Continue stirring until the pasta is fully cooked and the sauce is thick and creamy (add more pasta water gradually if needed to adjust the sauce consistency).
Serve the pasta in bowls, garnished with chopped parsley, Mozzarella pearls, additional chili flakes, and a drizzle of olive oil.
⁠Finish with a sprinkle of grated Parmesan and serve warm. Enjoy!

name: Cherry Vanilla Ice Cream
ingredients:
400 ml Whipping Cream
2 cups Sour Cherries (from a jar), strained
4 Eggs
140g Sugar
2 tsp Vanilla Extract
Dash of Cherry Extract
directions:
Place the whipping cream and 1 cup of cherries in a small pot and set to medium heat. Once the cream begins to simmer, remove from the heat and let cool to room temperature. Strain to separate the cream and cherries. Whip the whipping cream with an electric mixer until soft peaks form. Then place the cream in the fridge.
In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and add the sugar, vanilla and cherry extract. Beat well with an electric mixer until the mixture forms a ribbon when the whisk is lifted and the ribbon remains on the surface of the mixture for a few seconds. Add half of the egg mixture to the cream, and whisk together.
Once they are fully combined, add the remaining egg mixture and gently fold the mixture together and combine. Add the soaked cherries and additional 1 cup of cherries and fold to combine. Make sure to be gentle and keep the mixture as airy as possible.
Pour the ice cream into a Tupperware container, and seal with the lid. Place this in the freezer for 7-8 hours to chill and set.

name: Cherry-Almond Oatmeal
ingredients:
4 cups Vanilla Almond Milk, plus some additional
1 cup Steel-Cut Oats
1 cup Cherries, dried
1/3 cup Brown Sugar, packed
1/2 tsp Salt
1/2 tsp Ground Cinnamon
directions:
In a 6-qt. electric pressure cooker coated with cooking spray, combine first 6 ingredients. Lock lid; make sure vent is closed. Select manual setting; adjust pressure to high and set time for 12 minutes.
When finished cooking, allow pressure to naturally release for 10 minutes; quick-release any remaining pressure according to manufacturer's instructions. Serve with additional almond milk if desired.

name: Chicken Bacon Ranch Sliders
ingredients:
Chicken Seasoning of choice
3 lbs Chicken Thighs
Full package of Hawaiian Rolls
Marble Jack Cheese
2 Tbsp Green Onion
1/2 lb Bacon, chopped
Ranch
Pepper Jack Cheese
Butter and Garlic Rub
directions:
Season and grill up to 3lbs of chicken thighs until they reach 175 F internally.
Chop the cooked chicken up into bite size pieces.
Take full package of rolls (still attached to each other) and slice in half.
Assemble sliders with marble jack cheese, chopped chicken, 2 Tbsp green onion, 1/2 lb chopped bacon, ranch, pepper jack cheese.
Place top buns on sliders and brush butter and garlic rub on top of the buns.
Cook at 300F for 20 minutes until cheese melts.
Slice up sliders and serve hot.

name: Chicken, Bell Pepper, & Cashew Stir-Fry
ingredients:
1/2 cup Basmati Rice
1/4 cup Cashews, roasted unsalted
1 lb Chicken Thighs, boneless skinless
2 Garlic Cloves
1 (1 inch) Ginger Root
2 Green Bell Peppers
1/2 Small bunch Green Onions (scallions)
Sauce:
1/4 cup Soy Sauce
1 Tbsp Toasted Sesame Oil
2 tsp Cornstarch
1½ tsp Rice Vinegar
1½ tsp Brown Sugar
directions:
Cook 1/2 to 1 cup basmati rice.
Meanwhile, wash and dry the fresh produce (ginger, peppers, green onions).
Peel and mince ginger and garlic.
Place soy sauce, oil, cornstarch, vinegar, and sugar in a small bowl; whisk to combine the sauce.
Seed and medium dice bell peppers.
Cut chicken thighs into ½-inch pieces.
Heat a large skillet over high heat. Once the skillet is hot, add oil and swirl to coat the bottom.
Add chicken and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes. Add ginger, garlic, and bell peppers; continue to cook, stirring often, until veggies begin to soften, 2-3 more minutes.
Pour sauce into the skillet. Reduce heat to medium-high and cook, stirring often, until the sauce thickens, 4-5 minutes.
Meanwhile, trim green onions on a clean cutting board and cut crosswise into ¼-inch pieces.
Add cashews to the skillet and stir to combine.
To serve, divide rice between bowls; top with chicken stir-fry and green onions. Enjoy!
notes: Cook time 30 min

name: Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients:
6 Chicken Breasts, boneless and halves
1 Onion, chopped
6 Mushrooms, sliced or chopped
1 tsp Salt
1/4 tsp Pepper
2 (6-oz) cans Tomato Paste
1 Garlic Clove, minced
1 tsp Oregano
1/2 tsp Basil
1/2 tsp Celery Seed
1 Bay Leaf
1/4 cups Chicken Broth
directions:
Cut chicken into serving size pieces.
Put chicken and onions into crockpot.
Mix the rest of the ingredients together and pour over chicken.
Cover and cook on low 7-9 hours or on high for 3-4 hours.
Remove bay leaf.
Serve with noodles as a topping.

name: Chicken Caesar Salad Pasta
ingredients:
8 oz Brown Rice, Quinoa, or Pasta
1/2 cup Bread Crumbs
1/2 cup Parmesan, shredded
1 cup Caesar Dressing of choice
2 heads Romaine Lettuce, washed and cut
2 Chicken Breasts
Paprika
Garlic Powder
Onion Powder
Oregano, dried
Cayenne Pepper
Salt & Pepper
directions:
Cook noodles according to package.
Cut up Romaine lettuce and wash. Shred Parmesan Cheese.
Add breadcrumbs to a small pan with some olive oil and sauté until they are browned.
Cut up chicken into tiny pieces and season with the seasonings above.
Add it to a medium saucepan with some olive oil and sauté until chicken is cooked.
Once noodles and chicken have cooked, allow them to cook before adding to bowl.
In a large bowl combine: noodles, blackened chicken, parmesan, bread crumbs, Romaine, Caesar.
Mix until combined and coated with dressing (option to add more dressing if you would like).
Divide into four meal prep containers and eat cold throughout the week (you can heat it up for 35 seconds to break up the noodles a bit before eating).

name: Chicken Divan
ingredients:
3 Chicken Breasts or 2 cans Cooked Chicken
8 oz Broccoli, frozen
1 can Cream of Chicken Soup
1/2 cup Whipping Cream
1/2 cup Mayonnaise
1 tsp Lemon Juice
1 cup Cheddar Cheese, grated
2 cups Minute Rice
directions:
Whip the heavy cream. Fold in chicken soup, mayonnaise, and lemon juice into the cream to make the sauce.
Layer broccoli and chicken in a 9x13" dish.
Pour sauce over broccoli and chicken.
Cover with grated cheddar cheese.
Bake at 375 degrees for 40 minutes.
Serve over cooked rice.

name: Chicken Fajitas
ingredients:
1 Tbsp Cornstarch
2 tsp Chili Powder
1 tsp Salt
1 tsp Paprika
1 tsp Sugar
3/4 tsp Crushed Chicken Bouillon Cube
1/2 tsp Onion Powder
1/4 tsp Garlic Powder
1/4 tsp Cayenne Pepper
1/4 tsp Cumin
1 pound Chicken Strips
1 cup each, Green, Yellow, and Red Pepper, cut into strips
1/2 cup Onion Strips
Extra-Virgin Olive Oil
Flour Tortillas
Sour Cream
directions:
Combine cornstarch, chili powder, salt, paprika, sugar, chicken bouillon cube, onion powder, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, and cumin.
Add 1 cup of water and put in saucepan to heat.
Add chicken strips and mix well. Cook until chicken is done and water evaporates to just a nice sauce. While cooking, add more water if needed. Set aside.
Place flour tortillas in tin foil and seal. put in preheated 350 degree oven  for about 10 minutes. Turn heat off but do not remove or unwrap tortillas until you are ready to serve them.
Coat bottom of frying pan with olive oil and add onions and peppers. Cook till tender to the bite.
Add onions and peppers to chicken mixture and heat thoroughly. When hot, take flour tortillas and put chicken and vegetables in the middle of the tortilla. Fold both sides over the middle and serve with sour cream on top.
notes: Make sure chicken reaches 165F

name: Chicken Fajita Feast with Tomato Rice, Pico de Gallo, Green Salsa & Smoky Crema
ingredients:
1 Red Onion
1 Bell Pepper
1 Lime
1½ oz Tomato Paste
1 Tbsp Fajita Spice Blend
3/4 cup Jasmine Rice
10 oz Chicken Cutlets
1 unit Chicken Stock Concentrate
1 Tomato
1 Scallion
6 Flour Tortillas
7.06 oz Green Salsa
4 Tbsp Smoky Red Pepper Crema
4 tsp Cooking Oil
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Halve, peel, and thinly slice onion; mince a few pieces until you have 2 Tbsp. Zest and quarter lime. Halve, core, and thinly slice bell pepper.
Rice: Heat a large drizzle of oil in a small pot over medium-high heat. Add minced onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned, 1-3 minutes. Add half the tomato paste and 1/2 tsp Fajita Spice Blend; cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant, 30-60 seconds. Stir in 1¼ cups water, rice, and a big pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to low. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve. Fluff rice with a fork; stir in lime zest. Taste and season with salt and pepper.
Chicken: While rice cooks, pat chicken dry with paper towels and cut crosswise into 1/2-inch strips. In a small bowl, whisk together stock concentrate, remaining tomato paste, remaining Fajita Spice Blend, a squeeze of lime juice, and a large drizzle of oil. Toss chicken, sliced onion, and bell pepper on a baking sheet with tomato paste mixture. Season generously with salt and pepper. Roast on top rack until veggies are browned and chicken is cooked through, 14-17 minutes. Taste and season with salt and pepper if needed.
Salsa: Meanwhile, finely dice tomato. Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens. In a medium bowl, combine tomato, scallion whites, half the scallion greens, and a squeeze of lime juice. Taste and season with salt and pepper.
Wrap tortillas in damp paper towels and microwave until warm and pliable, 30 seconds.
Transfer chicken and veggies to a serving bowl. Transfer rice to a separate serving bowl; garnish with remaining scallion greens. Serve family style with tortillas, pico de gallo, green salsa, smoky crema, and remaining lime wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 30 min. Calories: 1000

name: Chicken Garlic Parmesan Pasta
ingredients:
1 ½ lb Chicken Breast
1 ½ tsp Paprika
1 ½ tsp Oregano
1 tsp Garlic Powder
1/2 tsp Thyme
1/2 tsp Pepper
1/2 tsp Salt
12 oz Farfalle Pasta
4 Tbsp Butter
2 tsp Shallots, dry
2 tsp Italian Seasoning
1/2 cup Chicken Broth
2 Tbsp Flour
3 cups Heavy Cream
12 oz Parmesan, shredded
1/2 tsp Salt
directions:
In a large pot, boil pasta according to the directions on the box for al dente.
Place all chicken seasonings into a small bowl and mix: Paprika, oregano, garlic powder, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Pound chicken down to thin out slightly. Then season the chicken on both sides with seasoning. In a large skillet, heat 2 Tbsp olive oil on medium heat. Once hot, sear the chicken for 5 minutes on each side.
Once both sides are seared, flip the chicken and lower the heat slightly to medium low. Place a lid on the pan and cook for an additional 10-12 minutes. Once the internal temperature is 165 degrees, remove the chicken from the pan and place onto a cutting board.
Place the butter into the pan and allow it to melt. Once the butter is melted, add the pasta seasonings: shallots, and Italian Seasoning. Stir well and simmer for one minute.
Next, add in the flour and stir well, scraping the bottom of the pan. Pour in the chicken broth and heavy cream. Whisk well until a smooth and creamy sauce has been formed.
Pour in the Parmesan Cheese and stir together until completely melted. Allow it to cook, stirring occasionally until desired consistency is met.
Pour in the pasta and toss well to coat evenly. Add pasta water one tablespoon as a time to thin out the sauce. Once that is done, slice the chicken breast and add them to the pasta. Carefully stir, then serve!
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 20 min

name: Chicken Marsala
ingredients:
12 oz Cremini Mushrooms, sliced, rinsed, dried
2 Tbsp Butter
Chicken:
2 large Chicken Breasts, boneless skinless
Salt & Pepper
1 tsp Garlic Powder
1/4 cup Flour
Marsala Sauce:
2 cups Chicken Broth
1/2 Beef Bouillon Cube
1/4 cup Heavy Cream
1 tsp Worcestershire Sauce
1/2 tsp Onion Powder
1/2 tsp Mustard Powder
1/4 tsp Thyme, dried
1/2 cup White Grape Juice
1/4 cup Sherry Vinegar
2 Tbsp Vanilla Extract
2 Tbsp Butter
1 Shallot, minced
2 Garlic Cloves, minced
2 Tbsp Flour
Fresh Parsley, to garnish
directions:
Combine Sauce Mixture: Combine chicken broth, beef bouillon, heavy cream, Worcestershire Sauce, onion powder, mustard powder, and thyme. Set aside.
Cook the Mushrooms: Melt butter over medium-high heat and add the mushrooms. Allow them to brown for 4-5 minutes, stir occasionally as they cook. Sprinkle with a little salt halfway through if desired. Set aside once cooked. (This method is the best way for them to retain their shape, color, texture, and flavor. This way they don't become waterlogged/rubbery by staying in the skillet.)
Dredge/Sear the Chicken: Slice the chicken in half lengthwise to create 2 thinner slices. Cover with saran wrap and use the textured side of a meat mallet to pound it to 1/2 inch thick. Pat dry.
Season each side with salt/pepper. Combine the garlic powder with the flour. Sprinkle it over the chicken and rub it over the surface of each side.
Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Sear the chicken in batches for 4-5 minutes per side, until a golden crust has developed. Set aside.
Make the Sauce: Turn the heat off. Add the white grape juice, sherry vinegar, and vanilla extract and then set the heat to medium. Use a silicone spatula to clean the bottom and sides of the skillet, the “fond” will add more flavor to the sauce. Bring to a gentle bubble and reduce by half, about 5-6 minutes.
Add the butter, garlic, and shallots and cook for 1 minute. Add the flour and stir continuously for 2 minutes. The color of the flour mixture should be dark brown.
Add the sauce mixture (from step 1) in small splashes, stirring continuously. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. Let it simmer and reduce for 7-10 minutes, uncovered. The longer it simmers, the thicker and more concentrated it will get.
Add the mushrooms back to the skillet and stir to combine. Add the chicken back and spoon the sauce on top. Cover partially and let it heat through for 3-4 minutes. Sprinkle with fresh parsley and serve!
notes: Prep time 15 min and Cook time 55 min

name: Chicken Nuggets
ingredients:
For the Chicken:
1 lb Chicken Thighs, boneless skinless
1 tsp Garlic Powder
Salt & Pepper, to taste
For the Dredge:
1/2 cups All-Purpose Flour
2 Eggs, whisked
3/4 cup Plain Panko
1/3 cup Plain Fine Bread Crumbs
2 Tbsp Paremesan, grated
2 Tbsp Butter, melted
Salt & Pepper, to taste
directions:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Spread panko across a baking sheet and bake for a few minutes until golden. Set aside to cool.
In a food processor, add chicken ingredients and blend until the mixture becomes a pasta and set aside.
Prep the dredge station: flour in one dish, eggs in another dish, and panko, fine bread crumbs, Parmesan, salt, pepper, and butter combined in another dish. Scoop about 2 Tbsp of chicken and form into nuggets.
Heat the oven to 450 degrees. Coat each nugget in flour, then dip into eggs, and into the crumbs.
Place on a wire rack and bake or about 15-20 minutes or until crispy and cooked in the center.

name: Chicken Parmesan Pasta
ingredients:
For Chicken:
2 slices Thick-Cut Bacon, diced
1/3 cup All-Purpose Flour
1 tsp Salt
1 tsp Black Pepper, freshly ground
1 tsp Italian Seasoning
1 tsp Onion Powder
1 tsp Garlic Powder
1/2 lb. Chicken Cutlets
For Topping:
2 Tbsp Extra-Virgin Olive Oil
1 cup Panko Breadcrumbs
1 tsp Italian Seasoning
2 Tbsp Everything Bagel Seasoning
1/4 tsp Salt
1/2 tsp Pepper, freshly ground
1/4 tsp Crushed Red Pepper Flakes
For Tomato Sauce:
1 Tbsp Extra-Virgin Olive Oil
8 Garlic Cloves, smashed
1/2 tsp Pepper, freshly ground
1/2 tsp Crushed Red Pepper Flakes (optional)
32 oz Glass Jar
2 tsp Sugar
2 cups Water
For Pasta:
1 lb. Pasta, such as campanelle or penne
8 oz Mozzarella, shredded, divided
3/4 cup Parmesan or Pecorino, divided and freshly grated
Fresh Herbs, such as basil and parsley, for garnish
directions:
In a large, deep-sided skillet over medium heat, cook bacon until crispy and fat is rendered, 4 to 5 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer bacon to a plate; keep bacon fat in skillet.
In a shallow dish, whisk together flour, salt, pepper, Italian Seasoning, onion powder, and garlic powder. Return skillet to medium-high heat. Lightly coat chicken cutlets in flour mixture and add to skillet. Cook, flipping halfway, until both sides are deeply golden, 4 to 6 minutes per side. Transfer chicken to a plate.
Make panko topping: skillet to medium-low heat. Add oil, panko breadcrumbs, Italian Seasoning, everything bagel seasoning, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes. Cook, stirring frequently, until panko mixture is golden, 5 to 6 minutes. Transfer to a bowl.
Make sauce: skillet to medium heat and add oil, garlic, pepper, and red pepper flakes (if using). Cook, stirring, until garlic is golden. Add marinara, sugar, and water and bring to a simmer.
Add pasta and cook, stirring occasionally, until noodles are al dente and sauce is creamy, about 12 minutes.
Fold in half the mozzarella and Parmesan until melty. Slice cooked chicken on the bias into strips and place on top of pasta. Remove skillet from heat, sprinkle with remaining mozzarella and Parmesan, and cover with lid to melt cheese, about 4 minutes.
Garnish with panko topping, cooked bacon, and fresh herbs.

name: Chicken Roll-ups
ingredients:
1/2 Onion, diced
2 Celery sticks, chopped
1 small can (2/3 cup) Mushrooms
10 Tbsp Butter, melted
1/2 tsp Pepper
8 oz Cream Cheese, softened
2 cups Chicken, cubed
2-3 cans Crescent Rolls
1 cup Chicken Broth
1 can Cream of Chicken Soup
directions:
Saute the onion, celery and mushrooms in small amount of butter.
Add to 4 Tbsp butter, pepper, cream cheese and chicken.
Roll the rolls thinner than normal and fill with 1/4 cup filling.
Fold and dip in the melted butter.
Roll in bread crumbs and bake at 375 degrees for 15-20 minutes.
Make a gravy with chicken broth and cream of chicken soup to serve other rolls.

name: Chicken Sausage Cavatappi Bolognese with Zucchini & Parmesan
ingredients:
1 Zucchini
1 Yellow Onion
1 Tbsp Italian Seasoning
6 oz Cavatappi Pasta
9 oz Italian Chicken Sausage
1½ oz Tomato Paste
1 Chicken Stock Concentrate
2 Tbsp Sour Cream
1/4 cup Parmesan Cheese
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 450 degrees. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Wash and dry produce. Trim and halve zucchini lengthwise; cut crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick half-moons. Halve, peel, and thinly slice onion.
Toss zucchini on a baking sheet with a drizzle of oil, half the Italian Seasoning (you'll use the rest later), and a pinch of salt and pepper. Roast on top rack, tossing halfway through, until browned and tender, 14-16 minutes. Tent with foil to keep warm.
Once water is boiling, add cavatappi to pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, 9-11 minutes. Reserve 1½ cups pasta cooking water, then drain.
While pasta cooks, heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add onion and a pinch of salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, 5-6 minutes. Add beef and cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned, 3-4 minutes (it'll finish cooking in the next step).
Add tomato paste and remaining Italian Seasoning to pan. Cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, 1 minute. Stir in stock concentrate, 1 cup reserved pasta cooking water (1½ cups for 4 servings), and a big pinch of salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer; cook until sauce has slightly thickened and sausage is cooked through, 2-3 minutes. Reduce heat to medium low.
Stir drained cavatappi, roasted zucchini, sour cream, and 1 Tbsp butter into pan until thoroughly combined. TIP: If needed, stir in more reserved cooking water a splash at a time until pasta is coated in a creamy sauce. Divide pasta between bowls. Sprinkle with Parmesan and serve.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 30 min. Calories: 820

name: Chicken Sheet Pan Quesadilla
ingredients:
8 Large Tortillas (burrito size)
2 Tbsp Olive Oil
1 Onion, medium and chopped
1 Green Pepper, chopped
1 Ib Chicken, cooked and shredded or diced (about 4 cups)
1 tsp Chili Powder
1 tsp Cumin
1 tsp Smoked Paprika
1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
1/2 tsp Salt
1/3 tsp Pepper
15 oz can Black Beans
3/4 cup Corn Kernels canned, drained and rinsed
2 cups Monterey Jack Cheese, shredded
1 cup Cheddar Cheese, shredded
directions:
Preheat the oven to 425 F. Spray an 18x13-inch sheet pan with cooking spray.
In a large bowl, add the chicken, onion, bell pepper, chili powder, cumin, smoked paprika, garlic powder, and salt and pepper. Mix.
Add in the black beans and corn kernels. Mix well.
Place 6 of the flour tortillas around the edges of the sheet pan, with the tortillas hanging halfway over the edge of the pan, leaving a gap in the center. Place 1 tortilla in the bottom center gap.
Evenly spread the meat and veggie mixture over the tortillas. Sprinkle the two cheeses evenly over the meat mixture.
Place the last tortilla on the center of the mixture. Carefully begin folding the tortillas that are hanging over the edge of the pan. Once all the tortillas have been folded over, place a second pan on top of the folded tortillas and press down a bit.
Transfer the baking sheets to the oven and bake for 20 minutes.
Remove the pan from the oven and take the top sheet pan off. Allow the quesadilla to slightly cool before cutting into servings.
Serve with sour cream, salsa, pico de gallo, or guacamole.

name: Chicken Stir-Fry
ingredients:
1 lb Chicken, boneless skinless, cut into strips
2 cups Frozen Stir-Fry Veggies
1 tsp Soy Sauce
2 tsp Asian Seasoning
2 Tbsp Oil
directions:
In large skillet, stir-fry chicken in oil on medium heat for 5 minutes.
Add vegetables, soy sauce and seasoning; stir-fry for 5 minutes, until chicken is done.

name: Chicken Tortilla Soup
ingredients:
4 Chicken Breasts, cooked, cooled and shredded
2 cans (family size) Chicken & Rice Soup
1 can Whole-Kernel Corn, drained
1 can Cream Corn
2 cans Tomato Soup
2 cans Ranch-Style Texas Beans
2 cans Rotel Tomatoes, mild
2 tsp Garlic Salt
2 cubes Chicken Bouillon
2 cups Water
directions:
Combine all ingredients in slow cooker, heat through and serve.
Garnish with tortilla chips, sour cream, cheese.
notes: Prep time min 10 and Cook time 4-6 hours.
original_author: Cindy Remer - Relief Society Broadcast and Dinner 2005

name: Chicken with Mushrooms and Zucchini
ingredients:
1 pound Chicken Breasts, boneless skinless
Cornstarch, for dusting
1 Tbsp Vegetable or Canola Oil
1 Tbsp Sesame Oil
8 oz White Button Mushrooms, stems removed and quartered
4 small Zucchinis, cut into 1-inch chunks
2 Tbsp Soy Sauce
1 Tbsp Balsamic Vinegar
2 Garlic Cloves, minced
1/2 tsp Ground Ginger or 1 tsp Fresh Ginger, finely minced
directions:
Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces. Toss them into a ziploc bag along with 2-3 Tbsp cornstarch. Seal the bag and toss until the chicken is lightly coated.
Heat the oil and sesame oil in a large, non-stick skillet until rippling and hot. Add the chicken and cook until the chicken is browned on all sides and cooked through, 5-7 minutes. Remove the chicken to a plate.
Add the zucchini and mushrooms to the hot skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring often. Add soy sauce, vinegar, garlic and ginger. Stir to coat the vegetables and continue to cook until the mushrooms and zucchini are tender, 2-3 minutes.
Add the chicken to the skillet and stir to combine and heat through. Serve over hot, cooked rice.
notes: Hoisin Sauce: also, sometimes I add a touch of hoisin sauce to round out the flavors.

name: Chick-fil-a Sauce
ingredients:
1/4 cup Dukes Mayo
1 tsp Yellow Mustard
1 Tbsp Honey
1 Tbsp Sweet Baby Rays BBQ sauce
directions: Mix all ingredients. Serve with nuggets!

name: Chimichangas
ingredients:
1 lb. Hamburger
1/3 cup Onion, chopped
1/3 cup Green Pepper, chopped
16 oz can Re-fried Beans
1/2 can Hot El Pato Sauce, optional
1/2 cups Cheese, shredded
1 package Flour Tortillas
directions:
Brown hamburger, and drain fat.
Add next five ingredients and mix well.
Take off burner.
Heat 1/2 inch oil in frying pan on medium-high.
Put 1/4 cup hamburger mixture on tortilla.
Fold and fry until light brown on both sides.
Top of with lettuce, tomatoes, and sour cream.

name: Chip Cookies
ingredients:
1 cup Butter, cold and cubed
1 cup Brown Sugar
1/2 cup Sugar
2 Eggs
1½ cups Cake Flour or All-Purpose Flour
1½ cups Flour
1 tsp Cornstarch
3/4 tsp Baking Soda
3/4 tsp Salt
2 cups Chocolate Chips
2 cups Walnuts, roughly chopped
directions:
Preheat oven to 415 degrees.
In a large mixing bowl, cream together cold cubed butter, brown sugar, and sugar for 4 minutes or until creamy.
Add eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each one.
Stir in flours, cornstarch, baking soda, and salt. Mix until just combined to avoid overmixing. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts.
Separate dough into large balls and place on cookie sheet with parchment paper. They are bigger than you think! You will fit 4 cookies on one large cookie sheet. The dough makes 8 extra large cookies.
Bake for 9-12 minutes or until golden brown on the top. Let them rest for at least 10 minutes to set.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 9-12 min.

name: Chocolate Banana Popsicles
ingredients:
2 Bananas
2 Tbsp Cocoa Powder
2 Tbsp Vanilla Yogurt, plus extra for filling
2 Tbsp Oatmeal
2 tsp Chia Seeds
Berries
directions:
In a food processor blend the bananas, cocoa, yogurt, oatmeal and chia seeds until smooth and ice cream-like, in a separate small bowl add a handful of berries and crush with a fork.
To assemble, layer the banana mixture into Popsicle molds coming half way to the top. Tap on the counter to ensure this layer is level and doesn't have air bubbles.
Layer the berries in each mold and then finish with any remaining vanilla yogurt. Stick the Popsicle stick into the center of each mold and freeze for 2 hours.

name: Chocolate Budino with Salted Caramel
ingredients:
Pudding:
5 Egg Yolks, large
2 cups Heavy Cream
1/2 cup Sugar
Pinch of Salt
2 cups Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips
Salted Caramel:
3/4 Sugar, granulated castor
1/3 cup Butter, cubed
3/4 cup Heavy Cream
Salt to taste
directions:
In a pot, whisk the egg yolks together. Add the milks and whisk to combine. Add the sugar and pinch of salt and whisk in. Place over medium heat and whisk continuously until it starts to thicken, around 3-5 minutes. Once it is thick enough to coat a back of the spoon and not move, take it off the heat. Make sure to do this process over medium heat, not high! We don’t want to scramble the eggs, so you must slowly bring them up to temp.
Whisk in the chocolate chips until combined.
Pass the mixture through a fine mesh strainer into a clean bowl. Pour the mixture into 4 oz ramekins and transfer to the fridge. Allow the budinos to set in the fridge for 2-3 hours.
Salted Caramel: In a pan or pot over medium heat, add the sugar. Once it starts to melt, stir it with a rubber spatula. It will start to get clumpy and look like the texture of wet sand, this is fine, keep stirring as the sugar melts.
Once the sugar has melted, is smooth, and dark in color, stir in the cubed butter. It will foam and bubble a lot, but keep stirring until the butter is completely melted.
Turn the heat off and stir in the heavy cream until the caramel is smooth. Add salt to taste, then jar and use or store in the refrigerator.
Remove budinos from the fridge, serve it topped with homemade salted caramel, and whipped cream!

name: Chocolate Crater Cupcakes
ingredients:
1 package (19.5 oz) Dark Chocolate Cake Mix, Duncan Hines
1⅓ cup Chocolate Milk Mix, Nesquik
1/2 cups Vegetable Oil
3 Eggs
4 oz Cream Cheese
1/4 cup Butter
1 cup Powdered Sugar
5 Tbsp Miniature Semisweet Chocolate Chips
directions:
Preheat oven to 350.
If you want, mix 1 cup of sweetened shredded coconut with 1 cup of chopped walnuts and spoon about 1 Tbsp of the mixture into the bottom of the tins.
In a large mixing bowl, beat cake mix, chocolate mix, oil, eggs with an electric mixer on low for 30 seconds.
Scrape the sides and beat for 2 minutes on medium.
spoon mixture into the tins half full.
In a medium mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and butter with an electronic mixer on low until well mixed.
Add powdered sugar and beat until smooth.
Spoon cream cheese mixture onto the batter.
Sprinkle cream cheese mixture in each cup with 1/2 tsp of the miniature chocolate chips.
Bake for 20-24 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the centers of the cake part comes out clean.
Cool for 5 minutes.

name: Chocolate Frosting
ingredients:
1 stick Butter or Margarine
4 Tbsp Cocoa
6 Tbsp Water
1/2 bag Powdered Sugar
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
directions:
Melt butter, cocoa and water and bring to a boil.
Remove from heat and add powdered sugar.
Add vanilla extract.
Frost cake when the cake is cool.
notes: For Chocolate Sheet Cake

name: Chocolate Lava Cookies
ingredients:
2 cups All-purpose Flour
3/4 cup Cocoa Powder
1 tsp Salt
1 tsp Baking Soda
1 cup Vegetable Shortening
1/2 cups Sugar, plus 1/2 cup for dusting
1/2 cups Brown Sugar
2 Eggs, large
1 tsp Vanilla
1 (12 oz jar) Hot Fudge Sauce
directions:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line a baking sheet with a silicone baking mat.
In a medium bowl, combine flour, cocoa powder, salt and baking soda. Set aside.
In a large bowl, cream together shortening and sugars with a hand-held mixer. Add eggs one at a time, and stir in vanilla. Add dry ingredients and mix until combined.
Scoop approximately 1/4 cup of dough in your hand and flatten. Pour approximately 1/2 tsp of hot fudge sauce in the center and wrap dough around it to form a ball. Repeat steps until all dough is used.
Toss dough balls in sugar and bake for 6 to 8 minutes until set. Cool cookies on a rack and serve immediately.

name: Chocolate Sheet Cake
ingredients:
2 cups Flour
2 cups Sugar
1 cup Butter or Margarine
1 cup Water
2 Tbsp Cocoa
2 Eggs
1/4 tsp Cinnamon
1/2 cup Buttermilk OR 1/2 cup Milk and 1 tsp Vinegar
1 tsp Baking Soda
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
directions:
Mix flour and sugar together in a bowl.
In a sauce pan, bring butter, water and cocoa to a boil.
Pour the mixture into the flour and sugar.
Add eggs, cinnamon, butter milk, baking soda, vanilla extract.
Beat until smooth and pour into ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake at 400 for 20 minutes.
Pour on Chocolate Frosting.
notes: Bake in cookie sheet pan.

name: Chocolate Shell
ingredients:
1 cup Coconut Oil
1 cup Cocoa Powder
3 Tbsp Maple, Agave, or Honey
Pinch of Salt
directions: Combine and put on top of ice cream.
notes: Put on ice cream or dip inch sized banana ice cream balls into chocolate and refreeze.

name: Chocolate Truffle Pie Filling
ingredients:
1 Pie Crust
12 oz Bittersweet Chocolate
1/2 cup Butter, unsalted
3 Eggs
3/4 cup Heavy Cream
1/3 cup Sugar
2 tsp Vanilla Extract
1/2 tsp Salt
directions:
Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees.
Cook empty pie crust for 15 minutes.
Cut butter in slices and melt in a sauce pan with chocolate.
When smooth, remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes.
In a large bowl, mix everything else.
When the chocolate has cooled, mix into the previous mixture and pour it into the the pie crust.
Bake pie for 30-35 minutes.

name: Chocolate-Dipped Chips
ingredients:
1 cup Ruffled Potato Chips
4 oz Chocolate, chopped
Chili Flakes, to taste
directions: In a microwave-safe bowl, melt chocolate in 15 second intervals, while stirring in between. Dip each chip halfway and place on a tray, lined with parchment or Silpat. While wet, sprinkle the chocolate with chili flakes. Allow to harden.
notes: Movie Night Snacks

name: Chocolate-Drizzled Peanut Butter Bars
ingredients:
1½ cups All-Purpose Flour
1 tsp Baking Powder
1/4 tsp Salt
1 cup Brown Sugar, packed
1/2 cup Sugar
1/2 cup Butter or Margarine, softened
1/4 cup Smooth Peanut Butter
2 Eggs
1 tsp Vanilla
1/2 cup Peanut, chopped and unsalted
24 Miniature Peanut Butter Cups, cut into quarters
Chocolate Drizzle:
1/4 cup Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips
1 tsp Butter or Margarine
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a small bowl, mix together flour, baking powder and salt.
In a large bowl, beat sugars, butter and peanut butter until smooth. Beat in eggs, one at a time, until incorporated. Stir in vanilla. Blend in flour and sugar. Stir in peanuts. Spread evenly in a lightly greased 13x9 inch cake pan.
Sprinkle pieces of peanut butter cups over batter and press down slightly. Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until tester inserted in the center of cake comes out clean. Allow to cool slightly.
Chocolate drizzle: in the top of a double boiler, over hot (not boiling) water, milk chocolate chips with butter, stirring until smooth. Drizzle over top of warm cake. Cool completely, then cut into bars.

name: Cindy's Cinnamon Rolls
ingredients:
Dough:
2 Eggs
1 cup Milk
1 Tbsp Yeast
1 cup Warm Water
1 tsp Salt
2 Tbsp Oil
1/2 cup Sugar
5-6 cups Flour
Filling:
1/4 cup Butter, softened
1 cup Brown Sugar combined with 1 Tbsp Cinnamon
Frosting:
8 oz Cream Cheese, softened
1/2 cup Butter, softened
1 tsp Vanilla
1 Tbsp Milk
3 cups Powdered Sugar
1 tsp Cinnamon, optional
directions:
Add milk to eggs in a large bowl and beat together.
Mix yeast into the liquid measuring cup with the warm water, sprinkle sugar on top, set aside to rise.
Add salt, oil and sugar to the egg/milk mixture. When the yeast is active and  bubbling up (about 10 minutes active in the water) add to the rest of the combined ingredients and mix well.
Add flour to the mixture, 1 cup at a time. After adding 2 cups, turn up the mixer until the dough is a smooth consistency. Turn down the mixer, switch to the dough hook, and mix in the remaining flour. Stop adding flour when it's starting to pull away from the sides.
Rub a little oil on top of dough, and cover to rise, about 1 hour.
Roll dough into a long rectangle. Spread butter across dough and top with cinnamon/sugar mixture.
Roll up tightly, from one long side of the rectangle to the other. Cut into 1 inch slices for rolls. Place sliced rolls onto a large greased pan.
Let the rolls rise for 30 minutes.
Bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes.
Frosting: In a small bowl, mix cream cheese, butter, vanilla and milk. Add powdered sugar and cinnamon and mix until smooth.
Spread frosting on warm rolls.

name: Cilantro Jalapeño Sauce
ingredients:
4 Jalapeños, halved
2 cups Cilantro, stems removed and loosely packed
1/2 cup Sour Cream
2 Garlic Cloves
1 Lime, juiced
Pinch of Salt
1/2 cups Olive Oil
1 Tbsp Apple Cider Vinegar
directions:
Combine jalapeños, cilantro, sour cream, garlic, lime juice, and salt in a food processor.
While the motor is running, slowly pour in the olive oil and viengar in a steady stream.
Once it's all combined, serve with chicken or fries.

name: Cinnamon French Toast Bites
ingredients:
4 thick slices White Bread, slightly stale and cut into 1" cubes
2 large Eggs or 3 small Eggs
1/4 cup Milk
Pinch of Salt
1/4 cup White Sugar
1/2 tsp Cinnamon Powder
3 Tbsp Butter, separated
Maple Syrup
directions:
Cut the crust off the bread, then cut each piece into equal 1" cubes.
Whisk the eggs, milk and salt in a medium bowl.
Combine sugar and cinnamon in a shallow bowl.
Melt 1/2 Tbsp of butter in a frying pan over medium heat.
Quickly toss half of the bread cubes into the egg mixture and use your hands to shake off the excess egg mixture.
Place the bread cubes in the frying pan and use a wooden spoon to saute them until browned on all sides -  about 2 to 3 minutes.
Remove the cubes from the frying pan straight into the sugar mixture. Toss to coat, then remove and place on a plate.
Serve immediately with maple syrup for dipping.

name: Cinnamon Muffins
ingredients:
1½ cups Flour
1/2 cup Sugar
2 tsp Baking Powder
1/2 cup Milk
1/2 tsp Salt
1/4 cup Shortening
1 Egg
directions:
Mix all ingredients.
Grease muffin tins at the bottom only (or use cupcake papers).
Place enough mixture in tin to cover bottom only.
Put a dab of your favorite jam in the middle.
Cover with mixture to fill tin.
May sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar mixture.
Bake at 400F degrees for 15 minutes.

name: Cinnamon Pretzels
ingredients:
1½ cups Warm Water
1½ tsp Instant Yeast
1/2 cups Bread Flour
1¾ cups All-Purpose Flour
1 tsp Salt
2 Tbsp Brown Sugar
2 cups Water
2 Tbsp Baking Soda
1/4 cup Butter, melted
3/4 cup Sugar
3 tsp Cinnamon
directions:
Mix the yeast with the warm water, and leave to sit for 5 minutes.
Add the two flours, brown sugar and salt to a bowl, and slowly pour in the yeast mixture and knead for 5 minutes until you have a soft dough.
Put the dough in a bowl and let rise for 30 minutes.
Once the dough is risen, knock the air out and split into 12 chunks. Roll the the chunks of dough into long ropes and twist together to make a pretzel shape. Lay them on a baking tray until complete.
Boil the water and baking soda together and dip each pretzel into the solution, dry with a towel then place them back on the baking sheet.
Bake at 400-450 degrees for 10 minutes.
Once cooked, melt the butter and mix the cinnamon and sugar together in a separate bowl.
Coat the cooked pretzel in butter and then dip them in the sugar mixture and serve.

name: Cinnamon Roll Pancakes
ingredients:
Mom's Pancake Recipe
Cinnamon Filling Recipe
6 Tbsp Butter, melted
3/4 cup Brown Sugar
1 Tbsp Ground Cinnamon
Cream Cheese Glaze Recipe
4 Tbsp Butter
2 oz Cream Cheese
1 cup Powdered Sugar
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
directions:
Mix up a batch of Mom's Pancake Recipe.
Next, make the cinnamon filling. In a bowl mix melted butter, brown sugar, and ground cinnamon. Add filling to a piping bag and set aside. Use this to create the cinnamon roll swirl in the pancakes.
Finally, in a bowl, add butter and cream cheese. Microwave for 30 seconds. Add powdered sugar and vanilla extract and whisk until smooth. Set aside.
Heat large skillet on medium heat. Spray with nonstick spray. Scoop 1/4 cup batter onto skillet and cook for 2 minutes. Squeeze piping bag filling into a spiral pattern on pancake. Let sit for 2 minutes; when bubbles begin to appear, flip with a thin spatula, and cook for another minute.
Transfer to plate and drizzle cream cheese glaze on top.

name: Citrus Vinaigrette
ingredients:
3/4 cup Orange Juice (not from concentrate)
1/4 cup Fresh Lime Juice (2-3 limes)
1 cup Fresh Basil, chopped
1 cup packed Fresh Cilantro Leaves
1 tsp Salt
1/4 tsp Pepper
1 heaping Tbsp Honey
1/2 cups Canola Oil
directions: Combine the orange and lime juices, basil, cilantro, salt, pepper, honey, and oil in a blender and blend for 1 minute.

name: Clay
ingredients:
2 cups Boiling Water
1/2 cup Salt
3 Tbsp Oil
1 Tbsp Alum
2½ cups Flour
directions:
Boil water.
Add to dry ingredients and knead.
To keep soft, store in zip-lock bags.

name: Coconut-Curry Chicken Cutlets
ingredients:
2 Tbsp Grapeseed Oil, divided
1 lb Chicken Cutlets
1 (14 oz) can Light Coconut Milk
1 Tbsp Brown Sugar
1 Tbsp Red Thai Curry Paste
1 Tbsp Lime Juice
2 cups Quinoa, cooked
Fresh Cilantro, chopped for garnish
directions:
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken, in batches if necessary, and cook, flipping once, until browned and cooked through, 1 to 3 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate.
Remove pan from heat. Whisk the remaining 1 tablespoon oil, coconut milk, brown sugar, curry paste and lime juice in the pan. Cook over high heat, stirring occasionally, until reduced by half, 5 to 10 minutes.
Serve the chicken with quinoa and the sauce, garnished with cilantro, if desired.
notes: Cook time 20 min

name: Confetti Calamari
ingredients:
1/2 lb Calamari
1 cup All-Purpose Flour, plus more if needed
1-2 Tbsp Paprika
Salt to taste
Oil, for deep frying
1 Lemon, zested
2-3 Tbsp Mayonnaise
directions:
Heat fryer to 360 F.
Blot and dry the calamari with paper towels.
Cut the tubes open by sliding your knife up the inside and cut outward. Unfold the flat piece the long way and cut into thin strips. For the tentacles cut off the stingers, the cut the tentacles in half the long way to make two symmetrical pieces.
To a large Ziploc bag, add approximately 1 cup flour, 1-2 Tbsp paprika, and salt.
Add the calamari to the bag, and zip the bag 90% across. Blow air into the opening to make the bag puff out, and zip it shut. Now shake, shake, shake. Pour the calamari into the colander with a bowl underneath to remove the excess flour.
Drop the calamari into the fryer and cook for 3-5 minutes, or until golden brown.
Make lemon zest mayo by combining lemon zest and mayo in a small bowl.
Transfer calamari to a mixing bowl. Add salt and toss. Sever with lemon zest mayo.

name: Conga Bars
ingredients:
2-1/4 cups All-Purpose Flour
2-1/2 tsp Baking Powder
1/2 tsp Salt
3/4 cup Butter, unsalted
2 cups Brown Sugar, light
3 Eggs
1 tsp Vanilla
1 cup Chocolate Chips
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Lightly grease 13x9 inch baking pan.
With mixer on medium speed, beat butter, and brown sugar in a large bowl until well blended.
Add eggs, one at a time.
On low speed better gradually beat in flour, salt and baking soda.
Add vanilla.
Spread mixture evenly in prepared pan.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until wooden toothpick comes out of center clean.
notes: 1/4 cup Nuts, chopped (optional)

name: Continental Chicken
ingredients:
6 Chicken breast, halves
1 package Pressed Sliced Beef
6 Slices Bacon
1 can Cream of Mushroom Soup
1/4 cup Sour Cream
1/4 cup Flour
directions:
Arrange dried beef slices on bottom of crock pot.
Wrap each piece of chicken with a slice of bacon.
Place on top of the beef.
Mix everything else and pour into crockpot.
Cover and cook for 7-9 on low or 3-4 hours on high.
Serve with noodles or mashed potatos as a topping.

name: Cookies and Cream Cheesecake
ingredients:
For the Crust:
30 Oreos, ground to a sand-like texture
6 Tbsp Butter, melted
1/2 tsp Salt
For the Cheesecake:
3 cups Cream Cheese, softened at room temperature
1/2 cup Sugar
3 Eggs, large
1 tsp Vanilla
1 tsp Lemon Juice
12 Oreos, chopped into 1/2-inch pieces
For the Ganache: 2 cups Dark Chocolate Chips
1 cup Heavy Cream
2 Tbsp Coconut Oil, melted
12 Oreos, halved, for topping
directions:
Make the Crust: Line a 9-inch springform pan with baking spray and parchment paper. In a medium bowl, combine Oreo crumbs, butter and salt. Press into pan and place in the freezer while you make the cheesecake.
Make the Cheesecake: Preheat the oven to 350F. In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese until smooth. Add sugar and mix until smooth. Add eggs one at a time. Add in vanilla and lemon juice. Fold in Oreo pieces and mix until evenly combined.
Bake for 40 to 45 minutes until the top of the cheesecake is golden and has firm wiggle. Allow the cheesecake to cool and place in the fridge for up to 4 hours.
Make the Ganache: Place the chocolate chips in a small bowl and heat heavy cream to almost a boil. Pour cream over the chips and stir until smooth. Add coconut oil and set aside.
Assemble the Cheesecake: Place the chilled cheesecake on a cooling rack on top of the baking pan. Pour ganache over cake to completely cover. Top with Oreo halves and serve.
notes: Cake will keep up to 4 days covered in the fridge.

name: Cookies and Cream Cheesecake Donuts
ingredients:
100g Oreos, crushed
Cream Cheese Filling:
250g Cream Cheese
200ml Sweetened Condensed Milk
White Chocolate Ganache:
200g White Chocolate Melts
100ml Thickened Cream
directions:
To make white choc ganache simply add the chocolate and cream to a large microwave safe bowl and microwave for 20 seconds at a time, mixing each time until it becomes a smooth mixture. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside to cool.
While the donuts are cooling prepare the cheesecake filling by adding the cream cheese and sugar or sweetened condensed milk to a large mixing bowl. use a wooden spoon to combine them or a hand mixer until the mixture is smooth. Transfer to a zip lock bag or piping bag.
To finish off the donuts simply poke a hole in the top of the donut and insert the bag with cheesecake filling in the donut. Fill with filling. Once all the donuts are filled carefully dip them in the white choc ganache.
notes: Use with Donut Recipe

name: Cookie Dough Pretzel Bites
ingredients:
½ cup Butter, softened
⅔ cup Brown Sugar
¼ cup Milk
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
1½ cups All-Purpose Flour, heat treated
½ cup Mini Chocolate Chips
For dipping:
¾ cup Chocolate Chips, melted
1 Tbsp Vegetable Oil
directions:
In a microwave safe bowl, microwave your flour for 60-90 seconds, stirring halfway through. Set aside to cool completely.
In a medium mixing bowl, cream together softened butter and brown sugar. Once smooth, mix in the milk and vanilla extract.
Sprinkle in the heat-treated flour and mix to form a dough. Fold in mini chocolate chips.
Place the dough in the freezer for 10 minutes to make it less sticky, then working one by one, roll the dough into ½ inch balls.
Place the cookie dough balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
Working one by one, sandwich each cookie dough ball between 2 pretzels and place back on the prepared baking sheet.
Combine your semi-sweet chocolate and vegetable oil in a microwave safe bowl and microwave in 30 second intervals until melted and smooth.
Dip each cookie dough stuffed pretzel halfway into the melted chocolate, then return to the prepared baking sheet.
Transfer to the fridge (or freezer) to let the chocolate harden before serving.
notes: Cook time 30 min

name: Corn Off the Cob
ingredients:
2 Ears of Corn, cooked
1/4 cup Mayonnaise
1 tsp Paprika
1/2 Lime, juiced
2 Tbsp Cilantro, chopped
1/4 wedge Manchego Cheese
directions:
To cut the corn, use a bundt pan or place a can inside a large salad bowl. Place the corn on top of the can or the center of the bundt pan and cut downwards to remove the kernels.
Add mayo, lime juice, paprika, cheese and cilantro to the corn, Stir until well incorporated.
Transfer to a paper cup. Top with a sprinkling of cheese and paprika.

name: Cranberry Dijon Pork Tenderloin with Mashed Potatoes & Roasted Green Beans
ingredients:
12 oz Yukon Gold Potatoes
6 oz Green Beans
1 Lemon
1 Thumb Ginger
1/4 oz Rosemary
10 oz Pork Tenderloin
4 Tbsp Sour Cream
1 Cranberry Jam Packet
1 Chicken Stock
2 tsp Dijon Mustard
directions:
Adjust rack to middle position and preheat oven to 450 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Dice potatoes into 1/2-inch pieces. Zest and quarter lemon. Peel and mince or grate ginger until you have 1 tsp. Pick rosemary leaves from stems; mince leaves until you have 1 teaspoon.
Mashed Potatoes: Place potatoes in a medium pot with enough salted water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil and cook until tender, 15-20 minutes. Reserve 1/2 cup potato cooking liquid, then drain and return potatoes to pot. Mash with sour cream and 1 Tbsp butter until smooth and creamy, adding splashes of reserved potato cooking liquid as needed. Season with salt and pepper. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve.
Pork: Pat pork dry with paper towels and season all over with salt and pepper. Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add pork and sear, turning occasionally, until browned all over, 4-8 minutes (it'll finish cooking in the next step). Turn off heat; transfer pork to one side of a baking sheet. Wipe out pan. Roast on middle rack until pork is cooked through. Transfer pork to a cutting board to rest.
Sauce: Heat a drizzle of oil in pan used for pork over medium-high heat. Add minced ginger and minced rosemary; cook until fragrant, 30 seconds. Stir in jam, stock concentrate, mustard, and 1/4 cup water (1/3 cup for 4 servings). Simmer until slightly thickened, 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat; stir in 1 Tbsp butter until melted.
Green Beans: Trim green beans if necessary. Toss green beans in a large bowl with a drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Spread out on opposite side of sheet from pork. (For 4 servings, toss green beans on a second sheet; roast pork on middle rack and green beans on top rack.) Cook green beans until they are tender, 10-12 minutes. Carefully toss green beans with lemon zest.
Slice pork crosswise. Divide pork, mashed potatoes, and green beans between plates. Drizzle pork with sauce. Serve with lemon wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 45 min. Calories: 600

name: Cranberry Pecan Cheese Ball
ingredients:
8 oz Cream Cheese, softened
1½ cups White Cheddar Cheese, shredded
1/2 cup Dried Cranberries, chopped
1/2 cup Pecans, chopped
4 Green Onions, thinly sliced (green part only)
1/4 tsp Garlic Powder
1/2 cup Pecans, finely chopped to coat outside
directions:
To a large stand mixer on low speed add the cream cheese, white cheddar cheese, cranberries, first 1/2 cup pecans, green onions and garlic powder until smooth, about 1-2 minutes.
Put mixture in the refrigerator for 1 hour to chill.
Lay a large plastic wrap square on your counter and put the mixture on it, then gather the sides and bunch them up to help shape the mixture into a ball.
Add the remaining 1/2 cup finely chopped pecans to a large bowl and roll the cheese ball into the chopped pecans then serve with crackers.
Best if served after 4 hours of refrigeration.
notes: Prep time 10 min

name: Cranberry, Pear & Turkey Salad
ingredients:
8 cups Spinach, chopped
12 oz Turkey Breast, cooked and chopped
2 Pears, sliced or cubed
1 cup Unsweetened Dried Cranberries
1/4 cup Pumpkin seeds, shelled
1 tsp Chia Seeds
Honey Vinaigrette:
2 Tbsp Olive Oil, light taste
2 Tbsp Honey
1 Tbsp Apple Cider Vinegar
Dash of Sea Salt
Dash of Dry Mustard
Dash of Pepper
directions:
Place all the ingredients for the Honey Vinaigrette into a blender and blend until smooth. Weigh the dressing and divide the weight by four to get the amount needed to fill one serving.
In a bowl, layer two cups of spinach, 3 oz turkey breast, 75g Pears, 1/4 cup of cranberries, one tablespoon of pumpkin seeds and 1/4 tsp of chia seeds for oneserving, Drizzle the vinaigrette over the top.
notes: Calories: 350

name: Cream Cheese Chicken
ingredients:
1 envelope Italian Dressing Mix
1/2 cup Butter or Margarine
6 Chicken Breasts, boneless skinless
1 can Cream of Chicken Soup
8 oz Cream Cheese
directions:
Turn crock pot on High. Place butter in bottom of crockpot.
When butter has melted, add one envelope Italian dressing dry mix. Stir into butter until well mixed.
Cut chicken breasts into 1" strips. Place in crock pot and stir to coat chicken in butter and dressing mix.
Cover and cook on high for 2 hours.
Remove chicken to plate to cool.
Add 1 can cream of chicken soup and cream cheese.
Stir to melt and mix well until smooth and creamy.
Remove sauce from crock pot and pour on chicken.
notes: Can be served on top of mashed potatoes, rice, or hot buttered noodles.

name: Cream Cheese Chocolate Chips Cookies
ingredients:
10 oz Mini Chocolate Chips
1¼ cups All-Purpose Flour
1½ tsp Baking Soda
1/2 cup Butter, softened
8 oz Cream Cheese, softened
1½ cups Sugar
1 Egg
1/2 cup Nuts, chopped (optional)
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a small saucepan, over very low heat, melt 1 cup chocolate chips.
In a medium bowl, mix together flour and baking soda.
In a large bowl, beat butter, cream cheese and sugar until smooth and creamy. Beat in egg until well incorporated. Beat in melted chocolate until well combined. Add flour mixture and mix well. Fold in nuts and remaining chocolate chips.
Drop by spoonfuls onto cookie sheet. Bake in oven for 10 to 12 minutes or until cookies are firm around the edges. Transfer to wire rack to let cool.

name: Cream Cheese Icing
ingredients:
1 pound Cream Cheese, softened
1 Stick Butter
2 cups Powdered Sugar
2 tsp Vanilla Extract
directions:
In a mixing bowl, beat all ingredients together until they're light and fluffy.
Add food coloring or leave it white.

name: Cream Puff Filling and Chocolate Sauce
ingredients:
1/3 cup Sugar
2 Tbsp Cornstarch
1/8 tsp Salt
2 cups Milk
2 Egg Yolks, slightly beaten
2 Tbsp Butter
2 tsp Vanilla
directions:
In a saucepan, Mix sugar, cornstarch and salt.
Gradually stir in milk.
Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens and boils.
Boil and stir for 1 minute.
Place eggs in a different bowl.
In a custard cup, place vanilla and butter.
After it boils for 1 minute, slowly pour half of the egg mixture into the pan.
Pour the rest of the egg mixture in and boil for 1 minute.
Take off heat and add butter and vanilla.
Frosting: Heat 1 square unsweetened chocolate and 1 tsp butter until melted. Remove from heat and stir in 1 cup of sifted confectioner's sugar and about 2 Tbsp hot water. Beat until smooth.
notes:
1 square unsweetened chocolate
1 cup sugar
2 Tbsp hot water

name: Cream Puffs
ingredients:
1 cup Water
1/2 cup Butter
1 cup Flour
4 Eggs
directions:
Pre-heat oven to 400 degrees.
Place parchment paper on cookie sheet.
In saucepan, heat water and butter to a rolling boil.
Remove pan from burner.
Slowly add flour and stir until completely combined (mixture will be lumpy).
Put pan bake on heat and stir quickly until mixture forms a ball and film appears at the bottom of the pan.
Take off and quickly beat in the eggs until the mixture is smooth and thick.
Place mixture on pan and form 6 mounds.
Bake for 35 minutes and until puffed and golden brown and dry.
Add cream filling and Chocolate frosting.
notes: Cream filling and Chocolate frosting are separate recipes

name: Creamy Asiago Pasta
ingredients:
Pasta, cooked
2 Tbsp Butter
4-5 Garlic Cloves, diced
1 tsp Oregano
1 tsp Flour
1 cup Milk
1-2 cups Asiago Cheese
2 cups Spinach
1 cup Pasta Water
Salt
Pepper
Chili Flakes
directions:
Melt butter in a pan and then add in diced garlic and oregano.
Once the garlic starts to lightly brown, add in flour to thicken sauce, keep stirring.
Then add in milk and keep stirring. Once the sauce is smooth add in 1-2 cups of Asiago Cheese.
When the sauce looks creamy add in about 2 cups of spinach, 1 cup of pasta water, and stir. Let that simmer for 2-3 minutes.
Then toss in your pasta, add in salt and pepper to taste and garnish with chili flakes.

name: Creamy Baked Orzo with Meatballs
ingredients:
16 oz Orzo
3 cups Chicken Broth
2 cups Tomato Soup, ready-to-serve
2–3 cups Meatballs, store-bought frozen or homemade
1 pint Cherry Tomatoes, halved
1/2 cup Parmesan Cheese
1 Garlic Clove
2 Tbsp Butter
Basil, for topping
Olive Oil, for topping
directions:
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees.
Pour the orzo, vegetable broth, tomato soup, meatballs, and tomatoes into a 9×13 baking dish. Stir to get everything coated and combined.
Bake for 25 minutes. Give it a little stir and check the texture. If needed, bake for another 10 minutes to let the orzo finish absorbing the liquid. Fluff up the orzo with a fork and stir in any remaining liquid that might be bubbling around the edges. This will gently break down the tomatoes and release some of their juices as well. (As the orzo sits, it will continue to absorb liquid so add more tomato soup or broth as desired.)
Add the Parmesan, garlic, and butter; stir to melt it in. Top with fresh basil leaves, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
notes: Cook time 45 min

name: Creamy Balsamic Spinach Bacon Mushroom Chicken
ingredients:
6 strips Bacon, cut into small pieces
2 Chicken Breasts,large and cut in half lengthwise
1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
Pepper to taste
Flour, for dredging
1 Tbsp Olive Oil
8 oz Cremini Mushrooms, sliced
1/3 cup Chicken Broth
3 Tbsp Balsamic Vinegar
1 cup Heavy Cream
2 cups Fresh Baby Spinach
directions:
Cut the bacon into small pieces (I do this with kitchen shears). Fry it over medium-high heat in a deep skillet until crispy. Take it out of the pan and set it aside on a plate. Leave about 2 tablespoons of the bacon fat in the pan.
Cut the chicken breasts in half lengthwise so you have 4 thinner pieces. Sprinkle them with the garlic powder and pepper and coat them in flour on all sides.
Cook the chicken for 4-5 minutes/side until golden and take it out of the pan (ok to put it on the same plate as the bacon).
The pan will likely be quite dry, so add a splash of olive oil (about a tablespoon) prior to adding the mushrooms. Cook the mushrooms until the water has cooked out and they get a nice sear (about 6-8 minutes). You may need to turn down the heat a bit if the pan becomes too hot/smoking.
Take the mushrooms out of the pan (adding them to the same plate as the chicken and bacon is fine).
Stir in the chicken broth and balsamic vinegar, and scrape the brown bits from the bottom of the pan. Let it bubble until the liquid reduces by half (about 2 minutes or so).
Stir in the cream, and then add the chicken, bacon, and mushrooms back to the pan. Cook it for 5 minutes or so until the sauce thickens and the chicken cooks through.
Stir in the spinach (I lift the chicken up with tongs and tuck it underneath to make it easy!) and cook for another minute or two until it's wilted. Serve immediately.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 20 min

name: Creamy Blue Cheese Dip
ingredients:
1/2 cup Sour Cream
1/2 cup Mayonnaise
5 oz Danish Blue Cheese, finely crumbled
1/8 tsp Cayenne Pepper
2 Tbsp Green Onions, finely chopped
directions:
In a food processor or blender, combine the sour cream, mayonnaise, blue cheese and cayenne pepper. Process until smooth. Transfer to a serving dish. Sprinkle with the green onions.
Cover and refrigerate until serving time.
The dip can be stored in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 5 days.

name: Creamy Chive Chicken with Lemony Rice and a Dijon-Apple Salad
ingredients:
1 Lemon
1/4 oz Chives
1 Apple
1/2 cup Rice
2 tsp Dijon Mustard
10 oz Chicken
1 Chicken Stock Concentrate
2 Tbsp Sour Cream
2 oz Mixed Greens
directions:
Wash and dry all produce. Halve and core apple; quarter one half lengthwise, then thinly slice crosswise into triangles. Mince chives. Zest and quarter lemon.
Rice: In a small pot, combine rice, 3/4 cup water, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to a low simmer. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve. Fluff rice with a fork; stir in 1 Tbsp butter and lemon zest. Season with salt and pepper.
Salad: In a medium bowl, combine 1 Tbsp olive oil, juice from half the lemon, half the mustard, 1/2 tsp sugar, salt, and pepper. Stir in half the chives. Add mixed greens and apple to bowl with vinaigrette. Season with salt and pepper; toss to combine.
Chicken: Season chicken all over with salt and pepper. Heat a large drizzle of olive oil in a large, preferably nonstick, pan over medium high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, 5-7 minutes per side. Turn off heat; transfer to a plate. Wipe out pan.
Heat pan used for chicken over medium-high heat. Add stock concentrate, remaining mustard, 1/4 cup water (1/3 cup for 4 servings), and a squeeze of lemon juice. Simmer until slightly thickened, 1-2 minutes. Turn off heat. Stir in sour cream and remaining chives. (TIP: If sauce seems too thick, add more water 1 tsp at a time until it reaches drizzling consistency.) Season with salt and pepper.
Divide chicken, rice, and salad between plates. Drizzle chicken with sauce. Cut remaining lemon into wedges and serve on the side.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 30 min. Calories: 600

name: Creamy Coconut Lime Salmon
ingredients:
4 Salmon Filets
1 Tbsp Coconut Oil
1 Shallot, finely chopped
3-4 Garlic Cloves, minced
1 cup Full-Fat Coconut Milk
1 tsp Oregano, dried
2 Tbsp Fresh Lime Juice
1 Tbsp Lime Zest
1 Tbsp Cornstarch
Salt & Pepper, to taste
Cilantro, to garnish
Extra Lime Slices, to garnish
directions:
Season the salmon with salt and pepper on all sides.
Heat coconut oil in a large non-stick pan over medium heat. Pan sear the salmon until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side. The salmon can be undercooked at this point as we will continue to cook it later into the sauce. Set aside on a plate.
Add in the shallot and garlic, and cook for 3-4 minutes, until softens.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, whisk the coconut milk, oregano, lime juice, zest, and cornstarch, until well combined.
Pour the coconut milk mixture into the pan and lower the heat. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Once simmering, return the salmon to the pan, and continue to cook until cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
Take it off the heat and sprinkle with fresh chopped cilantro and lime slices. Serve while hot and enjoy!
notes:
Prep time 10 min and Cook time 20 min. Calories: 430
Switch out the protein with any other protein like shrimp.

name: Creamy Dijon Rosemary Chicken
ingredients:
2 Chicken Breasts, large and cut in half lengthwise
Flour, for dredging
1 Tbsp Olive Oil
1 Tbsp Butter
3 sprigs Fresh Rosemary
1/2 cup Chicken Stock
3 Garlic Cloves, minced
3 Tbsp Dijon Mustard
1 cup Heavy Cream
Salt & Pepper, to taste
directions:
Heat the olive oil and butter over medium-high heat in a large skillet.
Cut the chicken breasts in half lengthwise so you’re left with four thinner cutlets. Dredge each piece in flour. Fry the chicken for 5 minutes per side and then remove it from the pan and set it aside.
Remove the rosemary needles from the stems and add the needles to the pan. Let the rosemary cook for about a minute.
Add the wine, garlic, and Dijon Mustard. Stir it until you have a smooth sauce, and then add the cream and chicken back in the pan. Cook for another 8-10 minutes over medium-low heat until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened. Season with salt and pepper as desired.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 20 min

name: Creamy Lemon Garlic Chicken & Gnocchi
ingredients:
12-16 oz Chicken Breasts, cut in half lengthwise to make cutlets
3/4 tsp Garlic Powder
1 tsp Lemon Pepper Seasoning
2 Tbsp Olive Oil or Butter
3 Garlic Cloves, minced
1/2 cup Chicken Broth
1 Tbsp Lemon Juice
1 cup Heavy Cream
1 lb Potato Gnocchi
1/3 cup Parmesan Cheese, grated
3 cups Fresh Spinach
directions:
Season each side of the thin chicken cutlets with garlic powder and lemon pepper.
Add oil and butter to skillet over medium-high heat and sear chicken for 5 min per side, until golden and cooked through. Transfer to a plate.
Stir in broth and lemon juice.
Add cream and gnocchi. Stir and make sure the gnocchi is covered in sauce. Let it simmer uncovered, for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally until sauce is thickened.
Remove pan from heat and add parmesan and spinach. Toss until spinach is wilted. Place chicken cutlets back into skillet and serve.

name: Creamy Lemon Garlic Parmesan Shrimp
ingredients:
1 lb Shrimp, thawed & peeled
2 Tbsp Butter
1 tsp Flour
4-5 Garlic Cloves, minced
1 Tbsp Lemon Juice
1 Lemon, zested
1 cup Heavy Cream
1/4 tsp Italian Seasoning
1/2 cup Parmesan Cheese, freshly grated
1 Tbsp Fresh Parsley, chopped
Salt & Pepper, to taste
directions:
Prep the shrimp (run them under cool water if they're frozen). You can remove the tails if you want. Pat them dry with paper towel.
Melt the butter over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Stir in the flour and cook for about a minute.
Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds.
Stir in the lemon juice + zest, cream, and Italian Seasoning. Simmer for 2 minutes.
Add the shrimp and cook for around 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until they're cooked through and the sauce has thickened up a bit (be careful not to overcook the shrimp). Reduce the heat a bit if it's bubbling like crazy/thickening too fast.
Stir in the parmesan cheese and parsley, then take the skillet off the heat.
Season with salt & pepper as needed. Serve immediately.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 10 min

name: Creamy Lemon Spinach Ricotta Ravioli with Roasted Bell Pepper & Parmesan
ingredients:
1 Garlic Clove
1 Bell Pepper
1 Roma Tomato
1 Lemon
9 oz Spinach Ravioli or Regular Pasta
Vegetable Stock Concentrate
2 Tbsp Cream Cheese
2 Tbsp Sour Cream
1/4 cup Parmesan Cheese
directions:
Adjust rack to middle position and preheat oven to 400 degrees. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Wash and dry produce. Halve bell pepper; remove stem and seeds. Cut tomato into six wedges. Peel and thinly slice garlic. Zest and quarter lemon.
Place bell pepper and tomato on a baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Arrange bell pepper cut sides down. Roast on middle rack until veggies are softened and lightly charred, 20-25 minutes. Let bell pepper cool slightly, then transfer to a cutting board and thinly slice into strips.
When veggies are almost done, gently add ravioli to pot of boiling water. Reduce to a simmer and cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente and floating to the top, 4-5 minutes. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta cooking water, then drain.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook, stirring, until softened, 2-3 minutes.
Add 1/4 cup reserved pasta cooking water, stock concentrate, cream cheese, sour cream, half the Parmesan (save the rest for serving), and 1 Tbsp butter to pan with garlic. Whisk until combined and creamy, then stir in roasted tomato and sliced bell pepper. Add a squeeze of lemon juice to taste. Season generously with salt and pepper.
Add drained ravioli to pan with sauce; gently toss until thoroughly coated. TIP: If necessary, stir in more pasta cooking water a splash at a time until ravioli is coated in a creamy sauce. Divide between plates and top with remaining Parmesan and lemon zest to taste. Serve with any remaining lemon wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time40 min. Calories: 600

name: Creamy Parmesan Garlic Mushroom Chicken
ingredients:
4 Chicken Breasts, thinly sliced
2 Tbsp Olive Oil
Salt & Pepper
8 oz Mushrooms, sliced
1/4 cup Butter
2 Garlic Cloves, minced
1 Tbsp Flour
1/2 cup Chicken Broth
1 cup Heavy Cream or half and half
1/2 cup Parmesan Cheese, grated
1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
1/4 tsp Pepper
1/2 tsp Salt
1 cup Spinach, chopped
directions:
In a large skillet add olive oil and cook the chicken on medium high heat for 3-5 minutes on each side or until brown on each side and cooked until no longer pink in center. Remove chicken and set aside on a plate.
Add the sliced mushrooms and cook for a few minutes until tender. Remove and set aside.
To make the sauce add the butter and melt. Add garlic and cook until tender. Whisk in the flour until it thickens.
Whisk in chicken broth, heavy cream, parmesan cheese, garlic powder, pepper and salt.
Add the spinach and let simmer until it starts to thicken and spinach wilts. Add the chicken and mushrooms back to the sauce and serve over pasta.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 20 min

name: Creamy Rigatoni With Pork Sausage plus Philadelphia Cream Cheese, Broccoli, Lemon & Parmesan
ingredients:
8 oz Broccoli Florets
1 Lemon
6 oz Rigatoni Pasta
9 oz Italian Pork Sausage
4 Tbsp Cream Cheese
2 Tbsp Sour Cream
1 tsp Garlic Powder
1 Chicken Stock Concentrate
1/4 cup Parmesan Cheese
directions:
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Wash and dry produce. Cut broccoli florets into bite-size pieces if necessary. Quarter lemon.
Once water is boiling, add rigatoni to pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, 9-11 minutes. Reserve 3/4 cup pasta cooking water (1 cup for 4 servings), then drain. TIP: If your water isn't boiling yet, get started on the next steps!
Place broccoli in a medium, microwave-safe bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Microwave until tender, 1-2 minutes. TIP: No microwave? No problem! In the last 2-4 minutes of cooking pasta, add broccoli to boiling water and cook with pasta until tender.
Remove beef from casing; discard casing. Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add sausage and cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned and cooked through, 4-6 minutes. TIP: Drain any excess grease from pan if necessary.
Reduce heat to medium low. Stir Philadelphia cream cheese, sour cream, garlic powder, stock concentrate, 1/4 cup pasta cooking water (1/3 cup for 4 servings), 2 Tbsp butter, and a big squeeze of lemon juice into pan with sausage. Season with salt and pepper. TIP: If you've got some on hand, add a pinch of chili flakes from your pantry for a spicy kick. Add rigatoni and broccoli. Cook, stirring, until pasta is coated in a creamy sauce. TIP: If needed, stir in more reserved pasta cooking water a splash at a time.
Divide pasta between bowls. Top with a squeeze of lemon juice. Sprinkle with Parmesan and serve with any remaining lemon wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 20 min. Calories: 980

name: Creamy Sausage Gnocchi
ingredients:
1 Tbsp Olive Oil
1 lb Italian Sausage, casing removed
1/2 Sweet Onion, diced
3 Garlic Cloves, minced
1 tsp Italian Seasoning
2 cups Beef Stock
1 (8-ounce) can Tomato Sauce
24 oz Potato Gnocchi
4 cups Baby Spinach, chopped
1/4 cup Heavy Cream
1/4 cup Parmesan, freshly grated
Salt & Pepper, to taste
1/4 cup Basil Leaves
directions:
Heat olive oil in a large stockpot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add Italian Sausage and onion, and cook until sausage has browned, about 3-5 minutes, making sure to crumble the sausage as it cooks; drain excess fat.
Stir in garlic and Italian Seasoning until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Gradually whisk in beef stock and tomato sauce. Stir in gnocchi. Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer until reduced and slightly thickened, and the gnocchi is cooked through, about 6-8 minutes.
Stir in spinach and heavy cream until the spinach has wilted, about 1-2 minutes.
Stir in Parmesan; season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Serve immediately, garnished with basil, if desired.
notes: Prep time 15 min and Cook time 15 min.

name: Creamy Shrimp and Corn Bisque
ingredients:
3 Tbsp Butter, unsalted or olive oil
2 Garlic Cloves, minced
3 Tbsp Yellow Onion, chopped
4 Tbsp Celery, chopped (plus more for garnish)
1/2 cup Corn Kernels, fresh or frozen
3 Tbsp All-Purpose Flour
1/2 tsp Salt
1/2 tsp Pepper
1 Tbsp Tomato Paste
1 tsp Creole Seasoning Blend *see notes
2 cups Milk
1 cup Heavy Whipping Cream
1/2 lb Large Shrimp, cooked
1/2 lb Crabmeat, imitation
4 Tbsp Red Wine Vinegar
3 Tbsp Parsley, chopped
Jalapeños, chopped (optional garnish)
directions:
Melt the butter in a dutch oven or large saucepan over medium-low heat; add the chopped onion and celery. Sauté, stirring, until tender, about 2 minutes. Add in garlic.
Blend the flour into the butter and vegetables until well incorporated. Continue cooking, stirring, for about 2 minutes. Add in seasonings and tomato paste.
Slowly stir the milk into the butter and vegetables. Continue cooking, stirring until thickened, about 3 minutes. Add in the heavy cream.
If desired, puree the soup in a blender or food processor at this point and then return it to the saucepan.
Stir in the cooked shrimp, shredded crab, corn kernels and sherry. Bring it to a simmer. Serve hot, garnished with parsley and additional chopped celery and corn.
To Cook Shrimp:
If you have raw shrimp, you will need to clean and shell it. Next heat 1 tbsp of oil in a sauté pan. Add shrimp to the pan once it's hot, on medium/high heat. Add a pinch of salt & pepper to the shrimp.
Optionally, add a dash of cayenne pepper for heat.
Cook for about 4 minutes on each side and then set the shrimp aside until the recipe calls for it.
notes:
Prep time 10 min and Cook time 15 min
Creole seasoning: 1/2 tsp each of paprika, garlic, onion, thyme together

name: Creamy Shrimp Tagliatelle with Heirloom Tomatoes, Garlic, and Chili
ingredients:
2 Garlic Cloves
1 Scallion
1 Chili Pepper
10 oz Heirloom Grape Tomatoes
1 Lemon
10 oz Shrimp
9 oz Tagliatelle Pasta
4 Tbsp Sour Cream
1 tsp Olive Oil
2 Tbsp Butter
