directions:
Wash and dry all produce. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Mince garlic. Trim, then thinly slice scallions, keeping greens and whites separate. Finely mince chili, removing seeds and ribs for less heat. Halve tomatoes. Cut lemon into wedges. Rinse shrimp and pat dry with a paper towel.
Heat a drizzle of olive oil in large pan over medium-high heat. Add garlic, scallion whites, and chili (to taste). Cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add shrimp and cook, tossing, until starting to turn pink but not quite cooked through, 1-2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Once water is boiling, add tagliatelle to pot. (TIP: If any noodles are stuck together, separate them first.) Cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, 4-5 minutes. Carefully scoop out and reserve 1/4 cup pasta cooking water, then drain.
Meanwhile, add tomatoes to pan with shrimp. Cook, tossing, until wilted and juicy, 2-3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat and set aside until pasta is ready. TIP: If you like it extra hot, add any remaining chili (to taste) at this point.
Once tagliatelle is done cooking, return pan with shrimp and tomatoes to medium heat and add tagliatelle and 2 Tbsp butter. Toss to combine and melt butter. Season with salt and pepper.
Remove pan from heat and stir in sour cream, a squeeze of lemon, and as much pasta cooking water as needed to reach a saucy consistency. Season with salt and pepper. Divide between plates or bowls and garnish with scallion greens. Serve with lemon wedges on the side for squeezing over.
notes: Cook time 20 min. Calories: 750

name: Creamy Spicy Garlic Ramen Noodles
ingredients:
Large Shrimp
BBQ Spice Blend
1-2 Tbsp Olive Oil
1 package Ramen Noodles
1 Tbsp Lime Juice
1 Tbsp Butter
1 Tbsp Garlic, minced
2 Tbsp Soy Sauce
1 Tbsp Sriracha
1/4 cup Heavy Cream
1/4 cup Parsley, chopped
1/4 cup Parmesan Cheese
Green Onion garnish, chopped
directions:
Season some large shrimp with Korean bbq blend or something similarly delicious. Add shrimp to skewer and grill or cook in pan with a Tbsp of oil in a pan.
Boil some instant ramen noodles and finish grilling the shrimp with a little lime juice.
Into a pan, add 1 Tbsp olive oil, a Tbsp of butter, and 1 Tbsp of minced garlic.
Then, add 2 Tbsp of Hoisin sauce, 2 Tbsp of soy sauce, 1 Tbsp of sriracha and 1/4 cup of heavy cream.
Stir that in with 1/4 cup of chopped parsley and 1/4 cup of parmesan cheese.
Then, add your ramen, shrimp, and chopped green onion garnish.
notes: add 2 Tbsp Hoisin sauce if you're feelin' spicy

name: Creamy Spinach Artichoke Pasta
ingredients:
12 oz Pasta
1 cup Pasta Water
1 Tbsp Olive Oil
1/2 White Onion, diced
3 Garlic Cloves, minced
Salt & Pepper
Chili Flakes, to taste
5-6 heaping cups Fresh Baby Spinach, roughly chopped
13.75 oz can Artichoke Hearts, drained and chopped
3/4 cup Greek Yogurt
4 oz Cream Cheese, softened
1/2 cup Parmesan Cheese, freshly grated (plus more for garnish)
2 tsp Lemon Juice
1/2 cup Milk + 1/2 Tbsp Cornstarch, whisked together
1¼ cup Mozzarella Cheese, divided
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over medium high heat and cook the pasta according to package instructions, being sure to reserve 1 cup of pasta water before draining cooked pasta. (Cook pasta just shy of al dente. The pasta will tenderize in the oven even more later on).
Add pasta to a 9×13 inch baking dish and set aside.
Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Sauté onions, stirring occasionally, for 2-3 minutes. Add in garlic, salt, pepper and red pepper chili flakes. Stir for 1 minute.
Add in chopped spinach, stir until wilted. Then add in chopped artichokes, stir.
Add in the cream cheese, freshly grated parmesan cheese, Greek Yogurt, lemon juice, and milk/cornstarch mixture. Stir until melted and smooth.
Lastly add in pasta water and 1 cup mozzarella cheese. Simmer, then remove from heat.
Toss the spinach artichoke mixture with the cooked pasta noodles. Top with remaining 1/4 cup mozzarella cheese if desired.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until hot and bubbly and then broil for 1-2 minutes until the cheese on top is golden brown.
Garnish with more cheese on top if desired, serve and enjoy!
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 40 min

name: Creamy Tomato Gnocchi with Burrata
ingredients:
1/3 cup Extra-Virgin Olive Oil
8 Garlic Cloves, peeled and lightly crushed
2 pints Cherry Tomatoes
1/2 tsp Red Pepper Flakes
1 tsp Salt & Pepper
1/2 cup Heavy Cream
2 (16 oz) packages Potato Gnocchi
2 (4 oz) Fresh Burrata Cheese Balls
1/2 cup Fresh Basil Leaves, sliced or torn
directions:
Start by bringing a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-low. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Increase heat to medium and add tomatoes. Cook, stirring occasionally, until at least half the tomatoes break down and become jammy, about 10 minutes. Season with red pepper flakes (if using), salt, and black pepper.
Reduce heat to medium-low and stir in heavy cream. (Note: if you prefer a creamier, saucier pasta sauce, feel free to add an additional 1/4 cup heavy cream.)
When the water comes to a boil, add gnocchi and cook according to package instructions until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta cooking water and drain remaining.
Transfer cooked gnocchi and reserved pasta water to skillet with tomato sauce and toss continuously until the sauce is thickened and glossy, about 2 minutes. Stir in fresh basil, reserving some for garnish.
Break burrata balls into pieces and disperse evenly over pasta. Remove skillet from heat and garnish with reserved basil.
notes: Cook time 30 min

name: Creamy Tuscan Spaghetti & Meatballs with Scallions & Lemon
ingredients:
1 Scallion
1 Lemon
10 oz Ground Beef
1/4 cup Panko Breadcrumbs
2 Tbsp Ketchup
1 Garlic Clove
6 oz Spaghetti
4 oz Cream Sauce Base
1 Chicken Stock Concentrate
1/2 Tbsp Tuscan Heat Spice
2 tsp Vegetable Oil
2 Tbsp Butter
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Wash and dry produce. Thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens; mince whites. Zest and quarter lemon. Peel and mince or grate garlic.
In a medium bowl, combine beef, panko, half the scallion greens, half the ketchup, 1 Tbsp water, juice from one lemon wedge, salt, and pepper. Form into 8-10 1-inch meatballs. Place meatballs on a lightly oiled baking sheet.
Roast meatballs on top rack until browned and cooked through, 14-16 minutes.
Once water is boiling, add spaghetti to pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, 9-11 minutes. Reserve 1 cup pasta cooking water, then drain.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add garlic, scallion whites, and half the lemon zest; cook, stirring, until fragrant, 30-60 seconds. Stir in cream sauce base, stock concentrate, half the Tuscan Heat Spice, and 1/4 cup reserved cooking water. Bring to a simmer, then remove pan from heat. Add 2 Tbsp butter (3 Tbsp for 4); taste and season with salt and pepper.
Add drained spaghetti and meatballs to pan with sauce; toss to coat. (For 4 servings, if your pan isn't large enough, carefully transfer everything back to the empty pasta pot.) TIP: If needed, stir in more reserved pasta cooking water a splash at a time until everything is coated in a creamy sauce. Divide pasta between bowls and season with pepper. Top with remaining scallion greens and remaining lemon zest to taste. Serve with a squeeze of lemon juice.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 20 min. Calories: 970

name: Crepes
ingredients:
3/4 cup Flour
1 cup Milk
1 Egg, beaten
Dash of Salt
directions:
Combine flour, milk, egg and salt.
Spray 6-inch skillet with nonstick spray.
Preheat skillet.
Then remove from heat.
Pour 2 Tbsp of batter in center of pan, lift and tilt skillet to spread batter.
Return to heat.
Brown on one side only- invert skillet over paper towel; remove crepe.
notes: can be filled with eggs, fruit, etc.

name: Crispy Chicken Wraps
ingredients:
1 lb Chicken Breast
1 Egg
1 Tbsp Mayo
1½ cup Panko Breadcrumbs
1/4 tsp Salt
1/4 tsp Garlic Powder
1/4 tsp Pepper
1/2 cup Lettuce, chopped
1 Tomato, chopped
1/4 cup Cheese
4 Tbsp Sauce of Choice (BBQ, Buffalo, Sriracha, Mayo, Italian Dressing)
4 Tortillas
directions:
Set oven to 425º. Prepare the crispy chicken for the wraps. Place the egg, mayo, salt, garlic powder, and pepper in a medium bowl and whisk until smooth; set aside. Get a baking sheet out and place a wire rack/cooling rack on it. This is the trick to getting the chicken perfectly crispy and cooked.
Mix panko and seasoning together. Add it to a skillet and toast on medium/low heat, stirring often. Only toast until the panko darkens a bit in color, about 5 minutes. Take it off the heat and set aside.
Working with one chicken breast at a time, place inside a gallon zip-top bag and pound with the flat side of a meat mallet or rolling pin to an even 1/4-inch thickness. Set the flattened chicken breast aside and repeat with remaining breasts.
Drudge the chicken in the egg/mayo wash and then coat both sides with the panko crumb (I just coat the chicken in the skillet I used to taste the panko). Place the coated breasts on the wire rack that’s on the baking sheet (see photo). Bake in the oven for 17-20 minutes or until internal temp is 165º.
Once chicken is cooked, let it rest for a few minutes before slicing up. Slice up lettuce, tomato and get the mayo mixture and cheese ready.
Assemble the wrap. Place everything into the center of the wrap, try now to overfill. Drizzle sauce of choice over the ingredients. Fold the wrap up like you would a burrito, both ends tucked in and then rolled horizontally.
Add the wrap to an oiled skillet pan on medium/high heat. Place the wrap with the folded side down first to seal it. Let it cook untouched for about 4 minutes each side. Once it is browned and crispy, remove from heat and let it cool for a minute. Then eat and enjoy.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 20 min

name: Crispy Chipotle Shrimp Tacos with Cabbage Slaw and Radishes
ingredients:
1 Lime
3 Radishes
1 Scallion
10 oz Shrimp
4 oz Red Cabbage, shredded
2 Tbsp Cornstarch
1 tsp Chipotle Powder
4 Tbsp Sour Cream
6 Corn Tortillas
1 tsp Olive Oil
2 Tbsp Vegetable Oil
directions:
Wash and dry all produce. Cut lime into wedges. Halve radishes, then slice into thin half-moons. Trim, then thinly slice scallions, keeping greens and whites separate. Rinse shrimp under cool running water and pat dry with a paper towel.
Toss cabbage and scallion whites in a medium bowl with a squeeze of lime, a drizzle of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
Heat a 1/4-inch layer of oil in a large pan over high heat (use a nonstick pan if you have one). Meanwhile, place shrimp, cornstarch, and 1/4 tsp chipotle powder in another medium bowl (we'll use more chipotle in step 5). Season with salt and pepper. Toss until shrimp are thoroughly coated.
Add shrimp to pan in a single layer and cook until golden brown and crisp, about 2 minutes per side. Remove from pan with a slotted spoon and set aside on a paper-towel-lined plate. Season with salt and pepper.
In a small bowl, stir together sour cream, a squeeze of lime, and a pinch of chipotle powder (use more to taste). Season with salt and pepper. Add enough water to create a drizzly consistency (about 1 Tbsp). Wrap tortillas in a lightly dampened paper towel and microwave until warm and soft, about 30 seconds.
Divide slaw, shrimp, and radishes between tortillas. Drizzle with crema, sprinkle with scallion greens, and serve with any remaining lime wedges for squeezing over.
notes:
Cook time 20 min. Calories: 580
Replace radish cabbage slaw with Coleslaw mixture (Mix 4 oz Cabbage (shredded), 2 Tbsp Mayo, 1 tsp Sugar, and juice from half of a lemon)

name: Crispy Jack Chicken with Roasted Carrots, Potatoes Wedges & Sriracha Mayo
ingredients:
12 oz Yukon Gold Potatoes
12 oz Carrots
1/4 cup Panko Breadcrumbs
1/4 cup Monterey Jack Cheese
1 Tbsp Butter
1 Tbsp Ranch Spice
10 oz Chicken Cutlets
4 Tbsp Mayo
1 tsp Sriracha
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Cut potatoes into 1/2 inch thick wedges. Trim, peel, and cut carrots on a diagonal into 1/2 inch thick pieces.
Chicken: Place 1 Tbsp butter in a small microwave-safe bowl; microwave until melted, 30 seconds. Stir in panko, Monterey Jack, half the Ranch spice (you'll use the rest in the next step), salt, and pepper.
Meanwhile, pat chicken dry with paper towels; season all over with salt and pepper. Place on a new baking sheet. Spread tops of chicken with 1 tsp mayo each (you'll use the rest in the next step). Mound with panko mixture, pressing firmly to adhere (no need to coat the undersides). Add chicken to middle oven rack for 15-18 minutes.
Potatoes and Carrots: Toss potatoes on one side of a baking sheet with a large drizzle of olive oil, remaining ranch spice, salt, and pepper. Toss carrots on empty side with a drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack for 20-25 minutes.
Sauce: In a second small bowl, combine remaining mayo with Sriracha to taste.
Divide chicken and potato wedges between plates. Serve with Sriracha mayo on the side for dipping.
notes: 810 Calories. Prep: 10 min and cook 35 min

name: Crispy Kickin' Cayenne Chicken Cutlets with Mashed Potatoes, Carrots and a Honey Drizzle
ingredients:
12 oz Carrots
2 Scallions
4 Tbsp Sour Cream
1/4 oz Frank's Seasoning Blend
1/4 cup Panko Breadcrumbs
1/4 cup Monterey Jack Cheese
10 oz Chicken Cutlets
12 oz Yukon Gold Potatoes
2 tsp Honey
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Trim, peel, and cut carrots on a diagonal into 1/2-inch-thick pieces. Trim and thinly slice scallions. Separating whites from greens.
Sauce: In a small bowl, combine half the sour cream(you'll use the rest later), 1/2 tsp Frank's seasoning, and a big pinch of salt. Stir in water 1 tsp at a time until mixture reaches a drizzling consistency.
Chicken: Place 1 Tbsp butter in a medium microwave-safe bowl; microwave until melted. 30-45 seconds. Stir in panko, monterey jack, remaining Frank's seasoning, and a big pinch of salt and pepper.
Meanwhile, pat chicken dry with paper towels and season all over with salt and pepper. Place on a plate. Mound tops of chicken with panko mixture, pressing firmly to adhere. Once carrots have roasted 5 minutes, remove sheet from over. Carefully place chicken, coated sides up, on empty side. Roast on top rack until chicken is golden brown and cooked through and carrots are browned and tender, 15-18 minutes. Drizzle honey on chicken.
Mashed Potatoes: Dice potatoes into 1/2-inch-thick pieces. Place in a medium pot with enough salted water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil; cook until tender, 15-20 minutes. Reserve 1/2 cup potato cooking liquid, then drain.
Heat a drizzle of oil and scallion whites in empty pot over low heat; cook until softened, 1 minute. Return potatoes to pot; mash with remaining sour cream and 1 Tbsp butter until smooth and creamy, adding splashes of reserved potato cooking liquid as needed. Season with salt and pepper. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve.
Carrots: While potatoes cook, lightly oil a baking sheet. Toss carrots on one side of prepared sheet with a drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack for 5 minutes.
Carefully transfer roasted carrots to a large bowl; add 1 Tbsp butter and toss until melted. Divide carrots, mashed potatoes and chicken with scallion greens and serve.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 30 min. Calories: 770

name: Crispy Parmesan Crusted Potatoes
ingredients:
Baby Dutch Yellow Potatoes
2-4 Tbsp Butter
1/4 cup Parmesan Cheese, and more for sprinkling on top
1/4 tsp Onion Powder
1/4 tsp Garlic Powder
Salt & Pepper, to taste
directions:
Preheat your oven to 415F.
Cut and score your potatoes.
Melt half a stick of butter and pour it into a baking dish. Add parmesan cheese,onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper to taste.
Add in your potatoes facing down. Brush them with melted butter and add more parmesan cheese on top.
Bake on 415 F for 20-25 minutes (if you're using small potatoes). Adjust the time for larger potatoes.
notes: You'll use how ever many potato halves that fit in the pan face down.

name: Crispy Potato Skins
ingredients:
4 large Russet Potatoes
1 Tbsp Vegetable Oil
1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
1 Tbsp Parmesan Cheese
directions:
Preheat oven to 400F.
Prick the potatoes with a fork in several places. Wrap in foil and bake until tender, about 50 minutes. Cool slightly before handling.
With a sharp knife, cut the potatoes into quarters. Scoop out the inside, leaving 1/4 inch shell. Reserve the filling for another use. Brush the skins with oil. Place cut side up on a baking sheet. Bake about 15 minutes, or until crisp.
Remove from the oven. Sprinkle with the garlic powder and Parmesan. Return to the oven for 2 minutes to melt the cheese.

name: Crispy Potato Squares
ingredients:
6 Maris Piper Potatoes
2 Tbsp Vegetable Oil
4 Garlic Cloves
Handful of Sea Salt
Few Springs of Rosemary, Thyme, and Sage, leaves removed
directions:
Peel and then cut your potatoes into small cubes. Place them in cold salted water and then bring them to a boil. Boil for 5-10 minutes or until they fall off of a knife easily.
Drain the liquid off, toss the potatoes about a little and then cover with a towel and leave to steam, dry and cook for 10 minutes.
Heat a tray of oil (2 or 3 Tbsp) in a preheated oven (400°F) until it's very hot and then add the potatoes to the tray whilst the oil is sizzling. Add the garlic cloves and then roast in the oven for 20 minutes, turning and repeating this until they're nice and crispy.
notes: If you're a regular person who doesn't know what a piper potato is (such as myself) use whatever potato your heart desires

name: Crock Pot Balsamic Glazed Drumsticks
ingredients:
8 Chicken Drumsticks
3 Tbsp Coconut Oil or Olive Oil
1/2 cup Balsamic Vinegar
3 Tbsp Soy Sauce
1 Tbsp Honey
directions:
Put all ingredients into a ziploc bag.
Either freeze for a make ahead meal or let marinade overnight.
The next morning just dump it all in the crockpot and cook on low for 6-8 hours.

name: Crock Pot Chicken Spaghetti
ingredients:
2 Chicken Breasts
1/2 tsp Salt
1/2 tsp Pepper
1 tsp Onion Powder
1 tsp Paprika
2 cans Cream of Chicken
10 oz Can of Rotel Tomatoes
1 Tbsp Garlic, minced
2 cups Colby Jack Cheese, shredded
1/4 cup Sour Cream
1 lb Spaghetti
directions:
Add chicken breasts, seasonings, cream of chicken soup, and rotel tomatoes to a crock pot and stir.
Cook on low for about 4-6 hours.
Stir in sour cream and shredded cheese.
Cook spaghetti according to the directions on the package, drain, and add to the slower cooker.
Mix everything together well and serve.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 4-6 hours

name: Crock Pot Chuck Roast Tacos
ingredients:
3-4 lb Chuck Roast
Salt & Pepper
Olive Oil
2 Tbsp Butter
1 Onion, sliced
2 cups Beef Broth
1 Tbsp Garlic, minced
1/4 cup Green Chiles
1/2 tsp Salt
1/4 tsp Cayenne
2 tsp Chili Powder
1 tsp Cumin
1 tsp Cilantro
1 tsp Pepper
directions:
Season the chuck roast with salt and pepper sear on all sides in a skillet.
Put chuck roast in a crock pot. Add butter and onions to the hot skillet.
Let those cook down just a little bit and add beef broth, minced garlic, green chiles, salt, cayenne, chili powder, cumin, cilantro, and black pepper. Stir everything together and let simmer.
Pour onion and broth mixture over the chuck roast in the crock pot. Cook on low for 8 hours.
Once meat is cooked, shred and let sit in the juices.
Assemble tacos with your favorite taco making ingredients.

name: Crumbl Lemon Cheesecake Cookies
ingredients:
Graham Cracker Cookies:
1/2 cup Butter, softened, salted or unsalted
1/3 cup Sugar
1/4 cup Brown Sugar
1 Egg
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
1 ⅓ cup All-Purpose Flour
1 cup Graham Crackers, finely crushed, about 7 sheets
1/4 tsp Salt
1/4 tsp Baking Soda
1/2 tsp Baking Powder
1/3 cup Graham Crackers, finely crushed, about 2 sheets
Cream Cheese Frosting:
4 oz Cream Cheese, softened
4 Tbsp Butter, softened
1 cup Powdered Sugar
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
1/2 Tbsp Lemon Juice
1 Lemon, zested
1/2 cup Lemon Curd (check Lemon Curd Recipe)
directions:
Preheat the oven to 350F then line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set it aside.
Cream the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until combined. Add in the egg and the vanilla and mix again.
Add in the flour, graham cracker crumbs, salt, baking soda, and baking powder and mix just until the flour mixture disappears.
Using a large (1/4 cup) cookie scooper, scoop out 8 equally sized cookie dough balls, roll them between the palm of your hands then roll them in the 1/3 cup of the crushed graham crackers.
Place the cookie dough on the prepared baking sheet, gently flatten to about 3/4-inch in thickness and bake in the preheated oven for 9-10 minutes. Let the cookies cool down on the baking sheet for 10 minutes then transfer to a cooling rack.
Cream Cheese frosting: In a stand mixer whip the softened cream cheese and butter together until smooth.
Add in the powdered sugar. the vanilla extract, lemon juice, and lemon zest, and mix on high speed again until light and fluffy. This should take 2-3 minutes.
Spread on top of each cookie using a spatula then top with a dollop of lemon curd and gently make a swirl on top of the cream cheese. Top each cookie with a slice of lemon and a dusting of crushed graham crackers if you'd like and enjoy!
notes: Check Lemon Curd Recipe

name: Crushed Potato Pie
ingredients:
2 Potatoes, large
2 Tbsp Olive Oil
Salt & Pepper, to taste
50g Mozzarella
8 Cherry Tomatoes, halved
2 Shallots, sliced
Handful of Spinach, wilted
2 Eggs
2 Tbsp Cream Cheese
½ tsp Garlic Powder
½ tsp Nutmeg
50ml Milk
Parmesan & Basil leaves, for garnish
directions:
Boil potatoes, then transfer to a 20cm greased baking tin and crush. Press firmly, creating the sides. Drizzle with olive oil, sprinkle with salt, and bake at 390F for 40-45 min.
Add mozzarella, tomatoes, shallots, and spinach.
Whisk eggs, cream cheese, salt, pepper, nutmeg, garlic powder, and milk. Pour over the potato base.
Bake for 30-35 min until settled.
Sprinkle Parmesan, garnish with basil.

name: Cucumber Honey Pepper Chicken Sandwich
ingredients:
Ciabatta Baguette
Sour Cream
Fresh Chives
Lemon Pepper Sauce:
3 Tbsp Butter
½ Lemon, juiced
2 Tbsp Soy Sauce
1 tsp Pepper
½ tsp Salt
2 Tbsp Honey
2 tsp Chili Crunch
Cucumber Salad:
¼ - ½ Cucumber, thinly sliced
½ Red Onion, thinly sliced
¼ - ½ cup Vinegar
2 tsp Chili Crunch
½ tsp Pepper
1 tsp Salt
2 tsp Olive Oil
1 Tbsp Honey
directions:
Air Fried Chicken: Take 2 chicken thighs and dredge them in flour, egg, then crushed corn flakes. Spray with an oil spray and get it in your air fryer at 385 for 16 minutes flipping halfway through. Cook till an internal of 165F is reached.
Lemon Pepper Sauce: In a pan add butter, lemon, soy sauce, black pepper, and honey. Heat and mix till thickened and sticky. Serve warm or it will get too solid to coat chicken.
Cucumber Salad: In a container, add cucumber, red onion, salt pepper, olive oil, white balsamic vinegar, honey, (chili crunch optional). Close lid and shake well.
Assembly: Slice ciabatta in half and add honey coated chicken, a layer of cucumbers, and a drizzle of sour cream with chives.
notes: Couldn’t find a good image. I promise the sandwich looks more appetizing than the sample image

name: Darcy's Cheese Bread
ingredients:
4 cups Flour
2 cups Water
1 Tbsp Salt
1 Tbsp Yeast
2 cups Cheddar Cheese, grated
directions:
Place warm water in mixer with yeast. stir to combine. Wait to add next ingredients until you see bubbling.
Add salt and flour.
Knead for 8 minutes.
Let rise in greased bowl for 1 hour or until doubled.
Turn out on flat surface. Roll into a rectangle. Divide into two equal parts. Spread the cheese on each section and roll tightly. Cover both loaves.
Let rise for about 45 minutes.
Heat oven to 425F.
Spritz bread dough with water and slice openings in the top.
Bake for 30 minutes rotating once.
Place on cooling rack.

name: Dark Chocolate Peanut Butter Cups
ingredients:
16 oz Dark Chocolate
1/2 cup Creamy Peanut Butter
3 Tbsp Coconut Oil
directions:
Melt the chocolate and half of the coconut oil on a double boiler.
Once smooth, turn off the heat and leave it on the pot.
Mix the peanut butter with the remaining coconut oil.
Line a muffin tin with cupcake liners.
Fill with enough chocolate to cover the bottom and put in the freezer for 5 minutes.
Once set add a scoop of the peanut butter and spread out with the back of a spoon.
Cover with more chocolate to cover the peanut butter completely.
Put in the freezer for 25-30 minutes.

name: Deep Dish Chocolate Chip Cookie
ingredients:
1 cup Butter
1 cup Sugar
1/2 cup Brown Sugar, packed
2 tsp Vanilla
2 Tbsp Real Maple Syrup
2 Eggs
2¾ cup Flour
1 tsp Baking Soda
1/2 tsp Salt
1 cup Semi-Sweet or Dark Chocolate Chips
1/2 cup Milk Chocolate Chips
1/2 cup Caramel Pieces
3 Tbsp Heavy Whipping Cream
Coarse Sea Salt
directions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degree.
Soften 1 stick of butter in the microwave for 30 seconds or until partially melted. Soften the remaining stick of butter for 10 seconds.
Mix the butter and sugar together with an electric mixer until creamed. Add the vanilla and maple syrup and mix again until smooth. Add the eggs; beat slowly until incorporated.
Add the flour, baking soda, and salt (sometimes it helps to add the flour in batches). Mix until a smooth, dry dough forms. Stir in the chocolate chips and chocolate chunks. Melt the caramel pieces and heavy cream in the microwave for 2 minutes. Stir well until melted and smooth.
Press half of the dough mixture into a 9-inch or larger cast iron skillet lined with parchment paper. Pour the caramel over the dough and smooth with a spoon. Cover with another layer of cookie dough. Bake for 15-25 minutes (see notes). Remove from oven, sprinkle with sea salt, and allow to rest for at least one hour in order for the pieces to hold their shape when cut.
notes: I baked mine uncovered for 15 minutes, but you could also cover with foil and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes to get the cookie center baked even further. If you only bake for 15 minutes total, like I did, the cookie WILL be underbaked.

name: Divinity Candy
ingredients:
2 cups Sugar
1/2 cup White Corn Syrup
1/2 cup Cold Water
2 Egg Whites, room temperature
Pinch of Salt
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
1 cup Pecans, chopped (optional)
directions:
Lay sheets of waxed paper onto two cooling racks and set aside.
Heat the sugar, corn syrup and water over medium heat in a heavy bottomed saucepan. Using a candy thermometer, heat the mixture until it reaches 250º F, a hard ball stage.
As the syrup is cooking, whip egg whites, along with a pinch of salt, until stiff peaks have formed.
When the sugar syrup has reached hard ball stage (250º F), remove it from the heat and begin to slowly pour it into the beaten egg whites, whipping together at a high speed.
Add the vanilla and continue whipping the mixture on high until it holds its shape and does not fall back onto itself, about 5-6 minutes. Stir in chopped pecans, if using.
Using two teaspoons and working quickly, drop scoops of divinity onto sheets of waxed paper that has been placed on top of cooling racks. If the divinity begins to harden, add a few drops of warm water to help loosen it while working.
Allow the divinity to dry and harden. This usually takes a couple of hours to overnight. Store in an airtight container for up to two weeks.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 30 min

name: Dole Whip
ingredients:
4 cups Pineapple, frozen and chopped
1/2 cup Milk
1/2 cup Condensed Milk
directions:
Place all ingredients in a blender, and blend until smooth.
Serve in a cold glass, garnish with an umbrella or a cherry and enjoy!

name: Donuts
ingredients:
2¼ tsp Active Dry Yeast
1/2 cup Warm Water, 110 degrees
1/4 cup Sugar, divided
1/4 cup Full Cream Milk, room temp
1/2 tsp Salt
1/4 cup Shortening, room temp
1 Egg, large
1 Egg Yolk
1/2 tsp Vanilla Extract
2½ cups All-Purpose Flour, add more as needed
3-4 cups Vegetable Oil, for frying
directions:
In the bowl of an electric stand mixer, whisk together yeast, warm water and 1/2 tsp of the sugar. Cover it with cling wrap and a towel. Let it rest 5-10 minutes in a warm spot until it becomes frothy.
Add in milk, remaining granulated sugar (3 Tbsp + 2½ tsp), salt, 1/4 cup Shortening, egg, egg yolk and vanilla.
Add half of the flour and set mixer with whisk attachment and blend until smooth. Switch mixer to hook attachment, slowly add remaining flour and knead on low speed until smooth and elastic about 4-5 minutes, adding additional flour as needed (about 2 Tbsp more. Should be slightly tacky and sticky). Transfer dough to a lightly oiled bowl, cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place until double in size, about 1½ hours.
Punch dough down and roll into an even layer onto a floured surface to slightly less than 1/2 inch thickness. Cut into doughnut shapes using a 3 inch cookie cutter. Cover and let rise until doubled, about 30-40 minutes.
Preheat the oil in a large pot on medium high heat. Drop a small amount of dough into the oil and if it bubbles and fizzes around the sides the oil is hot enough. Gently and carefully drop donuts into the oil. Don't add more than three donuts at a time. Cook them on one side until they're a light brown then flip them over. Once they're golden on both sides carefully take them out and transfer them to a plate lined with kitchen paper towels to let the oil drain.
Poke hole in middle and fill with filling.
Best served the same day they're made.

name: Double Chocolate and Toffee Cookies
ingredients:
1/4 cup Sugar
1/4 cup Brown Sugar
1/8 cup Cocoa Powder
1/4 tsp Salt
1/4 tsp Baking Soda
3/4 cup Flour
1/3 cup Chocolate Chips
1/3 cup Toffee Bits
1/3 cup White Chocolate Chips
1/4 cup Butter, softened
1 Egg
directions:
preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Combine all dry ingredients.
Add butter and egg.
Roll into one inch balls and bake for 8-10 minutes.

name: Drop Biscuits
ingredients:
2 cups All-Purpose Flour, spooned and leveled
1/2 cup Butter, unsalted, cold and cut into small pieces
1 Tbsp Baking Powder
1 tsp Salt
1 cup Whole Milk
directions:
Heat oven to 400 F.
In a bowl, combine the flour, butter, baking powder, and salt; and cut using pastry cutter or fork until pea-size clumps form.
Add the milk and mix until moistened.
Drop large mounds of dough onto a baking sheet. Bake until golden, 10-15 minutes.

name: Easy Brazilian Cheese Bread
ingredients:
1 Egg
1/4 cup Olive Oil
2/3 cup Milk
1½ cup Bob’s Red Mill Tapioca Flour
1/2 cup Cheddar Cheese, grated or Crème Fraîche
1/2 tsp Salt
directions:
Preheat oven to 400F.
Grease a standard muffin pan with butter or non-stick cooking spray.
Combine all ingredients in a blender. Pulse until ingredients are completely combined, stopping to scrape down the sides of the blender with a spatula as needed. Pour batter into muffin tins, filling each one a little over halfway.
Bake for about 20 minutes, until the tops of the buns are lightly brownies. Cool for 2 minutes before removing from pan. Serve immediately with jam.
original_author: Bob’s Red Mill Tapioca Flour package

name: Easy Chicken and Broccoli
ingredients:
1 lb. Chicken breasts, cut into chunks
3 cup Broccoli Florets, frozen
1 can Cream of Mushroom Soup
1 Soup Can of Water
1½ cups Instant White Rice, uncooked
1 cup Cheddar Cheese
directions:
Spray frying pan with cooking spray.
Add chicken.
Cook and stir on medium-high heat for 2-3 minutes or until brown.
Add broccoli, soup, and water.
Bring to boil and stir.
Stir in rice and sprinkle with cheese.
Cover and reduce heat to low and cook for 5 minutes.

name: Easy Chocolate Cookies
ingredients:
1 Devil's Food Cake Mix
2 Eggs
1/2 cup Vegetable Oil
6 oz Chocolate Chips
directions:
Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees.
Mix all ingredients together.
Bake on an ungreased pan for 10 minutes.
notes:
12 per Pan
Betty Crockers devil's food cake mix works the best

name: Easy Chocolate Suffle
ingredients:
3 oz Bittersweet Chocolate, chopped
2 Tbsp Butter
1/2 tsp Vanilla
2 Egg Yolks
2 Egg Whites
2 Tbsp Sugar
Pinch of Salt
Pinch of Cream of Tartar
Powdered Sugar
directions:
Preheat oven to 375F degrees.
In a large bowl, melt chocolate and butter. Add vanilla and whisk in yolks one at a time until smooth. Set aside.
In a clean bowl, beat egg whites with sugar, salt and cream of tartar until stiff peaks form. fold egg whites into chocolate.
Grease ramekins with butter and dust unsweetened cocoa and tap out excess. Spoon batter into ramekins.
Bake until puffed and set, approximately 20 minutes. Serve with powdered sugar.

name: Easy Elephant Ears
ingredients:
Powdered Sugar
1/2 lb. Puff Pastry, defrosted
directions:
Preheat oven to 425 F.
Sprinkle a pastry board with a thick layer of sugar. Place puff pastry on top and roll into a neat oblong.
Fold one long side of puff pastry inward, like a jellyroll, but stopping at the center. Repeat on the other side, so the two rolls meet in the center. Cut into slice 1/4 inch thick and press each slice in sugar.
Place slices on cookie sheet. Bake in preheated oven for 6 to 8 minutes. Turn over and bake for another 6 to 8 minutes or until golden brown.

name: Easy Orange Chicken
ingredients:
2 Chicken Breasts, large
Salt & Pepper, to taste
3 Tbsp Cornstarch
3 Tbsp Olive Oil, divided
Scallions, chopped
Sauce:
3/4 cup Orange Juice
2 Tbsp Soy Sauce
1 Tbsp Lemon Juice
1/4 cup Brown Sugar
1 Tbsp Cornstarch
1 Orange, zested
1/2 tsp Fresh Ginger, grated
2 Garlic Cloves, minced
1/4 tsp Crushed Red Pepper Flakes
directions:
With this recipe, it's important to prep everything ahead of time as the cooking part goes fast. Cut the chicken into bite-size pieces and place it in a medium bowl. Season with some salt & pepper and sprinkle the cornstarch over it. Toss until coated.
Add the sauce ingredients to another bowl and whisk together.
Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat for a few minutes.
Once the pan is HOT, add half of the chicken to the skillet and ensure each piece isn't crowded so it browns better. Cook for 4 minutes and then flip and cook another 3-4 minutes or so using cooking tongs. Chicken should be browned and cooked through (165F). For the second batch, add another tablespoon or so of olive oil to the pan. Transfer the chicken to a plate once it's done.
Turn the burner off, and pour the sauce into the skillet. The pan should still be screaming hot, so the sauce will thicken in about a minute. As the sauce bubbles, stir/scrape it to loosen any browned bits on the bottom of the pan. Add the chicken back in and toss to coat. Serve immediately.
notes: Prep time 15 min and Cook time 15 min

name: Easy Sweet Condensed Milk Christmas Fudge
ingredients:
1 can Sweetened Condensed Milk
2 cups Milk Chocolate Chips
1 tsp Vanilla
directions:
Place in sauce pan and mix until it all sticks together and has the consistency of pulled toffee.
Place in 9x9 pan and refrigerate for 3 hours on wax paper.
notes: Prep time min and Cook time min. Calories:

name: Easy Teriyaki Chicken
ingredients:
2 Chicken Breasts, cut into 1-in pieces
1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
Pepper, to taste
3 Tbsp Cornstarch
3 Tbsp Olive Oil, divided
Garnish (optional): chopped scallions & sesame seeds to taste
Sauce Ingredients:
1/4 cup Brown Sugar (packed)
1 tsp Fresh Ginger, grated
2 Garlic Cloves, minced
3 Tbsp Mirin
2 Tbsp Soy Sauce
1 tsp Rice Vinegar or Apple Cider Vinegar
1/2 cup Water
1 Tbsp Cornstarch
directions:
Add the sauce ingredients to a small bowl and whisk together.
Cut the chicken into about 1-in pieces and add it to another bowl. Add the garlic powder and pepper and stir until coated, then add the cornstarch and stir again to coat.
Add 2 tablespoons of oil to a skillet. Let it heat for a few minutes over medium-high heat. Cook the chicken in 2 batches (don't crowd the pan). Cook the chicken for 4 minutes and then flip (I use tongs to make it easy) and cook for another 3-4 minutes or so. Chicken should be browned and cooked through (165F). Transfer chicken to plate. For the second batch, I add another tablespoon of olive oil to the pan.
Once the second batch of chicken is done, add the chicken that's on the plate back to the pan.
Stir in the sauce and let it bubble for a minute or so, until thickened. Serve immediately over rice with scallions & sesame seeds sprinkled on top.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 20 min

name: Edible Peanut Butter Cup Cookie Dough
ingredients:
1 cup Butter, softened
1/2 cup Creamy Peanut Butter
1/2 cup Brown Sugar
1 tsp Vanilla
1½ cups All-Purpose Flour, heated for 1 minute in microwave
1/4 tsp Salt
1 tsp Baking Powder
1/2 cups Semi-Sweet Mini Chocolate Chips
1/2 cup Mini Peanut Butter Cups, halved
1/2 cup Reese's Pieces
directions:
In a stand mixer with paddle attachment, cream softened butter for about 1 minute on medium-high speed. Once smooth, add the peanut butter and sugar on medium speed until fluffy and light in color. beat in vanilla until incorporated and set aside.
In a separate medium-size bowl, whisk together the flour, salt and baking powder. With the mixer running on low, slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients using a cup measure or large spoon. Once combined, fold in chocolate chips, peanut butter cups and Reese's Piece's. Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving for best results.
Serve alone or dipped in chocolate as a truffle.

name: Edible Rocky Road Cookie Dough
ingredients:
2 cups Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips, divided
1/2 cup Butter, unsalted
1/2 cup Brown Sugar, dark
1 tsp Vanilla
3/4 cup All-Purpose Flour, heated for 1 minute in microwave
1/4 cup Unsweetened Cocoa Powder
1/4 tsp Salt
1 tsp Baking Powder
1 cup Mini Marshmallows
1 cup Almonds, sliced
1/4 cup Salted Caramel Sauce
directions:
Melt 1 cup of the chocolate chips in a double-boiler until smooth. Remove from the heat, and let cool to room temperature.
Using a stand mixer with paddle attachment, cream the softened butter for about 1 minute on medium-high speed. Once smooth, add the granulated sugar on medium speed until fluffy and light in color. Beat in vanilla until incorporated and set aside.
In a separate medium-size bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, salt and baking powder. With the mixer running on low, slowly add the melted chocolate, followed by the dry ingredients, to the creamed butter using a cup measure or large spoon. Once combined, fold in marshmallows, nuts, and salted caramel sauce until just combined. Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving for best results.
Serve alone or chill and use to make ice cream sandwiches.

name: Edible Sugar Cookie Dough
ingredients:
1 cup Butter, unsalted and softened
1/2 cup Sugar
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
1½ cups All-Purpose Flour, heated for 1 minute in microwave
1/4 tsp Salt
1 tsp Baking Powder
1/4 cup Rainbow Sprinkles
directions:
In a large bowl using a stand mixer with paddle attachment, cream the softened butter for about 1 minute on medium-high speed. Once smooth, add the granulated sugar and vanilla on medium speed until fluffy and light in color.
In a separate medium-size bowl, whisk together the flour, salt and baking powder. With the mixer running on low, slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients using a cup measure or large spoon. Once combined, fold in rainbow sprinkles. refrigerate for 1 hour before serving for best results.
Serve a scoop of chilled cookie dough on a sugar cone and enjoy.

name: Edible Triple Chip Cookie Dough
ingredients:
1 cup Butter, softened
1/2 cup Brown Sugar, dark
1 tsp Vanilla
1½ cups All-Purpose Flour, heated for 1 minute in microwave
1/4 tsp Salt
1 tsp Baking Powder
1/4 cup Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips
1/4 cup White Chocolate Chips
1/4 cup Milk Chocolate Chips
directions:
In a stand mixer with paddle attachment, cream the softened butter for about 1 minute on medium-high speed. Once smooth, add the sugar on medium-high speed until fluffy and light in color. Beat in vanilla until incorporated and set aside.
In a separate medium-size bowl, whisk together the flour, salt and baking powder. With the mixer running on low, slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients using a cup measure or large spoon. Once combined, fold in all three chocolate chips. refrigerate for 1 hour before serving for best results.
Serve alone or form into small 1/2 inch balls for an ice cream topping.

name: Emergency Gyoza Soup
ingredients:
2 cups Water
4 Pork Gyozas
1 Chicken or Beef Stock Cube
1 Tbsp Soy Sauce
1 Tbsp Balsamic Vinegar
1 tsp Crispy chili Oil
1 Egg
3 Spring Onions
1 tsp Sesame Seeds
directions:
Bring the water to a boil over a medium heat. Boil your frozen gyoza in the water for 2 mins (1 min less than the stated cooking time).
Meanwhile, add the soy sauce, balsamic vinegar, crispy chili oil to a mixing bowl, crumble in the stock cube and give it a mix.
Finely slice your spring onions. Crack the egg into a separate bowl and give it a whisk.
Strain out the cooked gyoza from the pot of water and set aside. Add the ingredients in the mixing bowl to the cooking water (this will form the base of your soup).
Reduce the heat to low and drizzle in the egg to form thin wispy strands of egg, stirring continuously as you go.
Add the gyoza back in. Divide between bowls and top with sliced spring onions and sesame seeds.
notes: Cook time 10 min

name: Everyone's Favorite No-Bake Cookies
ingredients:
2 cups Sugar
1/2 cup Milk
1/2 cup Unsweetened Cocoa Powder
1/2 cup Butter
3 cups Quick Oats
1/2 cup Peanut Butter
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
directions:
Place oats, peanut butter and vanilla extract in a large bowl. Set aside.
Combine sugar, milk, cocoa and butter in a large saucepan.
Bring to a boil; boil 1 minute (no longer). Remove from heat.
Pour over oat mixture. Stir well.
Drop onto wax paper and let cool.
notes: boil the mixture 1 minute - no more, no less

name: Extra Cheesy Garlic Bread
ingredients:
Fluffy loaf of French Bread
1 cup Butter, unsalted and softened
1 tsp Salt
Fresh Parsley
6 Garlic Cloves
1 tsp Garlic Powder
2 Tbsp Parmesan Cheese
1 tsp Pepper
1 tsp Paprika
1 cup Asiago Cheese
directions:
Cut french loaf in half.
Mix butter, salt, parsley, garlic, garlic powder, and parmesan cheese until smooth. Cover bread in butter mixture.
Cover top of butter mixture with pepper, paprika, and asiago cheese.
Cook open face in foil at 350F for 12-15 minutes. Put the loaf in the oven on broil for another 2 minutes. Watch carefully so it doesn’t burn.

name: Fajita Seasoning
ingredients:
3 Tbsp Brown Sugar
1 Tbsp Ground Cumin
2 tsp Salt
2 tsp Smoked Paprika
1 tsp Pepper
1 tsp Oregano, dried
1 tsp Garlic Powder
1 tsp Crushed Red Pepper Flakes
1/4 tsp Ground Nutmeg
1/4 tsp Thyme, dried
1/4 tsp Rosemary, dried
directions: Mix all ingredients. Stores well.

name: Fancy Mac and Cheese
ingredients:
100g Pancetta
1 Tbsp Olive Oil
250g Plain Cottage Cheese
250g Ricotta Cheese
3 tsp Dijon Mustard
1/2 tsp Cayenne
Nutmeg, generous grating
500g Extra-Mature Cheddar, grated
100g Parmesan, grated
1 Liter Full-fat Milk
450g Macaroni, uncooked
directions:
Preheat oven to 355 F.
Heat a large frying pan over medium heat, add the olive oil and pancetta. Fry until browned and crispy, about 8 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In a bowl, whisk together the cottage cheese, ricotta, Dijon, cayenne, nutmeg and good seasoning. Tip into a large bowl and add the cheddar, Parmesan and milk, stirring to combine.
Mix through the dried macaroni then tip into a large ovenproof dish. Top with the crispy pancetta and a sprinkling of Parmesan Cheese. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove the foil, baking another 30 minutes.
Remove and allow to cool slightly.

name: Fancy Quesadillas
ingredients:
Tortillas
Refried Beans
Cheese, shredded
Chicken, shredded
Tajin
Pico de Gallo
Queso
Sour Cream
directions:
Use a medium saute pan. Add enough cheese to cover the bottom and melt into a tortilla sized sheet.
Add cooked shredded chicken on top of the melting cheese with a bonus sprinkling of cheese. Season with Tajin.
Take a tortilla and add a layer of refried beans to the center. Flip the tortilla (refried beans facing down) onto the chicken and cheese in the pan.
Once the cheese has melted and browned a bit, flip the tortilla over and brown that side. Add Pico de Gallo and queso.
Once the tortilla is browned, remove from heat, fold in half, and cut into triangles. Serve with sour cream.
notes: This is a recipe measured and built by the heart. Add whatever you want.

name: Fast Mac and Cheese
ingredients:
1½ Tbsp Butter
1 Shallot, minced
1 cup Elbow Pasta
1 cup Chicken Stock
1/2 cup Fontina Cheese, grated
1/2 cup Cheddar Cheese, grated
1 Tbsp Cream
1 Tbsp Chives, minced
directions:
Heat a pan over medium-high heat. Add 1 Tbsp butter and the shallots. Saute until fragrant.
Add elbow pasta and 1/2 cup of chicken stock. When the stock is evaporated, check the doneness of the pasta. If it needs to cook longer, add the other 1/2 cup of chicken stock.
Once the pasta is fully cooked, add the shredded cheddar and fontina.
Once the cheese is melted and incorporated, add 1/2 Tbsp butter and the cream to finish. Top with chives.

name: Figgy Balsamic Steak with Roasted Carrots & Thyme Brussels Sprouts
ingredients:
8 oz Brussels Sprouts
1/4 oz Thyme
1 Shallot
10 oz Pork Tenderloins
12 oz Carrots
1 Chicken Stock Concentrate
5 tsp Balsamic Vinegar
1 Fig Jam Packet
directions:
Adjust racks to top and middle positions and preheat oven to 450 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Trim and halve Brussels Sprouts lengthwise. Strip thyme leaves from stems; chop leaves until you have 2 tsp. Trim, peel, and cut carrots on a diagonal into 1/2-inch-thick pieces. Halve, peel, and finely chop onion.
Brussels Sprouts and Carrots: Toss Brussels Sprouts on one side of a baking sheet with a drizzle of oil, half the chopped thyme, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Toss carrots on empty side with a drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack, tossing halfway through, until tender and crisped, 20-25 minutes.
Pork: Pat pork dry with paper towels; season all over with salt and pepper. Heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add pork and sear, turning occasionally, until browned all over, 4-8 minutes (it'll finish cooking in the next step). Transfer to a second baking sheet. Cook to desired doneness, 5-7 minutes per side. Transfer to a cutting board to rest for at least 5 minutes.
Roast pork on middle rack until cooked through, 10-12 minutes. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest a few minutes, then thinly slice crosswise.
Sauce: Meanwhile, heat a drizzle of olive oil in pan used for pork over medium heat. Add onion and remaining chopped thyme. Cook, stirring, until softened, 1-2 minutes. Stir in stock concentrate, vinegar, jam, and 1/4 cup water. Simmer until thick and saucy, 2-3 minutes. Remove pan from heat and stir in 1 Tbsp butter until melted. Season with salt and pepper.
Divide Brussels Sprouts, carrots, and pork between plates. Drizzle pan sauce over pork and serve.
notes:
Prep time 10 min and Cook time 30 min. Calories: 480
Switch out regular brussel sprouts for the Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Balsamic Vinegar & Honey recipe

name: Firecracker Meatballs with Roasted Green Beans & Sesame Rice
ingredients:
2 Scallions
1 thumb Ginger
2 Tbsp Mayo
2 Tbsp Sour Cream
2 tsp Honey
6 ml Ponzu or Soy Sauce
1 tsp Sriracha
1/2 cup Jasmine Rice
10 oz Ground Beef
1/4 cup Panko Breadcrumbs
6 oz Green Beans
1/2 tsp Salt
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry all produce. Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens; mince whites. Peel and mince ginger.
Sauce: In a large bowl, combine mayonnaise, sour cream, honey, 2 tsp soy sauce (or ponzu), and sriracha to taste. Set aside.
Rice: Heat a drizzle of oil in a small pot over medium-high heat. Add half the sesame seeds (save the rest for serving); cook, stirring, until golden brown, 1-2 minutes. Add rice, 3/4 cup water, and a big pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to a low simmer. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve. Fluff rice with a fork; season with salt and pepper. Divide between bowls or plates.
Meatballs: In a second large bowl, combine beef, panko, ginger, scallion whites, remaining soy sauce (or ponzu), salt, and pepper. Form into 10-12 1½-inch meatballs.
Place meatballs on one side of a lightly oiled baking sheet.
Green Beans: On empty side, toss green beans with a drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack until meatballs are cooked through and green beans are browned and tender, 14-16 minutes. Carefully add meatballs to bowl with sauce; toss to coat.
Top rice with meatballs and drizzle with any remaining sauce. Serve green beans to the side. Garnish with scallion greens, remaining sesame seeds, and chili flakes to taste.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 40 min. Calories: 770

name: Florentine Potatoes
ingredients:
1 lb Fingerling Potatoes
6 Garlic Cloves, crushed in their skins
10 Sage Leaves, torn into pieces
Extra-Virgin Olive Oil
Salt
Red Pepper Flakes
directions:
Set oven to 400F. Cut the fingerlings into equal but misshapened 1-inch pieces. Soak them in water for at least an hour.
Add the potatoes, crushed garlic, sage, olive oil, salt and red pepper flakes to a large bowl and toss to coat.
Transfer all of that to a baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes then mix potatoes around. Return to oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes, until golden brown and crispy.

name: Forgotten Cookies
ingredients:
2 Egg Whites
1/8 tsp Cream of Tartar
1/3 cup Sugar
1 cup Rice Krispy Cereal
1/2 cup Chocolate Chips
directions:
Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees.
Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper.
Separate the 2 eggs (discard the yolks).
Put egg whites into medium bowl and add tartar.
Use electric mixer, beat egg whites and tartar until foamy stage.
Add sugar and beat until stiff peak stage. Fold in Krispy rice cereal and Chocolate Chips.
Using a spoon, drop one spoonful per cookie on to cookie tray. Put cookie tray into oven and immediately turn off the oven.
"Forget" until the oven has cooled and cookies have hardened.

name: French Fries
ingredients:
2 Russet Potatoes
2 tsp Sea Salt
1 tsp Pepper
2 Tbsp Olive Oil
directions:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch matchsticks. Place on a baking pan lined with parchment paper and toss with salt, pepper and olive oil.
Spread out potatoes evenly and bake for 35-40 minutes or until golden brown and fully cooked.

name: French Toast
ingredients:
8 Eggs
2 tsp Vanilla
2 Tbsp Cinnamon
1 cup Milk
directions:
Mix all ingredients into bowl.
Dip bread into bowl covering both sides of the bread with the mix.
Put on to griddle.
Flip over when one side is cooked.
Cook at 200 to 250 degrees.

name: Fried Chicken
ingredients:
Breadcrumbs
Onion Powder
Garlic Salt
Flour
Chicken Breast
3 Eggs
1/2 cup Water
Salt
Pure Vegetable Oil
Pepper
directions:
Mix flour, onion powder and garlic salt in bowl.
In another bowl, mix eggs and water.
Cut chicken pieces and put in a bowl.
Dip chicken first in flour, then eggs, then bread crumbs.
Put dipped chicken into the oil which is in a frying pan.
Flip over when one side is done.
Cook chicken and make sure there is no pink in the middle.
notes: Put in how ever much you feel you need to make flavorful

name: Fried Mozzarella Sticks
ingredients:
1/2 lb. Mozzarella Cheese
2 Eggs
1/2 tsp Salt
1/4 tsp Pepper
2 cups Panko Breadcrumbs
1 tsp Parsley, fresh and chopped
1 Tbsp Parmesan Cheese
directions:
Cut the mozzarella cheese into 1/4 inch sticks.
In a small bowl, beat together the eggs, salt and pepper. Combine the bread crumbs, parsley and Parmesan Cheese in a shallow bowl. Dip the cheese sticks into the egg mixture, then roll them in the bread crumbs. Press the crumbs firmly onto the cheese sticks. Place them on a platter until you're ready to fry them.
Heat 1/2 inch vegetable oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook the cheese sticks for 3 minutes on both sides, or until they're golden brown. Drain on paper towels.
The mozzarella sticks can be reheated in a 350F oven for 7 minutes.

name: Fried Scones
ingredients:
2 cups Flour
3/4 tsp Salt
1/2 tsp Baking Powder
1½ tsp Sugar
1½ Tbsp Shortening
3 tsp Yeast + 1/2 cup water
2-4 cups Milk, scalded
directions:
Knead 20 times.
Raise for ten minutes.
Roll 1/2 inch thick, cut and deep fry.
notes: If using Saf instant yeast, add to flour mixture and add water to milk after scalded.

name: Frozen Berry Pops
ingredients:
1 cup Vanilla Yogurt (Greek style yogurt works well)
1 cup Fresh Mixed Berries (Strawberries, Blueberries, Blackberries, or Raspberries)
1 tsp Fresh Lemon Juice
3-5 Tbsp Honey or Agave to taste
directions:
Puree the berries.
Add vanilla yogurt, lemon juice and honey until smooth.
Divide mixture into freezer-pop molds stopping about 1-inch from the top.
Freeze until firm, about 6 hours.
Dip molds briefly in hot water to make it easier to take them out of their containers.

name: Frozen Chocolate Covered Bananas
ingredients:
2 Bananas
1/2 cup Semi-Sweet or Dark Chocolate Chips
1 Tbsp Coconut Oil
Peanut Butter
directions:
Melt the chocolate and oil together until warm and liquidy.
Chop bananas into 1/2 inch slices.
Dip and submerge bananas carefully and set out on wax paper and freeze.
If using peanut butter, cut banana slices in half and put peanut butter in between.
Then cover in chocolate.

name: Fruit Jello Slices
ingredients:
4 Limes, Oranges, or Lemons
1 box Fruit Jello
directions:
Cut fruit in half.
Clean out with spoon until there is only the rind left.
Make Box of jello.
Lay rinds in the muffin tin and pour jello into rinds.
Chill until firm.
If making watermelon slices, Push mini chocolate chips in with skewer.
notes: If making watermelon slices, Use mini chocolate chips

name: Fusilli Alla Caprese
ingredients:
1 lb. Fusilli Pasta
3 Tbsp Olive Oil
2 Garlic Cloves, minced
2 cups Cherry Tomatoes, quartered
1 tsp Salt
1/4 tsp Pepper
1/2 cup Basil, fresh and torn
8 oz Fresh Mozzarella Cheese, cubed
directions:
Cook pasta according to package directions. Reserve 1/2 cup of the pasta water. Drain pasta.
In a medium skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute.
Add the tomatoes, salt and pepper. As the tomatoes cook and soften, mash them gently with the back of a fork. Continue to cook until the tomatoes make a chunky sauce, about 4 minutes.
Add the tomato sauce to the cooked pasta, and add the basil and mozzarella. Stir to combine.
Add the reserve pasta water, 1/4 cup at a time until the pasta is moist. Serve immediately.

name: Garlic Alfredo Mac and Cheese
ingredients:
3 Tbsp Butter
2 Tbsp Olive Oil
2 Garlic Cloves, grated
2 cups Heavy Cream
Pepper
1/2 cup Parmesan Cheese
1/2 cup Mozzarella
3 cups Macaroni, cooked
1/3 cup Breadcrumbs
directions:
In a skillet, melt the butter with olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic, cream, pepper and bring mixture to a simmer stirring often. Add the Parmesan Cheese and simmer sauce for 10-15 minutes or until sauce has thickened and is smooth.
Add in the cooked and drained macaroni as well as the mozzarella. Stir to evenly coat. Top with bread crumbs and place in the oven on broil until the top has become crisp. Enjoy!

name: Garlic Edamame
ingredients:
1 cup Edamame, whole frozen
1 tsp Garlic Powder
Salt to taste
directions:
Cook edamame in lightly salted boiling water until tender.
Strain and season with garlic powder and more salt, if desired.
notes: Movie Night Snacks

name: Garlic Mushrooms
ingredients:
4 Tbsp Butter, unsalted
1 Tbsp Olive Oil
1/2 Onion, chopped, optional
1 lb. Cremini Mushrooms or Button
1-2 Tbsp Balsamic Vinegar
1 tsp Fresh Thyme Leaves, chopped
2 Tbsp Fresh Parsley, chopped
4 Garlic Cloves, minced
Salt & Pepper, to taste
directions:
Heat the butter and oil in a large pan or skillet over medium-high heat.
Sauté the onion until softened (about 3 minutes).
Add the mushrooms and cook for about 4-5 minutes until golden and crispy on the edges.
Pour in the wine and cook for 2 minutes, to reduce slightly.
Stir through thyme, 1 tablespoon of parsley and garlic. Cook for a further 30 seconds, until fragrant.
Season generously with salt and pepper (to your taste).
Sprinkle with remaining parsley and serve warm.

name: Garlic Parmesan-Stuffed Mushrooms
ingredients:
15 Mushrooms
1 Tbsp Canola Oil
2 Tbsp Garlic, chopped
1/2 Tbsp Salt
1/2 Tbsp Pepper, freshly ground
8 oz Cream Cheese, softened
1/4 cup Italian Breadcrumbs
1/2 cup Parmesan Cheese, shredded and divided
2 Tbsp Parsley, fresh and chopped, garnish
1 tsp Salt
1 tsp Pepper, freshly ground
directions:
Preheat oven to 350° F (180°C).
Cut the stems off of each of the mushrooms and finely chop them, setting the mushroom caps aside for later.
Bake the mushrooms stem side down for about 10 minutes on a paper towel. This helps the water release from the mushrooms and they aren’t so watery when you bite into them.
Heat the oil in a pan over high heat. Cook the chopped stems with the garlic, salt, and pepper for about six to eight minutes, constantly stirring. Be careful not to burn the garlic. Remove from heat.
In a medium bowl, combine cooked stems, cream cheese, breadcrumbs, half of the parmesan, parsley, salt, and pepper, mixing until evenly combined. The mixture should be extremely thick.
Space out the mushroom caps evenly on a baking sheet, upside down. Spoon a generous amount of the cream cheese mixture on top of each mushroom.
Top each mushroom with a sprinkle of parmesan cheese. Bake for 10 minutes.
Garnish with a sprinkle of parsley, then serve!

name: German Chocolate Cake Cookies
ingredients:
1/2 cup Butter, softened
2 Eggs
1 package Chocolate Cake Mix
2 Tbsp All-Purpose Flour
18 Maraschino Cherries, halved
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a large bowl, cream butter until smooth. Beat in eggs, one at a time, until incorporated. Mix in cake mix and flour.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls, about 2 inches apart, onto prepared cookie sheet. Press a cherry half into the top of each cookie.
Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 12 minutes. Immediately transfer to wire racks to cool.

name: Glaze
ingredients:
4 Tbsp Butter
2 cups Powdered Sugar
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
3-6 Tbsp Hot Water
directions:
Cream together butter and powdered sugar.
Add vanilla and hot water to desired consistency.

name: Gnocchi Carbonara
ingredients:
6 oz Pancetta
1½ oz Pecorino
1½ oz Parmesan
5 Egg Yolks
Pinch of Ground Nutmeg
16 oz Gnocchi
directions:
Dice the pancetta. Add it to a cold frying pan set over a medium heat and cook until it’s rendered and crisp. Take off the heat and set aside.
Grate the pecorino and Parmesan cheeses. Whisk together the eggs, egg yolks, grated cheeses, black pepper and nutmeg in a bowl.
Cook the gnocchi following pack instructions then drain, saving the water.
Add the gnocchi to the pancetta, then add the egg yolk mixture with a splash of the cooking water. Mix vigorously until emulsified.
To serve, top with some extra grated Parmesan and some more black pepper, if you like.
notes: Cook time 15 min

name: Gorgonzola Cheese Sauce
ingredients:
Gorgonzola Cheese, crumbled
1 Tbsp Cream
1/2 tsp Mayo
directions: Simply mix the three ingredients together and serve with fries or chicken nuggets.

name: Grandma's Beef Stew
ingredients:
2 lbs. Stew Meat
5 Carrots, sliced
1 Onion, chopped
3 Celery Stalks, sliced
1 quart Stewed Tomatoes
1/2 cup Quick Cooking Tapioca
1 Whole Clove
2 Bay Leaves
1 tsp Salt
1/2 tsp Pepper
directions:
Put all ingredients in a crockpot.
Stir.
Cover and cook for 10-12 hours on low or 5-6 hours on high.

name: Greek Potatoes and Whipped Feta
ingredients:
2 lbs Potatoes, peeled and diced
4 cups Chicken Stock
2-3 Lemons
1 Chicken Bouillon Cube
3 Tbsp Olive Oil
2 tsp Oregano, dried
1/4 tsp Salt
1/4 tsp Pepper
1 Garlic Bulb, small and left in skins, lightly smashed with side of knife
1 Tbsp Parsley, finely diced
Feta Mixture:
7 oz Feta, roughly broken up
3½ oz Cream Cheese
2 Tbsp Olive Oil
1 tsp Honey
directions:
Add the potatoes to a large pot and pour in the chicken stock. Squeeze in the juice of 2 lemons, then crumble in the bouillon cube. Give everything a stir, then place on high heat and bring to a boil. Cook until the potatoes are just about knife tender.
Drain and leave to steam dry for 10 minutes, but preferably until they completely stop steaming and are cool enough to handle. This is important to allow the moisture to escape so they crisp up in the oven. Preheat oven to 390F.
Add the potatoes to a large baking tray and toss with olive oil, oregano, salt, pepper, and garlic. Roast in the oven for around 40-45 minutes, or until deep golden and crispy, tossing a couple of times during.
Meanwhile add the feta cream cheese, olive oil, and honey to a food processor and blitz until smooth and creamy. You;ll need to stop and scrape down the sides a couple of times.
Spreading the base of a large shallow dish, then top with the roasted potatoes. Top with parsley and a squeeze of lemon juice.

name: Green Bean Casserole
ingredients:
2 cans Green Beans, cut
2 cans Cream of Mushroom Soup
1/2 cup Slivered Almonds
2 cups Cheese, grated
Salt & Pepper to taste
directions:
Drain the green beans.
Mix everything except cheese together.
Put in 9x13 pan.
Cover the top in cheese.
Bake 30 min at 375 degrees.

name: Griddled Onion Cheeseburgers with Special Sauce & Garlic Potato Wedges
ingredients:
12 oz Potatoes
1 Yellow Onion
2 Potato Buns
1 Roma Tomato
1 tsp Garlic Powder
5 tsp White Wine Vinegar
2 Tbsp Ketchup
2 Tbsp Sour Cream
2 tsp Dijon Mustard
10 oz Ground Beef
1/2 cup Cheddar Cheese
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch-thick wedges. Halve, peel, and finely dice onion. Halve buns. Thinly slice tomato into rounds.
Toss potatoes on a baking sheet with a drizzle of oil, 3/4 tsp garlic powder, salt, and pepper. (You'll use the rest of the garlic powder in the next step.) Roast on top rack until browned and crisp, 20-25 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine vinegar, 1 Tbsp onion, 1 tsp sugar, and a pinch of salt. In a separate small bowl, combine ketchup, sour cream, mustard, remaining garlic powder, and 1 tsp sugar.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add remaining onion; cook, stirring occasionally, until browned and softened, 5-7 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a plate.
While onion cooks, form beef into two patties, each slightly wider than a burger bun. Season generously with salt and pepper. Once onion is done, heat a drizzle of oil in same pan over medium-high heat. Add patties and cook to desired doneness, 3-5 minutes per side. In the last 1-2 minutes of cooking, top each patty with cheddar; cover pan to melt cheese.
While cheese melts, toast buns until golden brown. Stir pickled onion (draining first) into bowl with special sauce. Fill toasted buns with patties, griddled onion, tomato, and special sauce. Divide burgers between plates; serve with potato wedges and any remaining sauce on the side for dipping.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 35 min. Calories: 970

name: Grilled Hasselback Baguette
ingredients:
1 stick Butter, unsalted
3 Garlic Cloves, grated
2 French Baguettes, 10-12 in each
12 oz Block Whole Milk Mozzarella
4-5 Campari Tomatoes on the vine
4-5 slices Prosciutto
directions:
Preheat oven or grill to 350 F.
Begin by melting the butter in a small sauce pot. Grate in 3 cloves of garlic and cook until fragrant and butter has fully melted. Remove from heat.
Cut the break on a slight bias about 3/4 of the way down, making sure the bottom of the bread stays connected. Do this with both loaves and set aside.
Next, slice the mozzarella block in half, and then slice into thin pieces, about 1/4 inch thick. Set aside.
Slice the tomatoes the same as the cheese, about 1/4 inch thick rounds.
To assemble, alternate a slice of cheese with a slice of tomato in the sliced baguettes. Add a little piece of prosciutto in with every cheese slice.
Place each baguette on a piece of aluminum foil. Roll up the sides around the bread, so it acts like a boat to catch everything. Sprinkle both baguettes with salt and pepper and finish by drizzling the garlic butter evenly over.
Place on the grill or in the oven and cook for 10-12 minutes or until the cheese has melted, the bread has toasted and prosciutto has gotten a little crispy. Serve immediately.

name: Grilled Peaches with Yogurt
ingredients:
Peaches
Brown Sugar
Cinnamon
Butter
Yogurt
Honey
directions:
Slice peaches in half and remove the pit.
Cover griddle in butter and grill skin side of the peaches. While cooking the first side, sprinkle brown sugar and cinnamon on cut slide of peaches.
Flip peaches over (cut side down) on the griddle and cook until brown sugar has caramelized.
Add a scoop of yogurt.
Top with berries, honey, and/or granola. Sprinkle with flakey salt.
notes: Swap out yogurt for ice cream to turn it into a dessert

name: Grilled Peaches with Ice Cream
ingredients:
Peaches
Brown Sugar
Cinnamon
Butter
Vanilla Ice Cream
Honey
directions:
Slice peaches in half and remove the pit.
Cover griddle in butter and grill skin side of the peaches. While cooking the first side, sprinkle brown sugar and cinnamon on cut slide of peaches.
Flip peaches over (cut side down) on the griddle and cook until brown sugar has caramelized.
Add a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
Top with berries, honey, and/or granola. Sprinkle with flakey salt.
notes: Swap out ice cream for yogurt to turn it into a breakfast

name: Grilled Southwestern Steak Salad
ingredients:
1 Beef Top Sirloin Steak, 1-inch thick and 3/4 pound
¼ tsp Salt
¼ tsp Ground Cumin
¼ tsp Pepper
3 Poblano Peppers, halved and seeded
2 ears Sweet Corn, husks removed
1 Sweet Onion, cut into 1/2-inch rings
1 Tbsp Olive Oil
2 cups Bow Tie Pasta, uncooked
2 Tomatoes, large
DRESSING:
¼ cup Lime Juice
1 Tbsp Olive Oil
¼ tsp Salt
¼ tsp Ground Cumin
¼ tsp Pepper
1-2 Tbsp Cilantro, fresh and chopped
directions:
Rub steak with salt, cumin and pepper. Brush poblano peppers, corn and onion with oil.
Grill steak, covered, over medium heat or broil 4 in. from heat 6-8 minutes on each side or until meat reaches desired doneness (for medium-rare, a thermometer should read 135°; medium, 140°; medium-well, 145°). Grill vegetables, covered, 8-10 minutes or until crisp-tender, turning occasionally.
Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, cut corn from cob; coarsely chop peppers, onion and tomatoes. Transfer vegetables to a large bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk lime juice, oil, salt, cumin and pepper until blended; stir in cilantro.
Drain pasta; add to vegetable mixture. Drizzle with dressing; toss to coat. Cut steak into thin slices; add to salad.
notes: Low Salt recipe

name: Guiltless Alfredo Sauce
ingredients:
2 cups Low-Fat Milk
1/3 cup (3 oz) Low Fat Cream Cheese
2 Tbsp Flour
1 tsp Salt
1 Tbsp Butter
3 Garlic Cloves, minced
1 Cup Parmesan Cheese, grated
Pasta, to serve with
directions:
In a blender, blend the milk and cream cheese, flour, and salt until smooth and set aside.
In large bowl saucepan, melt butter on medium-high heat and add the garlic.
Saute for about 30 seconds, stirring constantly.
Add milk mixture. Stir constantly for 3-4 minutes or until it just starts to simmer.
Keep cooking and stirring a few more minutes until thickened.
Once thickened, remove from heat and whisk cheese in.
Cover and let stand 10 minutes before serving over pasta.
notes: 10 minutes before serving (it will get thicker)

name: Hash Brown Casserole
ingredients:
1 bag Frozen Hash Browns
1 large bag Cheddar Cheese, shredded
1 pint Sour Cream
1 Onion, chopped
2 Tbsp Margarine or Butter
1 can Cream of Chicken Soup
directions:
Placed chopped onion in microwave container with butter and sauté about a minute.
In largest mixing bowl, add hash browns, cheese onions, soup and sour cream. If the hash browns are frozen in clumps, unclump them.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Mix everything well and place in large 13x9 inch baking pan. You can butter or Pam pan.
Bake at 350 until bubbly and cheese is melted and slightly crispy on sides.

name: Hawaiian Haystack
ingredients:
1 can Cream of Chicken Soup
1/2 cup Chicken Broth
1 cup Chicken, cooked and cubed
2 cups Rice, cooked
1 can Chow Mein Noodles
2 medium Tomatoes, chopped
1/2 cup Celery, chopped
1/4 cup Green Onions, chopped
1 can Pineapple Chunks, drained
1 cup Cheese, grated
1/4 cup Coconut
Soy Sauce, for taste
directions:
Combine soup and broth in saucepan to make gravy.
Add chicken and simmer for 8-10 minutes.
On plate layer ingredients: Rice, Gravy, Cheese, other toppings, Salt, and Pepper.
notes: Toppings are optional

name: Hawaiian Huli Huli Chicken
ingredients:
1 cup Brown Sugar, packed
3/4 cup Ketchup
3/4 cup Soy Sauce
1 Tbsp White Vinegar
5 Garlic Clove, minced
1 Tbsp Fresh Ginger, minced
8 Chicken Thighs, boneless skinless
1 Pineapple, trimmed and cut into spears (core removed)
1 Tbsp Vegetable Oil
1/4 cup Green Onions, thinly sliced
directions:
Whisk together brown sugar, ketchup, soy sauce, sherry, garlic, and ginger.
Reserve half the sauce in a covered bowl in the refrigerator.
Add the remaining sauce and chicken to a large zip lock bag and marinate overnight or 8 hours.
On medium-high heat, cook the chicken on grill for 5-6 minutes on each side.
Coat pineapple spears with vegetable oil and grill alongside the chicken.
Brush remaining sauce over the chicken while grilling the second side (do not serve remaining sauce if you use brush on partially raw chicken).
Garnish with green onions.
notes: Quick version: switch out ginger and garlic for the powdered version of each. Skip marinating and cook directly in pan with sauce. Cook with chicken tenders cut into chunks.

name: Hawaiian Rolls
ingredients:
1 Tbsp Instant Yeast
2 Tbsp Warm Water
1/2 cup Pineapple Juice, canned
1/4 cup Butter, unsalted and softened
1/3 cup Brown Sugar
2 Eggs, large
1 Egg Yolk, large, with white reserved
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
3 cups All-Purpose Flour
2 Tbsp Potato Starch
1¼ tsp Salt
directions:
In the bowl of your stand mixer, combine the yeast, water, and pineapple juice. Let it rest for 5 minutes.
Add the butter, brown sugar, eggs, egg yolk (remembering to reserve the egg white), and vanilla, mixing until well combined.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, potato starch, and salt.
Add the flour mixture, beating with the paddle attachment for about 3 minutes at medium-high speed. Scrape the dough into the center of the bowl.
Switch to the dough hook and knead for about 5 minutes at medium speed.
Round the dough into a ball and place it into a greased bowl to rise (about 3 hours).
Prepare a 9x13-inch pan by lightly greasing it.
Gently punch down on the risen dough to deflate it.
Gently punch down on the risen dough to deflate it. Divide the dough into 16 equal pieces. (You can do this by continuing to divide the dough in half until you are down to 16 pieces. Or, roll the dough into a log and use a bench knife or stiff spatula to cut it into 16 pieces.)
Round each piece into a smooth ball and place it in the greased pan, evenly spaced.
Cover the rolls with a piece of greased plastic wrap and let them rise for an hour. They should be nice and puffy.
Preheat the oven to 350F when the rolls are just about done rising.
Add 1 Tbsp of water to the reserved egg white to make an egg wash.
Brush for 20-25 minutes, or until the rolls reach an internal temperature of 190F.
Remove the rolls from the oven and let them cool a bit before turning them out onto a wire rack.

name: Healing Veggie and Grain Soup
ingredients:
2 Leeks
2-3 Garlic Cloves
1 Onion
3 Carrots
15 Mushrooms
5 Celery Stalks
1 Turnip
1/4 cup Butter
1/2 cup Wild Rice
1/2 cup Red Lentils
1/2 cup Quinoa
Equal parts Oat Milk and Chicken Broth (enough to cover all veggies)
Handful of Spinach
Lemon Juice, to taste
Pinch of Turmeric
Pepper
Salt
Tajin
'21 Seasoning' from Trader Joes
Red Pepper Flakes
directions:
Cut up leeks, garlic cloves, onion, carrots, mushrooms, celery stalks, turnip and butter.
Sauté the mushroom separately without oil at first to get rid of all the excess water, then add in with the rest of the veggies and simmer down until the water evaporates a bit and the veggies have softened.
Then add washed wild rice, red lentils, and quinoa.
Add half oat milk and half organic chicken broth (or veggie broth) until the veggies are fully covered.
Add a handful of spinach.
Add lemon juice, pinch of turmeric, black pepper, salt, tajin, and '21 seasoning' from trader joes, and some cayenne or red pepper flakes if you wanna lil spice. Go easy on the turmeric.
Add more chicken broth and oat milk if it gets too thick and the liquid has all been absorbed.
notes: 1-2 cups of oat milk and 1-2 cups chicken broth maybe?

name: Heat and Sweet Beignets
ingredients:
2¼ tsps Active Dry Yeast
1½ cups Warm Water
1/2 Sugar
1 tsp Salt
2 Eggs
1½ cups Evaporated Milk
7 cups Flour
1/4 cup Butter Flavored Shortening
Oil, for frying
Powdered Sugar
Cayenne Pepper
directions:
In a large bowl add the yeast and the warm water and allow it to bloom, once there are active bubbles add the sugar, salt, eggs, and milk and blend well.
Add 4 cups and blend until smooth, finally add the rest of the flour and the shortening, cover and chill of 12 hours.
Roll out dough, cut and fry, serve hot with a light sprinkle of cayenne pepper and a ton of powdered sugar.

name: Herb and Goat Cheese Baked Egg Boats
ingredients:
1 long Baguette, sourdough
3 Eggs, large
2 Tbsp Heavy Cream
Salt & Pepper to taste
2 Tbsp Chives, finely minced
1 Tbsp Parsley, chopped
Basil, chopped
1 Lemon, zested
2 oz Soft Goat Cheese
1/2 cup Arugula
Extra-Virgin Olive Oil
directions:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Cut out long oval section from the top 1/4 section of the baguette. Scoop out the inside bread and discard.
Place on sheet tray making sure it sits flat.
In a bowl combine the eggs, cream and a pinch of salt and pepper. Whisk together. Next add in the chives, parsley, and basil. Stir to combine. Add lemon zest.
Stuff the arugula into the hollowed out bread. Next pour in the egg mixture. Then crumble over the goat cheese, pressing it down into the mixture. Lastly drizzle with a little olive oil.
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the bread is golden brown and eggs are set.
Slice and serve.

name: Hidden Vegetable Hamburger Helper
ingredients:
2 Tomatoes
2 Celery Stalks
1 Zucchini
1 Carrot, large
1 Onion
4 Garlic Cloves
1 lb Ground Beef
2 Tbsp Olive Oil
1 Tbsp Garlic Powder
1 Tbsp Salt
1 tsp Black Pepper
½ tsp Mustard Powder
½ tsp Paprika
¼ cup Tomato Paste
2 cups Broth
¼ cup Heavy Cream
1½ cups Cheddar Cheese, grated
1 lb Pasta
Parmesan
directions:
Start by prepping all of the vegetables: roughly chop the tomatoes, zucchini, onion, celery, carrot and garlic.
Brown the beef over medium heat in a skillet or pot and season with all of the seasonings: garlic powder, salt, pepper, mustard powder and paprika. Continue to stir as the beef cooks through (about 5 minutes). Remove the beef using a slotted spoon and reserve on the side for later.
In the same skillet/pot, you can add a touch more olive oil if needed (if you’re using a more lean ground beef there won’t be as much fat left in the pan). Sautée the onion, carrots and celery first for about 5 minutes, or until slightly softened. Add in the garlic and stir for another 2 minutes.
Next, add in the chopped tomato and chopped zucchini and season with salt. Stir to combine and continue cooking for a few more minutes. Add in the tomato paste and stir. Let this cook (while you stir occasionally) for about 3-4 minutes.
Add in the stock/broth, bring to a bubble, and then let simmer for about 10 minutes, or until everything is slightly softened. Carefully blend using an immersion blender or a regular blender and transfer back to the skillet/pot.
Meanwhile, boil water and cook small pasta of your choice in heavily salted water. Cook until al dente.
Finish the blended vegetable sauce with heavy cream, the browned ground beef, and grated cheddar cheese. Stir to combine until smooth over low heat.
Transfer the cooked pasta into the sauce and enjoy! Option to top with parmesan and basil.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 30 min

name: Homemade Play-Dough
ingredients:
1 cup Water
1 cup Flour
1 cup Salt
1 Tbsp Oil
1 Tbsp Cream of Tartar
A few drops of Food Coloring
directions:
Put all the ingredients into a saucepan on medium heat.
Stir constantly.
When in begins to come together into a ball, its done.
notes:
Burgerville recipe.
In need of a great milkshake??
Go to Burgerville for a chocolate monkey milkshake.

name: Homemade Ranch
ingredients:
Mayo Ingredients:
2 Egg Yolks
1 Tbsp White Vinegar
Pinch of Salt
Squeeze of Lemon Juice
1/2 Tbsp Dijon Mustard
1¼ cups Neutral Oil
Ranch Ingredients:
1½ Tbsp Chives
1½ Tbsp Dill
1½ Tbsp Parsley
1 Tbsp Garlic Powder
1/2 Tbsp Onion Powder
2 tsp Lemon Juice
Salt & Pepper to taste
1/2 cup Buttermilk
directions:
Mayo Recipe: Whisk all mayo ingredients in a jar or cup.
Use an immersion blender to combine, or whisk together in a bowl and add the oil a little at a time while continuously whisking.
Continue blending or whisking until you have mayo.
Ranch Recipe: Finely chop 1½ Tbsp each of chives, dill, and parsley.
In a separate bowl, whisk together a cup of homemade mayo, the chopped herbs, garlic powder, onion powder, lemon juice, salt, and pepper to taste.
Whisk in buttermilk.
Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.

name: Homemade Tortillas
ingredients:
2 cups All-Purpose Flour
1/2 tsp Salt
3/4 cup Water
3 Tbsp Olive Oil
directions:
In a large bowl, combine flour and salt. stir in water and oil.
Turn onto a floured surface; knead 10-12 times, adding a little flour or water if needed to achieve a smooth dough. Let rest for 10 minutes.
Divide dough into eight portions. On a lightly floured surface, roll each portion into a 7-in circle.
In a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray, cook tortillas over medium heat for 1 minute on each side or until lightly browned. Keep warm.

name: Honey BBQ Ribs
ingredients:
3 lbs Country Styled Pork Ribs
1/2 tsp Garlic Salt
1/2 tsp Pepper
1 cup Ketchup
1/2 cup Brown Sugar
1/2 cup Honey
1/4 cup Spicy Brown Mustard
2 Tbsp Worcestershire Sauce
1-1/2 tsp Liquid Smoke
directions:
Put the ribs in the crockpot.
Cover and cook on high for 3 hours.
Drain. Reduce heat from high to low.
Mix the remaining ingredients in a bowl.
Pour over ribs in the crockpot.
Cover and cook on low for 3 hours.

name: Honey Butter Garlic Chicken
ingredients:
1 Ib Chicken Thighs, boneless skinless, cut into small pieces
2 Tbsp Cornstarch
1 Tbsp Olive Oil
1 Tbsp Butter, unsalted
1 tsp Chili Powder
3/4 tsp Salt to taste
1/2 tsp Pepper
1/2 Tbsp Garlic, minced
1 tsp Red Pepper Flakes
2-4 Tbsp Honey
2 Tbsp Cilantro, finely chopped
1/2 Tbsp Rice Vinegar
Cilantro or Green Onions, chopped, for garnish
directions:
In a bowl, add the chicken that has been cut into small pieces along with the cornstarch. Mix so that each piece of chicken is coated evenly in the cornstarch.
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the olive oil and unsalted butter.
Toss in the chicken and sprinkle salt and pepper on top. Cook until the chicken has some browned bits and no pink in sight, about 5 minutes.
Add the minced garlic, red pepper flakes, honey, cilantro, rice vinegar, and more unsalted butter.
Saute until the chicken is golden brown and coated in the thick sauce, about 3 to 4 minutes.
