Take off the heat and garnish with more cilantro. Serve on top of rice, steamed veggies, or in lettuce wraps!
notes: If you are not a fan of dark meat, skip the chicken thighs and use breast or go for shrimp. Of course just cook for shorter times for both breast and shrimp as they dry out faster.

name: Honey Garlic Chicken Pita with Whipped Feta
ingredients:
4 Tbsp Olive Oil, divided
3 Chicken Breast halves, boneless, skinless
2 tsp Seasoned Salt
1/4 cup Honey
1 Tbsp Sriracha
4 Garlic Cloves, minced and divided
1/4 cup Chicken Broth
8 oz Feta Cheese
1/3 cup Milk
1/2 Lemon, zested and juiced
1 Tbsp Oregano, chopped
1 Bell Pepper, finely chopped
1/2 Red Onion, finely chopped
1/2 Cucumber, finely chopped
1/2 cup Cherry Tomatoes, finely chopped
1 tsp Red Wine Vinegar
Mini Naan or Pita, for serving
directions:
In a medium skillet over medium heat, add half of the olive oil. Add chicken and seasoned salt and cook for two minutes.
In a small bowl, whisk together honey, sriracha, 3 minced garlic cloves and chicken broth. Add to the skillet and turn heat up to medium high, cooking until chicken is glazed with sauce, about 5 minutes. Set aside.
In a food processor, add feta, milk, lemon zest and juice, remaining garlic clove and oregano. Pulse until combined and stream in remaining two tablespoons olive oil.
In a medium bowl, add bell pepper, onion, cucumber, tomatoes and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper.
Char naan or pita on the stove top then top with whipped feta, chicken and salad. Serve immediately.

name: Honey Mustard Chicken BLT Sliders
ingredients:
2 lbs. Chicken Tenders
1 pack Kings Hawaiian Slider Buns, Dinner Rolls or Hamburger Buns
Mayonnaise
Sweet Baby Rays Golden Mustard (or regular honey mustard)
8 Bacon Strips, cooked crisp
Colby Jack Cheese
1/2 Head Lettuce
1/2 Red Onion, small and sliced thin
2 Roma Tomatoes, sliced thin
Oil for marinade and cooking chicken
Blackened Seasoning:
2 Tbsp Smoked Paprika or regular
1 Tbsp Cayenne Pepper
1 Tbsp Onion Powder
2 tsp Garlic Powder
1 tsp Pepper
1 tsp Salt
1/2 tsp Thyme, dried
1/2 tsp Oregano, dried
Butter Topping:
4 Tbsp Butter, softened
1 Tbsp Parsley, chopped
2 Garlic Cloves, minced
directions:
Place tenders into a large zip-top bag or bowl. Add several tablespoons of blackened seasoning and a few tablespoons of oil. Mix to coat them evenly, making sure they are well seasoned on all sides.
Cook chicken either in an oiled skillet over medium-high, or grill the chicken. As chicken cooks, make your butter spread by combining all butter mixture ingredients in a small bowl. Heat for 30 seconds or until butter melts, then stir to combine.
If needed, slice the slicers horizontally using a serrated knife. Place them cut side up onto a baking sheet and toast under a broiler (or on your grill) until golden brown, just a few minutes.
Flip the top buns so the domed tops are facing up and leave them beside the bottom buns on the pan. Assemble the sliders by first adding a squeeze of mayo to all of the bottom buns. Add the chicken, scattering it evenly so each slider gets at least one chicken tender. Add a dollop of the golden honey mustard, then place cheese over the chicken.
Spread the top buns with the butter mixture. Add slider baking sheet back into the broiler for another minute or two until cheese softens and the top buns are slightly toasted.
Top the sliders with bacon, tomatoes, red onion, lettuce, and another drizzle of the honey mustard. Place the top buns over the sandwiches, slice to separate them and serve.
notes: Prep time 15 min and Cook time 15 min

name: Honey Mustard Chicken Salad With Bacon & Avocado
ingredients:
Dressing:
1/3 cup Honey
3 Tbsp Whole Grain Mustard
2 Tbsp Smooth and Mild Dijon Mustard
2 Tbsp Olive Oil
1-2 Tbsp Apple Cider Vinegar (or white vinegar)
1 tsp Garlic, minced
Salt to taste
4 Chicken Thighs or Chicken Breasts
For Salad:
1/4 cup Bacon, diced and trimmed of rind and fat
4 cups Romaine lettuce leaves, washed
1 cup Grape or Cherry Tomatoes, sliced
1 Avocado, pitted and sliced
1/4 cup Corn Kernels
1/4 Red Onion, sliced
directions:
Whisk marinade/dressing ingredients together to combine. Pour half the marinade into a shallow dish to marinade the chicken filets for two hours if time allows. Refrigerate the reserved untouched marinade to use as a dressing.
Heat a nonstick pan (or grill pan or skillet) over medium heat with about a teaspoon of oil and sear & grill chicken filets on each side until golden, crispy and cooked through. (Grill in batches to prevent excess water being released.) Once chicken is cooked, set aside and allow to rest.
Wipe pan over with paper towel; drizzle with another teaspoon of oil and fry the bacon until crispy.
Slice chicken into strips and prepare salad with leaves, tomatoes, avocado slices, corn, onion strips and chicken.
Whisk 2 tablespoons of water into the remaining untouched marinade / dressing and drizzle over the salad. Sprinkle the bacon over the top and season with a little extra salt and cracked pepper (optional).
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 15 min

name: Honey Mustard Sauce
ingredients:
1 Tbsp Mustard
1 Tbsp Mayonnaise
1 Tbsp Honey
directions: Simply mix the three ingredients together and serve with fries or chicken nuggets.

name: Honey Strawberry Ice Cream
ingredients:
Ice Cream:
2/3 cup Heavy Cream
2 cups Half-and-Half
1/3 cup Honey
1 tsp Salt
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
10 Strawberries, diced
Topping:
Whole Strawberries
Balsamic Vinegar
directions:
Combine all ice cream ingredients except strawberries in a bowl. Refrigerate for an hour before pouring the mixture into the ice cream maker.
Place the whole strawberries on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Drizzle balsamic vinegar over top and put them under the broiler for 1 minute.
When the ice cream starts to form, add the diced strawberries to the mixture.
Serve the ice cream with the warm strawberries over top.

name: Honeydew Sorbet
ingredients:
1 Fresh Honeydew, cubed
1 Tbsp Fresh Lemon Juice
1/4 cup Honey
1/4 cup Water
directions:
Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.
Place the cubed honeydew onto the baking sheet, leaving space in between the cubes to allow for even freezing.
Place the tray into the freezer and freeze the honeydew overnight or until fully frozen (4-6 hours).
Place the frozen honeydew into the bowl of a food processor, along with the lemon juice, honey, and water, and pulse until the honeydew becomes crumbly. You may need to add more water until the mixture becomes more fluid, but not slushy. You're looking for a soft sorbet texture at this point.
Taste and add any additional honey mixture as needed at a time.
notes: Lasts for up to 2 weeks

name: Hot Honey Ranch Chicken Smashburgers
ingredients:
20g Honey
1 tsp Hot Sauce
Chili Flakes
250g Chicken Mince
1 tsp Garlic Powder
1 tsp Onion Powder
1 tsp Smoked Paprika
2 Cheese Slices, swiss or american
2 Brioche Buns
Roundhead lettuce Leaves
20g Ranch
directions:
In a bowl, mix together the honey, hot sauce and chili flakes set to one side.
Then, season the chicken mince with the garlic granules, onion granules and smoked paprika. Split into four equal balls.
Transfer the balls to a hot pan. Cover with baking paper. Using a spatula or a burger press, flatten the chicken balls into patties. Fry for 8 minutes flipping halfway through.
Drizzle half of the hot honey over the patties, flip and cook for a further minutes before topping two with the cheese slices. Place the other patty on top and leave in the pan off heat to melt.
Meanwhile, toast the brioche buns. Top with the lettuce, chicken patties, the ranch sauce and the remaining hot honey.

name: Hummus
ingredients:
19 oz can Chickpeas, drained
3 Garlic Cloves, minced
2 Tbsp Fresh Lemon Juice
2 Tbsp Sesame Seeds, toasted
1 tsp Pesto
2 Tbsp Olive Oil
2 Tbsp Fresh Parsley, chopped
1/4 tsp Pepper
directions:
In a food processor, combine the chickpeas, garlic, lemon juice, sesame seeds and pesto.
Pulse several times until the mixture is coarsely chopped. Add the olive oil, parsley and pepper.
Puree until smooth and creamy. Move into a serving bowl and top with fresh cilantro is desired.

name: Hummus with Fried Chickpeas
ingredients:
1½ to 2 cups Dry Chickpeas, soaked overnight with baking soda (Reserve 1/2 cup soaking water and chickpeas for frying later)
1 Garlic Clove, grated
1 tsp Cumin
1 cup Ice Water
Salt
Lemon Olive Oil:
1/2 cup Extra-Virgin Olive Oil
2 Lemons, juiced
2 Garlic Cloves
To Garnish:
Paprika
Fresh Parsley
Fried Chickpeas
directions:
Add chickpeas, 1/2 cup water from soaking chickpeas, tahini, garlic, cumin, water, and salt to a food processor and blend until smooth. Taste frequently to season. Add more tahini or lemon as needed.
Add 1/2 inch oil to high-sided skillet. Add 1/2 cup chickpeas and fry until golden brown. Remove to a plate lined with paper towels and season with cumin.
Add lemon olive oil ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth.
Add hummus to a shallow, wide bowl and use a spoon to make a swirl in the hummus. Top with lemon oil and fried chickpeas. Sprinkle with paprika. Serve with pita chips.

name: In and Out Animal Sauce
ingredients:
1/2 cup Ketchup
1/2 cups Mayo
1 Pickle, minced
1 Tbsp Lemon Juice
1 tsp Paprika
1 tsp Cayenne
1 Tbsp Parsley
Salt & Pepper to taste
directions: In a medium bowl combine all sauce ingredients, mix well, and set aside.

name: Italian Chicken & Pepper Sandos with Potato Wedges & Tangy Garlic Sauce
ingredients:
12 oz Yukon Gold Potatoes
1 Yellow Onion
1 Long Green Pepper
2 Tbsp Mayo
2 Tbsp Sour Cream
1 tsp Garlic Powder
2 Demi-Baguettes
10 oz Chicken Cutlets
1 Tbsp Italian Seasoning
1/4-1/2 cup Chicken Stock
1/2 cup Mozzarella Cheese
directions:
Adjust racks to top and middle positions and preheat oven to 450 degrees. Wash and dry all produce. Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch-thick wedges. Halve, peel, and thinly slice onion. Halve, core, and thinly slice green pepper into strips.
Toss potatoes on a baking sheet with a large drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack until golden brown and crispy, 20-25 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, sour cream, and half the garlic powder (you'll use the rest later). Season with salt and pepper.
Heat a large drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add onion and green pepper; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and lightly browned, 5-7 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Turn off heat; transfer to a plate.
While veggies cook, in a second small microwave-safe bowl, combine 2 Tbsp butter and remaining garlic powder; microwave until butter is just softened, 10-15 seconds. Stir to combine and season with salt and pepper; set aside. Slice baguettes lengthwise, stopping before you get all the way through; spread garlic butter onto cut sides. Place cut sides up on a second baking sheet. Toast on middle rack until golden, 2-3 minutes.
While garlic buns toast, pat chicken dry with paper towels; season generously with salt and pepper. Heat a large drizzle of oil in pan used for veggies over medium-high heat. Add chicken and Italian Seasoning; cook, stirring, until chicken is browned and cooked through, 4-6 minutes. Stir in stock concentrate and 2 Tbsp water. Season with salt and pepper. Return cooked veggies to pan; stir to combine. Turn off heat.
Spread bottom halves of toasted garlic buns with half the garlic sauce. Top with chicken and veggie mixture, then sprinkle with mozzarella. Return to middle rack until cheese melts, 2-3 minutes. Divide sandos and potatoes between plates. Serve with remaining garlic sauce on the side.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 35 min. Calories: 1110

name: Italian Chicken over Lemony Spaghetti with Zucchini & Chili Flakes
ingredients:
1 Zucchini
1 Garlic Clove
1 Lemon
6 oz Spaghetti
10 oz Chicken Cutlets
1 Tbsp Italian Seasoning
1 tsp Chili Flakes
1 Chicken Stock Concentrate
2 Tbsp Sour Cream
1/4 cup Parmesan Cheese
directions:
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Wash and dry produce. Trim and quarter zucchini lengthwise; cut crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick pieces. Peel and mince garlic. Zest and quarter lemon.
Once water is boiling, add spaghetti to pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, 9-11 minutes. Reserve 1 cup pasta cooking water, then drain. (Keep empty pot handy for step 5.)
While pasta cooks, heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large, preferably nonstick, pan over medium-high heat. Add zucchini; cook, stirring occasionally, until browned and softened, 4-6 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Turn off heat; transfer to a plate. Wipe out pan.
Meanwhile, pat chicken dry with paper towels and season all over with Italian Seasoning, salt, and pepper. Once zucchini is done, heat a large drizzle of oil in same pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, 3-5 minutes per side. Turn off heat; transfer to a cutting board to rest. Once cool enough to handle, slice chicken crosswise.
Heat a drizzle of olive oil in pot used for spaghetti over medium-high heat. Add garlic, half the lemon zest, and a pinch of chili flakes. Cook, stirring, until fragrant, 20-30 seconds. Stir in 1/2 cup reserved pasta cooking water (3/4 cup for 4 servings), stock concentrate, and juice from two lemon wedges. Simmer until thickened, 1-2 minutes. Turn off heat.
Add drained spaghetti, zucchini, sour cream, and 1 Tbsp butter to pot with sauce; toss to coat. Add half the Parmesan and season with salt and pepper. TIP: If needed, stir in more reserved pasta cooking water a splash at a time until spaghetti is coated in a creamy sauce. Divide pasta between bowls. Top with chicken, remaining Parmesan, remaining lemon zest, and a pinch of chili flakes if desired. Serve with any remaining lemon wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 30 min. Calories: 760

name: Italian Sausage Orzo Soup
ingredients:
16 oz Italian Sausage
1/2 Onion, finely chopped
2 Celery Stalks, finely chopped
2 Tbsp Flour
4 Garlic Cloves, minced
4 cups Chicken Broth
1 (28 ounce) can Diced Tomatoes with Juices
1/2 tsp Oregano, dried
1 cup Orzo, uncooked
1 cup Heavy Cream
2 cups Fresh Baby Spinach
Salt & Pepper to taste
directions:
Add the sausage meat to a large soup pot. Sauté over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until the sausage is browned (about 7-10 min).
Take the sausage out of the pot and transfer to a paper towel lined plate. Leave about a tablespoon of the fat in the pot (drain any excess).
Add the onion and celery to the pot and cook for 4-5 minutes.
Add the flour and garlic and cook for a minute, stirring constantly.
Slowly add the chicken broth and stir until the flour has completely dissolved.
Add the canned tomatoes and oregano to the pot, and also add the sausage back in. Increase the heat to high and bring the soup to a gentle boil.
Once it's gently boiling, add the cream and orzo. Reduce the heat as needed and simmer for about 12 minutes or until the orzo is tender, stirring fairly often so it doesn't stick to the bottom of the pot.
Stir in the spinach and season with salt & pepper as needed.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 30 min

name: Italian Sausage White Bean Soup
ingredients:
1 lb Italian Sausage
4 strips Bacon
1/2 Onion, chopped
3 Garlic Cloves, minced
4 (14 ounce) cans White Beans (cannellini), drained
4 cups Chicken Broth
1/4 tsp Italian Seasoning
1/4 tsp Rosemary, dried
2 small Carrots, peeled & chopped
2 cups packed Fresh Baby Spinach
Salt & Pepper to taste
directions:
Add the sausage meat to a large soup pot, along with the bacon (I cut it up using kitchen shears).
Cook over medium-high heat until the sausage and bacon are somewhat crispy/the fat has been rendered out (this can take upwards of 15 minutes). Meanwhile, prep the other ingredients.
Transfer the sausage and bacon to a plate (I don't line it with paper towel because the extra fat adds more flavor, but you can if you want). Leave about 2 tablespoons of fat in the pot (spoon any excess out).
Add the onion to the pot and sauté it for 3-5 minutes or until it's softened and starting to lightly brown.
Stir in the garlic and cook for 30 seconds.
Add the beans, chicken broth, Italian Seasoning, and rosemary. Give it a good stir and scrape up any brown bits off the bottom of the pot.
Take the pot off the stove. Using an immersion/stick blender, purée the soup. I like to leave some beans whole. The soup will thicken a bit more as it cooks, but the thickness/texture will be similar to what it is after you do this part, so keep that in mind. If you don't have a stick blender, transfer a ladle or two of beans to a regular blender, or use a potato masher or fork for a more rustic texture.
Return the sausage and bacon to the pot and add in the chopped carrots as well. Place the pot over high heat. Once the soup starts to boil, cover the pot with the lid slightly ajar and reduce the heat so it's simmering. Cook for 15-20 minutes or until the carrots have softened and the soup has thickened up a bit more.
Stir in the spinach and let it wilt for a minute or two. Taste and season with salt & pepper as needed. Serve immediately.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 45 min

name: Jalapeño Lime Ranch
ingredients:
3/4 cup Mayo
3/4 cup Sour Cream
1 Tbsp Dry Ranch Seasoning
1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
1/2 tsp Salt
1/2 cup Pickled Jalapeños + 2 Tbsp Pickling Juice
3/4 cup Cilantro, large stems removed
1 Tbsp Lime Juice
1/4 cup Buttermilk
directions:
In a food processor (or blender works too), puree cilantro leaves with the pickled jalapeños and their juice. Puree until mostly smooth, scraping down the sides a few times. In a mixing bowl, add the mayo, ranch seasoning, garlic powder, and salt. Mix well to combine.
Pour cilantro mix directly into the sour cream mixture. Stir to combine. Add lime juice, then add in buttermilk a little at a time until you reach desired consistency. Store in a mason jar or a bowl tightly sealed. Refrigerate for up to five days. Best served chilled so they flavors have time to meld together.
notes:
Originally paired with Braised Brisket Tacos with Street Corn and Jalapeño Lime Ranch.
Chuy's Creamy Jalapeño Copycat Recipe

name: Jello Popcorn
ingredients:
1 cup Corn Syrup
1 cup Sugar
1 (3 oz) package Jello
6 qt. Popped Corn
directions:
Melt syrup, sugar and jello in sauce pan.
Pour over popped popcorn.

name: Julene's Cinnamon Rolls/Scones
ingredients:
1 cup Milk, scalded
3 Tbsp Sugar
1 tsp Salt
3 cups Flour
1 Egg
1/2 cup Shortening
1 Tbsp Yeast
1/3 cup Warm Water
directions:
Dissolve yeast in warm water; set aside.
Add sugar, shortening, and salt to scalded milk.
Add flour, egg, and dissolved yeast to milk mixture and mix well. You may need to add additional flour to make soft dough. You do not want stiff dough! Knead well. Let dough rise for 20 min.
Punch down, and let dough rise for 15 minutes more.
Roll dough into rectangle and add filling.
Filling: 2 Tbsp melted butter. Spread across dough.
Sprinkle 2 tsp ground cinnamon & 1/2 cup sugar generously across dough.
Roll dough and seal the edge.
Slice with piece of thread and place on buttered pan. Let rise for 20 minutes.
Bake rolls at 400 degrees for 5 minutes.Then bake at 375 degrees for 5-10 minutes until they are golden brown. Let cool slightly.
Frosting: Combine 1 cup powdered sugar, 1/4 tsp vanilla, 2 Tbsp softened butter, and enough milk to make a drizzle. You can add a little almond extract, if you like. Drizzle over warm rolls.
notes: To make scones: Make dough, let rise for 30 minutes, and fry

name: Jungle Juleps
ingredients:
2 cups Pineapple Chunks, frozen
1 cup Orange Juice, pulp-free
1 cup Grape Juice, 100%
1/4 cup Lemon Juice
2 Tbsp Sugar
directions: Add all ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth. Add a slice of fruit and mini umbrella for decoration.
notes: Adventureland, Disneyland

name: Korean Corn Cheese
ingredients:
1 Tbsp Butter
1 Onion
1 can Sweet Corn
1/2 cup Cream or 1/2 cup Cream Cheese
2 Tbsp Mayo
Handful Scallions, chopped
1 tsp Pepper
1 tsp Chili Flakes
1/2 cup Cheddar and Mozzarella Cheese, shredded
1/2 tsp Sugar
1/2 tsp Salt
directions:
Chop onion and saute until translucent in butter.
Add cream, mayo, corn, sugar, and spices. Stir until well combined.
Once mixture is bubbling, top with cheese in even layer across the top. Cover until cheese is melted. Top with Scallions.
Serve as side dish or as chip dip.

name: Lazy Day Lasagne
ingredients:
6 oz Lasagna Noodles
1/4 tsp Oregano, dried, crushed
1 (15.5 oz) jar Spaghetti Sauce with Meat
1 cup Cream Style Cottage Cheese
1 (6 oz) Mozzarella Cheese, sliced
directions:
Cook noodles in boiling water following package directions. Drain.
Add oregano to spaghetti sauce.
In greased 10x16x1½ baking dish make layers in this order: noodles, cottage cheese, Mozzarella Cheese, spaghetti sauce. Repeat.
Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes.
Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

name: Lemon Bars - Sally
ingredients:
1 cup Butter, unsalted and melted
2½ cups Sugar
2 tsp Vanilla Extract
1/2 tsp Salt
2-1/2 cups All-Purpose Flour
6 Eggs, large
1 cup Lemon Juice (about 4 lemons)
Confectioners' Sugar, for dusting
directions:
Preheat the oven to 325°F (163°C). Line the bottom and sides of a 9x13 baking pan with parchment paper, leaving an overhang on the sides to lift the finished bars out (makes cutting easier!). Set aside.
Make the crust: Mix the melted butter, 1/2 cup of sugar, vanilla extract, and salt together in a medium bowl. Add 2 cups and 2 Tablespoons of flour and stir to completely combine. The dough will be thick. Press firmly into prepared pan, making sure the layer of crust is nice and even. Bake for 20-22 minutes or until the edges are lightly browned.
Remove from the oven. Using a fork, poke holes all over the top of the warm crust (not all the way through the crust). A new step I swear by, this helps the filling stick and holds the crust in place. Set aside until step 5.
Make the filling: Sift the remaining sugar and flour together in a large bowl. Whisk in the eggs, then the lemon juice until completely combined.
Pour filling over warm crust. Bake the bars for 22-26 minutes or until the center is relatively set and no longer jiggles. (Give the pan a light tap with an oven mitt to test.) Remove bars from the oven and cool completely at room temperature. I usually cool them for about 2 hours at room temperature, then stick in the refrigerator for 1-2 more hours until pretty chilled. I recommend serving chilled.
Once cool, lift the parchment paper out of the pan using the overhang on the sides. Dust with confectioners' sugar and cut into squares before serving. For neat squares, wipe the knife clean between each cut. Cover and store leftover lemon bars in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.
notes: Prep time 15 min and Cook time 40 min.

name: Lemon Bars - Instagram
ingredients:
Crust:
2 cups Flour
1/2 cup Powdered Sugar
3/4 cup Butter, unsalted, chilled and cubed
Lemon Curd:
6 Eggs
3 cups Sugar
1½ cups Lemon Juice, freshly squeezed
3/4 cup Flour
3/4 tsp Baking Powder
directions:
In a large bowl, sift together flour and powdered sugar. With two knives cut butter into the flour mixture until the size of small peas. Press mixture firmly down into a 9x13 pan. Bake crust in a preheated 350F oven for 20-30 minutes or until golden brown.
Whisk together the eggs, sugar and lemon juice. In a small bowl mix together flour and baking powder. Keep this aside until the crust has finished baking, because it will react with the egg and lemon mixture. You want to save this reaction for when you bake the bars.
Once the crust is out of the oven, whisk the flour and baking powder mixture into the egg mixture. Whisk until well combined. Pour batter over the crust and bake at 350F for 25 minutes or until lemon curd is set. Cool well, cut into squares and sift powdered sugar on top.
Store in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

name: Lemon Curd
ingredients:
1 Egg, large at room temperature
1/3 cup Sugar
1/4 cup Lemon Juice
1/2 tsp Lemon Zest
2 Tbsp Butter
directions:
In a medium saucepan, bring the lemon juice and lemon zest to a boil.
While the juice is heating up, whisk the egg, and granulated sugar in a medium bowl until the sugar is dissolved.
Very slowly pour in the lemon juice into the beaten egg mixture while whisking rapidly to keep the egg from cooking and curdling.
Pour the mixture back into the medium saucepan and cook over medium low heat, stirring constantly. Once the lemon curd is thick, remove from the heat and add in the butter. Continue stirring until everything is combined.
You can now press the lemon curd through a sieve to ensure it's super smooth.
Transfer the lemon curd to a bowl, then press plastic wrap onto the surface of the lemon curd to keep it from forming a skin on top and chill in the fridge. The curd will thicken as it cools and can be used anytime after that.
notes: Goes with Crumbl Lemon Cheesecake Cookies
yields: 8 Tbsp - small batch of Lemon Curd

name: Lemon Curd Cake
ingredients:
225g Butter
225g Caster Sugar
4 Eggs, large
3 tsp Vanilla Extract
210g Self-Raising Flour
1 tsp Baking Powder
1 Lemon, zested and juiced
3 Tbsp Milk, to loosen batter
300g Butter, softened
1/2 tsp Vanilla Extract
520g Icing Sugar, sifted
300g Caster Sugar
50g Cornstarch
4 Egg Yolks, large
Pinch of Salt
2 Lemons, zested and juiced
60g Butter
directions:
For the Lemon curd, place the sugar, cornstarch and flour 450ml water in a large saucepan and stir until you have a smooth mixture. Stir in the lemon juice, egg yolks and salt. Place over a medium heat and keep stirring while the mixture boils, for about 10-12 minutes. Stir in the lemon zest and butter has melted, then remove the pan from the heat and allow to cool.
Preheat the oven to 350F. Grease and line two 21cm tins.
Cream butter, sugar, and lemon zest together until fluffy and pale. Then beat in the eggs one by one before adding the vanilla extract and lemon juice.
Using a spatula, fold in the flour until you have a smooth mixture. Use a little bit of the milk if you need to loosen the mixture. Should be a little loose.
Divide the mixture into two springform tins, Bake for about 20 minutes, until nice and golden brown. Take then out and let them cool for a few minutes.
While the bases are cooling prepare the buttercream filling by beating the butter and vanilla extract together in a bowl until light and fluffy then add the icing sugar, a little at a time, until it is all incorporated and the mixture is smooth.
Assembly: Spread lemon curd on one of the bases before topping with buttercream, then add the second base and sprinkle with icing sugar.

name: Lemon Dijon Shrimp
ingredients:
1 lb Shrimp, peeled and deveined
1 Tbsp Olive Oil
Salt & Pepper
1½ tsp Paprika
1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
4-5 Garlic Cloves, minced
1/4 tsp Chili Flakes
1/2 tsp Oregano
6 Tbsp Butter
1 Tbsp Dijon Mustard
1/3 cup Parsley, finely chopped
1 Lemon, zested and juiced
directions:
Grab your shrimp and carefully butterfly down the middle and add to a bowl.
Season with a tablespoon of olive oil, a couple pinches of salt and pepper, 1 tsp paprika and 1/2 tsp garlic powder. Mix well.
Get a pan on medium-high heat. Drizzle with olive oil, then cook the shrimp for about 90 seconds on the first side and about 60-90 seconds on the other side. You don’t want to overcook shrimp as it becomes rubbery.
For the sauce: grab a sauce pan and bring it to medium heat. Drizzle with olive oil and add in the garlic cloves, a small pinch of salt, pepper, chili flakes, oregano and 1/2 tsp of paprika. Mix well.
Turn the pan to low heat, add in 2 tablespoons of butter with 1 tablespoon of dijon mustard and mix until the butter melts. Continuously and gently stir.
Add in 2 more tablespoons of butter and melt, then another 2 tablespoons of butter after that and melt on low heat. Stir continuously.
Add in parsley, juice and zest of 1 lemon, and stir. Give it a taste and adjust as needed.
Plate up the shrimp, top it with however much of the sauce as you’d like and top with fresh parsley.
You can have the shrimp as is, serve over rice or quinoa, or use it as a filling for tacos, burritos, etc.

name: Lemon Meringue Pie
ingredients:
Pie Crust
3 Eggs
1½ cups Sugar
3 Tbsp All-Purpose Flour
3 Tbsp Cornstarch
2 Tbsp Margarine or butter
1-2 tsp Lemon Peel, freshly shredded
1/3 cup Lemon Juice
1½ cup Water
directions:
Poke holes in the pie crust and bake at 375 for 25 minutes.
Separate egg yolks from the whites and set aside.
Mix sugar, flour, cornstarch and a dash of salt. Gradually stir in water and stir over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Reduce heat and cook for 2 minutes.
Remove from heat.
Beat the egg yolks. Gradually stir about 1 cup of the hot filling into the yolks.
Pour egg yolk mixture back into the rest of the hot filling. Bring to a gentle boil then cook for 2 more minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in butter and lemon peel. Gently stir in lemon juice and keep the filling warm.
Pour warm filling into the crust and spread meringue over it and press into the crust's edges to seal.
Bake at 350 for 15 minutes and cool on a wire rack for 1 hour ad chill for 3-6 hours.

name: Lemon Pasta
ingredients:
2 cups Pasta, uncooked
2 Tbsp Olive Oil
2 cups Zucchini, thinly sliced (about 2 small/medium zucchinis)
1/2 cup White Onion, chopped
3 Garlic Cloves, chopped
1/2 tsp Rosemary, dried
1/4 tsp Salt
1/4 tsp Pepper
1/4 tsp Oregano, dried
1/2 tsp Chili Pepper Flakes
1/3 cup Lemon Juice
1 Tbsp Lemon Zest
1¼ cup Water
13½ oz can Full Fat Coconut Milk
1/2 cup Italian Cheese Blend
directions:
Heat your olive oil in a deep skillet or sauté pan on medium to high heat. Add in diced onions and zucchini. Sauté for about 3 minutes until fragrant. Then add in seasoning and chopped garlic. Sauté for another 3 - 5 minutes.
Add in lemon juice, zest, uncooked pasta, water and coconut milk. add a pinch more salt and cover. Cook on medium heat for about 15 minutes, or until pasta is al dente. Stir frequently while cooking.
Uncover and simmer on low/medium heat for another 3 - 5 minutes to be sure sauce is thickened. If using vegan shredded cheese, fold it in while hot. Serve topped with fresh basil and enjoy immediately.  Can also be served chilled.
notes: Prep time 8 min and Cook time 20 min

name: Lemon Pepper Chicken Skewer
ingredients:
Dry Rub:
1 Tbsp Garlic Powder
1 tsp Onion Powder
1 tsp Paprika
2 Tbsp Extra-Virgin Olive Oil
1 Lemon, zested
4 Garlic Cloves, minced
Salt & Pepper
Compound Butter Sauce:
1 tsp Garlic Powder
1/2 tsp Paprika
3 Tbsp Butter, unsalted
1 Lemon, juiced
Dash of Sugar
Salt & Pepper
directions:
Cube chicken, mince garlic, and zest lemon. Mix up the ingredients for the marinade. Toss chicken in the marinade and skewer chicken cubes.
Put skewers in the air fryer at 400F for 12 minutes. Flip over the skewers and then air fry for an additional 8-10 minutes.
While chicken cooks, mix butter sauce ingredients. Remove chicken from air fryer and immediately coat in butter sauce.
notes: Air fryer recipe
original_author: @dougdoesdelicious, check out Bad Batch Baking, too

name: Lemon Poppy Seed Scones
ingredients:
2 cups Flour
4 tsp Baking Powder
3/4 tsp Salt
1/3 cup Sugar
4 Tbsp Butter
2 Tbsp Shortening
3/4 cup Cream
1 Egg
1 Lemon, zested
1 Tbsp Poppy Seeds
directions:
Heat oven to 375 degrees.
In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, baking powder, lemon zest, poppy seeds, salt and sugar. Mix Well.
Cut in butter and shortening.
In a separate bowl, combine cream with beaten egg then add to dry ingredients.
Turn dough out onto a floured surface. Roll dough out and cut into biscuit size rounds.
Brush the top with egg wash and sprinkle some sugar on the top.
Bake for 15 minutes or until brown.
notes: Rather than using lemon zest and poppy seeds, experiment with other flavor combinations.

name: Lemon Red Potatoes
ingredients:
1½ lbs. Medium Red Potatoes
1/4 cup Water
1/4 cup Butter, melted
3 Tbsp Fresh Parsley, minced
1 Tbsp Lemon Juice
1 Tbsp Chives, minced
Salt & Pepper to taste
directions:
Either poke potatoes with a fork or cut a strip of peel around the middle of each potato. Place potatoes and water in a 6-qt. electric pressure cooker. Lock lid and make sure the vent is closed. Select manual setting; adjust pressure to high and set time for 12 minutes.
When finished cooking, quick-release pressure according to manufacturer's directions. Drain any cooking liquid; return potatoes to pressure cooker.
In a small bowl, combine butter, parsley, lemon juice and chives. Pour over the potatoes; toss to coat. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

name: Lemon Thyme Shortbread Cookies
ingredients:
1 cup Butter, unsalted and softened
3/4 cup Icing Sugar
1/2 tsp Vanilla
1/4 tsp Salt
1 Tbsp Lemon Zest, finely grated
1 tsp Fresh Thyme Leaves
2 cups All-Purpose Flour
directions:
Using an electric mixer or stand mixer, beat together butter, sugar, vanilla, and salt until light and fluffy. Stir in the lemon zest and thyme. Mix in flour just until combined.
Divide in half and shape into discs. Wrap each disc in plastic wrap, refrigerate until firm but not hard, about 45 minutes.
Preheat oven to 300F.
Roll out each disc, one at a time, on a floured board to a 1/4 inch. Cut out the cookies using a 2 inch cutter and place on a baking sheet covered with parchment. Repeat with second disc.
Bake until golden, about 20 minutes. Let cool on pans for 10 minutes. Remove them and let them cool completely.

name: Lemon Tomato Penne
ingredients:
Olive Oil
1/2 Yellow Onion, thinly sliced
Salt
1 Tbsp Red Pepper Flakes, more to taste
1/2 pound Penne Pasta
1/2 (14 oz) can Crushed Whole Tomatoes
1½ oz Parmigiano Reggiano, grated
1 Lemon, zested
Parsley to garnish
directions:
Bring a medium-sized pot of salted water to a boil.
Ina saute pan on high heat, add 2 Tbsp of olive oil and the sliced onion. stir and add a pinch of salt. Once onions begin to turn brown, add a ladle-full of water from the pasta pot.
Continue to cook down the onions and add water until they are soft and medium brown in color, about 25 minutes.
Once onions are caramelized, add a pinch of red pepper flakes and the tomatoes to the saute pan, lower the heat to medium and simmer. If the sauce looks too thick, add water from the pasta pot to thin out.
Add pasta to the boiling water, and cook 2 minutes less than box instructions.
Once the pasta is cooked, add it to the sauce. Turn the heat to high, add a ladle of pasta water and stir well for 2 minutes. Remove from heat, add the cheese, another ladle-full of water, and stir to combine. Stir in Lemon zest and more water if needed to thin out.
Transfer to a plate and garnish with more cheese, parsley and a splash of olive oil.
notes:
Active Time: 15 min
Total Time: 25 min

name: Lime Dipping Sauce
ingredients:
2 Tbsp Sugar
1/2 cup Cold Water
1 Tbsp Fish Sauce
1 Tbsp Fresh Lime Juice
1 Cilantro Leaf (optional)
directions:
Combine the sugar and water in a small saucepan and bring to a boil, stirring until the sugar dissolves. Remove from the heat. Stir in the fish sauce and lime juice.
Pour into a small bowl. Garnish with a cilantro leaf if desired.
Store for up to 5 days.
notes: Tasty with shrimp or steamed rice

name: Linguini
ingredients:
1 Onion, chopped
1 Garlic Cloves, crushed
1 Tbsp Tomato Paste
28 oz Italian-Style Tomatoes, drained
1 cup Half-and-Half Cream
1/2 cup Parmesan Cheese
1 package Fresh Linguini or about 8 servings Dry Linguini, cooked
directions:
Sauté onion and garlic. Stir in tomato paste.
Add the Italian-style tomatoes, and simmer for about 20 minutes.
In separate pan, warm half-and-half cream, ***BUT NOT TO A BOIL!!!
Pour half-and-half cream over hot cooked linguini.
Sprinkle Parmesan Cheese over linguini and cream; mix together to make sure that cheese sticks to the pasta.
Pour simmering tomato mixture over all. Mix together and serve.

name: Lollipops
ingredients:
1 cup Sugar
1/3 cup White Corn Starch
1/2 cup Water
1/2 tsp Flavoring
Food Coloring
directions:
Grease inside of molds with shortening.
Place mold on greased flat surface like a flat baking sheet.
Place clips over tabs of molds and insert sucker stick.
Combine sugar, water, and corn syrup.
Cook on medium high heat in sauce pan.
Remove from heat and let cool to 275 degrees.
Add flavoring and food coloring.
Pour into molds.
Allow candy to cool then remove molds from lollipops.
Set lollipops on second flat surface to complete cooling.
notes: Specific flavoring from store

name: Mac and Cheese Pasotto
ingredients:
1½ Tbsp Butter
1 Shallot, minced
1 slice Bacon, sliced into 1-inch squares
1 cup Elbow Pasta
1 cup Chicken Stock
1 cup Cheddar Cheese, grated
1 Tbsp Cream
1 Tbsp Chives, minced
directions:
Heat a pan over medium-high heat.
Add 1 Tbsp butter and the shallots. Saute until fragrant. Add elbow pasta and the chicken stock; cover.
Toss or stir every 2 minutes for 8 minutes. Remove top and allow stock to reduce.
When the stock is evaporated, check the doneness of the pasta. If it needs to cook longer, add some warm water or more stock.
Once the pasta is fully cooked, add the shredded cheddar and fontina.
Once the cheese is melted and incorporated, add 1/2 Tbsp butter and the cream to finish. Top with chives.

name: Mango Chicken Salad
ingredients:
1½ cups Rotisserie Chicken, shredded
1 Jalapeño, finely diced
1/2 cup Mango, chopped
1/4 cup Red Onion, finely diced
1/4 cup Cilantro, finely chopped
1/4 cup + 1 Tbsp Mayo
2 Tbsp Plain Greek Yogurt
1 tsp Apple Cider Vinegar
1 Lime, juiced
1/4 tsp Cumin Powder
1/4 tsp Chili Powder
1/2 tsp Honey
1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
1/2 tsp Sea Salt
directions:
Shred rotisserie chicken.
Finely chop red onion, jalapeño, cilantro and mango.
Using a small bowl, mix together dressing ingredients: mayo, greek yogurt, apple cider vinegar, honey, cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, cumin and sea salt.
In a large bowl, combine chicken with add-ins and pour over dressing. Mix together to combine.
Enjoy!
notes: Prep time 20 min and Cook time 20 min

name: Mangonada Smoothies
ingredients:
1/2 cup Pineapple Juice
1/2 cup Guava Juice
1 cup Mango Chunks, frozen
1/2 cup Peach Chunks, frozen
1 Banana, fresh and peeled
4 tsp Chamoy Sauce, divided
1/2 cup Mango, fresh and chopped
1/2 tsp Chili-Lime Seasoning
directions:
Combine pineapple juice, guava juice, frozen mango chunks, frozen peach chunks, and banana in a blender and blend until smooth.
Drizzle 1 teaspoon chamoy sauce inside walls of two drinking glasses. Divide smoothie mixture into glasses, add 1/4 cup mango to each cup, drizzle another 1 teaspoon chamoy sauce in each glass, and sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon chili-lime seasoning on each.
notes: HollywoodLand, Disney California Adventure

name: Marbled Cream Cheese Squares
ingredients:
Filling:
8 oz Cream Cheese, softened
1/4 cup Sugar
1 Egg
2 Tbsp All-Purpose Flour
Base:
3/4 cup Butter
4 Squares (1 oz each) Unsweetened Chocolate
1½ cups Sugar
3 Eggs
1 Tbsp Milk
1 cup All-Purpose Flour
1 cup Nuts, chopped
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
Filling: in a medium bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Beat in egg until incorporated. Blend in flour. Set aside.
Base: in a sauce pan, over low heat, melt butter and chocolate, stirring until smooth. Set aside to cool slightly.
When mixture has cooled, stir in sugar. Beat in eggs until blended. Stir in milk. Blend in flour. Stir in nuts.
Spread half the batter evenly in prepared pan. Spread filling evenly over base. Spread remaining batter evenly over filling. Run a knife through the layers to create a marbling effect. Bake in preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes or until a tester inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool completely and pan, then cut into squares.
notes: 9-inch square cake pan, greased

name: Marinated Shrimp & Couscous with Mixed Greens, Fresh Mozz & Balsamic Vinaigrette
ingredients:
2 Garlic Cloves
1 Scallion
1 Lemon
4 oz Grape Tomatoes
4 oz Fresh Mozzarella
10 oz Shrimp
1 Tbsp Fry Seasoning
2 tsp Italian Seasoning
5 oz Israeli Couscous
2 unit Veggie Stock Concentrate
5 Tbsp Balsamic Vinegar
2 Tbsp Mayonnaise
2 oz Mixed Greens
1/2 oz Sliced Almonds
3 Tbsp Olive Oil
1 tsp Vegetable Oil
1/2 tsp Sugar
2 Tbsp Butter
directions:
Wash and dry produce. Peel and mince or grate garlic. Quarter lemon. Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens. Halve tomatoes. Dice mozzarella into 1/2-inch cubes.
Rinse shrimp under cold water and pat dry with paper towels. Place shrimp in a large bowl. Add garlic, juice from half the lemon, 1 Tbsp olive oil, half the Fry Seasoning, 1 tsp Italian Seasoning, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Toss to coat. Set aside to marinate, tossing occasionally.
While shrimp marinates, heat a drizzle of oil in a small pot over medium-high heat. Add scallion whites and 1/2 tsp Italian Seasoning. Cook, stirring, until fragrant, 1 minute. Stir in couscous, stock concentrates, 1½ cups water, and a big pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to low. Cook until tender, 6-8 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, whisk together half the vinegar, half the mayonnaise, and 1/2 tsp sugar until smooth. Slowly whisk in 2 Tbsp olive oil; continue to whisk until combined and creamy. Season with salt and pepper.
Heat a large, preferably nonstick, pan over medium-high heat. Add shrimp with marinade; cook, stirring occasionally, until opaque and cooked through, 4-6 minutes. Remove pan from heat; stir in 1 Tbsp butter until melted.
In a medium bowl, toss together mixed greens, tomatoes, and mozzarella with as much dressing as you like. Season with salt and pepper if desired.
Fluff couscous with a fork. Stir half the scallion greens, 1 Tbsp butter, and a squeeze of lemon juice into pot with couscous. Season with salt and pepper. Divide couscous and salad between plates. Top couscous with shrimp, remaining scallion greens, and a squeeze of lemon juice to taste. Garnish salad with almonds and serve.
notes:
Prep time 10 min and Cook time 25 min. Calories: 1090.
Shrimp are fully cooked when internal temperature reaches 145°.

name: Marry Me Chicken
ingredients:
2 Chicken Breasts, thinly sliced in half (results in 4 thin chicken breasts)
1/2 cup Flour
Salt & Pepper
Paprika
Onion Powder
Oil
1-2 Tbsp Butter
3-4 Garlic Cloves, minced
1 cup Chicken Stock
1 cup Heavy Cream
Parmesan, grated
Red Pepper Flakes
Oregano
Thyme
4-5 Sun-Dried Tomatoes
directions:
Mix flour, salt, pepper, paprika, and onion powder. Coat chicken generously in flour mixture.
Heat 1 Tbsp of butter and oil in pan and cook chicken until chicken crusts (and has 165F internal temp).
Once chicken reaches 165F, remove but don’t clean out the pan. Add another Tbsp of butter and minced garlic into pan and deglaze with a cup of chicken stock and a cup of heavy cream. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add remaining seasoning, cheese, and sun dried tomatoes. Mix and add chicken back to sauce before serving.

name: Meatballs with Bulgogi Sauce plus Roasted Green Beans, Ginger Rice & Sriracha Crema
ingredients:
6 oz Green Beans
1 Thumb Ginger
2 Scallions
3/4 cup Rice
10 oz Ground Beef
1/4 cup Panko Breadcrumbs
4 oz Bulgogi Sauce
2 Tbsp Sour Cream
1 tsp Sriracha
1 Tbsp Sesame Seeds
directions:
Adjust racks to middle and top positions and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Peel and mince or grate ginger. Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens; mince whites. Trim green beans if necessary.
Rice: Heat a drizzle of oil in a small pot over medium-high heat. Add half the ginger; cook until fragrant, 1 minute. Stir in rice, 1¼ cups water, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to low. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve. Fluff rice with a fork; taste and season with salt if desired.
Form & Bake Meatballs: While rice cooks, in a large bowl, combine beef, scallion whites, panko, remaining ginger, and 1 Tbsp bulgogi sauce. (You'll use the rest of the bulgogi sauce later.) Season with salt and pepper. Form into 1½-inch meatballs; place on a baking sheet. Bake meatballs on middle rack until browned and cooked through, 14-16 minutes.
Green Beans: Toss green beans on a second baking sheet with a drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack until browned and tender, 12-15 minutes.
Sauce: Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine sour cream with Sriracha to taste. Add water 1 tsp at a time until mixture reaches a drizzling consistency. Once meatballs are done, carefully transfer to a second large bowl; add remaining bulgogi sauce and toss to coat.
Divide rice between plates and top with green beans, meatballs, and any bulgogi sauce from bowl. Drizzle with Sriracha crema. Garnish with scallion greens and as many sesame seeds as you like. Serve.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 25 min. Calories: 870

name: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad
ingredients:
1 (15 oz) can Chickpeas, drained and rinsed
1/2 Cucumber, diced
1/2 Red or Yellow Bell Pepper, diced
1 cup Cherry Tomatoes, halved
1/2 Red Onion, diced
1/2 cup Feta Cheese, crumbled
1/2 cup Parsley, chopped
Dressing Ingredients:
1 Garlic Clove, minced
1/2 tsp Red Pepper Flakes, more to taste
2 Tbsp Fresh Lemon Juice, more to taste
1½ Tbsp Extra-Virgin Olive Oil
Salt & Pepper to taste
directions:
Add all salad ingredients to a large bowl.
Mix all dressing ingredients in a small bowl or jar.
Pour the dressing over the salad, stir everything and check if you want to add more salt, pepper, red pepper flakes or lemon juice. Enjoy!

name: Mediterranean Potato Tzatziki Bowl
ingredients:
600 g Potatoes, diced
1 tsp Oregano, dried
1 tsp Thyme, dried
1 tsp Onion Flakes
1 Lemon, zested
1 Tbsp Olive Oil, divided
2 tsp Harissa
2 tsp Maple Syrup
1 tsp Ground Cumin
1 cup Chickpea, cooked
1 Head of Broccoli Florets
1/2 cup Baby Tomatoes
10 Almonds
Tzatziki
1 cup Yogurt
1 Cucumber
1/4 cup Fresh Dill, chopped
1 Garlic Clove, minced
2 Tbsp Lemon Juice
Salt & Pepper to taste
directions:
Preheat the oven to 400 F/200 C. In a large bowl, combine the diced potatoes, lemon zest, thyme, oregano, onion flakes, a pinch of salt, and half the olive oil. Mix well to ensure the potatoes are well coated.
Spread the potatoes on a baking tray and bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.
In the same large mixing bowl, combine the harissa, maple syrup, ground cumin, the remaining half of the olive oil, and a pinch of salt. Add the chickpeas and broccoli florets, stirring well until thoroughly coated.
Add the chickpeas and broccoli to the baking tray with the potatoes and continue to bake for an additional 20 minutes.
While the vegetables are roasting, place the almonds in an oven-safe dish and bake for 7 minutes. Once done, remove from the oven and chop roughly.
For the tzatziki, grate the cucumber and press using a cloth to remove the excess water. In a separate bowl, combine the soy yogurt, grated cucumber, chopped dill, minced garlic, lemon juice, and salt & pepper to taste.
To serve, layer the tzatziki in a bowl, followed by the roasted vegetables, tomatoes, and chopped almonds. Enjoy your Mediterranean Roasted Potato & Tzatziki Bowl!
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 40 min

name: Melon Rainbow Pops
ingredients:
Simple Syrup:
1/3 cup Water
1/3 cup Sugar
Pops:
1½ cups Watermelon, cubed
2 Tbsp Lime Juice
1¼ cups Honeydew, cubed
2 Tbsp Lemon Juice
1½ cups Cantaloupe, cubed
2 Tbsp Grapefruit Juice
directions:
Stir sugar into boiling water and whisk until dissolved. Remove and chill until cold.
Had watermelon, lime juice and 1 to 2 Tbsp simple syrup to the blender and blend until smooth. Fill six popsicle molds or paper cups 1/3 of the way full. Pop into the freezer for 40 minutes.
Rinse out blender and add honeydew, 1 to 2 Tbsp simple syrup, and lemon juice. Blend until smooth. Add to container to chill.
Rinse out blender once more and blend cantaloupe, grapefruit juice, and 1 to 2 Tbsp simple syrup. Remove to a container to chill.
After the watermelon is semi-firm, add honeydew to the mold. Place in freezer for 40 more minutes, then top with the cantaloupe. Place in freezer until completely firm, another four hours.

name: Mexican Street Corn Pasta Salad
ingredients:
16 oz Corn, frozen works
2 Tbsp Butter
8 oz Pasta, cook it per package instructions
1/4 cup Sour Cream
3-4 Tbsp Mayonnaise
4 Garlic Cloves, minced
1/2 cup Cotija Cheese, grated
1/4 cup Red Onion or Shallots
1 Lime
1/2 tsp Chipotle Powder
1/4 tsp Cumin
2 Tbsp Cilantro, finely diced
1/4 tsp Salt
Optional: 1 Jalapeño, seed removed, finely diced
directions:
Cook the pasta per package instructions. Once it is cooked, drain the pasta.
In a large skillet, add the butter. Once the butter melts, add the minced garlic and diced red onion or shallot.
Once the garlic is starting to get light brown, add the corn and 1/4 tsp of salt. Mix well and cook until the corn starts to get golden brown.
Add the cooked pasta to a large bowl and add the corn mixture once it is done cooking.
Add in the sour cream, mayo, chipotle pepper powder, and cumin. Mix well.
Add in the lime, finely diced Jalapeño, cotija cheese, and cilantro. Mix well.
You can add a little more cotija cheese, sour cream, mayonnaise based on your preference.
notes: Cook time 20 min. Calories

name: Middle Eastern Chickpea Bowls with Savory Pistachio Rice & Garlicky White Sauce
ingredients:
1 Yellow Onion
1 Garlic Clove
13.4 oz can Chickpeas
1/4 oz Cilantro
1 Lemon
1 Tbsp Shawarma Spice Blend
4 oz Grape Tomatoes
1/2 cup Basmati Rice
1 Vegetable Stock Concentrate
4 Tbsp Sour Cream
1 tsp Hot Sauce
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry all produce. Halve, peel, and cut onion into 1/2-inch thick wedges; mince a few wedges until you have 2 tablespoons. Peel and mince or grate garlic. Roughly chop pistachios. Drain and rinse chickpeas; pat very dry with paper towels. Roughly chop cilantro. Zest and quarter lemon. 4 SERVINGS: Adjust racks to top and middle positions. Mince a few onion wedges until you have 4 tablespoons.
Melt 1 Tbsp butter in a small pot over medium-high heat. Add minced onion, half the garlic, half the pistachios (save the rest for serving), half the Shawarma Spice (you'll use the rest in the next step), and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring, 1 minute. Stir in rice, 3/4 cup water, stock concentrate, and a big pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to low. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. Keep covered off heat. 4 SERVINGS: Use 2 Tbsp butter, a medium pot, and 1½ cups water.
Meanwhile, toss onion wedges, tomatoes, and chickpeas on a baking sheet with a large drizzle of olive oil, remaining Shawarma Spice, pepper, and a few pinches of salt. Roast on top rack, tossing halfway through, until veggies are tender and lightly charred and chickpeas are crispy, 18-20 minutes. 4 SERVINGS: Divide everything between 2 baking sheets; roast on top and middle racks, tossing veggies and swapping rack positions halfway through roasting. TIP: It's natural for chickpeas to pop a bit.
While veggies and chickpeas roast, in a small bowl, combine sour cream and remaining garlic to taste. Season with salt. Stir in water 1 tsp at a time until mixture reaches a drizzling consistency.
Fluff rice with a fork; stir in 1 Tbsp butter and half the cilantro. Season with salt and pepper. Once veggies and chickpeas are done, remove from oven and toss with lemon zest.
Divide rice between shallow bowls. Top with veggies and chickpeas. Drizzle with garlicky white sauce and hot sauce to taste. Sprinkle with remaining pistachios and cilantro. Top with lemon juice to taste; serve with remaining lemon wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 40 min. Calories: 660

name: Mike's Chocolate Peanut Butter Milkshake
ingredients:
1 cup Vanilla Ice Cream
1/3 cup Milk
1/4 cup Hershey Syrup
1/8 cup Jif Creamy Peanut Butter
1/2 cup Ice, 2-4 ice cubes
directions:
Put all of the ingredients into the blender.
Blend on max until thoroughly mixed and smooth.

name: Milk Chocolate Peanut Butter Creme Brulee
ingredients:
3 cups Heavy Cream
1/2 cup Whole Milk
1/2 cup Peanuts, toasted
1/2 cup Sugar
3½ oz Milk Chocolate, finely chopped
1/4 cup Smooth Peanut Butter
7 Egg Yolks, large
1/4 tsp Salt
1/2 cup Sugar
directions:
Bring the heavy cream and milk to a simmer in a medium saucepan over medium heat, remove from the stove, and stir in the peanuts. Let sit, covered, for at least 1 hour.
Strain the mixture, wipe out the pan and return the mixer to the pan.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Place the mixture back on the stove, add 1/4 cup of the granulated sugar and bring to a simmer, stirring until the sugar has dissolved. Remove from the heat and whisk in the chocolate and peanut butter. Whisk together the yolks, the remaining 1/4 cup granulated sugar, and the salt in a large bowl until pale color.
Slowly whisk in the hot chocolate mixture and continue whisking until combined. Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh strainer into a bowl.
Place four 8 oz ramekins inside a large baking dish and using a ladle, divide the mixture evenly among the ramekins. Pour hot water into the dish until it reaches halfway up the sides of the ramekins. Bake until the custard will continue to cook as it cools.
Let cool to room temperature, then cover each ramekin with plastic wrap and refrigerator until cold, minimum of 4 hours and up to 24 hours.
Preheat the broiler until very hot.
Sprinkle an even coat of the turbinado or raw sugar over each custard, place the ramekins on a baking sheet and broil until the sugar is melted and dark golden brown, about 2 minutes. Remove from the oven and serve immediately.

name: Minestrone
ingredients:
3 cups Water
1 Ib Beef Stew Meat
1 Onion, chopped
2 Carrots, diced
2 Celery Stalks, sliced
1 pint Stewed Tomatoes
2 tsp Salt
10 oz package Frozen Mixed Vegetables
1/2 cup Cabbage, shredded
1 Tbsp Basil, dried
1 Garlic Clove, minced
1/2 cup Vermicelli
1 (16 oz) can Garbanzo Beans
1 tsp Oregano
1 Zucchini, sliced
directions:
Place all ingredients except zucchini in crock pot.
Cover and cook on low 10 to 16 hours or on high 4 to 6 hours.
Add zucchini during last hour of cooking.
Remove from crock pot and let cool until serving.

name: Mini Chocolate Fudge Cream Pies
ingredients:
1 cup (2 sticks) Butter, unsalted and softened
1/2 cup Sugar
2 cups All-Purpose Flour
1/2 tsp Salt
8 (1 oz) Semi-Sweet Chocolate Squares
1/4 cup Milk
1 tsp Vanilla
1 (16 oz) Frozen Whipped Topping
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 24-cup mini muffin pan with non-stick cooking spray and set aside.
In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat the butter and sugar until well combined. Add the flour and salt and mix until a ball of dough forms.
Divide dough into 24 (2 tsp sized) balls and press each one into the bottom and up the sides of each greased muffin cup. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and press the crust back into the pan with the tip of your finger or the back of a small spoon. Return to the oven for 6-8 minutes longer or until the crusts are just starting to turn brown. Remove from the oven and let cool.
In a large microwavable bowl, melt the chocolate and milk on medium power in 30-second intervals until completely melted. Let cool for about 10 minutes. Stir in the vanilla and then fold in 1-1/2 cups of the thawed whipped topping.
Scoop a few teaspoons of the fudge filling into each pie crust until full.
Serve with whipped topping and chocolate shavings on top or store covered with plastic wrap in the refrigerator. Let sit for 15 minutes after removing from the fridge before serving.

name: Mint Chip Truffles
ingredients:
1/2 cup Hazelnuts
1/2 Walnuts
3/4 cups Coconuts Flakes
1/4 cup Medjool Dates, pitted
1/2 can Coconut Milk, chilled overnight
1/4 cup Cocoa Powder, plus more for coating
1/2 cup Dark Chocolate Chips
1/2 tsp Mint Extract
Pinch of Sea Salt
directions:
In a food processor, blend nuts and coconut flakes. Set aside.
Add dates to food processor and blend until they form a single ball.
Place nut and coconut mixture back into the food processor, and blend to combine. Add remaining ingredients and blend until combined.
Transfer "dough" to the freezer for 15 minutes to harden.
Remove from the freezer and roll in 1-inch balls. Place balls on a parchment-lined baking sheet and freeze for 30 to 45 minutes.
Once frozen, roll in coca powder or melted dark chocolate.

name: Mint Chocolate Meringues
ingredients:
2 Egg Whites
1 tsp Peppermint Extract
2 drops Green Food Coloring
1/2 cup Sugar
1 tsp Corn Flour
2 Tbsp Dark Chocolate, finely chopped
directions:
Preheat the oven to 235 degrees and line 2 baking trays with parchment paper.
Put the egg whites in a dry medium sized bowl and whisk until soft peaks form. Gradually add in the sugar one Tbsp at a time until fully incorporated.
Add in the peppermint extract and food coloring. Continue whisking until the sugar has dissolved and the meringue is thick and glossy.
Whisk in the corn flour and chocolate.
Drop heaped Tbsp onto prepared trays and reduce oven temperature to 200.
Bake for 1 hour and ten minutes or until they are crisp and hollow.
Turn off the oven and leave the meringues to cool with the door ajar.

name: Mint Juleps
ingredients:
Mint Syrup:
1/8 cup Water
1/8 cup Sugar
4-5 drops Peppermint Extract
Mint Julep Syrup:
1/3 cups Sugar
1/2 cup Water
1/4 cup Lime Juice
1½ cups Frozen Lemonade Concentrate
Mint Julep:
5 cups Water
5 cups Club Soda
Ice
Lemon, Mint leaves, and Maraschino Cherries, for garnish
directions:
Mint Simple Syrup: Dissolve 1/8 sugar in 1/8 water in a small pot over medium heat and bring to a boil. Once it begins boiling, remove from heat and let cool completely. Once cooled add in extract.
Mint Julep Syrup: Dissolve sugar in water in a medium sized pot over medium heat. Once sugar is dissolved, add lime juice and lemonade concentrate and bring to a boil. Once it begins boiling, remove from heat and add in the Mint Simple Syrup. Let cool completely.
Mint Julep Drink: Combine Mint Julep Syrup to 5 cups of water and club soda. Add ice and stir. Garnish with lemon slices, mint leaves, cherries, and enjoy!
notes: New Orleans Square, Disneyland. Serve with Beignets if you’re feeling extra Disney enthusiasm
original_author: A table full of joy (but majorly modified)

name: Mint Swirl Brownies
ingredients:
3 oz Cream Cheese, softened
1/4 cup Butter, softened
3/4 cup Sugar
2 Eggs
2/3 cup All-Purpose Flour
1/2 tsp Baking Powder
1/4 tsp Salt
1 oz Unsweetened Chocolate, melted and cooled
1/2 tsp Peppermint Extract
Several drops Green Food Coloring
Chocolate Glaze:
1 oz Square Unsweetened Chocolate
1 Tbsp Butter
1 cup Powdered Sugar, sifted
1/2 tsp Vanilla
2 Tbsp Boiling Water
directions:
Cream together cream cheese, butter and sugar; beat in eggs.
Stir together flour, baking powder, and salt; stir into creamed mixture.
Spoon half of the batter in checkerboard fashion into greased 9x9 baking pan.
To remaining batter, stir in extract and food coloring.
Spoon green batter into open spaces in baking pan.
Swirl with spatula to marble; do not over mix.
Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes.
Cool; pour Chocolate Glaze over top.
To make Chocolate Glaze, melt chocolate and butter over low heat; stir constantly.
Remove from heat and stir in powdered sugar and vanilla until crumbly.
Blend in enough boiling water until of pouring consistency.
notes: 1/3 cup chopped nuts (optional)

name: Minty Thins
ingredients:
1 Tbsp +1 tsp Crisco Shortening
1 cup Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips
18 Chocolate Wafer Cookies, Nabisco Famous
Green Sparkling Sugar, India Tree
directions:
In a medium microwave safe bowl, combine shortening and mint extract. Microwave on high for 30 seconds.
Add Chocolate Chips.
Microwave on medium for 1½ minutes, stirring every 30 seconds. Stir chocolate mixture until smooth.
Dip bottom of each cookie into the chocolate mixture and spread sooth with a knife.
Place cookies with chocolate side up on a wire rack. Let stand for about an hour or until chocolate hardens.
Repeat with other side of each wafer cookie so the whole cookie is covered with chocolate.
Let stand until chocolate hardens, sprinkling with sparkling sugar before it hardens.
notes: Freezes well for 1 month.

name: Miso Salmon Bites
ingredients:
2 Salmon Filets
2 Tbsp Miso
1 Tbsp Rice Vinegar
1 Tbsp Mirin
1 Tbsp Soy Sauce
¼ tsp Toasted Sesame Oil
directions:
Please note that this recipe requires a marination time of 1–2 hours.
In a large bowl or flat tray, mix the marinade ingredients: 2 Tbsp miso, 1 Tbsp sake, 1 Tbsp mirin, 1 Tbsp soy sauce, and ¼ tsp toasted sesame oil.
Cut salmon into bite sized pieces so they cook faster and evenly. Then, place the salmon in the bowl with the marinade, skin side up if applicable.
Spoon the marinade on top of the salmon, making sure to coat the sides and skin. Cover and keep it in the refrigerator for 1–2 hours max.
Next, take the salmon out of the refrigerator and remove any excess marinade; otherwise, the miso may burn.
Generously spray the inside of the air fryer with cooking spray or grease it with oiled parchment paper to prevent sticking. Place the salmon bites in the air fryer basket, skin side up if applicable. Spray the top of the salmon bites with oil until lightly covered. Set your air fryer to 400°F and cook for 8 minutes or until caramelized on the outside.
Take it out of the air fryer and test if the salmon is cooked by flaking the flesh. If it flakes easily, it’s cooked through. Optionally, you can broil the salmon to give it a nice char, if desired. Simply remove a few minutes early and broil in the oven until desired char is reached and internal temp reaches 145F.
Serve: Sprinkle salmon bites with sesame seeds and thinly sliced green onions. Serve over rice with steamed veggies.

name: Mom's Pancake Recipe
ingredients:
1 cup Flour
1 Tbsp Sugar
2 tsp Baking Powder
1/2 tsp Salt
1 cup Milk
1 Egg
2 Tbsp Oil
directions:
Mix all dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl.
Mix egg, milk, and oil together in a separate bowl.
Add milk, egg, and oil mixture to dry ingredients.
Mix well.

name: Monkey Bread
ingredients:
1/2 cup Sugar
2 cans Pillsbury Grands
1 tsp Cinnamon
1 cup Brown Sugar
3/4 cup Butter
directions:
Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees.
Lightly grease bundt cake pan or cupcake tray.
Separate dough into 16 biscuits.
Cut each biscuit in to 4 pieces.
Put cinnamon and sugar into a large bag and shake.
Put in 1/2 of the biscuits (32) and shake until coated in cinnamon/sugar mixture. Put in pan.
Melt butter and add brown sugar and pour over first half of dough. Repeat 6-9 for second half.
Bake for 28-35 minutes.
notes:
optional ingredients:
1/2 cup of walnuts
Pour butterscotch pudding on top

name: Monterey Jack Un-Fried Chicken, Potato Wedges & Sriracha Mayo
ingredients:
12 oz Yukon Gold Potatoes
1/4 cup Panko Breadcrumbs
1/4 cup Monterey Jack Cheese
1 Tbsp Butter
1 Tbsp Ranch Spice
10 oz Chicken Cutlets
4 Tbsp Mayo
1 tsp Sriracha
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Cut potatoes into 1/2 inch thick wedges.
Place 1 Tbsp butter in a small microwave-safe bowl; microwave until melted, 30 seconds. Stir in panko, Monterey Jack, half the Ranch spice (you'll use the rest in the next step), salt, and pepper.
Toss potatoes on one side of a baking sheet with a large drizzle of olive oil, remaining ranch spice, salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack for 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, pat chicken dry with paper towels; season all over with salt and pepper. Place on a plate. Spread tops of chicken with 1 tsp mayo each (you'll use the rest in the next step). Mound with panko mixture, pressing firmly to adhere (no need to coat the undersides).
Once potatoes have roasted 5 minutes, remove sheet from oven. Carefully place chicken, coated sides up, on empty side.
Roast until potatoes are golden brown and tender and chicken is cooked through, 15-18 minutes more.
In a second small bowl, combine remaining mayo with Sriracha to taste.
Divide chicken and potato wedges between plates. Serve with Sriracha mayo on the side for dipping.
notes: With green beans, this recipe is 770 calories. Prep 10 min Cook 35 min

name: Moo Shu Pork Bowls with Cabbage, Scallions & Buttery Rice
ingredients:
2 Scallions
1 Lime
10 oz Ground Pork
4 oz Red Cabbage, shredded
2 Tbsp Hoisin Sauce
1 oz Sweet Thai Chili Sauce
2 Tbsp Sweet Soy Glaze
1/2 cup Jasmine Rice
1 Tbsp Sesame Seeds
directions:
Wash and dry produce. In a small pot, combine rice, 3/4 cup water, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve. Thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens. Quarter lime.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add pork and cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned and cooked through, 4-6 minutes. TIP: If there's excess grease in your pan, carefully pour it out.
Stir scallion whites and cabbage into pan with pork; cook, stirring occasionally, until just tender, 2-3 minutes. Stir in hoisin, chili sauce, 2½ Tbsp sweet soy glaze, and 1/2 tsp sugar until thoroughly combined. Turn off heat. Taste and season with juice from half the lime, salt, and pepper.
Fluff rice with a fork and stir in 1 Tbsp butter until melted. Season with salt and pepper. Divide rice between bowls and top with moo shu pork. Sprinkle with scallion greens and as many sesame seeds as you like. Serve with any remaining lime wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 20 min. Calories: 760

name: Mozzarella Stuffed Rolls
ingredients:
4 Mozzarella Sticks, cut into 3 sections (12 total)
Dough:
2 Eggs
35g Sugar
580g Bread Flour
12g Salt
35g Butter, unsalted and softened
60g Whole Milk
6g Instant Yeast
Tangzhong:
120g Whole Milk
120g Water
40g Bread Flour
directions:
Make the tangzhong: Whisk all tangzhong ingredients in a small pot until no lumps remain. Then stir continuously over medium heat until the mixture resembles mashed potatoes. Remove from heat and let cool for 5 mins.
In the bowl of a stand mixer, add the tangzhong and all other dough ingredients except for butter. Using the dough hook attachment, mix for 5 mins until the dough comes together. Add the butter and mix for 8-10 mins or until a rough window pane is achieved.
Shape the dough into a ball, place into a bowl, cover, and let rise for 1½-2 hours or until almost doubled in size.
Punch dough to deflate and divide into 12 equal sections. Form into balls. Cover and let rest for 10 mins. Meanwhile lightly grease a 9”x13” pan.
Doing one at a time, roll the dough into a long oval ~9” long. Cut slits lengthwise making sure to stop 3/4 of the way. Place the cheese at the end with no slits and roll into a log. Place into the pan. Repeat with remaining dough and cheese.
Cover and let rise for ~30mins or until noticeably puffy. Preheat oven to 350F.
Lightly brush with a little milk before baking. Bake for 25-30 mins or until the top is golden.
Optional: brush with 1 Tbsp of melted butter mixed with 1 Tbsp of honey for a shiny top.

name: Muddie Buddies
ingredients:
4½ cups Chex Cereal
1/2 cup Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips
1/4 cup Smooth Peanut Butter
2 Tbsp Butter, unsalted
1 cup Confectioner's Sugar
directions:
Combine the chocolate chips, peanut butter, and butter and microwave for 30 seconds on high heat. Pour on top of the Chex cereal, stirring until the cereal is well coated. Pour this mixture into a large ziploc bag and add the powdered sugar. Shake until well coated.
Transfer onto a baking sheet lined with wax paper and let cool.

name: Mushroom Stroganoff
ingredients:
2 Tbsp (30 ml) Olive Oil
1/2 Yellow Onion, diced
2 Garlic Cloves, finely chopped
1 lb (454 g) Baby Portobello Mushrooms, sliced
1½ cups (355 ml) Chicken Broth
2 tsp (10 ml) Soy Sauce
1 tsp Thyme, dried
1/2 cup (60 g) Sour Cream
2 Tbsp (16 g) Flour
1 lb (454 g) Farfalle Pasta, cooked
Salt & Pepper to taste
Fresh Parsley, chopped
directions:
Heat the olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until fragrant and the onion is soft, about 5 minutes. Then add the mushrooms and cook until they release their juices and become soft, about 7 minutes.
Stir in the vegetable broth, soy sauce or tamari and thyme, and stir to combine. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until the liquid has reduced by a third, about 10 minutes. Mix in the Vegan Sour Cream and flour. Continue to simmer until the sauce thickens, another 3 minutes. Remove from heat.
Cook the pasta according to package directions, until al dente. Drain, rinse and return the noodles to the pot. Pour the mushroom sauce over the pasta and stir to coat. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Divide the pasta between 4 bowls and garnish with freshly chopped parsley. Serve immediately.
notes: Stirred in 2 Tbsp of lemon juice to the sauce after removing from the heat. It adds a subtle zing. Try with 1 Tbsp first and taste, add more if desired.

name: Nachos Supreme
ingredients:
1 lb. Ground Beef
1 package Taco Seasoning
1 Tomato Soup
1½ cups Water
1½ cup Rice, uncooked
Cheese, shredded
Lettuce, shredded
Salsa
Tortilla Chips
directions:
Cook beef and taco seasoning in skillet until browned.
Drain off grease.
Add soup, water and rice.
Heat to boil.
Cover and cook over low heat 5 minutes or until done.

name: Nestle Toll House Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients:
2¼ cups All-Purpose Flour
1 tsp Baking Soda
1 tsp Salt
1 cup Butter, softened
3/4 cup Sugar
3/4 cup Brown Sugar
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
2 Eggs
2 cups Chocolate Chips
directions:
Preheat oven to 375.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt in a medium sized bowl.
Beat butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar and vanilla extract in large bowl or bosch/kitchen aid.
Add eggs one at a time to the mixture, beating well after each egg.
Gradually beat flour mixture into the large bowl.
Stir in chocolate chips *and chopped nuts.
notes: *1 cup chopped nuts optional

name: No-Bake Oreo Strawberry Cheesecake
ingredients:
2 tsp Powdered Gelatin
3½ Tbsp Hot Water
9 Oreos, whole and 4 Oreos cut in half, for decoration
2 Tbsp Butter, melted
7 Strawberries, cut in half
1 (8 oz) package Cream Cheese, softened at room temperature
1/2 cup Heavy Cream
1/2 cup Yogurt
1/2 cup Strawberry Jam
1 Tbsp Lemon Juice
5 Strawberries, cut into cubes
directions:
Sprinkle gelatin into hot water and set aside for 10 minutes.
Combine 9 Oreos and melted butter inside a Ziploc bag and crush until crumbly.
Pour crumbs into a cheesecake pan lined with parchment paper and flatten down firmly with a spoon.
Arrange strawberry halves around the sides, with the insides of the strawberries facing outwards.
In a blender, combine cream cheese, heavy cream, yogurt, jam, lemon juice and gelatin mixture into the pan. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Once chilled and firm, transfer to a serving plate and decorate with more Oreos.

name: No Churn Chocolate Oreo Ice Cream
ingredients:
2 cups Heavy Whipping Cream
1 can Sweetened Condensed Milk
2/3 cup Cocoa Powder
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
1/4 tsp Sea Salt
16-20 Oreo Cookies, crumbled
directions:
Line a standard size 1 pound loaf pan with parchment paper. Set aside.
In a mixing bowl with a whisk attachment, whip the heavy cream until medium stiff peaks form.
In a separate bowl combine the sweetened condensed milk, cocoa powder, vanilla, and salt. Mix well until completely combined and no clumps of cocoa powder remain.
Pour the sweetened condensed milk mixture into the whipped cream and use a rubber spatula to fold everything together gently. Do not over mix, as this can cause the whipped cream to deflate.
Last, fold in the Oreo cookie crumbles, leaving a few out to crumble on top. Transfer the ice cream to the prepared pan and shape into an even layer. If desired, top with more Oreos.
Freeze for at least 12 hours before serving!
notes: Prep time 15 min and Freeze time 12 hour

name: Oatmeal Cookies
ingredients:
1/4 lb. Butter
1/2 cups Sugar
1/2 cup Brown Sugar
1 Egg
1/4 tsp Vanilla
1/2 tsp Baking Powder
1/2 Baking Soda
1 cup Flour
3/4 cup Oatmeal
1/4 tsp Salt
1/4 cup Walnuts, chopped
directions:
Mix all ingredients.
When dough is formed into balls dip tops in granulated sugar before placing on cookie sheet.

name: Oil and Vinegar Dipping Sauce
ingredients:
1/2 cup Olive Oil
1/3 cup Balsamic Vinegar
1 tsp Garlic, crushed
1 tsp Italian Seasoning
1 tsp Salt
1 tsp Chili Flakes
1/3 cup Asiago Cheese, shredded
1/3 cup Parmesan Cheese, shredded
directions: Mix all ingredients and serve with bread
notes: Serve with bread as a snack or appetizer

name: Old Bay Buttered-Up Chicken with Roasted Veggies
ingredients:
1 Tbsp Butter
6 oz Carrots
6 oz Green Beans
1 Tbsp Old Bay Seasoning
1 tsp Hot Sauce
10 oz Chicken Cutlets
1 Chicken Stock Concentrate
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Place 2 Tbsp butter in a small microwave-safe bowl; bring to room temperature. Trim, peel, and halve carrots lengthwise; slice into green-bean-size pieces.
Green Beans & Carrots: Trim green beans if necessary. Toss carrots and green beans on a baking sheet with a large drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack until veggies are tender, 15-20 minutes.
Chicken: Meanwhile, to bowl with softened butter, add 1/2 tsp Old Bay Seasoning and hot sauce to taste; mix to combine.
Pat chicken dry with paper towels and season with 1 tsp Old Bay Seasoning. Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, 3-5 minutes per side.
Divide chicken veggies between plates. Top chicken with pan sauce, then dollop with Old Bay butter and serve.
notes: Prep 10 min and cook 40 min

name: Olive Garden Alfredo Sauce
ingredients:
8 oz Fettuccine
1 Tbsp Butter, unsalted
3 Garlic Cloves, pressed
1/2 cup Heavy Cream
1/2 cup Whole Milk, or more, to taste
1/3 cup Parmesan, freshly grated
1 Egg Yolk, large and beaten
Salt & Pepper to taste
2 Tbsp Fresh Parsley
directions:
Combine butter, garlic, heavy cream, and milk in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a simmer; remove from heat and stir in Parmesan and egg yolk, whisking constantly to prevent the eggs from scrambling.
Temper the eggs until they are warmer, then slowly add the egg mixture to the remaining cream mixture.
If the mixture is too thick, add more milk as needed.
Stir into pasta (drained well) or add to the fabulous meal of your choosing.
notes: Add to noodles, grilled chicken, or seafood.

name: Olive Garden Chicken and Gnocchi
ingredients:
4 Tbsp Butter
2 Tbsp Olive Oil
1 cup Celery, 2-3 stalks chopped
3-4 Garlic Cloves, minced
1 cup Carrots, shredded
½ tsp Salt
½ tsp Black Pepper
2 tsp Onion Powder
1 Tbsp Italian Seasoning
¼ cup Flour
3 cups Chicken Broth
3 cups Milk
1½ cup Heavy Cream
2 cups Chicken, cooked and shredded
8 oz Spinach, frozen and chopped
16 oz Gnocchi
directions:
In a large pot, over medium heat, melt butter and add olive oil.
Once butter is melted, add in celery and cook for 5-7 minutes until soft.
Add garlic and stir for 30 seconds, then add in carrots. Season with salt, pepper, onion powder, and Italian seasoning.
Add in flour. Stir for 2 mins until everything is combined.
Add in chicken broth, milk and heavy cream, stir. Toss in frozen spinach and shredded chicken, stir to combine.
Turn up the heat and bring soup to a boil. Then gently add in gnocchi and boil for 4-5 minutes.
Serve with breadsticks.

name: Olive Garden Chicken Margherita
ingredients:
2 lbs Chicken Breasts, 4 portions
1 cup Italian Salad Dressing or your favorite marinade
2 Tbsp Olive Oil
1/2 cup Basil Pesto
2 tsp Garlic, minced
6 Tbsp Butter
1½ Tbsp Lemon Juice
1/2 Ib Mozzarella, 1 slice for each piece of chicken
1 cup Grape Tomatoes
1/4 cup Fresh Basil Leaves, thinly sliced
Pesto:
1 cup Fresh Basil Leaves
3 Garlic Cloves
2 Tbsp Pine Nuts
1/3 cup Extra-Virgin Olive Oil
1/2 tsp Salt
1/4 cup Parmesan Cheese, grated
1/4 cup Romano Cheese, grated
directions:
Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Pound chicken out between two sheets of plastic wrap. This will even out the thickness of the chicken, and it will make the chicken cook more evenly.
Place the chicken breasts into a gallon-sized zip top bag. Add Italian dressing marinade, and allow the chicken to marinate for at least 30 minutes before cooking.
Wash the grape tomatoes and set them aside.
Heat a couple of tablespoons of olive oil in a large cast iron skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken and cook for 7 to 8 minutes on each side, or until the chicken is almost done (it will continue to cook in the oven), remove the chicken from the skillet and place it on a plate or baking dish.
Add butter, minced garlic, and lemon juice to the skillet. Cook until the butter has melted.
Add the chicken back to the skillet with the lemon butter sauce.
Place a slice of mozzarella on top of the chicken.
Add the tomatoes to the skillet.
Place the chicken in the oven, and bake until the cheese begins to melt and brown. This should take 7 to 10 minutes.
Add a tablespoon or two of pesto on top of the mozzarella cheese.
Serve garnished with fresh basil if desired.
Basil Pesto: Place all pesto ingredients in a food processor.
Process until the mixture is smooth.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 20 min.

name: Olive Garden Salad Dressing
ingredients:
1/2 cup Mayonnaise
1/3 cup White Vinegar
1 tsp Vegetable Oil
2 Tbsp Corn syrup
4 Tbsp Parmesan Cheese
1/4 tsp Garlic Salt
1/2 tsp Italian Seasoning
1/2 tsp Parsley Flakes, dried
1 Tbsp Lemon Juice
directions:
Mix all ingredients in a blender until well mixed.
If it's too tart, add a bit of sugar.

name: Olive Garden Salad
ingredients:
1 Head Romaine Lettuce
Red Onion, sliced
Sweet Banana Peppers (from a jar)
Black Olives
Tomatoes, sliced
Croutons
Parmesan Cheese, freshly grated
directions: Assemble ingredients as desired and top with dressing right before serving.

name: Ombre Citrus Cake
ingredients:
Fruit Topping Layer:
4 Oranges (different varieties for ombre effect: orange, navel orange, blood orange, maybe a lemon)
1/3 cup Sugar
1/2 cup Water
2 Tbsp Orange Juice
Cake Batter:
3 Eggs
1 cup Sugar
3/4 Peanut Oil (or other neutral oil)
1/4 cup Yogurt
1/4 cup Heavy Cream
1 tsp Vanilla or Orange Extract
2 Tbsp Orange Juice
1 Tbsp Orange Zest
1 ¼ cup All-Purpose Flour
1 tsp Baking Powder
Syrup:
1/3 cup Sugar
1/3 cup Orange Juice
directions:
Fruit layer: With the peel on, slice the oranges horizontally so you have thin crosscuts. In a medium saucepan over high heat, heat the sugar, water, and orange juice until it comes to a boil. Place the oranges into the syrup, leaving the blood oranges out. Turn the heat to medium-low and let the slices candy for 10-12 minutes. Turn off the heat.
For the cake batter: In a large mixing bowl, add the eggs and sugar. Using a whisk, mix until combined. Add the oil, yogurt, heavy cream, extract, orange juice, and orange zest and continue to whisk for 30-60 seconds. Sift the flour and baking powder over the cake mixture, mix until well combined. Line the sides and bottom of an 8-inch cake pan with parchment paper.
Preheat the oven to 350F. Remove the orange slices from the syrup and line the bottom of the cake pan, arranging by color. Add the blood oranges to the syrup and brush lightly, and then add them into the cake pan as well. Create a pattern to create a fruit ombre.
Pour the cake batter over the orange slices. Place into the oven and cook for 30-40 minutes until lightly browned. Test to make sure the cake is done by inserting a toothpick into the middle and ensuring it comes out clean.
Once done, remove from the oven and let cool for 20-30 minutes. Flip the pan over onto your preferred serving plate, remove the parchment paper.
For the syrup, In the same saucepan with the leftover syrup, add sugar and orange juice. Let simmer for 5-7 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool for 10-15 minutes until just warm. Pour half of this mixture over the prepared cake and reserve the remaining half for serving.
