name: One-Pan Balsamic Chicken and Veggies
ingredients:
6 Tbsp Balsamic Vinegar
1/2 cup Zesty Italian dressing
1¼ Lbs Chicken Tenders
2 Heads of Broccoli
1 cup Baby Carrots
1/2 pint Cherry Tomatoes
1 tsp Italian Seasoning
3 Tbsp Olive Oil
1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
Fresh Parsley, salt and pepper
directions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Spray a large tray with nonstick spray (line with parchment paper if your tray isn't already nonstick or the balsamic & Italian mixture will stick to it) and set aside.
Whisk together the balsamic vinegar and zesty Italian dressing.
Trim the tenderloins of fat and undesired parts. Alternatively cut the breasts into small 1/4th-1/2th inch thick pieces.
Place 1/3 cup of the balsamic & Italian mixture in a large bag and add the chicken tenders. Coat and place in the fridge to marinate for at least 30 minutes and up to 6 hours.
Chop the broccoli into small pieces. Slice the baby carrots in half.
Place broccoli & carrots on the prepared tray with the cherry tomatoes (like your tomatoes LESS roasted? Toss in after 5-10 minutes of the broccoli and carrots being cooked. Otherwise they are ultra tender!), Italian Seasoning, olive oil, garlic powder, and add some seasoned salt and pepper to taste.
Roast the veggies for 10-15 minutes.
Remove from the oven and flip around. Section the veggies to each side of the tray (see video) and place the chicken tenders (discard marinade) in the center. Brush 1/3 cup of the balsamic & Italian mixture over the chicken.
Return to the oven and cook for another 7-15 minutes depending on the size of your chicken. Be careful to monitor the chicken so you don't overcook it.
Serve the chicken and veggies with the remaining Balsamic & Italian mixture. Top with freshly chopped parsley if desired.
Serve over rice or quinoa!
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 20 min

name: One-Pan Cajun Pork Sausage Skillet with Dirty Rice & Parsley Crema
ingredients:
9 oz Italian Pork Sausage
1/2 cup Jasmine Rice
1 Yellow Onion
1/4 cup Monterey Jack Cheese
1 Bell Pepper
1/5 oz Tomato Paste
2 Chicken Stock Concentrates
1 Tbsp Cajun Spice Blend
2 tsp Hot Sauce
4 Tbsp Sour Cream
1 Roma Tomato
1/4 oz Parsley
directions:
Wash and dry produce. Core, deseed, and dice bell pepper into 1/2-inch pieces. Halve, peel, and dice half the onion into 1/2-inch pieces. Dice tomato into 1/2-inch pieces. Remove beef from casing; discard casing.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a medium, preferably nonstick, pan over medium- high heat. Add sausage and cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned, 3-4 minutes (it'll finish cooking later). Using a slotted spoon, transfer sausage to a paper-towel-lined plate, keeping as much oil in pan as possible.
Heat another drizzle of oil in same pan over medium-high heat. Add bell pepper and diced onion; cook, stirring occasionally, until veggies are lightly browned, 2-3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Add rice, diced tomato, tomato paste, Cajun Spice, 1/2 tsp salt, and a pinch of pepper to pan with veggies. Cook, stirring frequently, 30 seconds. Add stock concentrate and 1½ cups water to pan and bring to a boil. Cook, stirring occasionally, until liquid is reduced by half, 3-4 minutes. Return sausage to pan. Cover pan and reduce heat to low; cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. TIP: Add a splash of water if pan seems dry.
While rice cooks, pick parsley leaves from stems; finely chop leaves. In a small bowl, combine sour cream with half the chopped parsley. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in water 1 tsp at a time until mixture reaches a drizzling consistency.
Stir remaining chopped parsley into rice skillet. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Top with Monterey Jack and parsley crema. Divide between plates and serve.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 35 min. Calories: 760

name: One-Pan Cheesy Beef Tortilla Melts with Green Bell Pepper & Spicy Cream Sauce
ingredients:
1 Green Bell Pepper
4 Tbsp Sour Cream
4 Tbsp Cream Cheese
2 tsp Hot Sauce
10 oz Ground Beef
1 Beef Stock Concentrate
2 Flour Tortillas
1/2 cup Cheddar Cheese
directions:
Wash and dry produce. Halve, core, and thinly slice bell pepper into strips. In a small microwave-safe bowl, combine sour cream, cream cheese, 1 tsp water, and hot sauce to taste. (Start with half the hot sauce, then taste and add more from there if you like things spicy.) Microwave until softened, 30 seconds. Stir to combine.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large, preferably nonstick, pan over medium-high heat. Add bell pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until slightly softened, 2-3 minutes.
Add beef to pan with bell pepper. Season with a big pinch of salt and pepper. Cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until beef is browned and cooked through and bell pepper is tender, 3-4 minutes. Carefully drain any excess grease in pan. Stir in stock concentrate until combined. Turn off heat.
Place tortillas on a clean work surface. Spread one half of each tortilla with half the cream sauce (save the rest for serving). Using a slotted spoon, top cream sauce with beef filling, then sprinkle with cheddar. Fold tortillas in half to create tortilla melts.
Wipe out pan used for filling. Melt 1 Tbsp butter in same pan over medium heat. Add tortilla melts; cook until tortillas are golden brown and cheese melts, 3-4 minutes per side. Transfer to a paper-towel-lined cutting board.
Cut tortilla melts into wedges. Divide between plates and serve with remaining cream sauce on top or on the side for dipping.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 20 min. Calories: 870

name: One-Pan Creamy Gnocchi with Sausage
ingredients:
16 oz Italian Sausage
1/2 Onion, chopped finely
4 Garlic Cloves, minced
1/3 cup Chicken Stock
1 (14 ounce) can Diced Tomatoes with Juices
1 cup Heavy Cream
1 lb Potato Gnocchi, uncooked
1/2 cup Parmesan Cheese, freshly grated
Handful Fresh Basil, torn
Salt & Pepper to taste
directions:
Sauté the sausage and onion in a skillet over medium-high heat for 7-10 minutes, or until lightly browned.
Add the garlic to the pan and sauté for about 30 seconds.
Add the wine and let it cook for about a minute.
Stir in the diced tomatoes, cream, and gnocchi. Once the sauce starts to bubble again, cover the pan and reduce the heat to medium. Cook for 5 minutes.
Uncover the pan, give it a good stir, and let it cook for another few minutes, or until the gnocchi has cooked through and is nice and soft and the sauce has thickened to your liking.
Stir in the parmesan cheese, basil, and salt & pepper, to taste. Serve immediately.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 25 min

name: One-Pan Pasta
ingredients:
200g Spaghetti
200g Cherry Tomatoes
1 Onion
3 Garlic Cloves, finely sliced
Small handful of Basil, roughly chopped
2 Tbsp Extra-Virgin Olive Oil
Pecorino Cheese, shaved
Sea Salt & Pepper
directions:
Arrange the tomatoes, basil, onion, and garlic across the base of a large frying pan and pour over the olive oil and 600ml of water or chicken stock.
Place the pan over a medium high heat and bring the contents of the pan to a boil. Using a tongs, stir the pasta regularly and cook for about 10 minutes until it's cooked and the liquid has nearly evaporated creating a sauce.
Add an extra splash of water if the sauce becomes too thick.
Remove the pan from heat and stir in the pecorino cheese and a little more basil. Season to serve.

name: One-Pan Pork Carnitas Tacos with Pickled Onion & Monterey Jack Cheese
ingredients:
1 Yellow Onion
1 Poblano Pepper
1 Roma Tomato
1/4 oz Cilantro
5 tsp White Wine Vinegar
10 oz Ground Pork
1 Tbsp Southwest Spice Blend
1 Chicken Stock Concentrate
1½ oz Tomato Paste
2 Tbsp Sour Cream
1 tsp Chipotle Powder
6 Flour Tortillas
1/4 cup Monterey Jack Cheese
directions:
Wash and dry produce. Halve and peel onion; thinly slice one half and finely chop remaining. Core, deseed, and dice poblano into 1/2-inch pieces. Dice tomato. Roughly chop cilantro.
Pickled Onion: In a medium bowl, combine sliced onion, vinegar, 2 tsp sugar, 1 Tbsp water, and salt (we used 1/2 tsp). Stir until sugar and salt are mostly dissolved. Set aside to pickle, stirring occasionally, until ready to serve.
Tacos: Heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add pork and season with salt and pepper. Cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned and cooked through, 4-6 minutes. Transfer to a plate and set aside.
Heat a drizzle of olive oil in same pan over medium-high heat. Add poblano and chopped onion; season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until softened, 3-4 minutes. Return pork to pan along with Southwest Spice, stock concentrate, half the tomato paste, and 1/4 cup water (1/3 cup for 4). Cook, scraping up any browned bits from bottom of pan, until mixture is thickened and saucy, 1-2 minutes more.
Sauce: While filling cooks, in a small bowl, combine sour cream, a bit of onion pickling liquid to taste (start with 1/4 tsp and add more if desired), and a pinch of chipotle powder (add more to taste if you like things spicy). Stir in water 1 tsp at a time until mixture reaches a drizzling consistency. Season with salt and pepper.
Wrap tortillas in damp paper towels and microwave until warm and pliable, 30 seconds. Divide tortillas between plates; fill with pork filling, tomato, Monterey Jack, cilantro, pickled onion (draining first), and crema. TIP: Alternatively, put everything in individual serving bowls and let everyone assemble their own tacos!
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 35 min. Calories: 860

name: One-Pan Santa Fe Pork Tacos with Monterey Jack & Cilantro Lemon Slaw
ingredients:
1 Yellow Onion
1/4 oz Cilantro
1 Lemon
10 oz Ground Pork
1 Tbsp Southwest Spice Blend
4 oz Red Cabbage, shredded
2 Tbsp Mayonnaise
1-2 Tbsp Tex-Mex Paste
6 Flour Tortillas
1/4 cup Monterey Jack Cheese
2 Tbsp Sour Cream
1 tsp Cooking Oil
1 tsp Sugar
directions:
Wash and dry produce. Halve, peel, and finely dice onion. Finely chop cilantro. Quarter lemon.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add onion and a pinch of salt; cook, stirring occasionally, until slightly softened and lightly browned, 2-3 minutes. Add pork and Southwest Spice. Cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned and cooked through, 4-6 minutes. TIP: If there's excess grease in your pan, carefully pour it out.
While pork cooks, in a large bowl, combine cabbage, mayonnaise, half the cilantro, juice from half the lemon, 1 tsp sugar, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Stir Tex-Mex paste into pan with pork mixture until fully coated. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Remove pan from heat. Wrap tortillas in damp paper towels and microwave until warm and pliable, 30 seconds. Divide tortillas between plates and fill with pork filling, Monterey Jack, slaw, sour cream, and remaining cilantro. Serve with any remaining lemon wedges on the side.
notes: Prep 5 min and Total cook time 20 min. Calories: 920

name: One-Pot Baked Ziti
ingredients:
1 Red Onion, diced
1 package Ziti, uncooked
1 jar Tomato Puree (about 2 cups)
1½ cups Water, or just enough to cover the Pasta
4 Heaping Tbsp Fresh Ricotta
1 Small bunch Fresh Basil
1 cup Mozzarella, shredded
Salt, to taste
directions:
Heat a pan with olive oil over medium-high heat and quickly saute the onion until fragrant. Add the ziti, tomato puree and water. Stir to combine.
Cover and cook according to pasta box directions, then remove the cover.
Turn oven broil setting to high.
Dollop the ricotta into the pan and stir through the pasta to combine. Tear basil leaves into the pot and stir to gently wilt in the pasta.
Fold half of the shredded mozzarella into the pasta to incorporate, then sprinkle the other half over top for a cheesy layer. Taste; the cheese might have enough salt in it depending on the brand. If not, add salt to taste.
Place the uncovered casserole in the over on the second highest rack. Broil for 5 minutes or until the top cheese layer is golden.

name: One-Pot Broccoli Cheese Pasta
ingredients:
1 Tbsp Extra-Virgin Olive Oil
1 Yellow Onion, small and chopped
2 Garlic Cloves, minced
1 lb. Fusilli
1 Head of Broccoli, cut into small florets
3½ cups Water
2 cups Half-and-Half
Salt & Pepper
Pinch Crushed Red Pepper Flakes
2 cups Cheddar, shredded
1/2 cup Parmesan, freshly grated
directions:
In a large pot over medium heat, heat oil. Add onions and cook until soft, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute more.
Add pasta and broccoli, then stir in water and half-and-half. Season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and let simmer, stirring occasionally, until pasta is al dente, 12 to 14 minutes.
Add cheeses and stir until melted.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Total time 35 min.

name: One-Pot French Onion Pasta
ingredients:
2½ cups Pasta, uncooked (any small or mini shape works best)
4 Yellow Onions, large
3 cups Beef Bone Broth
3 Tbsp Butter, unsalted
3 Garlic Cloves, crushed
2-3 Fresh Thyme Sprigs
3/4 cup Heavy Cream
1/2 cup Parmesan, plus additional for garnish
directions:
To a large pan, drizzle olive oil and add butter. Then add thinly sliced onions. Cook on medium-low for 20-25 minutes until golden and caramelized. Stir frequently. If using a cast iron or heavy bottom pan, deglaze with a splash of chicken stock.
Add fresh thyme leaves and the stem, garlic, pasta and beef broth. Simmer on medium-high heat for 15 minutes or so until most of the liquid is absorbed. Stir frequently.
Remove the thyme stems. Add the heavy cream and Parmesan. Add back any leaves that didn't fall off during cooking. Stir to combine and simmer for a few minutes just enough to melt the cheese and heat up the cream. Garnish with additional thyme and parmesan. You can easily make a protein on the side and add to this dish or through in some mushrooms in the last ten minutes of cooking onions.

name: One-Pot Longhorn Pork & Bean Chili with Jalapeño & Smoky Red Pepper Crema
ingredients:
2 Scallions
1 Jalapeño
1 Roma Tomato
10 oz Ground Pork
2 Tbsp Southwest Spice Blend
2 Chicken Stock Concentrate
13.76 oz Crushed Tomatoes
1 Tex-mex paste
13.4 oz Black Beans
2 Tbsp Smoky Red Pepper Crema
directions:
Wash and dry produce. Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens. Thinly slice half the jalapeño into rounds; mince remaining. (TIP: Remove ribs and seeds for less heat.) Dice tomato.
Heat a large drizzle of oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add scallion whites and as much minced jalapeño as desired. Season with salt. Cook, stirring, until softened, 5-7 minutes.
Add pork and Southwest Spice to pot with aromatics; season with salt and pepper. Cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until pork is browned and cooked through, 4-6 minutes.
Stir diced tomato, Tex-Mex paste, and half the crushed tomatoes into pot; cook until slightly darkened in color, 1-2 minutes. Add beans and their liquid, stock concentrates, 1/4 cup water, salt, and pepper; stir to combine. Bring to a simmer and cook until thickened, 8-10 minutes. Turn off heat. (TIP: If chili is too thick, add another splash of water.) Taste and season with salt and pepper. Divide chili between bowls. Top with smoky red pepper crema, scallion greens, and as much sliced jalapeño as you like. Serve.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 30 min. Calories: 720

name: One-Pot Vegetable Broth and Pasta
ingredients:
1 Onion
4 Carrots
4 Celery Stalks
2 Garlic Cloves
8 cups Water
Salt & Pepper to taste
1 package Thin Pasta, angel hair or thins rings
directions:
Peel all the vegetables and garlic.
Add to a large pot with the water and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Simmer for 30-40 minutes or until the vegetables are very, very soft. Poke with a knife and make sure it comes out clean.
Use a slotted spoon to transfer the vegetables to a blender with 1 cup of the liquid. Blend smooth. Return the blended mixture to the pot with the remaining liquid and stir to make the final broth.
(If you want to lighten the color or make this go farther, you can add 1-2 cups additional water. You can also mix with chicken broth.)
Use in soups, and pastas, or store for future use.
To cook pasta in the broth: Bring 1 quart of the broth to a simmer over medium heat in a medium pot. Add 8 ounces of a small shape of pasta (such as pastina, orzo, or abc pasta). Simmer for the time on the pasta package, plus 2-4 minutes or until the pasta is tender and cooked through and the broth is mostly absorbed.
Add 1 tablespoon butter, a pinch of salt to taste, and Parmesan Cheese as desired. Add 1-2 tablespoons tomato paste for more flavor.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 35 min.

name: Orange Chocolate Mousse
ingredients:
For the Base:
1 sleeve Graham Crackers, 8-9 sheets
2 Tbsp Butter, melted
For the Mousse:
1 cup Orange & Tangerine Conscious Chocolate, or Chocolate Chips and 2 Tbsp Orange Flavoring
1 cup (8 oz) Full Fat Coconut Milk
1-2 Tbsp Sugar
directions:
Add the biscuits to a food processor and pulse until you have a fine crumb mixture. Add the melted butter and pulse again until combined.
Divide the base mixture between 4 dessert glasses/pots and refrigerate while you make the mousse layer.
Pour the coconut milk into a saucepan and heat over a medium heat until it starts to bubble, then take off the heat.
Break the chocolate into a heat-proof dish, add in the sugar and pour in the hot coconut milk. Leave to sit for a minute, then whisk until you have a smooth velvety mixture.
Pour into the glasses/pots, and leave to cool slightly before transferring to the fridge to set. Allow to chill in the fridge for 2-3 hours, or until set.
Enjoy!
notes: Add some orange zest to kick up the orange flavor

name: Orange Julius
ingredients:
6 oz Frozen Orange Juice
1 cup Milk
1 cup Water
1/2 cup Sugar
1 tsp Vanilla
3/4 tray Ice Cubes
directions: Blend everything together in bender until desired consistency.

name: Orange Rolls
ingredients:
3 Eggs
1 cup Milk
3 Tbsp Butter
1 package Yeast
1/4 cup Water with 1 tsp Sugar
4-5 cups Flour
1/2 cup Sugar
1 tsp Salt
1/2 cup Butter, softened
1 large Orange, grated
1/2 cup Sugar
directions:
Beat eggs in a large bread bowl.
Scald milk, add butter, sugar and salt, and cool to lukewarm.
Add yeast mixture.
Add 1 cup of flour and mix well with a whip.
Let rise 1-2 hours then add remaining flour.
Mix well with a spoon. Don't knead.
Cover and let rise 2 hours.
Mix the last three ingredients.
Roll out dough as for cinnamon rolls.
Spread with the above mixture.
Cut into 2 dozen rolls and let rise for 1 hour.
Bake at 355 degrees for 12-15 minutes.

name: Orange Sherbet Punch
ingredients:
1 qt. Orange Sherbet, divided
1 qt. Lime Sherbet, divided
1 (2-liter) bottle Ginger Ale, chilled
2 cups Cranberry Juice, chilled
2 cups Pineapple Juice, chilled
2 Limes, thinly sliced
1 Orange, thinly sliced
1 bag Raspberries, frozen
Fresh Mint
directions:
Freeze sherbet scoops: Scoop 6 scoops each of the orange and lime sherbets into a 12-cup standard muffin pan, about 1/3 cup per cavity. Freeze until ready to serve.
Mix punch: Combine ginger ale, cranberry juice, pineapple juice, and 2 cups each of the remaining orange and lime sherbet in a large punch bowl, stirring occasionally, until sherbet melts, about 5 minutes. Stir in frozen scoops of sherbet, lime slices, orange slices, and raspberries. Garnish with mint. Serve immediately.

name: Orange Shortbread Cookie Sticks
ingredients:
2 cups All-Purpose Flour
1 cup Butter, unsalted
3/4 cup Castor Sugar
2 Tbsp Orange Juice
2 Tbsp Orange Zest
1/4 tsp Salt
1/2 tsp Cardamom Powder
Chocolate Dip:
5½ oz Dark Chocolate (60-70% cocoa solids), melted (Ideally, use tempered chocolate.)
1-2 tsp Coconut Oil, melted
directions:
Sift flour and salt together in a medium sized bowl and set aside.
Take another large bowl and cream butter and sugar together for at least 3-5 minutes,until the butter color is changed to pale.
Add the orange juice, orange zest and cardamom powder to the butter and beat again.
Add the flour into the beaten butter and work until a dough is formed.
If the dough is crumbly, add one tablespoon of water and mix until a dough is formed.
Roll the dough out into a rough rectangle (about a centimeter thick and 12 centimeters across).
Place it in the fridge for 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven at 300 F.
Take out the dough and cut it into cookies using a sharp knife into 1cmx1cmx12cm sticks.
Tip: I find this cookie stick size the cutest and perfect for dipping into coffee or cocoa, but feel free to make the cookie sticks whatever size you like best.
Carefully transfer the cookie sticks onto the lined baking sheet. Make sure that they're fairly straight and correct any bending.
Place the cookies on a silicone sheet on a baking tray.
Place the baking tray in the middle rack of the oven and bake for 12-15 minutes, until the edges are light golden.
Take the cookies out of the oven and place on a wire rack to cool.
Chocolate dip: Melt chocolate over double broiler.
If your melted chocolate is too thick and viscous, add 1-2 teaspoons of melted coconut oil to loosen it up. You want to be able to achieve an even, fairly thin layer of chocolate on the shortbread.
Transfer the melted chocolate into a narrow glass or other narrow container that will give you a deep layer of chocolate (you want to be able to dip at least half of a cookie stick into chocolate).
Dip the cookie sticks into the melted chocolate. After dipping, gently shake them to help any excess chocolate to drip away, then transfer the chocolate-dipped cookie sticks onto a lined baking sheet.
For extra decoration, transfer any remaining chocolate into a piping bag (re-melt it if necessary) and use it to pipe zig-zag lines over the chocolate-dipped end of the cookie stick.
Alternatively, you can also decorate them with sprinkles of choice.
notes: I mixed the orange shortbread cookies with the melted chocolate from the two authors. Reference their pages if something seems wrong. Bakecellence and The Loopy Whisk

name: Oreo Cheesecake Tart
ingredients:
Crust:
2 cups Oreos, crushed
1/2 cup Unsalted Butter, melted
Cheesecake:
8 oz Cream Cheese, room temperature
3 Tbsp Peanut Butter
1/2 cup Cream (35% fat content)
1 tsp Vanilla
1 cup Powdered Sugar
Ganache:
⅓ cup Dark Chocolate
3/4 cup Cream (35% fat content)
Topping:
3/4 cup Reeses Peanut Butter cups, chopped
directions:
Crust: Add whole Oreos to a food processor and blend until you reach a fine crumb. Add melted butter and mix until well combined. It should look like wet soil.
Add to a tart tin either rectangle (36 cm x 13 cm) or round 12 inches. Use the back of a spoon to evenly distribute crust around pressing down firmly on the side and bottom. Chill for 1 hour.
Cheesecake: Add all ingredients to a large mixing bowl and use a hand mixer or a wooden spoon and mix until well combined.
Ganache: Add chocolate and cream to a microwave safe bowl and microwave for 20 seconds at a time mixing each time until it becomes smooth.
Add cheesecake to the tart tin and use a Tbsp to spread evenly. Pour on ganache (set aside a little to drizzle on top) and spread evenly. Sprinkle the chopped Reeses peanut butter cups, drizzle more ganache on top.
Serve chilled.

name: Oven Baked Jalapeño Poppers
ingredients:
8 Jalapeños
4 oz Goats Chèvre (1/3 cup) or Feta Cheese
1/3 cup Cream Cheese or Sour Cream
1/4 tsp Salt
1/2 tsp Onion Powder
1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
1/4 tsp Pepper
1/4 cup Panko Breadcrumbs
4 Tbsp Green Onions, chopped
4 Tbsp Buffalo Sauce, optional
1/4 cup Bacon, cooked
directions:
Set oven to 375º Slice the tops off of the Jalapeños. Cut the jalapeños in half vertically and scoop out the seeds/white flesh and discard. Wash your hands after! In a small bowl mix sour cream, goat cheese, seasoning together well.
Line a cooking sheet with parchment paper. Gently scoop and fill each jalapeño with goat cheese mix and dip in panko or sprinkle the panko breadcrumbs over the top. Bake for 15-18 minutes or until panko and jalapeños are slightly browned. Sprinkle onions, bacon if using, and sauce over before serving and enjoy!
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 18 min

name: Pancetta White Pizzas with Baby Broccoli, Ricotta, and Herbs de Provence
ingredients:
6 oz Baby Broccoli
4 oz Pancetta
4 oz Ricotta Cheese
1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
1 tsp Herbes de Provence
2 Flatbreads
1/4 cup Parmesan Cheese
8 tsp Olive Oil
directions:
Wash and dry all produce. Adjust broiler rack so that it is in position closest to flame and place a baking sheet on rack. Preheat broiler to high. Cut baby broccoli into bite-size pieces.
Heat a large pan over medium-high heat. Add pancetta and cook until it begins to release oil, about 2 minutes. Add 1 Tbsp olive oil and baby broccoli to pan. Cook, tossing, until baby broccoli is tender and lightly crisped, 3-4 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Remove pan from heat.
While everything cooks, in a small bowl, mix together ricotta, a large drizzle of olive oil, 1/2 tsp garlic powder, 1/2 tsp herbs de Provence, and a large pinch of salt and pepper (we sent more of the garlic powder and herbs).
Spread ricotta mixture evenly over flatbreads. Scatter pancetta and baby broccoli on top, followed by Parmesan.
Carefully remove baking sheet from broiler and sprinkle with a drizzle of olive oil. Place flatbreads on sheet and sprinkle each with a drizzle of olive oil. Return sheet to broiler and broil until cheese melts and flatbreads are crisp and golden, 3-4 minutes. TIP: Keep an eye out for any burning—broiler heat varies widely.
Sprinkle flatbreads with remaining herbs de Provence, cut into slices, and serve.
notes: Cook time 20 min. Calories: 810

name: Panda Express Honey Walnut Shrimp
ingredients:
HONEY SAUCE:
1/2 cup Mayonnaise
1/4 cup Honey
1 Tbsp Sweetened Condensed Milk
1/2 Tbsp White Vinegar
CANDIED WALNUTS:
1/2 cup White sugar
1/2 cup Water
1 cup Walnuts
SHRIMP:
1 lb Large shrimp deveined, peeled, and tail off
1/2 tsp Salt
1/2 Tsp Pepper
TEMPURA BATTER:
4 Egg Whites, large
2/3 cup Cornstarch
1 tsp Baking Powder
1/2 tsp Baking Soda
1 tsp Chili Powder
1 tsp Paprika
1 tsp Garlic Powder
1 tsp Salt
1/2 tsp Pepper
OTHER:
Vegetable Oil for frying
Scallions to garnish
Jasmine Rice for serving
directions:
To make the sauce:In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, honey, sweetened condensed milk, and distilled white vinegar. Mix until smooth and set aside.
Candy the Walnuts: Heat a small pan or pot over medium heat. Add the water and sugar and bring to a boil. Boil for 2 minutes and then add the walnuts. Boil for another 2 minutes. Take out the walnuts with a slotted spoon and transfer to a plate or tray and set aside.
TO MAKE THE TEMPURA BATTER:
In a mixing bowl, add the egg whites. Use a hand mixer to beat the egg whites until fluffy and bubbly.
Add the cornstarch, baking powder, baking soda, chili powder, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper and whisk together. Set aside.
Shrimp: Toss shrimp in a large bowl with salt and black pepper.
Heat oil to 350°F in a wok or pot. Dip each shrimp in the batter and then let any excess drip off before dropping in the fryer. Make sure not to overcrowd them. Fry in batches if needed.
Fry the shrimp until golden brown, about 5 minutes. Take out with a slotted spoon and transfer to a wire rack to let any excess oil drip off.
Transfer the shrimp and walnuts to a deep bowl. Add the sauce (as much or as little as you like) and toss it.
Garnish with sliced green onions and serve with rice. Enjoy immediately for maximum crispiness.
notes: Prep time 30 min and Cook time 15 min.

name: Pasta e Ceci (Italian Pasta and Chickpea Stew)
ingredients:
3 Tbsp Extra-Virgin Olive Oil, plus more for garnish
1 cup Yellow Onion, finely chopped
1 Sprig Fresh Rosemary
3 Tbsp Tomato Paste
3 Garlic Cloves, minced1/4-1/2 tsp Crushed Red Pepper Flakes
1 (15 oz) can Chickpeas, drained and rinsed
6 cups Vegetable or Chicken Broth
1 cup Ditalini Pasta, uncooked
1/2 tsp Salt
1/2 tsp Pepper
4 cups Kale Leaves, chopped
1/3 cup Pecorino Romano, freshly grated cheese plus more for garnish
directions:
Heat 3 Tbsp olive oil in a large soup pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Once hot, add onions and rosemary sprig; cook 6 to 7 minutes, until onions soften.
Stir in tomato paste, garlic, and red pepper flakes; cook 3 more minutes, stirring occasionally, allowing tomato paste to caramelize.
Add chickpeas and stir to coat. Use the back of a fork (or spoon) to mash about half of the chickpeas while they simmer. (This helps create a creamier broth.) Sauté chickpeas for 3 minutes total.
Add broth and stir to release any browned bits stuck to the bottom of the pot. Bring mixture to a boil, add pasta, and season with salt and pepper. Slightly reduce heat to bring soup to a simmer.
Simmer, uncovered, until pasta is al dente, about 10 minutes.
Remove rosemary sprig and stir in kale (or escarole) and grated Pecorino Romano cheese. Continue cooking, uncovered, until the greens are wilted, about 2 more minutes. Taste and add more salt and pepper, if needed.
Ladle the soup into bowls, and garnish with additional grated cheese and a drizzle of olive oil.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 20 min

name: Pasta with Sun-Dried Tomato Pesto
ingredients:
12 oz Penne Pasta
1 (8.5 oz) jar Sun-Dried Tomatoes packed in olive oil
2 Garlic Cloves
Salt & Pepper
1 cup Fresh Basil
1/2 cups Parmesan Cheese, freshly grated
directions:
Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender but still but still firm to the bite, stirring occasionally, about 8 minutes.
Meanwhile, blend the sun-dried tomatoes and the oil, garlic, salt and pepper to taste, and basil in a food processor and blend until tomatoes are finely chopped.
Transfer the tomato mixture to a large bowl. Stir in the Parmesan.
Add the pasta to the pesto and toss to coat, adding enough reserved cooking liquid to moisten.
Season the pasta, to taste, with salt and pepper.

name: Pastina Soup
ingredients:
6 cups Vegetable Broth
1 Yellow Onion, small
4 Garlic Cloves
2 Celery Stalks
2 Carrots, large
1/2 lb. Pastina (Acini de Pepe)
2 oz Parmesan
1/2 tsp Pepper
directions:
Clean all your veggies. Peel and half the onion, peel the garlic, and cut the ends off and half the celery stalks and carrots.
In a large pot, bring the vegetable broth to a boil and add the prepared vegetables. Cover and boil for 15 minutes.
Remove the vegetables and add them to a blender with about 1/4 cup of the broth.
Blend until smooth and add the puree back to the boiling broth. Stir to combine.
Add the pastina, cover, and boil for an additional 8 minutes, stirring halfway through.
Serve hot with freshly grated parmesan and pepper.

name: Peach Cake
ingredients:
1½ cups All-Purpose Flour (180g)
1½ tsp Baking Powder
½ tsp Salt
¾ cup Butter, unsalted and softened (170g)
1 cup Sugar (200g)
2 Eggs, large
¼ cup Sour Cream, room temperature (60g)
1 Tbsp Vanilla Extract
2 cups Peaches, peeled, pitted, and sliced (400g/2 to 3 peaches)
directions:
Preheat the oven to 350F. Grease a 9-inch round cake pan with butter or baking spray.
In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
In a large mixing bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer with the paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until creamy. Add the sugar and beat until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Add the eggs one at a time, scraping down the bowl and beating well after each addition. Beat in the sour cream and vanilla.
With the mixer on low speed, gradually add the flour mixture just until combined. Fold in three-quarters of the peaches. Spread the batter into the prepared cake pan. Sprinkle the top with the remaining peaches and additional sugar, if desired.
Bake for 45 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool for at least 30 minutes before serving. Cake can be covered and stored at room temperature for up to 3 days.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 45 min

name: Peach Cobbler
ingredients:
4 cups Peaches, sliced
1/3 cup Sugar
2 Tbsp Cornstarch
1½ cups Flour
2 tsp Baking Powder
1/3 cup Sugar
1/2 tsp Salt
4 Tbsp Shortening
1 Egg, beaten
2/3 cup Milk
directions:
Mix peach ingredients and bring to a boil.
To make biscuit dough, cut shortening into dry ingredients.
Mix egg and milk together and add to rest of mixture, stirring just enough to combine.
Arrange dough by spoonfuls.
Bake for 400 degrees for 20 minutes.

name: Peach, Pesto, and Prosciutto Pizza
ingredients:
1 Pizza Dough
All-Purpose Flour, for dusting
1/2 cup Pesto, homemade or jarred
2 Fresh Ears of Corn, shucked
4 oz Fresh Mozzarella Cheese, thinly sliced or shredded
1 Peach, thinly sliced
1/3 cup Red Onion, thinly sliced
1/4 cup Parmesan Cheese, freshly grated
2 oz thinly sliced Prosciutto (sub 1/3 cup sliced sun-dried tomatoes if making vegetarian)
Fresh Basil leaves, for garnish
Chili Flakes
directions:
Preheat oven to 500ºF (or 375ºF for mom's pizza crust). Place a large piece of parchment paper on a work surface and lightly sprinkle with flour. Place pizza dough on parchment paper, and sprinkle dough with more flour for easy handling.
Use your fingertips to press dimples in dough, working from the center toward the outer edge and maintaining a circular shape. (Note: if using a baking sheet instead of a pizza stone, form the dough into more of an oval shape so it fits in the baking sheet.)
Stop dimpling 1″ before outer edge of dough (this will become the crust, and you want it to rise and puff higher than the center of the dough). Stretch dough over the backs of your hands, moving in a circular (or oval) pattern to create a 13″ to 14″ round.
Use the back of a spoon to spread pesto evenly over dough, stopping at inner edge of the crust. Cut kernels from corn and scatter over pesto, followed by slices of mozzarella.
Next, arrange peach slices, red onion, and prosciutto overtop.
Use a pizza peel to transfer pizza to preheated stone or baking sheet. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes, until crust is golden and cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove from oven and top with fresh basil leaves, Parmesan Cheese, and a pinch of chili flakes, if desired.
notes: Prep time 20 min and Cook time 15 min

name: Peanut Brittle
ingredients:
1 cup Cornstarch
2 cups Sugar
1/2 cup Water
1/2 cup Raw Peanuts
2 Tbsp Butter
2 tsp Vanilla
2 tsp Baking Soda
1/2 tsp Salt
directions:
Combine syrup, sugar and water in a saucepan.
Slowly bring to 230 degrees or until syrup spins a thread.
Add peanuts and continue to cook to 300 degrees.
Remove from heat, add remaining ingredients.
Stir until blended.
Pour into well buttered jiffy roll pan or large platter.
Then, if desired, put on counter top and pull when cool and break into pieces.

name: Peanut Butter and Honey Oatmeal Drops
ingredients:
1½ cups All-Purpose Flour
1 tsp Baking Soda
1 tsp Salt
1½ cups Quick Cooking Rolled Oats
1½ cups Crunchy Peanut Butter
2 cups Honey
3 Eggs
1 Tbsp Water
2 tsp Vanilla
2 cups Craisins or Raisins
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a medium bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, salt and oats.
In a large bowl, mix together peanut butter, honey, eggs, water, vanilla until well blended. Add flour mixture and mix well. Fold in Craisins. Refrigerate dough for 30 minutes until firm.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls, about 2-inches apart, onto prepared cookie sheet. Bake in preheated oven for 12 to 15 minutes or until tops spring back when lightly touched. Immediately transfer to wire racks to cool.

name: Peanut Butter Chip Scones
ingredients:
2 cups All-Purpose Flour
1/2 cup Sugar
2 tsp Baking Powder
1/2 tsp Baking Soda
1/2 tsp Salt
6 Tbsp Butter, cold and cubed
1/2 cup Peanut Butter
1/3 cup Heavy Cream
1 Egg, beaten
1/4 cup Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips
1/4 cup Peanut Butter Chips
1 Tbsp Milk
1 Tbsp Coarse Sugar, for dusting
directions:
Preheat oven to 425 F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Cut the cold butter into the dry ingredients with a pastry cutter, two forks, or crumble the butter in with your fingers.
Mix in the peanut butter, heavy cream, beaten egg, and both chocolate chips until completely combines and chocolate chips are evenly dispersed. (Do NOT over mix even with extra chunks of butter.)
Form dough into mounds and place on baking sheet, leaving about 2 inches between the scones. Don't compact them too much or they will lose their fluffiness.
Brush milk over the raw scones and sprinkle with sugar.
Bake for about 12 minutes, or until edges are golden brown. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

name: Peanut Butter Chocolate Mousse
ingredients:
4 oz Dark Chocolate, melted
2 Tbsp Peanut Butter, warmed
1/2 cup Aquafaba Liquid
1/2 tsp Cream of Tartar
1/2 tsp Vanilla Extract
1 Tbsp Sugar
Chocolate Shavings
directions:
Whip aquafaba with cream of tartar, sugar, and vanilla to stiff peaks.
Melt chocolate and peanut butter until smooth. Allow to slightly cool.
Gently fold aquafaba into the mixture until completely mixed.
Fill in cups and chill for at least 1 hour. Top with shaved chocolate and serve.

name: Peanut Butter Chocolate Oreo Pie
ingredients:
24 Oreos
6 Tbsp Butter, melted
8 oz Cream Cheese
3/4 cup Peanut Butter
2 Tbsp Maple Syrup
8 oz Cool Whip (1 tub)
directions:
Preheat oven to 350F.
In a food processor, blend the oreos and melted butter. Press into a greased pie dish making sure to go up the sides. Cook the crust for 10 minutes. Let cool.
Using a mixer, blend cream cheese, syrup and peanut butter until smooth. Fold in cool whip until combined.
Pour into the oreo crust and top with extra cool whip (or whipped cream), peanut butter drizzle and oreo crumbs.
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

name: Peanut Butter Cookie Brownie Bars
ingredients:
1 package (19.9 oz) Dark Chocolate Brownie Mix, Duncan Hines
1/2 cups Vegetable Oil
1/4 cup Milk
2 Eggs
1 package (16 oz) Refrigerated Filled Peanut Butter Cookie Dough, Nestle Ultimates
directions:
Preheat oven to 350.
Spray 9" square baking pan with cooking spray.
In a large bowl, stir together brownie mix, oil, milk, and eggs until well mixed. Pour half the batter into prepared baking pan.
Break apart cookie dough pieces and randomly drop the pieces into the batter.
Pour the rest of the remaining batter over the cookie dough and spread it smoothly.
(Sprinkle on the nuts).
Bake for 50-55 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
notes: sprinkle 1 package (2¼ oz) of nuts on top is desired

name: Peanut Butter Cup Ice Cream
ingredients:
2 cup Heavy Whipping Cream
14 oz Sweetened Condensed Milk
1/2 cup Unsweetened Cocoa Powder
1/2 cup Peanut Butter
40 Reese's Miniatures
directions:
Place Reese's in freezer long enough for them to harden.
Add cocoa powder to sweetened condensed milk and stir until dissolved.
Heat Peanut Butter in microwave for 20 seconds to melt, then stir and set aside to cool.
In a large bowl, whisk heavy cream until soft peaks form.
Fold in condensed milk mixture until blended.
Unwrap and cut peanut butter cups in quarters.
Fold 2/3 of the candy into the mixture.
Spread a third of this mixture into a loaf pan and drizzle with melted peanut butter.
Repeat this for two more layers.
Take a knife and run through pan to swirl mixture.
Top with the remaining candy pieces.
Cover with foil and freeze for 6 hours or until firm.

name: Peanut Butter Cup Pizza
ingredients:
1 Pizza Crust
2½ cups Flour
1 Tbsp Sugar
1 Tbsp Yeast
1/2 tsp Salt
1 cup Warm Water
2 Tbsp Oil
Enough Chocolate Chips to cover a pizza crust
Reese's Peanut Butter Cups
Some form of Peanut Butter Drizzle
directions:
Make Pizza Crust: mix 2 cups of flour, sugar, yeast, and salt.
Add water and oil; mix well.
Add remaining flour.
Knead 5 minutes.
Roll out pizza dough.
Bake at 375 degrees for 15-20 minutes.
While the crust is still warm, spread chocolate chips across the crust.
Cut up reese's Peanut Butter cups and sprinkle across.
Drizzle peanut Butter drizzle stuff on top of everything.
notes: Makes one pizza crust

name: Peanut Butter Frosting
ingredients:
1/3 cup Creamy Peanut Butter
4½ cups Powdered Sugar
1/4 cup Milk
1½ tsp Vanilla
directions:
In a mixing bowl beat peanut butter till fluffy. Gradually add 2 cups of powdered sugar. Beat well.
Slowly beat in the 1/4 cup of milk and vanilla.
Slowly beat in remaining powdered sugar.
Beat in additional milk, if needed, to reach spreading consistency.
notes: Add additional milk to thin consistency.

name: Peanut Butter Lava Cake
ingredients:
Peanut Butter Sauce:
1 cup Heavy Cream
1 cup Smooth Peanut Butter
1/3 cup Sugar
2 Tbsp Corn syrup
Lava Cake:
8 oz Dark Chocolate, chopped
8 Tbsp Butter, unsalted and divided
2 Eggs
2 Egg Yolks
2/3 cup Sugar
1/4 cup Flour, sifted
1 Tbsp Dark cocoa powder sifted
8 Tbsp Smooth Peanut Butter
directions:
Peanut Butter Sauce: In a small saucepan, combine all peanut butter sauce ingredients and cook over medium heat until sugar is dissolved. Set aside to cool.
Lava Cake: Preheat oven to 425 F. With one Tbsp of butter, grease for 1 cup ramekins or cake molds well.
In a medium heatproof bowl set over a pot of simmering water, melt chocolate and remaining butter, stirring occasionally.
In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, yolks and sugar until combined, then add the flour and cocoa powder. Add the chocolate mixture and mix until well combined.
Spoon an eighth of the chocolate mixture into each mold, then make a well in the batter and spoon 2 tablespoons of peanut butter into the center of each.
Cover with the remaining chocolate mixture, and place all 4 molds on a sturdy baking sheet. Bake for about 13 minutes, or until sides are set but the center of the cakes retain a bit of a jiggle.
Turn out cakes as quickly as possible, top with peanut butter sauce, dust with cocoa powder and serve immediately. It is important to serve lava cakes before they cool so the center will remain liquid.

name: Peanut Butter Ramen
ingredients:
For the broth:
1 Tbsp Sesame Oil
1 thumb Ginger
1 bunch Spring Onions
1 tsp Chili Oil
1 tsp Tumeric
1 Tbsp Soy Sauce
1 tsp Miso Paste
1 Tbsp Peanut Butter
1 Tbsp Tahini
1-1½ liter Vegetable Stock (with 1 stock cube)
1/2 can Coconut Milk
1 Lime
Sugar, Salt, & Pepper to taste
For the Protein Glaze:
2 Tbsp Cornstarch
1 Tbsp Garlic
1 Tbsp Ginger Powder
1 Tbsp Soy Sauce
1 tsp Miso Paste
1 tsp Peanut Butter
1-2 Tbsp Water
To serve:
4 servings Rice Noodles
Broccoli
Bok Choy
Toasted Sesame Seeds
Spring Onion Greens
Chili Oil
Lime Juice
directions:
Mince the garlic, ginger and chili. Then fry in 2 Tbsp sesame oil until fragrant.
Mix the veg stock with the miso, tahini, peanut butter. Then mix in the coconut milk.
Season with 1 Tbsp soy sauce, 1 tsp turmeric, black pepper, and 1 Tbsp sugar. Simmer for 15-20 minutes. Then season with lime juice
To make the glaze for protein of choice (Chicken, pork, tofu), mix garlic, ginger powder, soy sauce,  and peanut butter. Add a splash of water to loosen.
Cut the cooked protein into cubes and coat in cornstarch and seasoning, and fry in 2 Tbsp sesame oil until crispy. Toss in glaze and coat well.
Cook the noodles and veg. Slice spring onion and toast sesame seeds.
Bowl up - Noodles, broth, protein, veg, garnishes, and enjoy!

name: Pecan-Crusted Chicken with Honey Mustard Sauce & Lemony Apple Salad
ingredients:
1 Tbsp Butter
1/2 oz Pecans
1/4 cup Panko Breadcrumbs
1 Tbsp Fry Seasoning
2 tsp Honey
2 tsp Dijon Mustard
2 Tbsp Mayo
10 oz Chicken Cutlets
1 Apple
1 Lemon
2 oz Mixed Greens
directions:
Adjust rack to middle position and preheat oven to 450 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Finely chop pecans (or crush in a bag with a rolling pin).
Place 1 Tbsp Butter in a medium microwave-safe bowl. Microwave until melted, 30 seconds. Let cool slightly, then stir in chopped pecans, panko, half the fry seasoning (you'll use the rest later), a drizzle of olive oil, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
In a small bowl, combine honey, mustard, and mayo.
Season chicken with remaining fry seasoning, salt, and pepper. Place on a lightly oiled baking sheet (or parchment paper). Evenly spread tops of chicken with a thin layer of honey mustard sauce (save the rest for serving). Mound with pecan mixture, pressing firmly to adhere (no need to coat the undersides of the chicken). Roast on middle rack until crust is golden brown and chicken is cooked through, 15-20 minutes.
Salad: Meanwhile, halve, core, and thinly slice apple. Quarter lemon. In a large bowl, toss mixed greens and apple with a large drizzle of olive oil and as much lemon juice as you like. Season with salt and pepper.
Divide chicken and salad between plates. Drizzle chicken with remaining honey mustard sauce. Serve with any remaining lemon wedges on the side.
notes: 610 calories. Prep 5 min and cook 30 min

name: Peppercorn Sauce
ingredients:
1 Cucumber, peeled and grated
1 tsp Salt
2 cups Low-Fat Plain Greek Yogurt
1/2 Lemon, juiced
4 Garlic Cloves
1 tsp Dill Weed, dried
1 tsp Mint, fresh and chopped
2 tsp Peppercorns
directions:
In a medium bowl, add cucumber and sprinkle with salt. Let sit for 10 minutes, then place in a cloth or paper towel and squeeze out all the liquid.
In a separate large bowl, add yogurt, lemon juice, garlic, dill, mint, and peppercorns. Whisk to combine. Add cucumber and mix thoroughly. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use.
notes: This is a sauce for Disneyland’s Ronto Wraps. Add sauce to pita bread with scrambled eggs, pork sausage, and cheese for breakfast. Add sauce to pita bread with sausage and coleslaw for Disney style.

name: Peppermint Hot Chocolate Molten Cake
ingredients:
1/2 cup Butter, unsalted
6 oz Bittersweet Chocolate, melted
2 Eggs, large
2 Egg Yolks, large
1/4 cup Sugar
Pinch of Sea Salt
2 Tbsp All-Purpose Flour
1 tsp Peppermint Extract
Peppermint Ganache:
8 oz Bittersweet or Semi-Sweet Chocolate
1/2 cup Heavy Cream
1 tsp Cayenne Pepper
4 drops Peppermint Extract
directions:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Butter and lightly flour four 6-oz ramekins. Tap out excess flour over sink.
Place a nonreactive bowl over a pot of simmering water.
Add butter and chocolate to bowl and melt together, stirring occasionally.
In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs and egg yolks, sugar and salt until pale and thickened.
Whisk chocolate and butter mixture until completely smooth. Using a rubber spatula, quickly fold the chocolate mixture into egg mixture along with the flour until smooth. Add peppermint extract and mix.
Evenly pour batter into prepared ramekins. Transfer ramekins to a rimmed sheet tray and bake in oven until tops are almost set but center is jiggly, about 12 minutes.
In the meantime, prepare ganache. Place chocolate in a nonreactive bowl. Heat heavy cream in a saucepan over medium heat just until cream reaches a boil.
Pour hot cream over chocolate and let stand for 1 minute. Stir chocolate with cayenne until smooth, about 2 minutes. Add peppermint extract and stir. Set aside.
Remove cakes from oven and allow to cool in ramekins for 1 minute. Place dessert plate on top of each ramekin and flip cakes.
Let ramekins stand for 10 seconds before removing. Drizzle ganache over the tops of the cakes and allow to drip.

name: Pfefferneusse (Pepper Nuts)
ingredients:
1 cup Molasses
1 cup White Karo Syrup
1/2 cup Shortening
3/4 cup Brown Sugar
1/2 Lemon, juiced (use real lemon)
1 Lemon, zested
1 tsp Cinnamon
1/2 tsp Cloves
1/2 tsp Allspice
5 cups Flour
1/2 tsp Baking Soda
directions:
Warm molasses, karo syrup, shortening, and brown sugar in  pot and stir until dissolved.
Add lemon juice, rind, and spices.
Add flour mixed with baking soda.
Stir then refrigerate until chilled.
Make rolls about the size of a penny.
Cut several rolls at a time if you like, 1/3 inch thick.
Bake at 350 degrees for 8 minutes.
Let cool a few seconds before removing from cookie sheet.

name: Pie Crust
ingredients:
3 cups Flour
2 tsp Sugar
1 tsp Salt
1¼ cups Shortening
1 Tbsp Vinegar
1 Egg
5 Tbsp Water
directions:
Mix flour, sugar, and salt together in a medium sized bowl.
Cut in the shortening.
In a small bowl, mix the vinegar, egg, and water together.
Then mix all ingredients together.
Don't stir for too long or the crust won't be moist.
Divide into 2-3 balls.
Roll ball of dough out on a floured piece of wax paper.
Flip wax paper over into the pie pan.

name: Pineapple Coconut Smoothie
ingredients:
1/2 cup Sweetened Coconut Milk
1/2 cup Pineapple, frozen
1 Banana
1/4 to 1/2 cup Vanilla Greek Yogurt
1 tsp Honey
directions:
Put coconut milk, pineapple, and banana into a blender and blend for about 15 seconds.
Add the yogurt and honey, and blend until smooth.
Serve as a smoothie or turn the mixture into popsicles.

name: Pineapple Fried Rice and Shrimp
ingredients:
1 cup Jasmine Rice
1 can (20 oz) Pineapple Tidbits, drained
4 Green Onions, chopped
1 large Red Chili, minced
2 sprigs Cilantro, coarsely chopped
2 cups Fresh Shrimp, cleaned and deveined
3 Tbsp Oil
2 Garlic Cloves, minced
2 Tbsp Fish Sauce
1½ Tbsp Soy Sauce
1 tsp Sugar
Cilantro for garnish
directions:
Prepare rice according to package directions and set aside. In a medium bowl, combine pineapple, onions, chili and cilantro. Mix and set aside.
Heat 1 Tbsp oil in skillet, saute shrimp until done. Remove shrimp from skillet. In same skillet, over medium heat, add remaining oil. Saute garlic until golden brown. Add cooked rice and stir.
Add fish sauce, soy sauce, and sugar. Stir and heat thoroughly. Fold in pineapple mixture and shrimp. Heat through. Garnish with cilantro.

name: Pineapple Upside-Down Pancakes
ingredients:
Favorite Pancake Batter
Can of Pineapple Rings
Maraschino Cherries
1/2 cup Pineapple Juice
1/3 cup Brown Sugar
1/4 cup Butter
directions:
Throw some pineapple rings down on a griddle to toast gently on one side. Flip the pineapple slices over and put a maraschino cherry in the center of each.
Fairly quickly pour over with your favorite pancake batter. It’s important not to let the other side cook too much before you pour your batter because the sugar in the pineapple may burn.
Combine 1/2 cup pineapple juice, 1/3 cup brown sugar, and 1/4 cup butter. Reduce until thickened into a syrup.

name: Pita Chips
ingredients:
1 Tbsp Sesame Seeds
6 small Pita Breads
1 Egg White, slightly beaten
directions:
Preheat the oven to 350.
Toast the sesame seeds for 1 minutes over low heat in a small frying pan. Remove from heat.
Brush the pita with the egg white. Sprinkle with the toasted sesame seeds. Cut each pita into 6 wedges. Arrange the wedges in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake until lightly brown, about 8 minutes. Transfer to a rack and let cool.
The chips can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for 2 weeks.

name: Pork Bao Buns
ingredients:
For Bao Dough:
1 cup water
2 tsp Yeast
2½ cups Bread Flour
½ cup Corn Starch
5 Tbsp Sugar
2 Tsp Fine Sea Salt
2 Tbsp Butter
For Pork Filling:
300g Pork Mince
1 Garlic Clove, minced or 1 tsp Garlic Powder
1 Tbsp Soy Sauce
1 Tbsp Rice Wine Vinegar
1 Tbsp Honey
2 Tbsp Oyster Sauce
2 Tbsp Sesame Oil
Sprinkle of Salt
directions:
Bread Dough: Mix yeast in water that is warmed up to lukewarm (about 98 F). Let sit for 10 minutes.
In a stand mixer bowl, add the bread flour, cornstarch, sugar, and sea salt. Whisk together at first to incorporate all ingredients then add yeast and water mixture in the bowl gradually.
If needed or too dry, add 1 tbsp of water at a time. Add 2 tbsp of softened unsalted butter.
Mix 8-10 minutes until smooth and looks cohesive, gently shape dough into a ball. In a greased bowl, put inside, damp towel, let rise for 1.5 hr or until doubled in size.
Filling: Mix all filling ingredients in a separate bowl.
Assembly: Shape dough into a long log, 18 in long. Ideally you would get 12-14 pieces of dough.
Roll over the cut side. Do an 8 turn roll by rolling an eighth of the dough turning it, then rolling it again, leaving a thick center and a thin outside leaving a little bubble in the center for the filling. When rolled out with a rolling pin, the dough should be 4-5 inches in diameter.
Add enough filling so that there is a half inch border around the whole bao.
Pleat by pinching the dough then pressing it on the pinched edge repeatedly until the bao closes. You can also try wrapping them like a Taco Bell Crunchwrap.
Steamer basket setup: 2 inches of water and bring to a boil. Place steamer basket on top of the pot of boiling water without having the basket touch the water. 12-15 mins or until pork reaches an internal temp of 145F. Avoid opening the steamer baskets early as it will release the collected steam and slow cooking time.
notes: Dough rises for about 1.5 hours. You’ll need steamer baskets!
original_author: Three Way Cut, Josh Weissman, and Keslie Remer

name: Pork Chili 'n' Cheese Stuffed Poblanos with Black Beans, Fresh Salsa & Smoky Red Pepper Lime Crema
ingredients:
2 Poblano Peppers
1 Roma Tomato
1 Yellow Onion
1 Lime
13.4 oz can Black Beans
2 Tbsp Smoky Red Pepper Crema
10 oz Ground Pork
1 Tbsp Southwest Spice Blend
1½ oz Tomato Paste
1 Chicken Stock Concentrate
1/2 cup White Cheddar Cheese
1 tsp Hot Sauce
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Halve poblanos lengthwise; remove stems and seeds. Dice tomato. Halve, peel, and finely chop onion. Zest and quarter lime. Drain and rinse beans.
Place poblano halves on a baking sheet and rub all over with a drizzle of oil. Season with salt and pepper. Roast on top rack until browned and softened, 15-18 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine tomato, 2 Tbsp onion, half the lime zest, and a squeeze of lime juice to taste. Season with salt and pepper. In a separate small bowl, combine smoky red pepper crema, remaining lime zest, and a squeeze of lime juice to taste. Season with salt and pepper. Add water 1 tsp at a time until mixture reaches a drizzling consistency.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add remaining onion and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until softened, 4-5 minutes. Add pork and Southwest Spice; season with salt and pepper. Cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned and cooked through, 4-6 minutes.
Add tomato paste, stock concentrate, half the beans (use the rest as you like), and 1/4 cup water to pan with pork filling. (For 4 servings, use all the beans and 1/3 cup water.) Stir until mixture is saucy and thoroughly combined, 1-2 minutes. Season generously with salt and pepper. Once poblano halves are done roasting, remove sheet from oven. Stuff with up to half the filling (save the rest for serving). Evenly sprinkle with cheddar. Return to oven until cheese melts, 3-4 minutes.
Divide remaining filling between plates; top with stuffed poblanos, salsa, and crema. Drizzle with hot sauce if desired. Serve with any remaining lime wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 35 min. Calories: 800

name: Pork Meatloaf Parm over Spaghetti Marinara
ingredients:
1/4 cup Panko
1/2 cup Mozzarella Cheese
10 oz Ground Pork
1 Tbsp Tuscan Heat Spice
14 oz Marinara Sauce
6 oz Spaghetti
1/4 cup Parmesan Cheese
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. In a small bowl, combine panko, mozzarella, and a large drizzle of olive oil; season with salt and pepper.
In a large bowl, combine pork, half the panko mixture, half the Tuscan Heat Spice, and 1 Tbsp water; season generously with salt and pepper. Form pork mixture into two 1-inch-tall loaves; flatten tops. Place on a lightly oiled baking sheet.
Evenly spread tops of meatloaves with 1 Tbsp marinara sauce each (you'll use the rest later). Mound with remaining panko mixture, pressing gently to adhere. Bake meatloaves on top rack until pork is cooked through and crust is browned and crispy, 22-28 minutes.
Once water is boiling, add spaghetti to pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, 9-11 minutes. Reserve 1/4 cup pasta cooking water (1/3 cup for 4 servings), then drain.
Heat pot used for pasta over medium- high heat. Add remaining marinara sauce, remaining Tuscan Heat Spice, 1 tsp sugar, and reserved pasta cooking water. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. Cook until slightly thickened, 3-5 minutes.
Stir drained spaghetti, half the Parmesan, and 1 Tbsp butter into pot with sauce. Season generously with salt and pepper. Divide pasta between plates and top with meatloaves. (TIP: If you prefer, serve meatloaves on the side instead.) Sprinkle with remaining Parmesan and serve.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 35 min. Calories: 1070

name: Potato Wedges with Parmesan
ingredients:
3 Russet Potatoes, large and cut into wedges
4 Tbsp Olive Oil
3 tsp Sea Salt
3 tsp Garlic Powder
2 tsp Italian Seasoning
3/4 cup Parmesan Cheese
directions:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Place potato wedges in a large bowl. Drizzle with olive oil, then sprinkle with salt, garlic powder, italian seasoning and parmesan cheese. Use hands to mix well, making sure all wedges are well coated.
On a baking sheet covered with parchment paper, spread out potato wedges in a single layer. Bake for 25-35 minutes, until potatoes are golden.

name: Pretzel & Potato Chip Cookies
ingredients:
1 cup Butter, unsalted and softened
3/4 cup Brown Sugar, packed
1/2 cup Sugar
2 tsp Vanilla Extract
2 Eggs, large
2+1/4 cups All-Purpose Flour
1/2 tsp Baking Soda
1/2 tsp Salt
1½ cups Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips
1 cup Potato Chips, crushed
1/2 cup Pretzels, chopped
1/2 cup Toffee Bits
Flakey Sea Salt
directions:
Preheat the oven to 350F. Line large baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a large mixing bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the butter, sugars, and vanilla together on medium speed until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, stopping to scrape down the bowl between eggs. Beat each until well incorporated before adding the next.
To the mixing bowl, add the flour, baking soda, and salt. Beat on low speed just until combined. Add the chocolate chip, potato chips, pretzels, and toffee bits and stir in by hand until evenly distributed. Using a 2 tablespoons scoop, scoop the cookie dough and place on the lined baking sheets 2 inches apart. Sprinkle the top of each dough ball with flakey salt.
Bake one sheet at a time for 12 minutes or until the edges turn golden. Let cool for a few minutes on the pan, then transfer to a wire rack and cool completely. Store cookies in an airtight container for up to 1 week.
notes:
Prep time 15 min and Cook time 12 min
The dough can be mixed with any toppings. Just don't exceed 3½ cups worth of mix-ins

name: Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Muffins
ingredients:
4 Eggs
2 cups Sugar
1 can (15 oz) solid-packed Pumpkin Puree
1½ cups Canola Oil
3 cups All-Purpose Flour
2 tsp Baking Soda
1 tsp Baking Powder
1 Tbsp Pumpkin Pie Spice or Cinnamon
1 tsp Salt
2 cups (12 oz) Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips
directions:
Preheat oven to 400°. Place paper liners in a regular sized muffin pan.
In a large bowl, beat the eggs, sugar, pumpkin and oil until smooth. Combine the flour, baking soda, baking powder, pumpkin pie spice and salt; Add flour mixture slowly to pumpkin mixture and mix well. Fold in chocolate chips. Fill greased or paper-lined muffin cups three-fourths to almost all the way full.
Bake for 15-17 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Do not over bake. It makes all the difference between a good and a great muffin. Cool in pan 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack.

name: Pumpkin Pie
ingredients:
3/4 cup Sugar
1/2 tsp Salt
1 tsp Ground Cinnamon
1/2 tsp Ground Ginger
1/4 tsp Ground Cloves
2 Eggs, large
1 can Libby's 100% Pumpkin
1 can Evaporated Milk
directions:
Mix sugar, salt, cinnamon, ginger and cloves in a small bowl.
Beat eggs in a large bowl.
Stir in pumpkin and sugar spice mixture.
Gradually stir in the evaporated milk.
Pour into the pie crust.
Bake in preheated oven at 425 for 15 minutes.
Reduce temperature to 350.
Bake for 40-50 minutes or until knife comes out clean.
Cool on wire rack for 2 hours.

name: Pumpkin-Oat Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients:
2½ cups All-Purpose Flour
1½ cups Quick Oats
1 tsp Baking Soda
3/4 tsp Salt
1¾ tsp Ground Cinnamon
1/4 tsp Ground Nutmeg
1½ tsp Ground Ginger
1 cup Butter, unsalted and softened
1⅓ cups Brown Sugar
2/3 cup Sugar
1 Egg, large
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
1¼ cups Canned Pumpkin Puree
1¾ cup Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a mixing bowl whisk together flour baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg and ginger for 30 seconds, set aside.
In an electric mixing bowl, whip together butter, brown sugar and granulated sugar until creamy.
Blend in egg then blend in vanilla extract and pumpkin puree.
With mixer set on low, slowly add in dry ingredients and mix until combined.
Mix in chocolate chips and let batter rest for 5-10 minutes.
Scoop dough onto a cookie pan and bake for 12-14 minutes.

name: Queso Fundido
ingredients:
1 Tbsp Butter, unsalted
1 Tbsp All-Purpose Flour
1 cup Whole Milk
12 oz Monterey Jack Cheese, grated (about 3 cups)
Salt & Pepper
8 oz Goat Cheese, sliced into 8 rounds
2 Tbsp Fresh Cilantro, chopped
directions:
Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat; add the flour and cook, whisking, 1 minute. Whisk in the milk and cook, whisking, until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the monterey jack. Add 1/4 tsp salt and pepper to taste. Turn on the broiler.
Scrape the cheese mixture into an 8-inch cast-iron pan and arrange the goat cheese rounds on top. Broil until golden brown in spots. Drizzle with the vinaigrette and sprinkle with the cilantro. Serve with tortilla chips.
notes: http://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/bobby-flay/queso-fundido-with-roasted-poblano-vinaigrette-recipe.html?oc=linkback

name: Queso Fundido with Chicken & Smoky Bacon plus Roasted Green Peppers, Pickled Jalapeño & Pico de Gallo
ingredients:
2 Long Green Peppers
1 Jalapeño
1 Lime
1 Scallion
1 Roma Tomato
5 tsp White Wine Vinegar
4 oz Bacon
1 Tbsp Mexican Spice Blend
10 oz Chicken Cutlets
4 oz Cream Sauce Base
3 oz Queso Blanco
1/2 cup Mexican Cheese Blend
1/2 cup Mozzarella Cheese
6 Flour Tortillas
1½ oz Blue Corn Tortilla Chips
2 tsp Vegetable Oil
1/2 tsp Sugar
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Halve, deseed, and slice green peppers into 1/2-inch-thick strips. Trim and halve jalapeño lengthwise, removing ribs and seeds for less heat; thinly slice into half-moons. Quarter lime. Dice tomato. Trim and thinly slice scallions.
Toss green peppers on a baking sheet with a drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast on top rack until just softened and lightly charred, 12-15 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a small microwave-safe bowl, combine jalapeño, vinegar, juice from one lime wedge, 1/2 tsp sugar, salt, and pepper. Microwave for 30 seconds; set aside to pickle. In a separate small bowl, combine tomato, scallions, and juice from half a lime. Season with salt and pepper.
Slice bacon crosswise into 1/4-inch pieces. Heat a large dry pan over medium-high heat. Add bacon in an even layer; cook, undisturbed, until crispy on bottom, 2-3 minutes. Stir bacon and continue to cook, stirring occasionally and adjusting heat if browning too quickly, until crispy, 2-5 minutes more. In the last 30 seconds of cooking, reduce heat to low and stir in half the Mexican Spice Blend until well coated and fragrant. Turn off heat; using a slotted spoon, transfer bacon to a paper-towel-lined plate. Discard bacon fat; carefully wash out pan.
Pat chicken dry with paper towels; season all over with remaining Mexican Spice Blend, salt, and pepper. Heat a drizzle of oil in same pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, 3-5 minutes per side. TIP: If chicken is browning too quickly, reduce heat to medium and cover pan with lid. Transfer to a cutting board to rest.
Heat cream sauce base in a small pan over medium-high heat until steaming and slightly bubbling, 1-2 minutes. Reduce heat to medium, then gently whisk in queso blanco sauce until well combined. Gently stir in Mexican cheese blend and mozzarella, one packet at a time, until smooth. Remove pan from heat.
Wrap tortillas in damp paper towels; microwave until warm and pliable, 30 seconds. Slice chicken crosswise. Top queso fundido with bacon, a few spoonfuls of pico de gallo, and a few slices of pickled jalapeño. Place pan with queso fundido in the center of a large serving board; arrange chicken, tortillas, tortilla chips, roasted green peppers, and remaining pickled jalapeño (draining first) alongside. Squeeze remaining lime wedges over chicken and serve with remaining pico de gallo on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 25 min. Calories: 1330

name: Raspberry Cheesecake Dessert Parfait
ingredients:
Cheesecake Mousse:
1/2 cup Sugar
4 Eggs, large
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
1 cup Heavy Cream
1/3 cup All-Purpose Flour
1 cup White Chocolate Chips
16 oz Cream Cheese
2 cups Raspberries, Fresh or frozen then thawed
1 tsp Raspberry Extract
2 cups Whipping Cream
1/4 cup Sugar
16 oz package Raspberry Jell-o
1 cup Fresh Raspberries
Mint leaves, for garnish
Crust:
12 Graham Crackers
1½ cups Salted Pretzels
1/3 cup Butter, melted
directions:
Begin by preparing custard base for the cheesecake: Whisk together 1/2 cup sugar with 4 egg yolks and vanilla extract in a small bowl.
In a small saucepan, whisk together 1 cup cream with the flour. Cook the cream mixture over low heat for a few minutes until hot; Stir constantly and whisk vigorously to remove clumps. Slowly pour cream into the egg yolks, whisking constantly. Cook custard over low/medium heat for 7-10 minutes until thickened.
Remove from heat and add white chocolate; whisk until completely melted. Cover custard and set aside to cool to room temperature.
Meanwhile, prepare crust. Place pretzels and graham crackers in a food processor and crush into small crumbs. Combine crumbs with 1/3 cup melted butter; set aside.
Once custard has cooled, prepare cheesecake mousse. Whisk cream cheese in a mixer bowl until light and fluffy. Add the two cups raspberries and the raspberry extract. Mix until raspberries are completely crushed. Add the cooled custard and blend until well combined; scrape down sides of bowl often. Remove mixture from mixer bowl into a separate bowl.
Into clean mixer bowl, add the remaining two cups heavy cream and 1/4 cups sugar. Whisk on high speed until stiff peaks form. Fold 1 cup whipped cream into cream cheese mixture, then gradually begin folding cream cheese into the whipped cream. Fold very gently so the whipped cream stays light and airy.
To assemble dessert, spoon several tablespoons of graham cracker crumbs into plastic or glass cups. Transfer mousse into a pastry bag and pipe into cups, filling about 3/4 of the cup. Place cups into the refrigerator for about 1 hour to set.
Prepare the Jell-o according the package instructions replacing the cold water with ice water to cool down the mixture faster. Add fresh raspberries on top of the mousse, then carefully pour over the Jell-o. Fill the cups to the brim. Place in refrigerator to set completely (4-6 hours). Keep refrigerated until ready to serve.

name: Raspberry Chocolate Chip Crackles
ingredients:
1/4 cup Butter (no substitutes)
10 oz Raspberry Chocolate Chips
2 cups All-Purpose Flour
2 tsp Baking Powder
1/4 tsp Salt
1½ cups Sugar
4 Eggs
1/2 cup Walnuts, finely chopped
Confectioner's Sugar, sifted
directions:
Preheat oven to 300 F.
In the top of a double broiler, over hot water, melt butter with 1 cup raspberry chocolate chips, stirring until smooth. Remove from hot water and set aside.
In a medium bowl, mix together flour, baking powder, and salt.
In a large bowl, beat sugar with melted butter mixture. Add eggs, one at a time, beating until incorporated. Beat in flour mixture until well blended. Fold in walnuts and remaining raspberry chips. Wrap dough tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least an hour.
Shape dough into 1 inch balls about 2 inches apart on prepared cookie sheets. Bake in oven for 15 to 18 minutes or until cracked on the surface but set in the middle.

name: Raspberry Jam
ingredients:
800g Fresh Raspberries
260g Sugar
1-2 Tbsp Lemon Juice
directions:
Place the raspberries and sugar in a pot set to medium heat. Stir until the sugar has melted.
Increase the heat to high and bring to a boil. Scoop the scum off the surface. Reduce until your desired consistency is reached.
Add the lemon juice and mix well. Pour the jam into a sterilized jar and screw the lid on top. Flip over and place in the fridge to chill.

name: Raspberry Mustard Sauce
ingredients:
1/2 cup Raspberry Jam
1/4 cup Honey
2 Tbsp Dijon Mustard
1/2 tsp Cayenne Pepper
1 Tbsp Fresh Lemon Juice
1/4 tsp Pepper
directions: Combine all ingredients. Cover and chill until serving time.
notes: Eat with roast turkey or grilled chicken.

name: Raspberry White Chocolate Muffins
ingredients:
2 cups All-Purpose Flour
1¾ tsp Baking Powder
1/2 tsp Salt
1/2 cup Butter, melted
1/2 cup Sugar
2 Eggs, large and room temp
1/2 cup Almond Milk
1 tsp Almond Extract
6 oz Fresh Raspberries or Strawberries
1/2 cup White Chocolate Chips
1/3 cup Almonds, sliced
directions:
Preheat the oven to 375º In a medium sized bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. In a large bowl, or stand mixer whisk the egg, melted butter, almond extract and almond milk. Add the flour mix to the wet ingredients and stir just until combined. Don't over stir.
Add in the raspberries. To give them a beautiful color, I like to add them into the dough in the stand mixer and blitz them quickly (do not over mix! just a quick few seconds to break them up). Next, fold in the chips and almonds.
The batter will be thick, use a spoon to fill a muffin lined pan. Fill the muffin liners about 3/4 of the way. Place in the oven and bake for about 16-20 minutes or until the tops are lightly browned and a toothpick comes out clean.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 20 min

name: Red Curry Chicken Stir Fry with Spicy Cashew Sauce
ingredients:
Red Curry Chicken Stir Fry:
1 lb. Chicken Breasts
2 Tbsp Cornstarch
1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
Salt & Pepper to taste
2 Tbsp Avocado Oil
2 Tbsp Red Curry Paste
2 Tbsp Brown Sugar
Spicy Cashew Sauce:
1¼ cup Roasted Salted Cashews
1/2 cup Water
2 Tbsp Maple Syrup
2 Tbsp Sriracha
1½ Tbsp Soy Sauce
1 Garlic Clove
2-3 Tbsp Lime Juice
1 tsp Ginger
1/2 tsp Salt
2 cups Broccoli Florets (about 1 small head of broccoli or 1 frozen steam-in-the-bag)
2-3 cups Rice, cooked
directions:
Make the Spicy Cashew Sauce: Blend all ingredients in a high-powered blender until very smooth.
Prep the Chicken: Cut the chicken breasts into very thin pieces. Toss with the cornstarch, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Cook the Chicken: Add the avocado oil to a nonstick pan over medium high heat. Add the curry paste and brown sugar; cook for a few minutes to get it caramelizy and bubbly. Add the chicken. Toss once to coat in the sauce, then let it sit for several minutes to get the chicken nice and golden brown. Flip and repeat until chicken is cooked through. If needed, add 1-2 tablespoons of water to the pan to lift up any browned pieces that are stuck to the bottom.
Serve: Serve the chicken on cooked rice, with cooked broccoli, topped with the cashew sauce.
notes: Cook time 40 min

name: Red Lobster Cheddar Biscuits
ingredients:
2 cups All-Purpose Flour
1 Tbsp Sugar
1 Tbsp Baking Powder
2¼ tsp Garlic Powder, divided
3/4 tsp Salt
1 cup Whole Milk
1/2 cup + 3 Tbsp Butter, melted and divided
2 cups (8 oz) Cheddar Cheese, shredded
1/2 tsp Parsley, dried
directions:
Preheat oven to 450F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper.
Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, 2 teaspoons garlic powder and 3/4 teaspoon salt in large bowl; mix well. Add milk and 1/2 cup butter; stir just until dry ingredients are moistened. Stir in cheese just until blended. Drop scant 1/4 cupfuls of dough about 1½ inches apart onto prepared baking sheet.
Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown.
Meanwhile, combine remaining 3 tablespoons melted butter, 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder, pinch of salt and parsley flakes in small bowl; brush over biscuits immediately after removing from oven. Serve warm.

name: Reese’s Peanut Butter Bread
ingredients:
12 Reese’s Cups
1/2 cup Butter
4 Eggs
2 cups Bisquik, or any pancake mix
1 cup Chocolate Chips (mix with peanut butter chips for additional fun)
directions:
Unwrap 12 regular sized Reese’s cups. Add cups and butter to a double broiler and melt. Take off the heat and mix in eggs slowly to avoid scrambling.
Mix in pancake mix and fold in 1 cup of chocolate/peanut butter chips.
Add mixture to greased loaf pan and cook in 350F for 45-55 minutes.

name: Reese's Peanut Butter Candy
ingredients:
2½ cups Graham Cracker Crumbs
1 lb. Powdered Sugar, sifted
2 cubes Butter, melted
1-1/2 cup Peanut Butter
6 oz Chocolate Chips
directions:
Combine everything except for the chocolate chips.
Press into a small baking pan 9x9.
Melt the chocolate chips and spread on top.

name: Restaurant Style Honey Garlic Chicken
ingredients:
1 kg Boneless chicken cubes
1 tsp Salt
1 Tbsp Garlic Powder or Paste
Batter:
2 cups Plain Flour
1 cup Corn Flour
1 tsp Salt
1 Tbsp Chili Powder
1 Tbsp Black Pepper
1 Tbsp Oregano
1 Tbsp Ginger Powder
1 tsp Garlic Powder
Oil, for frying
150g Butter
2 Bulbs Garlic, chopped
1/2 cup Soy Sauce
1/3 cup Sugar
1/3 cup Honey
Sesame Seeds, garnish
directions:
Marinate cubed boneless chicken with salt and garlic powder/paste. Mix well and marinate for 30 minutes.
Combine plain flour, corn flour and spices. Divide the flour mix into halves & mix one half with 250ml water to form a wet batter. Mix wet batter with marinated chicken first. Then mix the battered chicken with the dry mixture to create textured and battered chicken.
Deep fry in hot oil for 5 to 6 minutes until golden and crispy.
For sauce, melt butter and add minced garlic. Cook on high until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Lower the heat and add soy sauce, sugar, and honey. Cook on medium high for a minute or two.
Add fried chicken to sauce and toss.

name: Rice Cooker Lemonade
ingredients:
600-700g Crystal Rock Sugar
6 Lemons, cleaned and sliced
directions:
In the rice cooker or slow cooker, add in a layer of sugar, then a layer of lemon slices. Repeat the process and finish with sugar.
Slow cook for 2 hours, and then keep warm for 7-9 hours.
Afer cooling, store in a clean glass jar and chill in the fridge and store for up to 3 months.
To serve, add a few lemon slices to a glass with ice and sparkling water.

name: Risotto with Shrimp and Asparagus
ingredients:
3 Tbsp Butter, unsalted
1 Onion, small and finely diced
6 Garlic Cloves, minced
1⅔ cups Arborio Rice, uncooked
1 cup Chicken Stock
4 cups Chicken Broth
1/2 cup Parmesan Cheese, shredded and divided
2 Tbsp Olive Oil
3 Garlic Cloves, minced
2 lbs. Shrimp (26-30 per lb.), uncooked, peeled and deveined
1 Tbsp Butter, unsalted
1/2 cup Italian Salad Dressing
1 lb. Fresh Asparagus, trimmed
Salt & Pepper to taste
directions:
Select saute setting on a 6-qt. electric pressure cooker and adjust for high heat; warm butter until melted. Add onion; cook 4-5 minutes. Add garlic; cook 1 minute. Add rice; cook and stir 2 minutes. Stir in 1/2 cup wine; cook and stir until absorbed. Add remaining wine, broth, and 1/4 cup cheese. Lock lid and make sure the vent is closed. Select manual setting; adjust pressure to high. Set the time for 8 minutes. When finished cooking, quick-release pressure according to manufacturer's directions; stir.
Meanwhile, heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic; cook 1 minute. Add shrimp; cook and stir until the shrimp begin to turn pink, about 5 minutes. Add butter and dressing; stir until butter melts. Reduce heat. Add asparagus; cook until tender, 3-5 minutes. Serve over risotto. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese.
notes: Cook time: 30 minutes

name: Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Balsamic Vinegar and Honey
ingredients:
1½ lbs. Brussels Sprouts, halved, stems and ragged outer leaves removed
3 Tbsp Extra-Virgin Olive Oil
3/4 tsp Salt
1/2 tsp Pepper
1 Tbsp Balsamic Vinegar
1 tsp Honey
directions:
Preheat oven to 425 and set an oven rack in the middle position. Line a baking sheet with heavy-duty aluminum foil.
Cut Brussels Sprouts in half. If you have some brussels sprouts that are very large, cut them into quarters. They should all be cut about the same size to ensure even cooking.
Directly on the prepared baking sheet, toss the Brussels Sprouts with 2 Tbsp of the oil, the salt, and the pepper. Roast, stirring once halfway through, until tender and golden brown, about 20 minutes.
Drizzle the remaining Tbsp of oil, the balsamic vinegar and the honey over the roasted Brussels Sprouts. Toss to coat evenly. Taste and adjust seasoning, if necessary, then serve.
notes: Cook time 30 min. Calories: 116

name: Roasted Chickpeas
ingredients:
1½ cups canned Chickpeas, strained and pat dried
2 tsp Old Bay Seasoning
1 Tbsp Parmesan, grated
Olive Oil
directions:
Preheat oven to 375 F. Toss everything together and spread on a baking sheet.
Baked for 30 minutes, tossing the chickpeas every 10 minutes to prevent burning.
notes: Movie Night Snacks

name: Roasted Garlic Spread
ingredients:
4 whole heads Garlic
2 Tbsp Olive Oil
1/2 tsp Fresh Thyme or 1/4 tsp Dried Thyme
Salt & Pepper to taste
directions:
Preheat oven to 350.
Remove the papery outside layer of the garlic. Trim 1/4 inch off the tops of the garlic heads. Place them in an ovenproof dish and brush with the oil. Sprinkle with thyme, salt and pepper. Cover the dish with foil and bake 1½ hours, or until very tender.
Serve warm or at room temperature. To remove the garlic, gently squeeze if from the husks.

name: Roasted Strawberries Ice Cream
ingredients:
Roasted Strawberries:
3 cups Fresh Strawberries, hulled and halved
1/4 cup Sugar
1/4 tsp Salt
Roasted Strawberry Coconut Ice Cream:
2 cups Full Fat Coconut Milk
1/2 cup Roasted Strawberries, plus some for topping
1/4 cup Honey
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
Pinch of Salt
Pistachios, chopped for serving
directions:
Roasted Strawberries: Preheat oven to 375F. Place strawberries on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Toss with sugar and salt. Roast for 20-25 minutes.
Roasted Strawberry Coconut Ice Cream: In a bowl, combine coconut milk, roasted strawberries, honey, vanilla, and salt. Transfer to a freezer-safe container and freeze until set. Serve with more roasted strawberries and chopped pistachios.

name: Rosemary and Onion Focaccia
ingredients:
Pizza Dough
6 Tbsp Olive Oil
1/2 tsp Salt
3 Onions, large and sliced thinly
1 tsp Sugar
1/2 tsp Salt
1 Tbsp Rosemary, chopped
1/2 cup Parmesan Cheese
directions:
Follow Pizza dough recipe instructions. Roll or press the dough to fit an oiled baking sheet. Cover with a small towel and let rise.
When the dough has risen, dimple the top with your fingers. Brush with 3 Tbsp of olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Set aside.
Heat the remaining 3 Tbsp of olive oil in a large non-stick skillet over low heat. Add the onions, sugar, salt, and rosemary. Cook for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the onions are tender and lightly brown. Cool to room temperature.
Preheat the oven to 350F. Spread the onions evenly over the dough. Sprinkle with the Parmesan Cheese.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until the bottom is crisp. Cut into 2-inch wedges and serve.

name: Rudy's Slow-Cooker Creamed Corn
ingredients:
32 oz Corn, frozen
8 oz Cream Cheese, cut into 1" cubes
1/3 cup Heavy Cream
1/4 cup Butter
2 Tbsp Sugar
1/2 tsp Pepper
1/4 tsp Salt
directions:
Combine all ingredients in the crock-pot and cook on low for 4 hours. Stir to combine and make sure the cream cheese has completely melted into the sauce.
The finished corn will hold nicely on low (or on warm, if your Crock-Pot has that setting) for another hour or two without a problem. Enjoy!

name: S'more Dip
ingredients:
Chocolate Chips
Peanut Butter Chips
