Large Marshmallows
Graham Crackers
directions:
Pour as many chocolate chips of both kinds into the bottom of the pan.
Line and cover the top of the chocolate with the large marshmallows.
Put in oven long enough to melt the chocolate and slightly brown the marshmallows.
Dip graham crackers into the melt mixture and eat.
notes: Experiment with temperatures

name: Salt Dough
ingredients:
2 cups Flour
1 cup Salt
1 Tbsp Oil
Water
Food Coloring
directions:
Combine salt and flour.
Add oil and enough water to give it a clay like consistency.
Mix food coloring into water before adding it to the mixture if you wish to color it.
Add more water a little at a time until the mixture is pliable but not sticky.
Knead slightly.
Keep in air tight container.
notes: Less oily and more salty than other clay recipe.

name: Salted Caramel Sauce
ingredients:
1 cup Sugar
2 Tbsp Water
6 Tbsp Butter, unsalted
1/2 cup Heavy Cream
1/2 to 1 tsp Sea Salt
directions:
In a medium saucepan, heat sugar and water on medium high heat.
Cook until sugar turns into amber hue. DO NOT USE YOUR SPOON TO STIR. It'll cause the caramel to crystalize.
Quickly add the butter and swirl into the pan until it's combined.
Then add the cream and sea salt and stir to combine.
Let cool completely.
notes: Add into the middle layer of the Salted Caramel Brownies then spread the rest on top.

name: Salted Caramel and Chocolate Ice Cream
ingredients:
Caramel:
3/4 cup Sugar
2 Tbsp Water
1 cup Cream, room temperature
1/2 tsp Sea Salt Flakes
Ice Cream:
1½ cups Milk
3/4 cup Heavy Cream
6 Egg Yolks
2 Tbsp Sugar
Chocolate Ganache Swirl:
6 oz Dark Chocolate Chips
1/3 cup Heavy Cream
1/2 tsp Cayenne Pepper
directions:
Heat sugar and water in large saute pan. When it begins to melt and turn amber, swirl the pan to incorporate all the sugar and cook until fully melted and amber. Pour the room temperature cream and salt flakes into the sugar mixture and transfer to a bowl to cool.
While it's cooling, heat the milk and heavy cream to a slight simmer.
While that's heating, beat the egg yolks and sugar until pale yellow. Temper the egg yolks by slowly pouring the heated milk and cream into the yolks. Return the mixture to the original pot and cook slowly while stirring until it coats the back of the wooden spoon. Pour this mixture into the caramel and stir to fully incorporate. Chill for 2-4 hours.
Once the custard is cool, add it to an ice cream maker and churn until thick.
When the mixture is almost done, make the ganache. Heat the chocolate chips over a double boiler until melted, then stir in cream and cayenne. Cool at room temperature, then pour into the ice cream maker. Continue to churn for about 40 seconds.
Put ice cream in a container and freeze for at least two hours.

name: Salted Caramel Brownies
ingredients:
1/2 cup All-Purpose Flour
3/4 cup Cocoa Powder, unsweetened
1¼ cup Sugar
1/2 cup Butter, unsalted
2 Eggs, cold
1/8 tsp Baking Soda
1 Tbsp Cornstarch
1/4 tsp Salt
1/4 tsp Vanilla Extract
1/2 cup Chocolate Chips
directions:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Line an 8x8 inch pan with parchment or foil, set aside.
In a medium saucepan, melt butter and sugar on medium high heat.
Once melted, remove and stir in vanilla extract and cocoa powder. Set aside and let cool for 5 minutes.
To the cooled butter mixture, whisk in egg one at a time, mix until incorporated.
In a large bowl, whisk flour, baking soda, cornstarch and salt.
Incorporate the butter mixture to the flour mixture and mix until combined.
Fold in chocolate chips, and pour brownie batter over prepared pan.
Next, take salted caramel and drizzle over brownies. Using the back of a spoon, swirl the caramel around.
Bake brownies for 22-25 minutes, or until brownies are set.
notes: Use Salted Caramel Sauce recipe for caramel sauce

name: Salted Caramel Meringues
ingredients:
4 Egg Whites
220 g Caster Sugar
1 tsp Vanilla
Sea Salt Flakes
Salted Caramel Sauce
Caramel Chew Candy
directions:
Preheat oven to 200 degrees.
Line a flat baking tray with baking paper.
Whip the egg whites on high speed with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form.
Gradually, and very slowly, add the sugar 1 Tbsp at a time, while whipping it together on a medium high speed.
Once all the sugar is in, add the vanilla extract and continue whipping for 5-6 minutes or until you reach stiff peaks. If you can turn the bowl upside down and no meringue fall out, you know it's done.
Dab a little meringue on the corners of the baking tray and stick the baking paper to it. This prevents it from flying around the oven.
Scoop the meringue onto the tray to form little mounds.
Bake the meringues for 90 minutes. Do not open the oven door at any point or they will crack. Once they're finished, turn off the heat and leave them in the oven to cool completely.
Drizzle salted caramel sauce over the meringue mounds, sprinkle on some sea salt flakes and add caramel chews.
notes: Stores for 3 days (not refrigerated)

name: Salted Honey Butter Jalapeño Cheddar Rolls
ingredients:
3½-4 cups All-Purpose Flour
2¼ tsp (1 packet) Rapid Rise Yeast
1/2 tsp Salt
2 cups Cheddar Cheese, shredded
1-2 Jalapeños, seeded and chopped
1 cup Warm Whole Milk
3 Tbsp Honey
1- Tbsp Butter, salted and room temperature
1 Egg, large
Honey Butter
3 Tbsp Honey
Flakey Sea Salt
directions:
In the bowl of a stand mixer, combine the flour, yeast, and salt. Add the cheese and jalapeños. Mix with a fork to combine.
Pour in the warm milk, honey, egg, and 4 tablespoons of butter. Using the dough hook, mix until the flour is incorporated, about 4-5 minutes. If the dough seems sticky, add the remaining 1/4 -1/2 cup of flour. Cover the bowl and let sit at room temperature for 15 minutes or up to a few hours at room temperature.
To make the honey butter. Combine the remaining 6 tablespoons of butter, honey, and a pinch of salt together in a small bowl.
Preheat the oven to 350° F. Grease a 9×9 inch square baking dish.
Lightly dust your work surface with flour. Turn out the dough, punch it down, and divide the dough in half. Roll each half to a 12-inch square, about 1/4-inch thick. Brush each square with honey butter, saving any leftover butter for serving. Cut each square of dough into 6 strips. Roll each strip into a coil (see above photo) and arrange, seam side down, in the prepared baking dish.
Cover the dish and let the rolls rise for about 30 minutes, until they're puffy. Alternatively, you can let the rolls sit in the fridge overnight.
Bake the rolls for 20-25 minutes, until they're golden brown. Remove them from the oven and brush with the remaining honey butter. Pull them apart to serve warm with a sprinkle of flaky sea salt.
notes: Prep time 30 min and Cook time 20 min

name: Saucy Beef & Charred Poblano Tacos with Mango Salsa & Smoky Red Pepper Crema
ingredients:
4 oz Mango
1 Roma Tomato
1 Yellow Onion
1 Lemon
1 Poblano Pepper
10 oz Ground Beef
1 Tbsp Blackening Spice
1 Beef Stock Concentrate
6 Flour Tortillas
4 Tbsp Sour Cream
2 tsp Smoked Paprika
directions:
Wash and dry all produce. Drain mango. Finely dice tomato. Halve and peel onion; thinly slice one half. Mince a few slices until you have 1 Tbsp (For 4 servings, thinly slice whole onion; mince a few slices until you have 2 tablespoons.) Zest and quarter lime (for 4, zest 1 lime and quarter both). Halve, core, and thinly slice poblano into strips.
In a small bowl, combine mango, tomato, minced onion, lime zest, and juice from half the lime. Season with salt.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add poblano, sliced onion, and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until tender and lightly charred, 5-7 minutes. (TIP: Add a splash of water if veggies begin to brown too quickly.) Season with salt and pepper. Turn off heat; transfer to a plate. Wipe out pan.
Heat another drizzle of oil in same pan over medium-high heat. Add beef, Blackening Spice, and a big pinch of salt. Cook, breaking up meat into pieces and stirring occasionally, until browned and cooked through, 4-6 minutes. Stir in stock concentrate and 2 Tbsp water (3 Tbsp for 4 servings); bring to a simmer. Return veggies to pan, stirring, until thoroughly combined. (TIP: Add a splash or two of water, if necessary, until mixture is saucy.) Taste and season with salt and pepper.
Meanwhile, wrap tortillas in damp paper towels. Microwave until warm and pliable, 30 seconds.
Divide tortillas between plates and fill with beef and veggie filling. Top with mango salsa and smoky red pepper crema. Serve with remaining lime wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 25 min. Calories: 830

name: Saucy Pork Burrito Bowls with Charred Poblano, Smoky Crema, Salsa Fresca & Cilantro Lime Rice
ingredients:
1/2 cup Jasmine Rice
1 Roma Tomato
1 Yellow Onion
1 Lemon
1 Poblano Pepper
1/4 oz Cilantro
10 oz Ground Pork
2 Tbsp Smoky Red Pepper Crema
1 Tex-Mex Paste
directions:
In a small pot, combine rice, 3/4 cup water, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to a low simmer. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve.
While rice cooks, wash and dry all produce. Finely dice tomato. Halve, peel, and cut half the onion into 1/2-inch-thick wedges. Mince one wedge until you have 1 Tbsp. Zest and quarter lime. Core, deseed, and dice poblano into 1/2-inch pieces. Mince cilantro.
In a small bowl, combine tomato, minced onion, and a big squeeze of lime juice; season with salt. Add smoky red pepper crema to a separate small bowl. Stir in water 1 tsp at a time until mixture reaches a drizzling consistency.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a medium pan over medium-high heat. Add poblano and onion wedges. Season with salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and lightly charred, 7-9 minutes. Transfer to a plate.
Heat a drizzle of oil in same pan over medium-high heat. Add pork and a big pinch of salt. Cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned, 4-6 minutes. Stir in Tex-Mex paste and 1/4 cup water (1/3 cup for 4 servings) until combined. Bring to a simmer and cook until mixture is saucy and pork is cooked through, 1-2 minutes more. Turn off heat.
Fluff rice with a fork; stir in lime zest and half the cilantro. Season with salt and pepper. TIP: Stir in 1 Tbsp butter for extra richness. Divide rice between bowls and top with veggies, saucy pork, any remaining sauce from pan, salsa, crema, and remaining cilantro. Serve with remaining lime wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 25 min. Calories: 650

name: Sausage and Lemony Herb Risotto with Pistachios & Scallions
ingredients:
1 Yellow Onion
1 Scallion
1 Garlic Clove
1 Lemon
9 oz Italian Chicken Sausage Mix
3/4 cup Arborio Rice
2 unit Chicken Stock Concentrate
1/4 oz Parsley
1/2 oz Pistachios
1/2 cup Italian Cheese Blend
1 tsp Olive Oil
3 Tbsp Butter
directions:
In a medium pot, bring 5 cups water (8 cups for 4 servings) to a boil, then reduce to a low simmer. (You'll use it in Step 3.) Wash and dry produce. Halve, peel, and dice half the onion. Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens; mince greens. Peel and mince garlic. Zest and quarter lemon.
Heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add diced onion; cook, stirring occasionally, until slightly softened and lightly browned, 4-5 minutes. Add beef and cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned, 3-4 minutes. Add 1 Tbsp butter, scallion whites, garlic, and rice. Cook, stirring frequently, until garlic is fragrant and rice is translucent, 1-2 minutes. Season with a big pinch of salt.
Add 1 cup hot water and stock concentrates to pan with rice mixture. Cook, stirring, until liquid has mostly absorbed. Repeat with remaining water—adding 1/2 cup at a time and stirring until liquid has mostly absorbed—until rice is al dente and mixture is creamy, 25-30 minutes. Season generously with salt and pepper. TIP: Depending on the size of your pan, you may need a little more or a little less water.
While risotto cooks, finely chop parsley (use leaves and thin stems; discard any thicker stems). Roughly chop pistachios.
Once risotto is done, remove from heat; stir in 3/4 of the Italian cheese blend, half the parsley, half the scallion greens, 2 Tbsp butter, and a squeeze of lemon juice until melted and combined. TIP: The risotto should be a little loose and saucy right before serving; it will thicken as it cools, so add more water if necessary. Taste and season generously with salt and pepper.
Divide risotto between plates. Top with pistachios, remaining Italian cheese blend, remaining parsley, remaining scallion greens, and lemon zest to taste. Serve immediately with remaining lemon wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 30 min. Calories: 900

name: Scalloped Hasselback Potatoes
ingredients:
2 Golden Potatoes
2 Tbsp Butter
1 piece about 2 inches long Parmigiano-Reggiano Cheese, sliced thinly
1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
1/4 tsp Salt
2 tsp Olive Oil
1/4 cup Heavy Cream
1/4 cup Cheddar Cheese, blend
directions:
Preheat oven to 400 F. Scrub potatoes.
You need 2 wooden spoons with handles of the same width. Place a spoon on each side of the potato and start slicing the potato into thin slices. The spoons will stop the knife from cutting all the way through the potato.
Slice the butter into thin pieces. Alternate the butter and the parmesan, stuffing them in between the slices of the potato. Season the potato with garlic powder and Salt. Drizzle the potato with olive oil.
Bake at 400ºF for 45 minutes. Remove from the oven and drizzle heavy cream over the potatoes. Top with cheddar cheese.
Place back in the oven for 10-12 more minutes. Remove and serve!

name: Scones
ingredients:
2 cups Flour
1/4 cup Sugar
3 tsp Baking Powder
3 Tbsp Shortening
3 Tbsp Butter
2/3 cup Milk
Dash of Salt
directions:
Mix dry ingredients.
Cut in shortening and butter.
Add milk and mix.
Turn out on lightly floured board.
Knead 20 or so times.
Divide dough into thirds. Pat each into a circle about 4-5 inches across. Cut each into quarters or thirds.
Let rise on cookie sheet for a few minutes.
Bake at 425F for about 7-10 minutes or until golden brown.
notes:
Serve with honey.
Add different fillings like grated lemon and poppy seeds, grated orange and cranberries, dark chocolate and cranberries, etc.

name: Sheet Pan Cashew Chicken
ingredients:
3 Chicken breasts, cut into 1/2-1 inch pieces
2 cups Broccoli Florets
1 Red Bell Pepper, diced
1 cup Cashews, unsalted
3 Tbsp Sriracha
2 Tbsp Coconut Aminos
2 Tbsp Rice Vinegar
2 Tbsp Toasted Sesame Oil
1 Tbsp Honey
2 Garlic Cloves, minced
1 thumb Ginger, peeled & minced
Cilantro
Lime Wedges
Rice of choice for serving
directions:
Preheat oven to 425F degrees.
Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
Add chicken, broccoli, bell pepper and cashews.
Mix together all of the sauce ingredients in a small bowl.
Pour 3/4 of the sauce on the chicken and veggies, and toss to coat evenly.
Roast for 25 minutes, tossing halfway through.
Top chicken and veggies with remaining sauce, and toss.
Serve with rice of choice, and top with lime juice and cilantro. Enjoy!

name: Sheet Pan Dijon Onion Crunch Chicken with Green Beans & Garlic Bread
ingredients:
10 oz Chicken Cutlets
1½ oz Honey Dijon Mustard
1/4 cup Monterey Jack Cheese
1 package Crispy Fried Onions
6 oz Green Beans
1 tsp Garlic Powder
1 Ciabatta Roll
directions:
Adjust rack to middle position and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Place 2 Tbsp butter (3 Tbsp for 4) in a small bowl and bring to room temperature. Pat chicken dry with paper towels and season all over with salt and pepper; place on one side of a baking sheet. Brush tops of chicken with 1/2 Tbsp honey Dijon dressing (save the rest for serving). Sprinkle with Monterey Jack. Crush crispy onions in their package, then sprinkle over cheese, pressing to adhere. Roast on middle rack for 5 minutes (you'll add more to the sheet then).
Meanwhile, wash and dry produce. Trim green beans if needed. Once chicken has roasted 5 minutes, remove sheet from oven. Carefully toss green beans on empty side with a drizzle of oil; season with salt and pepper. (For 4 servings, leave chicken roasting; add green beans to a second baking sheet and roast on top rack.) Return to middle rack and bake until green beans are tender and chicken is browned and cooked through, 12-15 minutes more.
Meanwhile, combine softened butter with garlic powder to taste. Season with salt and pepper. Halve and toast ciabatta. Spread cut sides with garlic butter. Cut each half on a diagonal.
Toss green beans with 1 Tbsp plain butter until melted. Season with salt and pepper. Divide chicken, green beans, and garlic bread between plates. Serve with remaining dressing on the side.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 30 min. Calories: 730

name: Semolina Pizza Dough
ingredients:
1/4 cup Water, warm (120F)
1 tsp Sugar
2½ tsp Active Dry Yeast
1 cup Water, room-temperature
1 Tbsp Olive Oil
2 cups + 2 Tbsp Fine Semolina Flour
1 cup+7 Tbsp All-Purpose Flour
1 Tbsp Salt
directions:
In a measuring pitcher, stir together the warm water and the sugar and sprinkle with the yeast. Let the mixture stand until it starts to foam, about 5 minutes. Add the 1 cup room-temp water and the olive oil.
In a food processor, combine the semolina flour, all-purpose flour, and salt. With the motor running, add the yeast-water mixture in a steady stream, and then pulse until the dough comes together in a rough mass, about 12 seconds. If the dough does not form into a ball, sprinkle with 1-2 teaspoons of water and pulse again until a rough mass forms.
Let rest for 5-10 minutes. Process again for 25-30 seconds, steadying the top of the food processors with one hand. The dough should be tacky to the touch but not sticky. Transfer the dough to a lightly floured work surface and form it into a smooth ball.
Place the dough in a large, oiled bowl, turn to coat with oil and cover with plastic wrap. Let the dough rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk and spongy, about 1½ hours.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and divide into two balls of dough. Freeze dough for up to two months (when ready to use, thaw the frozen dough for about 3-4 hours at room temp).

name: Sesame Honey Chicken Drumettes
ingredients:
1/2 cup Honey
2 Tbsp Dijon Mustard
1 Tbsp Soy Sauce
1 Tbsp Rice Vinegar
1 tsp Chili Flakes
24 Chicken Drumettes
1 tsp Salt
1/2 tsp Pepper
1 Tbsp Sesame Seeds, toasted
directions:
Preheat the oven to 375.
Combine the honey, mustard, soy sauce, rice vinegar and chili flakes in a small bowl. Set aside.
Rinse the drumettes under cold water and pat dry. Place them in a roasting pan and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake, uncovered, for 40 minutes, turning after 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and discard the fat and liquid.
Pour the honey mustard sauce over the drumettes and toss well. Return to the oven. Bake until the chicken is crispy and golden in color, about 30 to 40 minutes.
Transfer to a serving platter, sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve immediately.
notes: Toast the sesame seeds in a dry frying pan over low heat for 2-3 minutes.

name: Sesame Soy Chicken Bowls with Chili Mayo, Cilantro, and Crispy Onions
ingredients:
3/4 cup Jasmine Rice
1 Lemon
1/4 oz Cilantro
2 Tbsp Mayo
1 oz Sweet Thai Chili Sauce
10 oz Chicken Breast, cut into strips
4 oz Carrots, shredded
4 Tbsp Sweet Soy Glaze
1½ oz Sesame Dressing
1 Crispy Fried Onions
directions:
In a small pot, combine rice, 1¼ cups water, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to a low simmer. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve.
While rice cooks, wash and dry produce. Zest and quarter lemon. Roughly chop cilantro. In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise with Chili sauce to taste.
Pat chicken dry with paper towels and season all over with salt and pepper. Heat a drizzle of oil in a large  pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook stirring, until browned all over, 3-4 minutes. Stir in carrots, sweet soy glaze, and 3 Tbsp sesame dressing. Cook until carrots are softened, chicken is cooked through, and sauce has thickened, 2-4 minutes more. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Turn off heat.
Fluff rice with a fork; stir in lemon zest and 1 Tbsp butter. Season with salt and pepper. Divide rice between bowls and top with chicken mixture and any remaining sauce from pan. Drizzle with Chili mayo. Sprinkle with crispy fried onions and cilantro. Serve with lemon wedges on the side.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 20 min. Calories: 950

name: Shrimp Ceviche Appetizer
ingredients:
2 Lemons, juiced and zested
3 Tomatoes, diced
2 Cucumbers, diced
2 lbs. Shrimp, cooked
1 Onion, diced
2 Tbsp Ketchup
3 Tbsp Salsa Perry
directions: Mix all ingredients. Eat plain or with chips!

name: Shrimp Cocktail Sauce
ingredients:
1/2 cup Sweet Thai Chili Sauce
2 Tbsp Ketchup
1 tsp Horseradish
1/2 tsp Worcestershire Sauce
1 tsp Fresh Lemon Juice
directions:
Combine all the ingredients and mix well. Cover and chill for 30 minutes before serving.
The sauce can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for 2 weeks.

name: Shroom 'n' Swiss Pork Burgers with Potato Wedges & a Creamy Honey Dijon Dipper
ingredients:
12 oz Yukon Gold Potatoes
4 oz Button Mushrooms
2 Potato Buns
1 Tbsp Mushroom Stock Concentrate
10 oz Ground Pork
2 Slices Swiss Cheese
4 Tbsp Sour Cream
1½ oz Honey Dijon Dressing
directions:
Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 450 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch-thick wedges. Trim and thinly slice mushrooms. Halve buns.
Toss potatoes on a baking sheet with a large drizzle of olive oil and a big pinch of salt and pepper. Roast on top rack until browned and crisp, 20-25 minutes.
Meanwhile, melt 1 Tbsp butter in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms and cook, stirring, until lightly browned and softened, 3-5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in half the stock concentrate (you'll use the rest in the next step) and 1 Tbsp water. Cook, stirring, until mushrooms are coated, 30 seconds. Turn off heat; transfer to a small bowl. Wipe out pan.
In a large bowl, combine pork and remaining stock concentrate. Season with salt and pepper. Form mixture into two patties, each slightly wider than a burger bun. Heat a large drizzle of olive oil in pan used for mushrooms over medium- high heat. Add patties and cook until browned and cooked through, 4-7 minutes per side. In the last 1-2 minutes of cooking, top each patty with Swiss Cheese. Cover pan until cheese melts.
While patties cook, toast buns until golden. In a second small bowl, combine sour cream and honey Dijon dressing. Season with salt and pepper.
Spread bottom buns with as much sauce as you like. Top with patties, mushrooms, and top buns. Divide burgers and potato wedges between plates. Serve with any remaining sauce on the side for dipping.
notes: Prep 10 min and cook time 35 min. Calories: 1050

name: Simple Cucumber Salad
ingredients:
1 Cucumber
1½ Tbsp Soy Sauce
Splash of Fish Sauce
1 Tbsp Sugar
MSG, to taste
3-4 Tbsp Sesame Oil
Garlic clove, grated
2 Green Onions, chopped
Toasted Sesame Seeds
directions:
Thinly slice cucumbers and chop green onions. Optionally, peel the cucumber before slicing.
Mix all ingredients well.

name: Simple Poured Icing
ingredients:
2 cups Powdered Sugar
1-2 Tbsp Lemon Juice
directions:
Mix powder sugar and enough lemon juice to form a thin glaze.
Add food coloring if desired.

name: Sizzling Sesame Shrimp Noodles
ingredients:
1 cup Pasta, uncooked
5 Tbsp Asian Sesame Dressing
1 lb. Shrimp (uncooked)
3 Garlic Cloves, minced
1 Tbsp Sesame Seed
4 cups Frozen Asian-Style Stir-Fry Vegetables, thawed
2 Tbsp Soy Sauce
directions:
Cook pasta as directed on package.
Heat 2 Tbsp of dressing in 1g. skillet on medium-high heat.
Add shrimp, garlic and sesame seed. If using Chinese Spice, add now.
Stir fry for 3 minutes.
Add veggies, soy sauce, and remaining dressing.
Stir-fry 3 minutes or until veggies are heated through.
Drain pasta and toss with shrimp.
notes:
Dressing can be substituted with 2 Tbsp olive/veggie oil and 1-2 tsp of Chinese spice.

Shrimp can be substituted with bite size chicken strips.

name: Skillet Cinna-Buns
ingredients:
Cinnamon Rolls:
2½ cups Flour
1 cup Milk (tepid)
1/3 cup Butter, unsalted and cubed
1/3 heaping cup Sugar
Pinch of Salt
1/2 Tbsp Instant Yeast
2 Eggs
Filling:
1/3 cup Butter, unsalted and softened
1/2 Tbsp Cinnamon
1/2 cup Brown Sugar
Icing:
3 Tbsp Cream Cheese
2 Tbsp Butter, unsalted and softened
1/3 cup Icing Sugar
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
directions:
Add the yeast into the milk, stir together and leave to sit for a few minutes. Whisk in the eggs to combine.
In a stand mixer, add all of the dry ingredients and butter and with a dough hook attached, slowly pour in the wet ingredients and knead for 5 minutes until soft.
Place the dough in an oiled bowl and allow it to rise for an hour or doubled in volume.
Once ready, knock the dough back and using a rolling pin, roll it into a large rectangle.
Spread the soft butter on top of the dough. Mix together the sugar and cinnamon and spread this evenly over the top.
From the short side of the rectangle, roll the dough into a tight log. Cut into 1 inch discs and arrange the rounds into a buttered skillet pan.
Allow to rise for 20 minutes, then bake at 395 degrees for 10 minutes or until golden brown on top.
While cooking, mix the cream cheese butter, icing sugar and vanilla together.
Spread the mixture on top of the cinna-buns as soon as they re baked and serve.

name: Skinny Mac and Cheese Soup with Broccoli
ingredients:
4 oz Elbow Macaroni, uncooked
1½ cups Onion, chopped
1 Carrot, large and chopped
1 Celery Stalk, chopped
2 Garlic Cloves, minced
1 Tbsp Butter
2 Tbsp Flour
1 cup Fat Free Milk
Pinch of Nutmeg
1/2 tsp Dry Mustard
Salt & Pepper to taste
2½ cups Chicken Broth, Fat Free Low Sodium
2 cups (about 10 oz) Broccoli Florets, chopped into small pieces
1½ cups 2% Sharp Cheddar, shredded
2 Tbsp Parmesan Cheese
directions:
Boil pasta in salted water according to package directions for al dente. Drain and set aside.
Chop onion, carrot, celery, garlic by hand or mini food processor.
In a large soup pot or dutch oven, melt light butter. Add chopped vegetables and sauté on low heat until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add flour and fresh pepper to the pot and stir until smooth. Slowly add chicken broth, milk, nutmeg and dry mustard powder; whisking constantly. Set heat to medium-high until it comes to a boil. Cover and cook on low about 10-15 minutes.
Add broccoli florets, Parmesan Cheese, and stir well. Adjust salt and pepper to taste. Cook uncovered until broccoli is cooked, about 5 minutes or more to your liking.
Add cheddar, mixing well until cheese melts and immediately remove from heat. Add cooked elbows and mix well, adjust salt and pepper if needed. Eat right away so the pasta doesn't absorb all the broth.
notes: Any noodle works

name: Slow Cooker Lemon Garlic Chicken Thighs
ingredients:
4 Garlic Cloves, minced
1/4 tsp Salt
1 tsp Basil, dried
1 Lemon, zest and juice one half, other half for garnish
1/2 cup Chicken Stock
1 tsp Chicken Bouillon
2 Tbsp Butter, unsalted and cut into small cubes
1½ lb Chicken Thighs, boneless skinless
Parsley, garnish
directions:
In the insert of a 5-6 quart slow cooker, combine the garlic, salt, basil, lemon zest, chicken stock and chicken stock concentrate. Stir until well combined, then add the chicken thighs. Turn to coat in the sauce, then scatter butter cubes evenly over.
Put the lid on, then set the slow cooker to cook on the lowest setting for 4-5 hours.
Just before serving, stir in the juice of half a lemon, garnish with extra lemon slices, and fresh parsley.
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 4 min

name: Smoky & Creamy Caramelised Onion Butter Beans
ingredients:
3 Onions, finely sliced
2 Garlic Cloves, minced
30g Tomato Puree
1½ tsp Smoked Paprika
50 ml Chicken Stock
100 ml Double Cream
1 can Butter Beans
1/2 Lemon, juiced
Basil and Parsley, chopped for garnish
directions:
In a medium sized frying pan over a medium heat, add a couple tablespoons of oil and the chopped onion. Fry until softened and caramelized. Stir often.
Add the garlic and tomato puree, cook for 2 minutes. Stir frequently.
Deglaze the pan with the chicken stock then simmer for a couple of minutes until mostly evaporated.
Add the butter beans with their liquid.
Add the double cream then bring to a simmer for 5 minutes.
Squeeze in the lemon and taste for seasoning. Top with the chopped herbs. Enjoy!
notes: Serve with naan bread

name: Snickerdoodle Cookies
ingredients:
1 cup Butter
1½ cups Sugar
2 Eggs, large
1¾ cups Flour
2 tsp Cream of Tartar
1 tsp Baking Soda
1/4 tsp Salt
3 Tbsp Sugar
3 tsp Cinnamon
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
Mix butter, 1½ cups sugar and eggs thoroughly in a large bowl.
Combine flour, cream of tartar, baking soda, and salt in a separate bowl.
Blend dry ingredients into butter or margarine.
Chill dough, and chill an ungreased cookie sheet for about 10-15 minutes in the fridge.
Meanwhile, mix 3 Tbsp sugar, and 3 tsp cinnamon in a small bowl.
Scoop 1 inch globs of dough into the sugar and cinnamon mixture.
Coat by gently rolling balls of dough in the sugar mixture.
Place on chilled ungreased cookie sheet, and bake 10 minutes.
Remove from pan immediately.

name: Sophie's Chopped Salad
ingredients:
Dressing:
1/4 cup Balsamic Vinegar
1 Tbsp Dijon Mustard
1 tsp Salt
1¼ tsp Pepper
1/2 cup Canola Oil
Salad:
3 cups Romaine Lettuce, finely chopped
2 Beefsteak Tomatoes, seeded & finely diced
1/2 cup can Chick-Peas, rinsed and drained
1/2 cup Nicoise Olive, pitted and coarsely chopped
3/4 cup White Cheddar Cheese, cubed
3/4 cup Monterey Jack Cheese, cubed
Chives, chopped for garnish (optional)
directions:
In a blender, or with a wire whisk, blend balsamic vinegar, mustard, salt and pepper until smooth. Slowly blend in oil and blend until emulsified.
Toss lettuce, tomatoes, beans, chickpeas, olives and cheeses together in large bowl and dress lightly with vinaigrette. Garnish with tortilla chips and chives.
notes: http://www.food.com/recipe/sophies-chopped-salad-432126

name: Soup Dumplings - Xiao Long Bao
ingredients:
FOR THE DUMPLING WRAPPERS:
10½ oz 00 Flour
1 Tbsp Neutral Oil
1 tsp Salt
5¾ fl oz Boiling Water
5 Tbsp Cornflour
5 Tbsp Plain Flour
FOR THE SOUP JELLY:
9 fl oz Water
¼ oz Gelatine Leaf
1 oz Fresh Ginger
½ tsp Chicken Bouillon Powder
½ tsp Dashi
FOR THE DUMPLING FILLING:
9 oz Pork Mince
2 Spring Onions
½ Tbsp Fresh Ginger
1 Garlic Clove
1½ Tbsp Soy Sauce
½ Tbsp Oyster Sauce
½ Tbsp Rice Wine Vinegar
½ Tbsp Sesame Oil
½ tsp Ground White Pepper
1 tsp Salt
3 Tbsp Water
9 oz Soup Jelly
FOR THE DIPPING SAUCE:
3 Tbsp Chinese Black Vinegar
¼ oz Fresh Ginger
directions:
MAKE THE SOUP JELLY: Into a small pot, combine all the ingredients except the gelatine leaves, and bring to a boil for 8 mins with a lid, just to infuse the aromatics into the liquid.
In the meantime soak the gelatine leaves in a bowl of cold tap water for 3 mins or until softened like contact lenses, squeeze the excess liquid out and set aside.
Take the small pot off the heat and add all the gelatine leaves, mix until dissolved then strain into a shallow pasta bowl. When cool enough, place it into the freezer for 30 mins to quickly set up, then leave in the fridge for another 30 mins or until needed. This can be done up to 2 days before.
MAKE THE WRAPPERS: Grab a large bowl and add flour, oil and salt and add ¾ of the boiled water, leaving a little water behind. Use a chopstick or the back of a wooden spoon to mix everything, then use your hands and create a dough ball. If the dough ball feels dry add some of the remaining water and knead until it is soft and feels like play-dough. It should not be stuck to your fingers, just add more flour if this happens.
Knead for 2 mins or until smooth, cover in cling film or throw into a sandwich bag, set aside for at least 25 mins. This dough can be made up to 2 nights before.
MAKE THE DUMPLING FILLING: Grab a large bowl and add all the ingredients into the bowl except for the spring onions and water/chicken stock. Use a fork or chopsticks, to mix in one direction until a big meatball forms.
Add the water/chicken stock in 2 parts, mixing in between until the meatball absorbs the liquid, then add the renaming liquid. Finely slice the spring onions and mix just until it is evenly incorporated. Cling film the bowl and leave in the fridge until needed.
When the jelly is fully set, use a knife to score the jelly into small cubes, roughly the size of peas. Then scoop all jelly onto the dumpling filling and use a spatula to mix until the jelly is evenly incorporated into the dumpling filling, cling film and leave in the fridge.
Prep the steamer basket by cutting a circle of baking paper that fits the bakers, then cut multiple finger-sized holes so that steam can escape, then lightly oil the baking paper and leave inside the steamer basket and set aside.
CONTINUE MAKING THE WRAPPERS: Roll the dough into a log the width of a round cherry tomato and use scissors to cut into 25 pieces, slightly smaller than the size of a cherry tomato, or 12g each if you want to be exact.
In a small pot combine a 1:1 ratio of cornflour and flour and mix with fingers, use this for dusting.
Lightly dust all the pieces of dough and toss with your hands to lightly coat. Turn the pieces of dough upwards so the sticky part is facing you, then use the fattest part of your palm to press down firmly, revealing a coin shape. Repeat for all the dough pieces, then cover with a lightly damp tea towel to prevent them from drying out.
Using the dusting flour, roll out each piece of dough, roughly 10 cm in diameter, trying to keep the center of the wrapper a bit thicker than the edges of the wrapper. Lightly dust each side if needed, then place onto a sheet of cling film, and lightly cover with cling film.
Repeat to all pieces of dough, stacking the wrapper on top of each other, making sure to lightly dust between each wrapper and always covering with the cling film, to prevent it drying out.
FOLD THE SOUP DUMPLINGS: Place 1 Tbsp of filling in the center of a wrapper and create multiple folds around the filling, making sure to seal it super tight by pinching everything together in the center. Alternatively fold the dumpling like a tortellini, which is very simple. Fold the dumpling in half and seal all the edges like a purse.
Use your pinky finger to lightly dent the middle of the dumpling and fold the edges together and squeeze to seal, to create a tortellini shape. Place it into the steamer basket. Repeat folding the dumplings as desired, ensuring whatever method you choose, they are tightly sealed and add the dumplings to the steamer basket giving 3 cm space between all the dumplings.
STEAM THE DUMPLINGS: Find a saucepan that snugly fits the steamer baskets, and fill the pan ½ way with water. Bring the water to a boil, then add the steamer basket and reduce the heat medium low. Steam for 8 minutes and reveal.
In the meantime combine vinegar and thin slices of ginger together for the dipping sauce.
When eating, do not burn your mouth, these are pockets of boiling soup. Place a dumpling onto a spoon, pour a tsp of vinegar, poke or bite a small hole to release the heat, drink the soup to test the temperature, then eat.
notes: 3 hours

name: Sour Cream Sugar Cookies
ingredients:
1/2 cup Butter, unsalted
2 cups Sugar
4 Eggs
1 tsp Vanilla
2/3 cup Sour Cream
1/2 tsp Baking Soda
3 tsp Baking Powder
1 tsp Salt
4 cups All-Purpose Flour, fluffed and leveled
directions:
In a large bowl with an electric mixer, beat butter and sugar on high until creamy.
Add eggs, vanilla, and sour cream and beat until smooth.
Add baking soda, baking powder, and salt and mix until combined. Add flour and beat on low until no white remains — dough will be soft, almost like cake batter.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F and line baking sheets with parchment paper. Drop by heaping tablespoonfuls onto baking sheets 2-3 inches apart and bake for 10-12 minutes, until edges are golden and centers are set.
Cool and decorate with frosting!

name: Southwestern Fries
ingredients:
2 Tbsp Ancho Chile Powder
1 Tbsp Salt
5 Potatoes, large and peeled
4 cups Vegetable Oil
1/4 cup Cilantro, freshly chopped
directions:
Combine the ancho powder and salt in a small bowl.
Cut the potatoes into 1/4-inch-thick slices, then cut each slice into 1/4-inch-thick fries. Place the fries in a large bowl of cold water.
Heat the oil in a large saucepan to 325 degrees F as measured on a deep-frying thermometer. Drain the fries in batches on paper towels. Fry each batch for 3 to 4 minutes, until pale blond color. Remove to a sheet pan lined with paper towels.
Raise the heat of the oil to 375 degrees F. Working in batches, fry the potatoes again, until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove to a sheet pan lined with paper towels and season with the chile mixture and cilantro.

name: Spanish One-Pan Chicken with Chorizo and Bell Peppers
ingredients:
12 oz Chicken Breasts
1/2 cup Basmati Rice
2 oz Dried Chorizo
1 Yellow Onion
1 Red Bell Pepper
1/4 oz Parsley
1 Lemon
2 Garlic Cloves
1 Chicken Stock Concentrate
1 tsp Olive Oil
directions:
Wash and dry all produce. Core, seed, and thinly slice bell pepper. Halve, peel, and dice onion. Mince or grate garlic. Slice chorizo into 1/4-inch-thick rounds.
Heat a large pan over medium heat. Add chorizo to pan and cook until it crisps and releases some of its oil, 1-2 minutes per side. Set aside, leaving oil in pan.
Season chicken on all sides with salt and pepper. Heat same pan over medium heat. (TIP: If pan seems dry, add a drizzle of oil.) Add chicken and sear until browned and cooked through, 5-6 minutes per side. Remove from pan and set aside.
Add onion, garlic, bell peppers, and a drizzle of oil to same pan over medium heat. Stir until just softened, 3-4 minutes. Add rice and stir to coat. Stir in 1 cup water, a pinch of salt, and chicken stock concentrate. Cover and reduce heat to low. Simmer until rice is tender, 15-20 minutes.
Meanwhile, cut lemon into wedges. Finely chop parsley. TIP: While you wait for rice to finish, try practicing this Spanish phrase: Con pan y vino se anda el camino (life is better with food and wine).
Fluff rice with a fork and season generously with salt and pepper. Place chicken on top and sprinkle with crispy chorizo. Remove pan from heat and sprinkle with parsley and a few squeezes of lemon.
notes: Cook time 35 min. Calories: 530

name: Spanish Chicken Tray Bake
ingredients:
Marinade:
2 lb Chicken Thighs, bone-in skin-on
3 Tbsp Olive Oil
2 tsp Smoked Paprika
1½ tsp Oregano
1 tsp Salt
1/2 tsp Pepper
1/2 tsp Cayenne Pepper
1/2 Lemon, juiced
Tray Bake:
14oz Baby Potatoes, halved
7oz Spanish Chorizo, sliced into around 8 1-in pieces
7oz Cherry Tomatoes
2/3 cup Olives, pitted
5-6 Garlic Cloves, lightly crushed (skins left on)
2 White Onions, quartered & peeled
2 Bell Peppers, sliced in large wedges (3/4-in wide)
1/2 Orange, zested
Few Sprigs Fresh Rosemary
Olive Oil, as needed
Salt & Pepper, as needed
directions:
Whisk together smoked paprika, oregano, salt, cayenne pepper & black pepper with olive oil and lemon juice in a large mixing bowl. Mix in the chicken thighs until completely coated, then tightly cover and marinate in the fridge for as long as you have time for (2 - 24 hours). If you're pushed for time just marinate at room temp whilst you prep the other ingredients.
In a large deep baking tray combine potatoes, peppers, onion, chorizo, rosemary and garlic with a light drizzle of oil and a pinch of salt & pepper. Nestle in the chicken thighs (skin side up) and brush with any leftover marinade. Ensure the potatoes are all visible to allow them to crisp, then make sure the chorizo is more hidden to prevent it from burning. Place in the oven at 400F for 30 mins.
Remove from the oven, flip the potatoes and baste the chicken with the juices in the base of the pan. Evenly scatter over the olives, tomatoes and orange zest, then place back in the oven for another 15 mins, or until the chicken is piping hot through the center and lightly charred/crisp on top. The tomatoes and olives should be slightly wrinkled with the potatoes soft all the way through.
Evenly divide everything for serving, then whisk the liquid left in the pan to combine the fats & juices. This is bonus flavor! Plus the garlic will be buttery soft, do with that what you will.
notes: Prep time 15 min and Cook time 45 min

name: Spicy Tom Kha Soup
ingredients:
1 Banana Shallot
4 Garlic Cloves
Thumb of Ginger
½ Red Chili
1 Lemongrass Stalk
2 Tbsp Soy Sauce
1 Tbsp Rice Wine Vinegar
1 Tbsp Thai Red Curry Paste (optional)
1-2 Chicken Stock Cubes
400ml Coconut Milk
1 tsp Brown Sugar
1 Lime
200g Mushrooms, shiitake work great
150g Chicken or Tofu
1 bunch Spring Onions
Handful fresh Coriander
Thai Chili Oil
1 Tbsp Vegetable Oil
Salt & Pepper
directions:
Prepare all your aromatics - chop your shallot, garlic, ginger and chili. Bash the lemongrass, then warm the oil on a medium heat in a saucepan.
Add your aromatics, stirring well and allow flavors to combine. Sauté for 3-5 mins.
Add the soy, rice vinegar and curry paste. Stir well and cook off for another 2-3 mins.
Mix your stock cube(s) with the boiling water, then slowly add to the pot, stirring as you go.
Bring to a boil, then allow to simmer for 15-20 mins. Strain the broth through a sieve, then add the coconut milk + simmer.
Slice the mushrooms and chicken, then add to the broth and cook until internal temp reaches 165F.
Add a bunch of chopped spring onion and coriander if you like. Season with sugar and lime juice.
To serve, ladle into deep bowls. Garnish with red chili, coriander, lime wedges and a swirl of chili oil if you like.

name: Spicy Tuscan Mini Farfalle
ingredients:
10 oz Farfalle
2 cups Heavy Cream
2 cups Pecorino Romano, freshly grated
2 cups Fresh Baby Spinach
1/4 cup Sun-Dried Tomatoes
3 Tbsp Butter, unsalted
4 Shallots, finely minced
Garlic Cloves, finely minced
1 tsp Chili Flakes
directions:
In a large pot of water seasoned with salt, boil the pasta until al dente, per package instructions. Reserve 1/4 cup of pasta water.
In a large skillet, add butter, shallots and garlic. Cook on medium heat until translucent.
To the same pan, add sun-dried tomatoes, spinach and crushed red pepper flakes. Cook 3-5 minutes until the spinach is wilted and sun dried tomatoes are fragrant. Stir in heavy cream and grated cheese.
Combine pasta and pasta water with the sauce. Top with more cheese and sun-dried tomatoes.

name: Spun Sugar Decorations
ingredients: 1 cup Super-Fine Sugar
directions:
Prepare a baking sheet with a silicon mat or wax paper.
Melt the sugar in a pan, stirring until it has completely melted into caramel.
Allow to cool slightly, then begin to pull your sugar decorations.
For a sugar disc, drizzle the caramel in a circular motion over the baking sheet, and allow to cool completely.
For the spiral, make sure the caramel is slightly cooler and holding its shape. Twirl the sugar around a steel knife-sharpening blade to create tight spiral effect.

name: Steamed Dumplings
ingredients:
1 Tbsp Vegetable Oil
1 Onion, small and finely chopped
2 Garlic Cloves, minced
1 Tbsp Ginger, chopped
1 cup Mushrooms, finely chopped
1/4 cup Carrot, grated
2 Tbsp Soy Sauce
1 tsp Sesame Oil
2 Tbsp Fresh Cilantro, chopped
1/8 tsp Pepper
36 Dumpling Wrappers
Lettuce
1/4 cup Spicy Dipping Sauce
directions:
Heat the oil to medium-high in a large, non-stick frying pan. Add the onion, garlic, and ginger and cook about 5 minutes, or until soft and fragrant.
Add the mushrooms and cook until tender. Transfer to a large bowl and add the carrot, soy sauce, sesame oil, cilantro and pepper. Toss gently.
Lay out as many dumpling wrappers as you have room for on your work surface. Lightly brush the edges of each wrapper with warm water. Place a heaping spoonful of filling in the edges firmly to seal. Place the finished dumplings on a baking sheet and cover with waxed paper.
Repeat with the remaining wrappers. The dumplings can be frozen on the baking sheet, transferred to an airtight container and kept in the freezer for 2 months.
To cook the dumplings, line a bamboo steamer or colander with lettuce. Arrange in a single layer over the lettuce and cover with the lid. Place over a pot of simmering water and steam for 12 minutes. Serve immediately with dipping sauce.
notes: Use Bamboo steamer or line a metal colander with lettuce leaves, cover it with a lid and place directly over a pot of simmering water.

name: Stovetop Potpourri - Cinnamon Apple
ingredients:
1 Apple, sliced into wedges
3 Whole Star Anise
1 Cinnamon Stick
3 Ginger, slices
directions:
Fill a pot with water and the ingredients.
Allow to come to a boil and then reduce the heat to low.
Be sure not to let the water evaporate completely. You can refill the pot with as much water as needed.

name: Stovetop Potpourri - Orange and Cranberry
ingredients:
1 Orange, small and sliced
1/3 cup Cranberries, fresh
1 tsp Cloves
3 Cinnamon Sticks
directions:
Fill a pot with water and the ingredients.
Allow to come to a boil and then reduce the heat to low.
Be sure not to let the water evaporate completely. You can refill the pot with as much water as needed.

name: Stovetop Potpourri - Rosemary and Lemon
ingredients:
1/2 Lemon, sliced
1 Tbsp Vanilla Extract
2 Sprigs Fresh Rosemary
1 tsp Cardamom Pods
directions:
Fill a pot with water and the ingredients.
Allow to come to a boil and then reduce the heat to low.
Be sure not to let the water evaporate completely. You can refill the pot with as much water as needed.

name: Strawberry Cheesecake Crackers
ingredients:
9 oz Strawberries
1 Tbsp Sugar
2 tsp Balsamic Vinegar
½ oz Basil
2 fl oz Double Cream
¾ oz Icing Sugar
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
3½ oz Cream Cheese
12 Cream Crackers
directions:
Start by washing the strawberries in water and removing the stalk and leaves from the strawberry, by twisting or carefully using a knife. Finely chop the stalks and leaves, they’re totally edible!
Slice the strawberries thin and pop them into a mixing bowl, sprinkle over the sugar, gently mix through then set to one side. Tear in some basil leaves and tip in the balsamic vinegar. Mix to combine.
In another bowl, whisk the double cream, icing sugar and vanilla essence until forming stiff peaks, soften the cream cheese in another bowl then gently mix together.
Now you are ready to build your mini cheesecakes, pipe or spoon the cheesecake base onto a cracker leaving a well for the strawberries to sit in. Spoon in the strawberries and some of their juice.
For a fancy garnish, top with extra some fresh basil and a little lick of the strawberry syrup.
notes: Cook time 15 min

name: Strawberry Cream Puffs
ingredients:
1 cup Flour
100 ml Milk
100 ml Water
2 tsp Sugar
1/2 tsp Salt
5½ Tbsp Butter, unsalted
4 Eggs
2 cups Heavy Cream
1/3 cup Powdered Sugar
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
Fresh Strawberries
directions:
Bring the milk, water, sugar, salt, and butter to a boil. Remove from heat, add flour and incorporate mixing with a wooden spoon until homogeneous. Return over low heat and while stirring cook for 2 minutes to pull out the moisture and pulls away from the sides of the pan. Allow to cool slightly.
Add the eggs one at a time, using the wooden spoon or even a stand mixer.
Pipe the dough into 1 to 1½ inch circles. Bake for 25-30 minutes at 350F until browned and puffed. Prick each with a skewer to release steam and allow to cool on a wire rack.
Whip the cream until it forms stiff peaks. Add sugar and vanilla extract and mix to combine. Split the cream puffs in half and fill them with cream mixture and strawberry slices.
Dust with powdered sugar and serve.

name: Strawberry Goat Cheese Bruschetta
ingredients:
1/2 cup Balsamic Vinegar
1 loaf Italian Bread
1 Tbsp Olive Oil
1 cup Goat Cheese, room temperature
1 lb Strawberries, washed and diced
2 tsp Fresh Thyme
1/2 tsp Salt
1/8 tsp Pepper
directions:
Add balsamic vinegar to a saucepan on medium heat and simmer until reduced by half, about 6-8 minutes.
Let cool.
Brush slices of bread with olive oil and toast.
Spread goat cheese on bread.
Mix balsamic vinegar, strawberries, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Spoon the strawberry mixture over the goat cheese. Be careful to not spoon any of the remaining liquid with it.
notes: Prep time 8 min and Cook time 6 min

name: Strawberry Ice Box Cake
ingredients:
1 lb. Vanilla Wafers, ground
1/2 cup Butter
2 cup Powdered Sugar
2 Eggs
1 qt. Fruit: Strawberry, Pineapple, etc.
1 pint Whipping Cream, whipped with sugar added
directions:
Pour half ground wafers in 9x13 pan.
Mix butter and sugar then add eggs one at a time and beat hard.
Carefully spread this mixture on wafers; then put on a layer of fruit, (nuts), and whipped cream.
Top with remainder of wafers.
Let stay in refrigerator overnight.
notes: 1 cup pecans or walnuts, chopped (optional)

name: Strawberry Jam
ingredients:
2 cups Strawberries, crushed (use blender)
2 cups Sugar
1 package Strawberry Jell-O
directions:
Put in pan and boil for 1 minute; stir constantly.
Take off stove and stir in 1 small package of strawberry Jell-O.
Blend well.
Put in bottles or jars and freeze.

name: Strawberry Pretzel Salad
ingredients:
6 oz Strawberry Jell-O
2 cups Boiling Water
2½ cups Salted Pretzels, (measured before crushing)
1/4 cup Sugar
8 Tbsp Butter, unsalted
8 oz package Cream Cheese, softened
1/2 cup Sugar
8 oz Cool Whip, thawed in the fridge
1 lb Strawberries, fresh, hulled and sliced
directions:
Pre-heat oven to 350°F. Combine strawberry Jell-O with 2 cups boiling water and stir until completely dissolved. Set aside to cool to room temperature.
Crush 2½ cups pretzels in a sturdy ziploc bag, using a rolling pin.
In a medium saucepan, melt 8 Tbsp butter then add 1/4 cup sugar and stir. Mix in crushed pretzels.
Transfer to a 13x9 glass casserole dish, pressing the pretzel mix evenly over the bottom of the dish and bake for 10 min at 350°F, then cool to room temp.
When pretzels have cooled, use an electric hand mixer to beat 8 oz cream cheese and 1/2 cup sugar on med/high speed until fluffy and white. Fold in 8 oz Cool Whip until no streaks of cream cheese remain. Spread mixture over cooled pretzels, spreading to the edges of the dish to create a tight seal. Refrigerate 30 min.
Hull and slice 1 lb strawberries then stir into your room temperature jello. Pour and spread strawberry jello mixture evenly over your cooled cream cheese layer and refrigerate until jello is set (2-4 hours).
notes: Prep time 20 min and Cook time 10 min. Chill for 2 hours.

name: Street Corn
ingredients:
4 Ears of Corn, husked and grilled in a skillet/grill
3 Tbsp Mayo
1 Garlic Clove, minced
1 Lime, juiced and zested
1/3 cup Scallions, sliced
1/3 cup Cojita Cheese, grated
1/4 cup Cilantro, minced
1 Jalapeño, diced
1/2-1 tsp Chili Powder
1/4 tsp Salt
directions: Grill up the corn and carefully slice it off the husk. Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Refrigerate until you’re ready to use. You can make this a day ahead for maximum flavor and ease.
notes: Originally paired with Braised Brisket Tacos with Street Corn and Jalapeño Lime Ranch.

name: Sugar Cookies
ingredients:
3 cups Flour
1/2 tsp Salt
1/2 tsp Baking Soda
1/2 tsp Baking Powder
1/2 cup Butter
1/2 cup Shortening
2 Eggs
1½ cups Sugar
1/2 tsp Vanilla
directions:
Sift flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda.
Cut in butter and shortening.
Beat eggs and sugar until fluffy.
Add flavoring and combine mixture.
Roll dough.
Bake at 350 degrees for 8-10 minutes.

name: Summer Pasta Salad
ingredients:
1/2 Ib Mezzi Rigatoni
Extra-Virgin Olive Oil
5 Cremini Mushrooms, whole
1 Carrot
1/2 Cucumber
1/2 cup Red Bell Pepper
1/3 cup Fresh Corn Kernels
8-10 Cherry Tomatoes
1/3 Kalamata Olives
3-4 Small Fresh Bocconcini
4-6 Large Fresh Basil Leaves
Salt & Pepper to taste
directions:
Cook pasta al dente in abundantly salty water, drain and add a drizzle of olive oil. Stir to coat and set aside to cool.
Slice the mushrooms, carrot, cucumber and red pepper into bite-sized pieces. Add to a large bowl along with the corn kernels. Halve the cherry tomatoes and add to the bowl as well.
If using olives with pits, take a small clean rag and lay olives across one half of the towel. Fold the other half over the olives and press down firmly on them to gently squash them. Pits will easily slide out while retaining the shape of the olive. Discard pits and add olives to the bowl.
Break apart the cheese and tear the basil into bite-sized pieces, directly into the bowl.
Stir to combine so the tomatoes release some of their juice. Drizzle with 2 Tbsp olive oil and stir to coat. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve at room temperature; the longer you this dish sit, the better it tastes!

name: Sunrise Smoothie
ingredients:
1/2 cup Milk
2 Tbsp Frozen Orange Juice Concentrate
1/2 cup Peaches, frozen
1/4 cup Greek Yogurt
1/2 tsp Vanilla Extract
1 tsp Honey
directions:
Put milk, juice, and the peaches into a blender. Blend for about 45 seconds.
Then add the yogurt, vanilla, and honey.
Blend until smooth.
Serve it as a smoothie or turn the mixture into popsicles.

name: Sweet and Sour Chicken
ingredients:
10-12 Chicken Tenderloins (or 6-8 chicken breasts)
2/3 cup Sugar
1/2 cup White Vinegar
1/4 cup Water
3-4 Tbsp Ketchup
1 Tbsp Soy Sauce
1-2 Tbsp Cornstarch
1/2 tsp Salt
directions:
Put chicken in 9x13 baking pan.
Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees.
In a medium sauce pan, mix everything else and bring to a boil.
Stir constantly.
Pour hot liquid over chicken.
Cover pan with tin foil and cook for 4o minutes for tenderloins or an hour for chicken breasts.

name: Sweet and Sour Pork
ingredients:
2 Tbsp and 1½ tsp Paprika
1½ lbs. Porkloin roast, boneless, cut into 1-in strips
1 Tbsp Canola Oil
1 can (20 oz) Unsweetened Pineapple Chunks
1 Onion, chopped
1 Medium Green Pepper, chopped
1/4 cup Cider Vinegar
3 Tbsp Brown Sugar
3 Tbsp Soy Sauce
1 Tbsp Worcestershire Sauce
1/2 tsp Salt
2 Tbsp Cornstarch
1/4 cup Cold Water
Green Onions, thinly sliced
directions:
Place paprika in a large resealable plastic bag. Add pork, a few pieces at a time, and shake to coat. Select saute setting on a 6-qt electric pressure cooker and adjust to medium heat; add oil. Brown the pork in batches, then return all pork to pressure cooker.
Drain pineapple, reserving juice, onion, green pepper, vinegar, brown sugar, soy sauce, Worcestershire Sauce and salt to the pressure cooker. Lock lid; make sure the vent is closed. Select manual; adjust pressure to high and set time for 10 minutes. When finished cooking, quick-release pressure according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Select saute setting and adjust for high heat, bring liquid to a boil.
In a small bowl, mix cornstarch and water until smooth; gradually stir into pork mixture. Add pineapple. Cook and stir until sauce is thickened (1-2 minutes).
If desired, sprinkle with green onions and serve over rice.
notes:
Prep: 20 min
Cook: 15 min

name: Sweet Chili Pork & Cabbage Stir-Fry with Cilantro & Crispy Fried Onions
ingredients:
1/2 cup Jasmine Rice
4 Tbsp Sweet Soy Glaze
1 oz Sweet Thai Chili Sauce
12 ml Ponzu Sauce
5 tsp Rice Wine Vinegar
10 oz Ground Pork
1 tsp Garlic Powder
4 oz Red Cabbage and Carrot Mix
1 package Crispy Fried Onion
1/4 oz Cilantro
directions:
Wash and dry produce. In a small pot, combine rice, 3/4 cup water, and a big pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to a low simmer. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve.
While rice cooks, in a small bowl, combine sweet soy glaze, chili sauce, ponzu, and half the vinegar. TIP: If you like a sweeter sauce, stir in a pinch of sugar.
Heat a large drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add pork and garlic powder; season with salt and pepper. Using a spatula, press into an even layer. Cook, undisturbed, until browned on bottom, 3-4 minutes. Break up meat into pieces and continue cooking until pork is cooked through, 1-2 minutes. Stir in sauce and cook, stirring, until slightly thickened, 1 minute more.
Stir red cabbage and carrot mix into pan with pork; cook until just tender, 2-3 minutes. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Turn off heat. Fluff rice with a fork; stir in 1 Tbsp butter until melted. Divide rice between bowls and top with stir-fry and crispy fried onions. Pick cilantro leaves from stems; roughly tear and sprinkle over bowls. Serve.
notes: Prep time 5 min and Cook time 20 min. Calories: 830

name: Sweet Chili Sauce
ingredients:
2 Tbsp Sweet Thai Chili Sauce
1 Tbsp Mayo
Coriander, chopped
directions: Simply mix the three ingredients together and serve with fries or chicken nuggets.

name: Sweet Potato Casserole
ingredients:
3 cups Cooked Canned Yams, mashed with fork
1/2 cup Butter, softened
1 cup Sugar
1 tsp Vanilla
1 tsp Cinnamon
1 Egg
Bag of Mini Marshmallows
1/3 cup Flour
1 cup Brown Sugar
directions:
Mix yams, butter, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon and egg and pour into casserole dish.
Mix flour and brown sugar and spread over top.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
Then spread marshmallows on top and bake for 10 minutes.
notes: 1 cup chopped nuts optional

name: Sweet Soy Sauce
ingredients:
1/4 cup Soy Sauce
1/2 cup Mirin
1 tsp Sugar
2 Tbsp Water
directions:
Combine all ingredients.
Cover and refrigerate for up to 5 days.

name: SweetFire Chicken Breast from Panda Express
ingredients:
1/2 cup + 1 Tbsp Vegetable Oil, divided
1 Ib Chicken Breasts, cut into 1-inch squares, but thinly
1/2 cup All-Purpose Flour
1/4 cup Cornstarch
2 Eggs, beaten
2 Garlic Cloves, minced
1 Red Bell Pepper, chopped into 1 inch cubes
1/4 White Onion, sliced into 1 inch thick wedges
2 cups Pineapple, cubed into 1 inch cubes
1/2 cup Sweet Thai Chili Sauce
3 Tbsp Green Onions, chopped for garnish
Sesame Seeds, for garnish
directions:
Heat 1/2 cup of vegetable oil in a skillet over medium high heat.
In a large ziploc bag add the chicken and cornstarch, seal and shake until totally covered.
Dip each piece into the egg to cover, then dredge into the flour (to be honest I usually just add flour back into the original ziploc bag and add the chicken back into it and shake it a little each time so the chicken doesn't stick to each other.)
Working in batches, cook for 2 minutes on the first side and one minute on the second side or until golden brown and crispy.
Remove from the pan.
Heat the remaining tablespoon of vegetable oil in your skillet over medium high heat.
Add bell pepper, onion, garlic and pineapple.
Cook until the bell pepper and pineapple just starts to wilt a little and is warm throughout (about 2-3 minutes).
Add the chicken back in and add in the sweet chili sauce.
Stir to combine everything and serve immediately.
If using the green onions and sesame seeds, sprinkle them on top as a garnish.
notes: Prep time 20 min and Cook time 20 min.

name: Swig Key Lime Cookies
ingredients:
Cookies:
1 cup Butter, room temp
3/4 cup Oil
1¼ cups Sugar
3/4 cup Powdered Sugar
2 Tbsp Water
2 Eggs
1/2 tsp Baking Soda
1/2 tsp Cream of Tartar
1 tsp Salt
5½ cups Flour
Coconut Lime Frosting: 8 oz Cream Cheese
1/2 cup Butter, softened
2 tsp Lime Juice
2 tsp Lime Zest
2½ tsp Coconut Extract
1/2 tsp Vanilla Extract
4 cups Powdered Sugar
directions:
Cookies: Cream together the butter, oil, sugar, water, and eggs. Once smooth, add remaining ingredients. Bake at 350F for 8 minutes (until barely brown on bottom).
Frosting: Cream the frosting ingredients together and thinly slice limes. Frost when cookies are cold. Serve cooled with a lime wedge on top.

name: Taco Soup
ingredients:
2 cans Tomatoes, diced (not drained)
2 cans Corn, not drained
2 cans Kidney Beans, drained
1 Ib Ground Beef
1 packet Taco Seasoning
Cheese, shredded
Sour Cream
Corn Chips
directions:
Brown ground beef. Add to crockpot.
Add tomatoes, corn and kidney beans. Stir in taco seasoning.
Cook on low for 8 hours on high for 6 hours.
Serve with shredded cheese, sour cream, and crushed corn chips.

name: Tarragon Chicken Bake
ingredients:
1.3lb Chicken Thighs, boneless skinless, diced into bite-sized pieces
7oz Asparagus, woody ends removed then sliced into 1½" chunks
3½ oz Pancetta, diced
3 Shallots, finely diced
2 Garlic Cloves, finely diced
2½ Tbsp Butter, unsalted
3 Tbsp Flour
2 cups Chicken Stock
1/2 cup Full Fat Creme Fraiche, at room temp
1 Tbsp Fresh Tarragon, finely diced
2 lb Potatoes, diced into small cubes (approx 2 large potatoes)
2-3 Tbsp Parmesan
Olive Oil, as needed
directions:
Add a drizzle of olive oil to a large pan over medium-high heat. Season the chicken all over with 1/2 tsp salt & 1/2 tsp pepper, then space out in the pan. Fry both sides until it builds up a golden crust and the chicken is almost cooked through (approx 3-4 mins each side). Remove the chicken and place to one side, leaving any excess fat behind.
Add the asparagus to the pan and fry for 3-4 minutes until it just begins to soften and take on color (it will continue cooking later). Remove and place in a separate bowl to one side, then lower the heat to medium.
Add the pancetta to the pan and fry until it begins to crisp and leak out fat, then add in the shallots and fry until soft and golden. Add the garlic and fry for a minute longer then melt in the butter. Stir in the flour to create a roux, then gradually add in the stock, whisking as you go to prevent lumps forming. Stir in the creme fraiche and tarragon then stir in the chicken alongside any resting juices. Bring to a simmer and stir somewhat frequently for 7-8 minutes until the sauce thickens. Preheat the oven to 400F.
Stir the asparagus through the sauce then pour everything into a baking dish. Leave to cool as you cook the potatoes (next step) until a firm skin forms over the top.
Add the diced potato to a large greaseproof baking tray and toss in a light drizzle of oil (~1 tbsp) and 1/2 tsp salt & 1/4 tsp pepper (or to taste). Bake in the oven for 18-20 minutes until they're fork tender, but not overly crispy. Scatter over the filling, closing as many gaps as you can. Sprinkle with parmesan then bake in the oven for 18-20 minutes or until crispy on top with the sauce bubbling around the outside. I recommend checking halfway to gently push down any potatoes that are charring too quickly.
Garnish with a pinch more tarragon then serve and enjoy!
notes: Prep time 15 min and Cook time 1 hour

name: Texas Roadhouse Rolls
ingredients:
1¼ cup Milk
¼ tsp Active Dry Yeast, or 1 packet
1/4 cup Honey
4 Tbsp Butter, melted and divided
1 Egg, large and at room temperature
1 tsp Salt
4 cups All-purpose or Bread Flour
directions:
If using a bread machine, see next section below.
Bring the milk to a near boil. Remove it from heat when you see it begin to steam and small bubbles form on the side of the pan. Let it reduce to lukewarm, between 80-90 degrees.
Mix the milk, yeast, and honey in a small bowl until well combined. Let it sit for 5 minutes.
In a large bowl, mix 3 tablespoons of the butter, the milk mixture, the room temperature egg, salt, and half of the flour. Mix slowly until smooth. (Use a mixer with a dough hook if you have one, or by hand.) Gradually add the remaining flour and mix until a dough has formed.
Mix/knead for 8 minutes. Transfer the dough to a floured surface and knead for a few more minutes.
Spray a large bowl with cooking spray and place the dough inside. Cover with plastic wrap and let it rise for an hour in a warm place.
Punch down the dough and roll it out on a flat, floured surface until it’s about ½ inch thick. Fold it in half and gently seal.
Cut into 24 squares of even size and place on 2 light, lightly-greased baking sheets. Cover and let them rise for 30-40 minutes, until doubled in size.
Preheat oven to 350° F and bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the top is a light golden brown.
Melt the remaining tablespoon of butter and brush the top of the rolls.
Serve with Copycat Texas Roadhouse Butter.
If using a Bread Machine:
Bring the milk to a near boil. Remove it from heat when you see it begin to steam and small bubbles form on the side of the pan. Let it reduce to lukewarm, between 80-90 degrees.
Add the milk, honey, butter, egg, and salt to the bread machine. Add the flour and create a small hole in the middle of the flour, don't let liquid inside the hole. Place the yeast in the hole.
Set the bread machine to the dough cycle, let it do the work from there.
Once complete, Spray a large bowl with cooking spray and place the dough inside. Cover the bowl (plastic wrap or a damp cloth works) and let it rise for an hour in a warm place.
Punch down the dough and roll it out on a flat, floured surface until it’s about 1/2 inch thick. Fold it in half and gently seal.
Cut into 24 squares of even size and place on a 2 lightly greased and lightly colored baking sheets. Cover them and let them rise for 30-40 minutes, until doubled in size.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees and bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the top is a light golden brown.
Melt the remaining tablespoon of butter and brush the top of the rolls. Serve with Copycat Texas Roadhouse Butter.
notes: Total time: 3 hours

name: Thai Red Curry with Chicken
ingredients:
1 lb Chicken Thighs, boneless and skinless, cut into thin pieces
2 Tbsp Olive Oil or Coconut Oil
1 Tbsp Ginger Paste
1 Tbsp Garlic, minced
1/4 cup Red Curry Paste
1/2 Tbsp Fish Sauce
13 oz can Coconut Milk
1 Tbsp Lime Juice
1 Tbsp Brown Sugar
1/2 to 1 tsp Red Pepper Flakes
Salt to taste
1 Red Bell Pepper, thinly sliced
1 cup Green Beans, chopped
2 Tbsp Thai Basil, chopped
1 Tbsp Cilantro, finely chopped
1 Tbsp Cornstarch mixed with 2 Tbsp Water
directions:
To a pan over medium heat, add the oil, ginger, garlic, and red curry paste. Saute for 2 to 3 minutes.
Add the fish sauce, coconut milk, lime juice, brown sugar, red pepper flakes, and salt. Mix together and bring to a boil.
Add the chicken and cook for about 8 minutes or until fully cooked through.
Add the red bell pepper and green beans and cook for 4 to 5 more minutes just until softened a bit.
Finish off with the basil, cilantro, and the cornstarch slurry. Mix together and the curry will start to thicken up a bit.
Take off the heat and enjoy it with rice!
notes: Prep time 10 min and Cook time 20 min

name: Tiana’s Beignets
ingredients:
1½ cups Water, warm
1/2 cup Sugar
1/4 oz Yeast
2 Eggs, large
1¼ tsp Salt
1 cup Evaporated Milk
7 cups Bread Flour, divided
1/4 cup Shortening
4 cups Vegetable Oil, for frying
3 cups Powdered Sugar
directions:
In a small bowl, stir water together with sugar and yeast. Let sit for 10 minutes.
In the bowl of a stand mixer, add eggs. Using the whisk attachment, beat eggs for 1 minute. Add salt and evaporated milk. Add yeast mixture and combine.
Add 3 cups of flour while continuing to mix. Add shortening until combined. Add remaining flour until thoroughly combined.
Switch to dough hook attachment and knead until dough comes together, about 5 minutes.
Grease a separate large bowl with nonstick cooking spray. Transfer dough to a greased bowl. Place plastic wrap greased with cooking spray over top of bowl and let rise for 3 hours at room temperature.
In a large, heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat, add vegetable oil. It should measure to a depth of about 2”. Heat until oil reaches 350F. Line a large plate with paper towels and set aside.
Roll the dough out to .5” think and either cut into rectangles or use a floured mickey mouse cookie cutter. Lay the beignets away from yourself into the oil and cook on each side for about 1 minute, or until golden brown.
Remove beignets from oil and drain on paper towels for a few minutes before dusting with powdered sugar.
notes: New Orleans Square, Disneyland

name: Tiana’s New Orleans Beignets
ingredients:
1/2 tsp Dry Yeast
1/4 cup Water, warm
1/4 cup Sugar
2 Tbsp Vegetable Shortening
1/2 tsp Salt
1/2 cup Heavy Cream
1 Egg
4 cups All-Purpose Flour
1/2 cup Water, boiling
Vegetable Oil, for frying
Powdered Sugar, for dusting
directions:
Sprinkle yeast over warm water in a small bowl. Stir to dissolve.
Add sugar, shortening, salt, heavy cream, egg, flour, yeast, and boiling water to a large bowl. Mix together.
Rest dough mixture for 30 minutes.
Roll out dough to 1/4 inch thickness and cut into individual squares. Let dough rise for 2 hours in a warm area.
Heat vegetable oil to 350F and fry beignets for 2-3 minutes, or until golden brown.
Dust warm beignets with powdered sugar and enjoy!

name: Tiffany's Pizza Recipe
ingredients:
2½ cups Flour
1 Tbsp Sugar
1 Tbsp Yeast
1/2 tsp Salt
1 cup Warm Water
2 Tbsp Oil
directions:
Mix 2 cups of flour, sugar, yeast, and salt.
Add water and oil; mix well.
Add remaining flour.
Knead 5 minutes.
Roll out pizza dough.
Add sauce and toppings.
Bake at 375 degrees for 15-20 minutes.
notes: Makes one pizza crust.

name: Tocino
ingredients:
1-2 lbs. Pork Belly
1/2-3/4 cup Brown Sugar
5 Garlic Cloves, minced
2 Tbsp Soy Sauce
2 Tbsp Vinegar
1/2 cup Pineapple Juice
15-20 drops Red Food Coloring
Salt & Pepper
directions: Use pork belly or pork shoulder cut so it looks like bacon. Score so it has a checkered pattern and will soak up more sauce. Mix all other ingredients together to form the marinade. Mix sauce with Tocino so it’s fully coated and marinate for 2 to 3 days. Cook over medium-low heat so sugar doesn’t burn. Serve with garlic rice and eggs.

name: Tri-Color Neapolitan Cookies
ingredients:
2½ cups All-Purpose Flour
1/2 tsp Baking Powder
1/2 tsp Salt
1 cup Butter, softened
1½ cups Sugar
1 Egg
1 tsp Vanilla
1/2 tsp Almond Extract
6 Drops Red Food Coloring
1/2 Walnuts, chopped
1/4 cup Unsweetened Cocoa Powder
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a medium bowl, mix together flour, baking powder and salt.
In a large bowl, beat butter and sugar until smooth and creamy. Beat in egg until incorporated. Stir in vanilla. Gradually add flour mixture and mix until a soft dough forms.
Divide dough into three equal portions.
Place one portion in a small bowl. Add almond extract and red food coloring in and knead until fully integrated into the dough. Spread this portion evenly over the bottom of the prepared pan.
Add nuts to another portion and knead well. Spread this portion evenly over the first layer.
Add cocoa to the last portion and knead until it is evenly distributed throughout the dough. Spread this portion over the second layer.
Cover with plastic wrap or waxed paper and refrigerate overnight.
When ready to bake, remove from pan and cut loose in half lengthwise. Cut each half into slices 1/4 thick. Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 12 minutes or until firm.
notes:
9x5 inch loaf pan, bottom and sides lined with wax paper
Cookie sheet, ungreased

name: Tuscan Mac and Cheese
ingredients:
2 cups Milk
1 cup Heavy Cream
1 tsp Hot Sauce
1/2 tsp EACH: Oregano, Basil, Onion Powder, Garlic Salt, Mustard Powder, & Parsley
1/4 tsp Smoked Paprika
1 pinch Red Pepper Flakes
Mac and Cheese
1 lb. Pasta Shells
2 Tbsp Salted Butter
1 Tbsp Sun-Dried Tomatoes oil
3 Garlic Cloves, minced
2 Tbsp Flour
1 Tbsp Tomato Paste
10 oz. Sun-Dried Tomatoes
2 cups Cheddar Cheese, shredded
1/2 cup Mozzarella Cheese, shredded
1/4 cup Parmesan Cheese, shredded
2 cups Baby Spinach, whole or roughly chopped
directions:
Combine the milk, heavy cream, hot sauce, and seasonings in a large measuring cup with a spout and set aside. Reserve 1 tbsp of oil from the sun dried tomatoes. Pat sundried tomatoes dry, dice, and set aside.
Begin boiling a pot of water for the pasta. Generously salt the pasta water once a boil is reached. Boil the pasta to al dente according to package instructions. Set a timer to avoid overcooking.
Make the Cheese Sauce: Meanwhile, add the butter and oil to a large high-walled skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Add the flour and tomato paste and stir continuously for 1-2 minutes.
Reduce heat to medium-low and slowly add the milk/heavy cream mixture in small splashes, stirring continuously. Doing this slowly ensures that the roux stays intact and that the sauce is thick.
Add the sundried tomatoes. Bring to a gentle bubble, then reduce heat to low.
Gradually stir in the cheese, adding small amounts at a time to ensure it melts well.
Once the cheese is incorporated, add the spinach and cover the skillet to allow it to wilt. It will continue to wilt more as the pasta is added/incorporated.
Drain the pasta and add it to the sauce. Stir to combine, the pasta will continue to absorb the sauce as it stands.
notes: Prep time 15 min and Cook time 15 min

name: Tuscan Salmon
ingredients:
2-3 Salmon Filets
1 can Butterbeans
Basil, roughly chopped
200g Cherry Tomatoes
8 Sun-Dried Tomatoes, drained from oil and chopped
1 Shallot, diced
2 Garlic Cloves
Handful Spinach
2 Tbsp Heavy Cream
1/2 tsp Smoked Paprika
Chicken Stock Cube
1 Lemon, zested
Parmesan, grated
directions:
Season the salmon filets with salt and pepper. Sear in a hot pan on all sides until colored. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, sweat the shallot and garlic with a pinch of salt. Mix in the whole cherry tomatoes, sun-dried tomatoes, smoked paprika and chopped basil stems.
Saute for a few minutes, then add in a chicken stock cube and 200mL of water. Bring to a gentle simmer, add in the butterbeans and leave for 10 minutes.
Turn the heat down, add in heavy cream, the zest of a lemon, parmesan, and a crack of black pepper. Stir. Then mix in the spinach and some chopped basil. Allow to wilt.
Place the salmon filets into the dish and allow to warm through until they are cooked.
Service with extra basil and parmesan.
notes: 20-30 minutes

name: Twix Cookies
ingredients:
Shortbread Cookies:
1 cup Butter, unsalted and softened
½ cup Powdered Sugar
1 tsp Vanilla Extract
2 cups All-Purpose Flour
¼ tsp Salt
Caramel Layer:
15 Soft Caramels, unwrapped
2 Tbsp Heavy Cream
Chocolate Layer:
1 cup Milk Chocolate Chips
1 tsp Vegetable Oil
directions:
Prepare the Shortbread Cookies: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, beat the softened butter and powdered sugar together until light and fluffy. Mix in the vanilla extract. Gradually add the flour and salt, mixing until just combined. Roll the dough into 1-inch balls and place them on the prepared baking sheet. Flatten each ball slightly with your hand or the bottom of a glass. Bake for 12-14 minutes, or until the edges are just starting to turn golden. Let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Make the Caramel Layer: In a small saucepan, melt the caramels and heavy cream over low heat, stirring constantly until smooth. Spoon about 1 teaspoon of caramel onto each cooled cookie, spreading it evenly over the top. Let the caramel set for about 10 minutes.
Make the Chocolate Layer: In a microwave-safe bowl, combine the milk chocolate chips and vegetable oil. Microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring after each, until the chocolate is melted and smooth. Spoon or drizzle the melted chocolate over the caramel layer on each cookie.
Allow the chocolate to set completely before serving.
These Twix-inspired cookies have all the layers you love from the candy bar – buttery shortbread, gooey caramel, and a rich chocolate topping!
notes: Prep Time: 20 minutes | Cooking Time: 14 minutes | Total Time: 45 minutes

name: Uova Al Purgatorio
ingredients:
3 Tbsp Extra-Virgin Olive Oil
1 Yellow Onion, small and thinly sliced
1 Garlic Clove, lightly crushed and peeled
Generous pinch Red Pepper Flakes
1 Red Bell Pepper, coarsely chopped
Salt
1 (28 oz) can Tomatoes, chopped
4 Eggs, large
5-8 Basil Leaves, freshly torn
3-4 Tbsp Parmigiano Reggiano, freshly grated
Crusty Bread, for serving
directions:
Make the base: In a large skillet or wide saucepan with a lid set over medium-low heat, stir together the olive oil, onion, garlic, red pepper flakes, and red bell pepper. Cook, stirring, until the onion and peppers are softened, about 10 minutes. If the bell pepper isn’t quite tender, cover the pan partially and cook for another 5 minutes, until the pepper is softened but still holds its shape. Season with a generous pinch of salt.
Add the tomatoes: Stir in the tomatoes and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Lower the heat to medium-low, cover the skillet partially and simmer gently until the tomatoes have darkened in color and thickened, about 15 minutes. Uncover and cook another 5 minutes until the sauce is nicely thickened.
Poach the eggs: Use the back of a spoon to carve out 4 wide wells in the sauce, making homes for your eggs. Crack the eggs into the wells and season each with a sprinkle of salt. Cover the pan and cook gently until the whites are set and the yolk is still runny, about 2-3 minutes.
Serve: Remove from the heat and garnish with torn fresh basil leaves and cheese. Serve right away, with good bread on the side.
notes: Translates to Eggs In Purgatory. Very similar to shakshuka

name: Virginia's Dinner Rolls
ingredients:
1 pat Butter, melted
2 cups Hot Water
2 tsp Salt
1/2 cup Sugar
2 Eggs, beaten
1/3 cup Warm Water
2 heaping Tbsp Yeast
1/2 cup Powdered Milk
7-8 cups Flour
directions:
Melt butter.
Add very hot water, salt and sugar. Stir to dissolve.
Place in mixing bowl.
Add 3 cups of flour and powdered milk; mix very well.
Add beaten eggs.
Add yeast which has been dissolved in 1/3 cup warm water.
Add flour gradually. Turn out on floured board.
Cover, let rest for 10 minutes.
Knead till smooth and satiny.
Place in container to rise. Let rise until double.
Roll out on lightly floured board, 1/2 inch thick. Cut rolls and place on greased pans.
Let raise and bake at 375 degrees for 12 minutes.
Brush with melted butter after baking.

name: Waffle Donut
ingredients:
Dough:
3/4 cup Lukewarm Milk
1/4 cup Sugar
1 Tbsp Yeast
3 Egg Yolks
2½ cups Plain Flour, plus extra
3½ oz Butter, chilled and cut into small cubes
Icing:
2 Tbsp Butter, melted
1/4 cup Maple Syrup
1 cup Icing Sugar
directions:
Combine milk and a pinch of the sugar into a medium sized bowl. Sprinkle over yeast and set aside for 5-6 minutes or until foamy. Stir in the remaining sugar and egg yolks until combined.
In a large bowl add the flour. Rub the butter to the flour until the mixture resembles a bread crumb consistency.
Pour in the egg mixture and stir until a rough dough forms. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 5 minutes or until a smooth dough forms.
Place into a lightly oiled bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let rise in a warm place for 1 hour.
Punch down the dough and turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Divide into 12 equal portions and roll each into a ball and then flatten slightly.
Spray a waffle maker with grease and place 4 balls on the hot iron. Press down and cook using the machines normal timing.
Once the donuts are all cooked and cooling begin making the glaze.
In a bowl combine the melted butter, maple syrup and icing sugar. Whisk until smooth. Dip each waffle donut in the glaze and top with small ripped pieces of the candied bacon.
notes: Make candied bacon: Preheat oven to 375 F. Place bacon strips on a baking tray lined with parchment paper. Drizzle 1 tsp of maple syrup over each slice of bacon. Bake for 10 minutes, flip strips and bake for another 5 minutes. Use 1 tsp of maple syrup for each strip of bacon.

name: Waffle Peach Topping
ingredients:
1/2 cup Sugar
2 heaping Tbsp Cornstarch
1 small can Peaches
1/2 cup Cold Water
1 tsp Butter
Sprinkle of Nutmeg
directions:
Put 1/2 cup of sugar into sauce pan.
Put 2 heaping tsp of cornstarch into sugar.
Drain peaches into mixture.
Add 1/2 cup of cold water into mix. Mix mixture.
Cook until thickens, stirring constantly.
Add chopped peaches.
Add 1 tsp of butter.
To top it off, add a sprinkle of nutmeg.
notes:
*May need to add more liquid after adding chopped peaches.
Delicious on waffles!

name: Waffles
ingredients:
